description:
Believe it or not, you can get a more than decent seafood meal at Fisherman's Wharf - although I must admit I can only vouch for the salads since that's what my friend Maggie and I decided to zero in on for dinner here. We didn't plan on dining here, but we were taking a leisurely stroll on the Embarcadero just as the sun was starting to set on a quiet Monday evening. Just as we approached the absolute thick of the tourist zone, Maggie said she was feeling peckish. Oh dear, Fisherman's Wharf was the last place I really wanted to be as I expected to confront exorbitant prices and annoying tourists.

But then I suddenly remembered a recent episode of "Check, Please! Bay Area" where one of the guests, not an old-timer but a relatively young woman, raved about the freshness of the Dungeness crab and the reliability of the service. I've never been here. NEVER. Neither had Maggie. Do we steel ourselves for the height of culinary commercialism and give it a try? It was early enough in the evening that hardly anyone was dining yet, and we were able to snag a table next to one of the huge bayside windows. A band of boisterous French tourists already monopolized the shared binoculars the restaurant provides to take in the panoramic views.

Ah, the French. Good thing I'm a local. Sure, we saw the sizzling iron skillets go by, but there was no room for garlic butter for me. However, I caved when the complimentary crusty sourdough loaf arrived with chunks of ice-cold butter (photo: http://bit.ly/2ylkDyQ). Yeah, I took a slice. Sue me. We decided to share an appetizer, the $12.99 Toy Box Tomato, Roasted Red Pepper Bruschetta drizzled with a balsamic vinaigrette and served with a mound of burrata and s couple of toasted baguette slices that needed to be quickly replenished (photo: http://bit.ly/2PG65R1). No surprise the fresh burrata made the dish. We then went our separate ways with our respective salads.

Maggie ordered the $23.98 Crab Caesar where their traditional housemade dressing takes center stage over the chopped Romaine hearts topped with seasoned croutons, shaved grana, and fresh crabmeat (photo: http://bit.ly/2PDUDFf). She was pleased with her selection. I decided on the $27.98 Louie with Crab which arranged iceberg lettuce, avocado slices, black olives, halved cherry tomatoes, and a sliced hard-boiled egg on an oblong platter. The Louie dressing was served on the side, a mix of mayo, cocktail sauce, lemon juice, and pickle relish (photo: http://bit.ly/2EuLw8Z). It was definitely satisfying, though the total price tag for dinner reminded me we were on the Wharf. Still, our server was extremely attentive, and the French eventually retreated.

FOOD - 3.5 stars...fresh crab was nice and the execution as well...but ah, those tourist targeted prices were hard to stomach
AMBIANCE - 4 stars...quite a huge standalone building with great views and it looks like it's been renovated recently 
SERVICE - 4.5 stars...really stellar server deserves praise
TOTAL - 4 stars...barely a 4 though keep in mind that Fisherman's Wharf brings its own set of lowered expectations

RELATED - Looking for other sights and bites on the Wharf or in the Marina? Here's a collection of places I've experienced and reviewed: http://bit.ly/2PMqIut
author: Ed U.

description:
I am giving two stars for the following reasons;
Quality of food: 4 (Great)
Ambiance: 4 (Great)
Price: 3 (Fair)
Service: -3 (Please read below)

Few weekends ago was my father's birthday. He has a very fond memory of this place, because this was the place where he had his first crab in San Francisco on his business trip 26 years ago. I flew him over from Seattle for his birthday, and made a reservation to have dinner with him and my aunt's family. There were two sizes available for the crab bisque; cup or a bowl. We ordered the crab bisque for the bowl size. The bisque came out in a bread bowl, which I suppose is by default. My aunt asked if it was possible to have the bisque in a ceramic bowl instead of the bread bowl. The server was a very young man; perhaps having a very bad day; got extremely upset at her. It seemed that he misunderstood her preference request as if he had been told he made a mistake. He started yelling at her that he got the order right, and threw down the plates and dishes very loudly on the table. His behavior got attentions of several tables around us and interrupted their meals. Another server, who seemed more experienced, came by and told the young man to just pour the bisque in a ceramic bowl and bring it back. The young man  came by later, and again put down the bowl very loudly on the table and left. For rest of the evening, we felt very uncomfortable and unwelcome at the restaurant. We didn't even eat the bisque, because after seeing his behavior, it would not have been a surprise if he spit in our bisque. It really was difficult to enjoy our time there, and completely ruined my father's birthday dinner. My plan was to bring him or my friends when they visit me in San Francisco. However, I do not think I will ever be returning here again.
author: Lisa O.

description:
Took two out of town friends. DON'T GO.
The caesar salad with crab was terrible. Bad dressing with no flavor and maybe two ounces of crab.
One whole crabs and one half crab were served warm with a disgusting red sauce which disguised any taste of Dungeness crab.
Total cost with tip and one beer= $193.16
author: ted t.

description:
This restaurant was featured on Check, Please! Bay Area and decided to check it out for dinner since I was in the area. I made a reservation on OpenTable and all times were available, and I encountered no wait at 8pm on a Friday night. We were seated promptly and our server greeted us with bread and butter shortly after.

Given the higher prices on entrees, we decided to split a few smaller items: crab chowder, crab fondue with toasts, and a sizzling platter of mussels and shrimp. Of the three items, I enjoyed the mussels and shrimp the most. There was a generous amount of mussels and about 12 shrimp. They were seasoned and had a strong lemony taste to them. I was not as impressed by the chowder or fondue, though. The crab got lost in the broth or cheese/spinach dip, when it should be the main attraction. The soup had a minestrone/split pea quality to it that did not mesh with the crab. The crab fondue was full of cheese and spinach, but it was not creamy in texture and lacked seasoning. I would avoid those items. I think to really enjoy crab here, you should order it by the pound or in a sizzling platter. 

For the high prices (prime location aside), I was expecting much better food. You're better off getting chowder and calamari at the stands outside, or going to Boudin Bistro or Alioto's for a sit-down dinner.
author: Edwina D.

description:
This was my first visit here after dozens of visits to the city.  We brought my wife's sister and her husband to the Wharf for the day.  After a terrific harbor cruise we were hungry and came here.  I was expecting to have to wait but we were pleasantly greeted and shown to a window table.  We had great view of the Bay and Alcatraz.  

Everyone always says the restaurants at Fisherman's Wharf are pricey.  Well of course they are but then again it's not a fast food chain!.. The Wharf is one of San Francisco's main attractions, rents are high and the food is terrific so when tourists flock to a place it's not going to be cheap.  Personally I felt the prices were reasonable and the quality of food is very good.

We had a terrific waiter who was attentive but not intrusive.  I had the Crab Chowder which was good with a creamy broth and the crab was shredded, I would have preferred it to be chunky.  Others had a Crab Enchilada, a Louie with crab and shrimp and a caesar salad.  We shared a delicious plate of calamari as well.

The only complaint I had was that our bus person needs a bit of customer service training.  She just reached in front of you to clear a dish  and clanked the dishes so hard I thought they would break.

Yes I'll go back here as the food was good and you can't beat the Bay views.
author: Russ V.

description:
Decided to have an early family dinner here after our long sightseeing day. Since we stayed so close to fisherman's wharf so this was a convenient choice of restaurant. This restaurant and bar on the water is very open and bright with nice ocean and Alcatraz views. 

Hubby and I had a beer and mermaid Mary at the bar, the drinks were reasonably priced. When our entire family arrived we were seated at a window table, the binoculars at window seatings came in very handy to look out and see even clearer.

The menu was big with mostly seafood items, they were recipes too. We decided on dozen oysters, clam chowder, 2 lbs up whole roasted crab, lemon butter garlic caper way wild halibut and sea bass, also strawberry sundae as dessert. The food was hit and miss, crab was fantastic that was so fresh and meaty. Halibut was a bit hard and dry, sea bass was better, crab melt was great, chowder was not good, desert was yummy. Our server forgot to give us basket of bread! He wasn't attentive enough either. Instead the bus girl was very attentive and took care of us even more than our actual server! But the seafood prices seemed to be just a bit cheaper than LA especially the oysters. 

Food was good mostly but the service was lacking, I wanted to give it three stars but I really liked the whole crab! Would we come back here next time? Probably not!
author: Mimi L.

description: My aunt and my uncle flew into California for the weekend. We decided to take a quick drive to San Francisco for some of the major highlights. Headed down to the wharf for some seafood and walked into this restaurant. It was so good and such a great find! The clam chowder was delicious, the pasta was delicious, the crab sandwich was delicious, and the whole crab is a must order!
author: Bobby N.

description: We loved the look of the restaurant and we had a great view of the water. Our waiter was very attentive and even replaced my soup after another waiter came and took mine when I wasn't done with it. The best thing we all liked was the clam chowder. We also ordered the crab melt, crab enchiladas, spicy shrimp pasta and Italian burger. It was all bad, bland, the crab melt was no melt, just crab meat on some dry bread with onions and barely there avocado. Burger dry too. The enchiladas had a lot of crab meat but who makes enchiladas with flour tortillas and it tasted like canned stewed tomatoes. We are so disappointed. I'm including a pic of my leftovers, the dry supposedly crab melt, no sign of anything melty!
author: Tiffany H.

description:
The write up from check Bay Area was great so with my niece visiting from Japan. We decided to check it out. We were seated right away sat along the window with a spectacular view of Alcatraz. It was a beautiful day.
The double order of mussels and crab legs was a bit pricey $50.00, but was it great. It was cooked in garlic with some wine and served with garlic butter and sherry. You drizzle the sherry over the mussels. My older sister, niece and I devoured everything leaving nothing behind.
The crab Caesar and house salads were just the right amount with just the right amount of dressing.
I have to bring the hubby back so he can check it out.

There is a wall outside the restaurant with all the celebrities who have dined here in the past.
Warren Beatty, Ronald Reagan, Arnold Schwarzenegger plus many many others.
author: Janet I.

description:
Busy place on the pier and we came with family after a wedding. We made a reservation and it was pretty busy even for a weekday evening.

Server was friendly and we got calamari and crab cakes for apps. Both were very good and fresh.

We ordered a variety of dishes but the wife and I split the "lotsa crab".

Food came out quick and the crab was fresh. I expected more from the garlic butter sauce though. I'd pass and just get steamed crab next time because neither the wife or I really thought it added anything. More like it made the crab heavier and richer than it needs to be.
author: Chris A.

description: Great views and great service. The yellow tail appetizer was excellent! We had crab and sea bass, both were cooked just right and the portion size was very good.
author: David B.

description: Franciscan's is a great choice for crab and a view whether you're with family, friends, a date, and especially if you're a tourist and celebrating an occasion (like us). The menu has pictures and ingredient list to accompany each dish, so you really know what you're ordering. The paper bibs are also a nice and much appreciated touch. You will need the bib if you're ordering crab (and you should be ordering it here). We shared this plate "losta crab" between the two of us; it was some of the best crab we've tasted, and the presentation was on point. The meal was a little pricey, but the service was efficient, and don't forget the view that makes the whole experience special. They have two hour free validated parking.
author: Ali M.

description:
I love the location of this restaurant, right in the heart of fisherman's wharf. The structure of this building gives you that feel like you are in an old luxury ship, about to dine in. I love the interior and All the photos on their walls.
Service was great, all the servers where very friendly and attentive. The food was amazing, tasted fresh. We had the clam chowder, calamari and of course the crabs! Great dine in experience in San Francisco!
author: Maricel J.

description: Good place for tourists who want the typical restaurant by the water with a view.  This place caters to tourists and does have good sea food along with a huge menu with lots and lots to chose from.  If you go, ask to sit by the window with a view to Alcatraz and the pier.
author: Rima M.

description:
Came here twice. The first time my fiancé and I only got beignets (SO GOOD). The second time we came to try their food. Fiancé ordered the chicken and chips ($9.99) and I ordered the fish combo and chips ($9.99), which consisted of shrimp, calamari, and white fish. We HAD to order the beignets again (definitely try the creme that comes with it, it adds a little bit of sweetness that doesn't overpower at all)! 

You would think that the fish combo would be a little more extra because you are getting more than one seafood option, but hey, I'll take the $9.99 and try a little bit of everything. 

Had to rate 3.5/5 because the first time they total missed our order as they were calling every number but ours and we only ordered beignets. Also, there was so much trash every where. We came on Memorial Day, it was hectic I'm sure, I'll give them that, but there should be no excuse for missing our order that was so simple.
author: Jessica S.

description:
I was in town for a work trip and after having a co worker take me on a tour of all the cool sites and tourist stops, we ended up at the bar waiting for a friend. We started with drinks and planned to meet our friend at another Restaraunt but we realized most of the close spots were closing soon. 

We ended up staying at the bar and ordering food. My co worker who has lived in San Fran was raving about he clam chowder but I had to be different and I ordered the crab chowder in a bread bowl. It was not good, had an odd after taste or something that I can't put my finger on. The food was mediocre at best. 

The service was 5 Stars!! Our bartender asked he chefs if we could order though we had maybe a 10 minute window before the kitchen was closing! The food wasn't something I'd return for I would come back for a drink. It's also a cool place, it's designed like a ship and looks our onto the water.
author: Allegra S.

description: Wow!  This place was delicious.  The server knew everything on the menu and gave great selections for our dinner!   This place is a must to dine.  Beautiful view of the ocean.
author: Tracy P.

description:
A very good place where to eat seafood!!!!We really enjoyed our first night dinner in san francisco overthere!!!
I ordered an entire crab for me:very delicious and also oyster n a clam soup at the end!!!all was very good and well cooked.My boyfriend choose the pasta seafood and was happy of his choice.
All the staff was kind and fast
Really happy to have choose this place
I really recommand
author: Manu T.

description:
Everyone knows that the food in touristy places is often overpriced, and not the quality that can be found elsewhere. I know this, but I took a chance and... well. Everyone is right. 

We chose the Franciscan over other options because of the view and the menu. We wanted crab, and somewhere nice to sit and look at the water. 

This place does in fact have an amazing view. We were seated promptly at a table with a bay view, and we really enjoyed the view. 

Sadly, that is all that was enjoyable besides the bread. The bread was good; crusty on the outside and soft inside. 

Two of our party did the Prixe Fixe menu. One selected the chowder, one the house salad. Both were alright, but not worth the price tag. We both went with the Dungeness crab legs in their 'special' garlic sauce. 

Never in my life have I had crab legs that were so brittle to deal with. The shell literally broke into shards, flaked and cracked away from the meat... the meat that was overcooked, dry, rubbery, and flavorless. Add to that the bizarre flavorless oil smeared all over the thing, and it was quite an unpleasant dining experience. 

Why? I'll never know. A place like this should 100% be able to cook crab appropriately. I feel like we would have been better ofd at Joe's Crabshack. 

Dessert came with this. It was described as a house made vanilla custard ice cream. It was served in a drinking glass, and it tasted like McDonald's soft serve.

Don't let them view talk you into eating here, kids. Your $ is surely better spent elsewhere.
author: Ashley P.

description:
I have passed by the Franciscan on my way to Pier 39 for many years but never went upstairs. I tried eating here months ago, but the wait was too long so we left.

Today we came for lunch. We were seated at a window, where there were binoculars on a chain I used to see Alcatraz, ferry boats in the water, and tourists in line for the bay cruise.

As soon as we were seated, sourdough bread and butter appeared at our table. I knew not to fill up on bread given all the seafood I intended to eat.

We were really tempted to have chowder, but it would have been really filling. So we had some appetizers instead. But which one? I narrowed it down to the crab cakes, the octopus, or the squid. The portion of squid looked a little large, and I was concerned the octopus was raw. So we had the crab cakes. And my cousin ordered the prosciutto di san daniele.

The we ordered the crab enchiladas and the crab sandwich melt. See a trend here?

The crab cakes were the pinnacle of our meal. Large and meaty, with no fillers. Seasoned perfectly, outstanding! The prosciutto was tasty, but didn't knock my socks off.

The crab sandwich melts were a little deceiving. Half the huge platter was covered by three baguette-sized sandwiches, the other half was full of grilled vegetables. Although the sandwiches were small, they were tasty and meaty. Just excellent. I also liked the grilled corn and potatoes.

The crab enchiladas were pretty good. I do think the sauce and the enormous amount of cheese (love cheese though!) overwhelmed the delicate flavor of the crab.

Service was excellent, the staff was nice and friendly. It's not cheap to eat here, but the food was very good.
author: The Bottomless Pi T.

description: Great experience. Had the sample plate skillet with calamari. Everything was very tasty and fresh. I will most definitely be back
author: Julius T.

description: Beautiful spot to have a drink waiting for the ferry. We had my son with us so we couldn't sit at the bar but the host obligingly offered a table on the second level for us. We parked our stroller and went up the steps. The server and the staff was so very nice and attentive. They even brought us bread even though we were only having a drink. We explained we just wanted a drink and had to catch a ferry, and the server didn't mind that we took a table and gladly brought us the check when we had to go. The bread was really good and kept my kid happy and soaked up the  big beer my friend had. When I say big, I mean huge. It wasn't cheap but the size was definitely worth the price.
author: Jen L.

description: I had a perfect lunch at Franciscan crab restaurant. I had a Sizzlin have crab and I enjoyed it immensely. My charming waiter Raul helped make my experience enjoyable.
author: Cathy S.

description:
I was lured into this restaurant by all the stellar reviews. The first red flag was when I looked on Open Table and saw virtually all reservations were open.  However, when I called the lady at the front told me it was busy and at least a 15-20 minute wait.  When we arrived at our reserved time, we still had to wait.  She seemed completely overwhelmed and flustered to say the least.  It was a crowded restaurant and groups of people were standing or walking around.  

The highlight of the night was their service.  They were attentive, friendly and quick.  I have nothing but great things to say about that.  The food on the other hand... not so great.  

I picked the prix fixe meal and I'll state that it was lackluster.  To start off, the clam chowder was not good.  If you're expecting something like Boudin's, this is not it.  It was thin in texture as opposed to creamy and tasted a little on the tangy/sour side.  I read plenty of reviews that raved about the crab enchiladas... again, it was disappointing to say the least.  It was mushy because of the flour tortilla and sauce and they stuffed lettuce inside with the crab.  The actual crab portion was good, just not with the rest of the dish.  My daughter's chicken fettuccine was not up to par either.  It tasted worst than pasta roni.  

The saviors for the evening were the mashed potatoes as a side dish and the vanilla ice cream dessert.  I'd say stick to the crab here...
author: Quynh D.

description: Saw a sign said "FRESH-MADE BEIGNETS". And is been awhile since we had one, so decided to pick up an order. It WAS fresh when it was made alright, not sure how long ago that was. Totally stale. So disappointed.
author: Eddie D.

description: Great seafood. The ocean view was great! I would say so far the best service we have had so far in SF! We have eaten at a couple of place and it was terrible. This city definitely treats tourist like crap. But our waiter and the staff was 5 star!!
author: Robert W.

description:
So this place has a lot of character, it is fun place to check out .
The service was good and actually fast.
My appetizer was great.
The main dishes were just a little over seasoned for my taste. I really wanted to like my food more.
On one hand this is a nice location and you are on the water. It is a little touristy and priced pretty high.
It is up to you, I am still on the fence.
author: David C.

description:
With no food plans on Thursday night, I found myself on the Fisherman's Wharf wanting one thing: CLAM CHOWDER. 

So many options to choose from but the Franciscan Crab had the appeal of a classic wharf restaurant. Prices are a bit high compared to other options, but the A+ service, cleanliness, food, and retro decor definitely make up for the price.

I ordered the Crab Chowder instead of clam & was very satisfied. Sourdough bread is served at every table and because it's soooo warm and fluffy, the waiters already expect to bring a second serving to the table.

I'd recommend the Dungeness crab sliders because even the side of potatoes are special. 3 sliders are served but with the avocado, thick pieces of crab, sourdough bread served before hand, you're sure to leave feeling full.  The calamari tasted pretty average compared to everything else we ordered.

Happy with my last minute Fisherman's Wharf restaurant pick & would definitely come back here.
author: Karla M.

description:
This place is quite top-notch with the excellent views, great food, attentive service - a fine dining place.

I and my wife were around Pier 39 roaming around and we decided to try out this for our lunch. Upon entering we were promptly seated on a bay side table with sweeping views of the vast expanse of the bay, and our waiter was very courteous to us in helping us make the right order. We ordered a Clam chowder in the sourdough bread bowl and a crab sandwich. The waiter brought a bread loaf and butter to start with. The texture of the butter is really top-notch and we were already impressed.

The food reached a little late given the fact, that the restaurant was almost empty (maybe a few tables filled). However, we were really happy with the food and it was quite delicious. I see that other reviewers have pointed out that the clam chowder was not up to the best standards. Personally, I don't like the super-creamy texture of some other places, and this was quite the perfect chowder to my taste. The crab sandwich came with a side of potatoes and the crab filling was delectable which is expected since they specialize in crabs, I guess. 

Overall, the dining experience at this place was great and I would have given 5 stars had the food arrived a little bit early.
author: Suvadeep B.

description: Went here for dinner with my husband. He got the spicy shrimp pasta & I got the crab fettuccine. Neither had much flavor at all. We also got the clam chowder, which was okay but nothing special. We were very disappointed considering our 2 meals (we ordered water) cost us $85! Very overpriced considering the quality of the food.
author: Brittany J.

description:
Love Love Love!!! 
Service: Service was amazing. The whole staff greats customers with smiles. Staff is very pleasant and welcoming. Weekends this place gets packed but it's a fairly big restaurant! 
Food: AMAZING!!!! I usually order a full crab every time I come to this restaurant and I am never disappointed! My crab is always fresh and well seasoned, and never over cooked!! 
Atmosphere: beautiful!! You have the option to sit outside and over look pier 39, or sit facing the beautiful bay!!! Inside the restaurant is also cute and unique. 

All around if your looking for some amazing sea food with some amazing views this restaurant is a must visit!
author: Angelica N.

description:
Crab was over cooked, dried. Mussels were also over cooked Roth easy to crack shells and too salty. 
I had a crab enchilada that was also too salty but good flavor. Great buttata cheese that comes with almost every order. 
If you spend a lot of money for your food, at minimum you would want it to be freshly cooked. 
Great service but I won't go back for the food.
author: Biemme B.

description:
**** Review 122 ****

After a long day of walking all over Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39, we wanted to stop by a restaurant that offered some of the best seafood in San Fran. So we asked a few locals and they all said we had to try this place. 
The first thing you notice about this place is the building, this place stands out from everything around it. I felt like Frank Sinatra, or the whole Rat Pack were going to come in and sit at their regular booth. 
 The staff was really nice, very attentive which made the atmosphere great for everyone around. We wanted to make sure we tried as much as we could so we ordered Octopus Carpaccio, a cup of Crab Chowder, the Sizzling Iron Skillet Roasted Combo (which came with mussels, shrimp, & crab), and the Bay Shrimp & Chips.
The food was phenomenal! Octopus was tender, tossed in light lemon-olive oil and severed with some nice bread. The crab chowder was the best I've ever had, lots of crab meat and perfect seasoning. The Iron Skillet combo was amazing, lots of mussels and shrimp, and half a crab. Definitely enough food to share. Make sure to wear a bib, and have plenty napkins around. If you love seafood as much as I do, then you'll be in heaven! I'll be stopping here every time I'm in San Fran.
author: Luis S.

description:
I've been coming here for over 20 years when I pass through San Francisco but never again

Sat down at the bar for lunch on Monday afternoon bartender totally ignored only two other people were seated at the bar.

After sitting there for 10 minutes making eye contact several times with the bartender we walked out came across the parking lot to Bodin.  Sat down for immediately served and the funny thing is we met two other people that had just walked out minutes before with the same experience.

Also bartender takes for granted that Caucasian people do not understand Spanish heard him talking a lot of crap about one of the patrons and the tip that they left will never return.
author: Gregory P.

description: Ordered the fish and chips and the crab chowder. The fish and chips are pretty good, a bit greasy but it's a safe order. I thought those were carrots but to my surprise they were actually sweet potatoes, mmmm, what a wonderful surprise! The crab chowder was a bit too salty for my liking. I should remember that next time.
author: Lawrence T.

description:
My friend & I were craving seafood while on vacation so we decided to try out this place. 

It is on the pricier end, but the view is amazing! We were seated right next to it so we could see Alcatraz from our table (which had a pair of binoculars too). 

As for the food, we got some chowder, crab Alfredo, and crab sliders. These were sooo good~ I definitely recommend getting them if you try this place. I really liked how they put furikake on the corn too- amazing! Honestly, it was very filling for us, so it was good that we shared. The chowder wasn't really that special, but the complimentary bread made it yummy to dip in. 

The servers are extremely friendly & the service was good!!
author: Bea L.

description:
I literally come here for one thing:   Steamed Clams.  I'm slurping up that white wine garlicky infused broth with the clams just like I'm sipping on my red wine, one sip at a time. Delicious.

I'm allergic to crab but found the buttery grilled shrimp was a nice substitute.  I would love it if they served LOBSTER.  Thats the only thing missing from your seafood menu.
author: Lien N.

description:
This restaurant is on a wharf, and the walls are all glass so the customers can enjoy dining while watching the different boats and yachts sail through the harbor.  The restaurant was engulfed with different black and white photos, and you could possibly find a favorite celebrity among the images.  It's also across from Alcatraz Island. I had reservations, so AU didn't have to experience a wait time.

The food and service were good.  The waiter was nice, and willing to assist in any way.  I ordered calamari as an appetizer, and it was pretty good.  My entree was even more pleasing, and they mix small slices of sweet potatoes into their serving of patties, but it's really good.  This place shocked me, because it was better than what I thought it would have been.
author: Bradley S.

description: If you visit the Franciscan make sure to get some crab! I opted for the family meal of grilled shrimp and crab with the potatoes and corn. I was too busy eating to talk to my colleagues because the food was so delicious. While at the Fisherman's wharf trying this restaurant out is a must, especially if you are a seafood lover! My waitress was superb and the staff very attentive. They also have very nice views of the bay.
author: Siobahn D.

description:
Fantabulous food with amazing view and great ambience.. prices are great, friendly staff and service is good.
1. Crab cakes are the best I have ever had
2. Sizzler shrimp- very flavorful 
3. Calamari is usual and okay
4. Drinks are great
author: Nidhi S.

description:
I love the whole old style American set up, with all the black and white celebrity fotos and the red diner style seating with amazing views over the bay right at Alcatraz. They even have binoculars next to the table! 
But most important is of course the food. I had half a sizzling crab, and it was totally fantastic. The crispy bits on the outside and the shell so satisfying to crack to get to the juicy meat inside. I enjoyed that very much. 
I also had a bowl of clams, which came in lots of juicy,  buttery broth, perfect for soaking up with the fabulous San Francisco Sourdough bread.
author: Jana S.

description:
Came to San Francisco to play tourist and we wanted some crab for dinner. This place did not disappoint. We got the following: mussels and shrimp hot plate wish the shrimp had been peeled before cooking. Other than that it was great. 
Dungeness crab for 2 people to share and it was awesome! Mashed potatoes with zucchini in it was delicious! Dessert was banana strawberry sundae which was the cherry on the whole meal. 

It is pricey but definitely worth it. Service was great and the view too. 

The downsize was the restaurant was cold and with it being cold outside we were cold almost the entire time.
author: Indira R.

description: Amazing view of the bay, and it didn't matter where you sat, you had a nice view. We came with3 adults and 3 kids. The menu was a little overwhelming because it's book style. We had a rough time finding the kids menu! It's there, just in the back of the menu. My daughter had fish and chips. Pretty good. The chips were smashed red potatoes. Of course we also had the clam chowder bowls, which my daughter ended up loving! The crab fondue appetizer was pretty good as well! Overall, a nice place to eat!
author: Francesca C.

description: Great food and fantastic service! Prices vary depending on what you order- I got a crab chowder bread bowl and it was delicious. I thought it was well priced considering you get a beautiful view on the water. The stairs getting into the restaurant are kind of steep so if you aren't good with stairs take the elevator! An older gentleman almost fell down the stairs when we were there. They also offer partial parking validation.
author: Emily G.

description: We went at lunch time, about noonish. It was busy, not a long wait. I had the crab melt, very delicious. The staff was super friendly. This place has great views of the Bay and Alcatraz. Great place to go visit if you are a tourist, or an evening with your significant other.
author: Jerica G.

description: Really good fish. Served more of fast food style. Very fast service. Great deserts too.  Sit inside or out on the pier or front walk.
author: Alan S.

description:
Beautiful views and friendly staff with average seafood options. 

Let's start by stating the obvious. For good or for bad, this is a tourist trap. 

The views are amazing and the service is good. The food quality however is not reflected in the price.

If you are going with the name SF Crab Restaurant, you better serve some mean crab. I'm sorry but the Crab doesn't even rank in my top 10, let alone my top 5. 

The rest of the seafood is actually quite better compared to the Crab but still falls short, given the price point. 

This is a great place to go with a large group that's never been to San Francisco for the experience and the views, assuming you do not mind overspending on mediocre food.
author: Mario B.

description:
Ordered double mussels,  shrimp and crab combo, clam chowder, and garlic noodle (happens to be the best of the items we ordered. 

3/5 taste (this is all for the garlic noodle)
1/5 service (no service at all from Leonard
4/5 atmosphere (great view of the bay)

Overall 2 stars because of their service level. Wait time for server. No engagement.  

Probably will not come back. Better reviews at Scoma McCormick.  Will try that next.
author: Harry L.

description:
This place offers great views and good food. The atmosphere is charming and the service is great. The menu has many options and great tastes. 

The downside to this place is the price. While the food is good quality it is somewhat lacking for the high price tag. The seafood is mostly fresh and the entrees are well prepared and plated. The ambience is worth the extra dollar with your loved ones. This spot is casual and slightly upscale all at the same time. I would recommend. All the wonderful experience of eating on the bay, without the wind.
author: Chris K.

description: This place was very nostalgic, you could feel the history. We came in for something a little sweet. We saw the Beignet  sign and thought that would be perfect. They were rather large, server with sweet whip cream and powder sugar. They were not quite as light and fluffy as I am use to. They were a little doughy.  I don't know that I would recommend them. We didn't have anything else.
author: Jennifer D.

description:
The presentation was good and the staff were pretty nice. The view was amazing as the sun set and the waves flowing. We had a party of 7 and was seated immediately after check in.

But when we ordered the clam chowder, the cup was smaller than expected but that was fine. Personally, it was a little bit different from other clam chowders I have had but it was creamy. Had the halibut, it was slightly over cooked and unable to stick from the pan it was presented in. The albacore and halibut dishes were very oily. Overall, the experience was not worth the price.
author: Amy H.

description:
Ended up here yesterday because everywhere else on the wharf was crazyyy busy and had a long wait. To be fair, it is Labor Day weekend so I get it but we were hungry! They say us in about 15 minutes so that was nice. 

We ordered some cocktails and some apps to start. The calamari was super crispy (large portion $19.95) and the crab fondue was a total hit amongst everyone  My parents were visiting from MA and were craving some seafood and it definitely hit the spot.  

We also shared the skillet combo which came wth mussels, shrimp and crab. So good! On top of everything, the views here are amazing. Some places on fisherman's wharf are over priced and the food is meh. This place has great food and the views to charge the tourist price; we weren't mad about it. 

Our actual server was MIA the most of the time but again, it's Labor Day weekend, I wouldn't hold it against them and all our food came out promptly.
author: Katlyn H.

description: Súper bueno!!! I had the seafood fettuccine, and it was delicious with the  right amount of spiciness. The shrimp, crab, octopus, calamari and scallops were perfect. The fettuccine was perfectly al dente like I enjoy it.  My husband ordered the regular size seafood cioppino, and he wished he had ordered the medium size. Our waiter was attentive attentive.
author: Lila P.

description: The place is crowded, touristy, and overpriced. Because  there're so many tourists, it feels like the restaurant staff doesn't care if you'll come back. We were waiting for the table by the window, which we didn't get - a guy cut in front of us and  the host gave him our table (the host saw that we were first). And  the and this is a picture of rotten tomatoes in our salad.
author: Yulia S.

description: These guys get soooo busy. One night -- Labor Day Sunday? -- one of their chefs was actually running around tables taking and delivering orders. the wait was long but it was worth the food. Yummy. Went back a week or two later with another friend. Their pastas are delicious. Good beers on top. friendly staff. The friend who ordered the crab was sad the crab's top of the head didn't come with the 'meat' that's normally there when you get them "whole" . apparently, the tops are cleaned off at the market and then taken to the restaurant. Other than that, she was super happy. dessert is meh.
author: A. I.

description:
We dined here a couple weeks ago.  I hadn't been there for many years.  The service was very good.  Fried calamari was good but a little over cooked.  The crab soup was delicious.  The white fish and vegetables I had were very good.  My cousin and I had ordered a crab Louie to share.  It was small with very little crab.  My sister ordered a regular salad and had crab added to it.  She had twice as much as our Louie.  The abalone was tough and had too much batter on it.  Our desserts were all good.  It was good but not as good as I remember it being.   

Also their elevator was out of order.. made it difficult .. I had to walk up stairs with problem knees
author: Doria M.

description:
Whenever we travel into San Francisco, we always visit the Franciscan, either for just drinks (Bloody Marys) or to have lunch and dinner, the experience is outstanding!   We have had the Crab Cakes, the whole Crabs and the pasta dishes, enjoy the freshness of the sea food, it's amazing! 

The servers are outstanding!  Make sure you try the crab and the crab cakes!    You won't be disappointed!
author: Mark J.

description:
YUM! This spot was perfect!!

Upon arriving we were quickly seated. I couldn't have asked for a better seat, we had a booth with a great view of the ocean and Alcatraz, as a tourist I appreciated that!

Our sever came by  and introduced himself, we asked for wine as we looked over the menu. The menu was full of delicious choices and pictures, I had a hard time trying to figure out what to order, our server was kind enough to make suggestions.  Our server was attentive, helpful, and very hospitable.

I was told by friends in Chicago that I HAD to try the clam chowder in San Francisco and our server also recommended the chowder so I decided on that along with a dozen oysters. My chowder was thick, potato-y and loaded with clam pieces and my oysters were fresh with a a buttery flavor, I was very happy with my choices.

My cousins ordered a lemony Halibut dish, crab sliders, and a pasta that was modified to be vegan per my cousins request.

We also had a side of potatoes, corn, onions and olives that we shared.

I tried my cousins halibut and couscous and really enjoyed that as well, it tasted light and fresh. 

When I return to California I want to order the crab enchiladas, the picture in the menu of the enchiladas looked so good!! I had so much fun having  catching up with my cousins over drinks and lunch and creating new memories.
author: Mayra Z.

description:
This restaurant lives up to it's reputation of being an expensive restaurant. However, it is a Fisherman's Wharf landmark. It was around decades before Pier 39 was built and has a good view of Alcatraz Island. They have a good selection of pastas, seafood, and steaks. We had the crab, pasta, and some salads. All were good. The sourdough bread they serve is from Acme Bakery from the East Bay. I prefer it to Boudin's, which is the longtime bakery at Fisherman's Wharf.

This restaurant does not have parking, but there are lots close. Traffic is congested around the Wharf and Pier 39, so I recommend the bus, cable car, or walking.
author: Curtis T.

description:
Pros:
Incredible view

High ceilings with tall windows



Multiple levels of seating so everyone can enjoy the view even if you're not seated right next to the window

Food arrives hot and fresh

Menu has a recipes to the dishes inside so if you like what you're eating you can enjoy it at home.

Cons:

Service take absolutely too long to get to you, so your best bet is to know exactly what you want to eat and drink and because there will be a 10 to 20 minute wait between server visits.

The lack of cleanliness in a restaurant this upscale leave something to be desired. We had to not only ask our server to wipe down the dirty tables and seats but then we have to show them where the dirt was. And as we look on the floor if we could see the trend of tables and seats having been to swipe on to the floor and in the mess left there.


Commentary

Seated on the shores of San Francisco with the picturesque view of Alcatraz is the Franciscan restaurant. The restaurant environment seems as busy as the city streets themselves as the lack of abundance of servers makes it understandable why it takes so long to get serviced as needed in this restaurant. I will say the food will arrive, the food will be absolutely fresh, and you will enjoy the flavors. The recipe is in the mini you are a nice touch because if you do like what you had you can see exactly how it was me except for the sink with garlic sauce they don't give that recipe away. My wife thoroughly enjoy the crab and I absolutely adore the garlic noodles. She cannot stop speaking about them.She says they are rich and flavorful and the pasta was cooked just right.

I Partake in the clam chowder myself. I thought the clam chowder had a generally good flavor, it left something to be desired. The lack of clam and the lack of flavor Made it a rather basic experience. I will deathly have to continue to walk the pier in search of clam chowder worthy of the name.

Conclusion

This is the type of restaurant you go to so that when others ask you if you've been there before you can tell them you've been there and have a conversation. The view in and of itself is actually what is made this restaurant worth the journey to me and of course the company of my beautiful wife! 

I'm not saying I wouldn't come back and dine here again, I'm just saying that it is a rather mediocre experience in my eyes.
author: Sj B.

description: I'm never coming back to California. Too many bad restaurants specifically targeting tourists trying to take advantage of people. Hole in the wall places are the best. And why would I ever go back? I doubt these people suddenly figured out how to make decent food
author: Lauren C.

description: I love this place! The food is wonderful. The crab is delicious and the cocktails are great. Just like the majority of the other reviews, the view is why most people come here. Beautiful! It is a bit pricey though. I also love the cool music..definitely oldies
author: Olive R.

description: I tried the Franciscan Crab Restaurant during a business trip. The atmosphere, location, and staff were all great. I ordered from the prix fixe menu clam chowder and crab legs. The clam chowder was a little different from what I was expecting, it was good, just had a different taste from most clam chowders I've had before (I am from the east coast so maybe they make it differently where I'm from). The crab legs were okay. I had never had dungeness legs before. The crab legs themselves were good but it was very messy to eat because the butter mixture is placed on top of the crab legs on the plate instead of to the side. Crab legs are pretty messy to begin with so this didn't really help the situation. I'm not sure that the butter on the outside of the shell does anything for taste, but then again I'm not a chef. I would definitely like to try this restaurant again in the future but maybe some different dishes.
author: Nicki S.

description:
Visiting from out of town and my boyfriend had been here before and raved about it. I was excited to try it and was pleasantly surprised that there was no wait on a rainy afternoon. I loved the diner vibe and black-and-white pictures everywhere. We were seated in a nice booth with a great view of Alcatraz. The restaurant is located upstairs on the second floor so there is nothing impeding your view. 

Our waiter was very attentive and brought us everything we asked for in a timely manner. We ordered a cup of crab chowder and a whole dungeness crab to share between the two of us. Chowder was good, but $13 is overpriced for a cup of soup anywhere, even in SF. Fresh sourdough bread went very well with the soup. Loved the presentation of the whole crab, and it was fresh and delicious. Cooked in just a perfect amount of garlic butter. I really appreciated that our waiter even offered to break it up for us to make it easier to eat. Expensive lunch for two people, but it's very rare that we get to enjoy a whole dungeness crab with such an incredible view. 

Franciscan's has a lot of character and I would definitely recommend it to any out-of-towners looking for a great restaurant at the wharf!
author: Katie R.

description: Great locations. However very disappointed with the crab selections. We expect more. Service is good and no wait.! Great view of the bay.
author: Gina M.

description:
Wow.  What a useless manager tonight unwilling to help a 90 year old woman ( long term resident of San Francisco). She left her credit card at the restaurant and bring a good neighbor I volunteered to go back and get it for her on a crowded Fleet Weekend evening. 

The manager was unable to navigate or understand the gravity of making a 90 year old woman go across  the city to get her cars vs working out the situation with me. 

Clueless about senior citizens and common sense when dealing with the elderly. 

So now my 90 year old neighbor is forced to get out of house and venture the crowds due to lack of skills in the manager there tonight.
author: Ed John ..

description: I recently went to this restaurant for the first time. Amazing views of the Bay, stylish interior, and it has that bustle and busyness of a good restaurant. As large as this place is, it was a surprise to find it full, busy and people waiting for table. We arrived early for our reservation, but were seated at our reservation time. To be honest, I wasn't expecting much from the food, and thought this would be a tourist trap. I was impressed at the level of service, and the food quality and presentation. The crab was outstanding. The sides, and pastas were really very good. Even their wine selection was excellent. We didn't think we would have dessert, but we did, and it too was really wonderful. We look forward to dining again there, as it was such a positive experience.
author: Jason P.

description: Service was just ok, and the food was subpar especially for the cost. The calamari was rubbery and just...bad. Really disappointed in the quality.
author: M D.

description:
When the promise of ceviche is denied and your favorite empanada stop is sold out you are left to settle.  Sorry Franciscan... you were our third option.  

Service:  (In fairness this was a weekend so they had a full crowd)  Lines were out the door to order a crab sandwich to share with the wife and two bowls of clam chowder for the kids.  Staff was not the friendliest; but when dealing with a crowd they were focused on getting orders through so kudos for them.

Food: Chowder was good.. I mean I think I have become jaded because I think ALL chowder is good.  Nothing exceptional compared to neighboring restaurants and chowder huts.   The crab sandwich I was not a fan of.  Maybe with some more hot sauce; but as it was it was to "creamy".  

Beignet - This deserves its own spot.  If you go here you must order some beignets.  I have never been to New Orleans; but my wife having visited said these were on point.  Fresh and hot out of the oven.  Kids devoured them and my wife and I ended up running an extra mile that night.  This earned the entire restaurant an extra star and a half in my opinion.  

Price: Comparable to the local area as its touristy and a little higher than you would find away from the wharf.  But for the amount of food you get (the crab sandwich was huge) you do get a large portion for what you pay for.
author: Sean G.

description:
Yummy crab cakes 
Good entrees I recommend the spicy shrimp pasta, crab enchiladas 
Good cocktails too
author: Louise K.

description: Whenever we are in town, we make a stop at the Franciscan. Fantastic crab, great service and beautiful view.  Tried the crab fondue for the first time and it's well worth it.  Only negative is that there beer menu is a bit limited.
author: Jeff M.

description: The best Crab in town!!!! I'm a crab lover and highly recommend this place. The View is beautiful and waiters always in a good mood. Every time we have a special celebration we come to Franciscan Crab Restaurant
author: Marcela F.

description: We had the garlic noodles and half order of roasted crab. The noodles were not the typical garlic noodles that you find in San Francisco but not bad. The crab was excellent.
author: Gogo A.

description:
Double Crab. Double Shrimp and a cup of Clam Chowder. We had a couple of bottles of wine sat by the window and just relaxed. Very friendly and prompt staff 
Food was great! The lemon butter was legit!  It's a really cool atmosphere!
author: Joshua H.

description: Wonderful food. We had the crab chowder in a sourdough bowl with the double crab and double shrimp. Everything we delicious! I ordered the Ariel allure martini cocktail but sent it back. It wasn't as refreshing as I thought with the lime and cucumber.
author: J K.

description:
Located by the water with a lovely view, this upstairs and 1920s vibe of a restaurant is a crab lovers and seafood paradise. Beautifully crafted menus illustrate their items and the decor is classy. The food was pretty good but it didn't make my top list of seafood restaurants. 

[The restaurant & service] 
Arriving at the restaurant, watch your step as you ascend the stairs into a beautifully decorated space with large windows (lots of natural lighting), white table cloths, and a fresh crab display. Since my group was a party of 10 people including a toddler, we were put more towards the restroom area where it was more spacious and out of the way. Menus were handed and drink orders were taken. Service was on top of things, they even brought out complimentary bread and amazing butter. They had the freshest and most creamy butter that I have ever tasted! 

[The food] 
The food was tasty but nothing special that exploded my tastebuds or anything. 

-appetizer // complimentary bread with butter // I LOVED that butter, but man did that bread make my jaw hurt. It was tasty but as a person who wears retainers at night to keep their teeth straight, this one definitely made my teeth crooked for the night haha....

-starter soup // crab chowder in a sourdough bread bowl // 15.95 // Decided to YOLO and go with the bread bowl since there was only a 3.00 difference between the cup and bread bowl. The crab chowder has a different base than the clam chowder, so do not be fooled. It's still good but from everyone's reaction, the clam chowder was the real winner. 

-entree // wild halibut in ciopinno sauce // 32.95 // Overall a tasty dish, with tiny quinoa looking pasta, veggies, a generous chunk of halibut and the cioppino sauce. My only downfall was that the cioppino sauce was not as good as other places that I've been to around the wharf area. It was missing something and tasted more of marinara or canned stewed tomatoes. 

Overall, this restaurant has a nice ambiance and is appealing to the eye, however there was just a few flavor components missing in the food for me to truly feel like it was worth the amount of money spent. 

ALSO, please don't forget to get your car tickets validated if you parked in the lots around fishermen's wharf. We were only there for about 2 hours and we were charged 36 dollars because we forgot to get our ticket validated....it was as if Karl the fog decided he wanted to join us for dinner as well.
author: Emily T.

description: I can't rave enough about the crab here. They know what they're doing, I haven't had crab that delicious in a while. The calamari was nice too- I forget the name of my drink but it was ok. I wish it were stronger for the price, but that wasn't a major thing for me- so I just got one. The service was quick and they also had this cool phone charger device! Nothing like my being able to take food pics because your phone died! All in all, I enjoyed my time here. We went during a rainy evening so I missed out on the great views that this place offers. When I return, I want to go earlier in the day to have the full experience. Also, the free parking (with validation) for two hours was a plus.
author: Chloe O.

description: This place is fun!!   Cool 80's Miami vibe.  Only got the Bruschetta so I can't speak to the gmfood much but that was great.   Nice view and decent service.
author: Heather B.

description:
Crab enchiladas again!! Always good here,
The view is great. Sit at the bar tables for the best view.
Food is ok, but it's the view that you come for. I think they should lower the prices, but it's a tourist attraction.  The cost of doing business in s prime location.
author: Tracy G.

description: Menu options were ok, but I appreciated the recipe / swap out of items. The halibut with garlic / oil dipping sauce was very good. Decor was pretty cool and our waiter was very attentive.
author: Jim A.

description: The best clam chowder hands down also the crab foundue was great as well.  The service was fantastic,  staff continued checking on us our entire time we were dining.  When ever in San Francisco I will always dine here and will recommend this place .  The ambiance is great was able to take some great photos.  Loooove this place so much
author: Annie B.

description: CRAB HEAVEN! Franciscan was an awesome dinner spot that was highly recommended from a family friend. The atmosphere of the restaurant was wonderful. We had panoramic views of the harbor and was able to eat dinner and watch the sunset. We ordered the Crab Feast which feeds 4 people comfortably. However, if you're not a fan of garlic then you won't like the secret garlic sauce they use on the crabs. I'm a huge fan of garlic so it was delicious for me.
author: Chris K.

description: The fish m chips and crab enchiladas were awesomely delicious! Will absolutely return here for another round. Two thumbs up for the service as well. #HighlyRecommended
author: Robert T.

description:
I believe Franciscan, Crab House, Dead Fish, & The Stinking Rose (which i've only been to the one in LA) are all under the same owner, like sister restaurants. Menus all have the same idea, pricing about what what (give or take a few bucks), and food all very similar.
I sat upstairs outside.. nice scenery, good service, and the restaurant (at least where I sat) had a good vibe. I ordered the whole crab with mussels. You get a good amount of mussels with this order. The food was good but not amazing. The crab could use more of the roasted green taste, just like The Crab House.
Pricing is very similar to the other restaurants I listed above. Whole crab about $45 another $15 for the mussels. I thinking it's worth the visit.. if you go on a nice day, opt to sit outside. A lot to watch while you sit lol.
author: Qushandia H.

description: The service is okay, but the food was mediocre at best and the prices are ridiculous. We got the octopus carpaccio, yellowtail carpaccio, and lump crab meat cocktail. The only thing that was decent was the crab cocktail, we didn't even eat the rest of the food.. My Moscow Mule was even bad, how is that possible?
author: Jonathan H.

description:
Pros:
- great view of the ships and water at sunset
- good service
- crab chowder in a bread bowl was tasty

Cons:
- long wait (an hour)
- too expensive, not worth it in my opinion (over $200 for a party of 4)
- bacon bits in my spicy shrimp pasta overpowered the seafood taste (which I want to be able to taste if I'm eating at a seafood restaurant)

Would I come back again? No. If I could do it again, I would just get their Dungeness crab instead of pasta and other dishes. It would probably be more worth it.
author: April H.

description: The food was alright nothing to special, the servers were great on a Tuesday afternoon. The view is absolutely amazing though.
author: Rian B.

description:
Feeling pretty full from an afternoon lunch we decided to get a snack before dinner. Everyone I knew that has visited San Francisco told me 1 million times that I have to go to the wharf to get the best food in town. After a quick walk-through of the old arcade we stumbled upon the Franciscan crab restaurant. We ordered the calamari and fries basket and a couple of beers to boot. It was super cool while we are waiting for food there was a group of break dancers dancing just upfront that kept us entertained. The food came out quickly. I snapped a quick photo and it was time to dig in. I took my first bite and oh no!!! It was super cold and not like it can be warmed up cold but like it's been sitting out all day in a ice chest. I couldn't figure it out how could something that's been deep-fried be cold. The only logical explanation  is that it may not be as fresh as I was hoping. Maybe it was an off day maybe it's just a tourist attraction that is lost sight of their quality but either way I certainly won't be back. 

There is a silver lining to the story. I did happen upon one of my most favorite beers I have ever had in my entire life. It's called anchor steam and I will be looking everywhere to find this at my local store.
author: Eric S.

description: My parents were in town, so it was the perfect opportunity to visit the Franciscan Crab restaurant and have a crab feast. It's literally called the Crab Feast! The crab was so delicious with that buttery garlicky flavor. We also got the mussels & shrimp skillet, crab fondue, and a side of steamed vegetables. It was the perfect meal for us four. That crab fondue, though. It's a definite must-order every time we go. The steamed vegetables on the other hand are very basic, and felt simply steamed with no seasoning at all. However we were dredging the crab & seafood skillets with the vegetables to get that great buttery garlicky awesomeness. We had a window table with a great view of the bay and of Alcatraz, and service was attentive without being overbearing. Great experience overall!
author: Chris Y.

description:
I and my friends went to Franciscan yesterday.
This place has a nice view that you can see Alcatraz. We ordered calamari , fresh oyster and iron combo set. The oyster not fresh as I think but it not bad.The iron set is ok but I think the service not good enough for the big restaurant because the server and runner just walk pass and didn't ask for everything ok or ask to fill the water, they just ask to take the place out and are we done?.So we pay expensive we should get better service.
author: Panpaporn K.

description: famous destination at fisherman wharf if you're visiting san francisco. prime location right on the bay water with amazing views. crab is their specialty and served in many different dishes. various flavor sauces to choose on how you like the crab prepared. always enjoy my time eating here. a little difficult to find parking but that's how it goes in the city. great location to celebrate special occasions.
author: Jack W.

description: We were very hungry when we got off the ferry and hence we're willing to eat anywhere. All the food we got and desert were delicious: fried calamari, blini with smoked salmon, clam chowder, shrimp and chips, strawberry cheesecake and sea bass. The view is phenomenal and service was relatively attentive. The 2 main downsides were that the bathrooms were not clean and that the bread served to us was cold and when we asked to warm it, they only offered to heat it in the microwave, not an oven.
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
Excellent place for all occasions! We were sat immediately by a window with a great view of Alcatraz. The staff was extremely attentive and very friendly. The bread starter is delicious and just kept coming! 
I had the best fish and chips I've ever had in my life- wow. 
I also tried he vegetable Bolognese which I thought could be a much bigger portion for $20 but still tasty and he crab sliders were very flavorful. 
If you're looking for great seafood, this is the place to go!
author: Alyssa E.

description:
Generous portions!  Choose from
A variety of seafood selection a meal is good for 2 people
author: Aileen G.

description: Great selection of seafood!! Oysters and crab are just ok... but parents loved it! If you order whole crab the waiter can cut it in front of you if you request. Highly recommend the crab cheese fondue. It's on the pricier side but the view is awesome
author: Alicia Xiaorong Z.

description:
I had a great experience and the food was yumm!
  One crab cost us 45$ but it worth it.
The view on the ocean ... romantic)
author: Kate K.

description:
Pick pocket inside restaurant, manager refused to help. Disappointed. Travel to here, be careful!
Wallet and phone were gone in 5 mins after paying the meal without leaving the restaurant.
Asked Manager to review camera, he said no, asked to call police, he said later...
We had reported to police by ourself.
author: Andy L.

description: Our trip was coming close to the end in San Francisco so we decided to try out this restaurant on the pier. So glad we decided to,  the crab chowder was delicious and our dungenous crab platter was to die for. We also ordered an appetizer of the clams and garlic buttered shrimp to top it off. The crab platter comes to our table still sizzling hot. The set up is very smart,  below our platter sits two bowls to put our crab shells in,  very smart I must say.  Our waiter was very nice, found out where we were from and it was over,  he was planning on taking his family to Hawaii next summer,  so we have him some advice. The prices are a bit more on the pricier side so if you don't mind spending a little more you'll love this restaurant...almost forgot to mention to leave room for dessert,  they have a delicious custard ice cream too.
author: Janice T.

description:
Love this place. Was with my husband and daughter (asleep in her stroller the entire dinner!) and had great food and service! They were accommodating with us wanting/needing to bring our sleeping 2.5 yr old in her stroller. Gave us a nice spot along the windows with a perfect view of the bay AND gave my husband a quiet clean place to lay out his prayer rug and offer his prayers. 

The food was BEYOND delicious. My husband was fasting (its Ramadan) and we ordered 5-6 dishes and absolutely loved each one. The complimentary bread and butter was out of this word. Warm bread and soft slow churned butter was delicious. We ordered an array of pasta, fish, side dishes, crab, clam chowder (no bacon yay!). Honestly, probably one of the best fish dishes we have had in our entire lives. Cant wait to come back!
author: Hinna A.

description:
We were visiting San Francisco and we were being tourists on Pier 39, walking around looking for a place to eat. There are so many choices, but we decided to go into the Franciscan Crab Restaurant. The view from the Franciscan is amazing! The have long windows all around and you could see into the bay and Alcatraz (they even have binoculars so you can take a closer look). This place is in the expensive side but the food was amazing!

There were 4 of us, but another group of 5 joined us. We did not have any reservations, we just kind of showed up. The staff was great and accommodated in a big table big enough for our group. They took our orders and the food came out really fast. The server was really attentive and when we asked at the beginning if we could get separate checks, the server said "yes". 

Most of the group ordered the Clam Chowder and/or Crab Chowder. However, I ordered the Basa (fish) with a spicy gochujang glaze (side note: the glaze on the fish was to die for) and it also comes with acini di pepe pasta with sun dried tomatoes and snap peas, some potatoes and slices of corn on the cob.

The Basa was cooked to perfection and the combination with that spicy gochujang glaze was a pair made in heaven. The acini di pepe pasta was also delicious, at first glance I thought it was Israeli Couscous because it looks similar. Overall, it was tasty and had a great time. 


P.S. I'm still dreaming of that BASA!
author: Hector G.

description: The service, the view, the food, the drinks, all so good! After reading other reviews, I would agree that the clam chowder is just good. Not the best I've ever had but still delicious. Get it in the bread bowl! The crab in everyone's dishes at my table tasted fresh and just as we hoped. The crab fondue was a favorite of mine as well as my Italian cheesecake dessert (see photo). Overall, we will be coming back because the combination of everything that The Franciscan Crab Restaurant offers made for one of our favorite Bay Area dinners to date.
author: Beth M.

description: We stop by to try out the oysters and grab a drink while we take in the view. We have been here before and the service is fast and friendly but the food is just ok. But they have seating with the view of the water, you can see Alcatraz and people watch as they walk on the boardwalk below. Some of the seats have binoculars so that you can see everything up close. Very cool. Lol.
author: Ron V.

description:
Did the touristy thing with the sister and niece's family and decided to stop here for a late lunch. This place is still bustling with late Sunday brunch diners. The room has a panoramic view of the bay. 
We ordered the Crab, shrimps and mussels, clam chowder and crab sandwich. All were delicious except the shrimp was a little small for something left on shells.
Nice atmosphere for any gathering.
author: Melissa T.

description:
I keep seeing reviews how this place is over priced or "on the expensive side" but if you're from the Bay Area their food is pretty normal priced for the area it is in. 

This place has amazing views all throughout the whole restaurant. The booth I was sat at had a nice view of Alcatraz. 

My friend and I ordered the double mussels & double crab on the iron roasted skillet. It was really actually flavorful, I did have my doubts beforehand. Their garlic butter for dipping is so good!

The only disappointment I had during my experience was, we had ordered an extra side of butter because it was two of us sharing and we thought we might as well have 2 butters... our server brought it out promptly but it was cold :(

The service here is great! Our server was very attentive but not overbearing. 

I would definitely come back, next time I'll probably order more food because I was still a little hungry in the end.
author: Marissa G.

description: Staff was fantastic, food was good, but not great. However, we had a great table overlooking Alcatraz, and our waiter was awesome. I would certainly come back for a drink and appetizers, but not sure I would have dinner here again.
author: Bill D.

description:
We dined here for a business meal while visiting the SFO area. Myself and another in our party have been here in the past and had impeccable food and service and were very excited to go back. Needless to say we clearly knew this was going south quick from the moment we sat down.
1. It took 10 minutes just to be greeted by our waitress
2. Before getting our drinks, she paused at a dinning room mirror to reapply her lipstick and then cleaned her mouth with her hands before getting our drinks
3. The appetizers were tasteless and not hot when they should be hot
4. The entrees here awful. None of us finished our meal and only took about 4-5 bites each
5. Service was so slow and the lack of attention was depressing

Overall, when we got our bill, we asked for the manager. When the manager came over to the table, we explained our concerns in a very nice way. She apologized and thanked us for the feedback and left. I normal circumstances when a guest mentions such issues and it is clear they did not eat the food ordered, the manager would offer a dessert or discount on the bill. In this case we were made to pay the full bill and brushed off. I will never again dine here and I would suggest that you don't either.

https://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g60713-d493274-r560112448-Franciscan_Crab_Restaurant-San_Francisco_California.html#
author: Travis S.

description: Went here on a Friday afternoon for a couple drinks and the toy box cherry tomatoes.  Excellent food, drinks, and service.  Had a seat by the window for that perfect view, too.  You definitely should check this place out.  Next time, I'm going hungry so I can eat some crab!
author: Jason T.

description: Had lunch here during fleet week, crab melts were great, calamari was over cooked, and the Crab cakes were amazing! Large portions, service was average
author: Mike G.

description: I really enjoyed this place. Me and my girlfriend love crab and This place delivered. It isn't cheap but I think the price is fair. Not to mention the view is amazing the back of the restaurant is has windows looking out at the bay. I shoveled crab in to my face while gazing out at Alcatraz.
author: Matt C.

description: I came here because a friend previously went and recommended it. They give you binoculars by the window, but it's all a game of chance on where you're seated and what you'll be able to see. The binoculars can't be adjusted and all I saw was a docked ferry, but still a fun item they provide. I expected more from a seafood restaurant, everything here seemed very basic. I had the clam chowder bowl. The extra for the bread bowl was not worth it, and the soup was kind of sour. We also had the crab fondue dip. The bread they gave us was cold and could barely chew it. We had that seafood sizzling combo with crab, mussels, and shrimp. It was okay, nothing special. Overall, the place is just all right. There was nothing amazing about the food, I've had better. Since I was only visiting, it made me wish I checked out a different seafood restaurant.
author: Toni Rose J.

description: A bit shocked at just how great the (v. Affordable) fish and chips were. Service is leisurely, but good music and superlative views.
author: Dan S.

description:
Fish sandwich: okay, but so many better places around. 

$10 for a fish sandwich, basa on dry and stale roll, light slaw on top, bland. Coating on fish was attractive and it was cooked right, but 1/20th the taste palette of Codmother's which is just a block or two away (with AWESOME fries too!). 

Packaged tarter sauce and malt vinegar helped it go down, threw out most of the roll. No hot sauce at this place?!? Yeesh.

What really blew my mind, on a day with air quality of 172 at this location due to the Napa fires, they actually fleece customers and additional DOLLAR for a cup for water. Thankfully I still had a small one from work that they filled "free." Minor miracles. 

I know it's the wharf and you kinda bend over when you come up here, but still can't support a local business that pulls stunts like this. Meh sandwich, I get it, it's food and didn't get sick. But charging your customers an outrageous fee for a cup for water to wash it down just ruins whatever they had going for them. A couple stars for the view and the fact I found a workaround to the water fleecing.
author: T J.

description:
Had the fishwich and I must say it was tasty and definitely something you should try. Fish was fresh, flaky, and flavorful. I would add a more zesty coleslaw to add more flavor to sandwich overall. Great portion size to share and plenty to enjoy. 

Location and ambiance are great. Right on the water and you can see Alcatraz out the window while dining. 

I would definitely try this spot and enjoy it.
author: Terrance S.

description: The view was amazing.   The food was delicious.   Best muscles ever tasted.   Shrimp was plump and juicy.  Will be coming back when in San Francisco.
author: Marco M.

description: We were craving seafood and this hit the spot! We actually stopped in for drinks but the food looked good we just stayed for dinner. Our server was amazing -- I don't remember his name but he's the little guy with the thick curly black hair -- you know who you are. We ordered the crab, shrimp, and mussel combo which was perfect for the two of us. And we splurged with dessert because why not. The food was great, the service was great, and the view was great. Excellent Saturday night meal.
author: Megan L.

description: Wow this place is awesomeeeeee i went to San Francisco last year and i had a fish dish there, it was one of the best things i ever ate. I made sure to visit this restaurant again during my visit now because i never forgot how great was the food. I went with my mum and she loved it too. Worth every penny !!
author: Nadine D.

description:
Still a fan after all these years (way before Yelp days).  I have Yelp now to share the luv.  Actually, I'm a fan of all their restaurants, not only in the city, but also Deadfish in Crockett, and their other restaurant Salito's Crab House & Prime Rib in Sausalito formerly Margaritaville, good times there.  Sit at the bar, stay awhile and watch the bartenders make some mean arse drinks.  Franciscan Crab never disappoints.  Our friend visiting SF said their menu is like a magazine LOL.  Get the seafood platter, it's a must.  If you still have room, get the filet or crab enchiladas.  Can't go wrong with the clam chowder (bread bowl, cup, or regular bowl).  For dessert, get the decadent chocolate mousse.  Our waitress was really sweet, she kept bringing towelettes out, it can get messy eating all that crab, mussels, and shrimp.  She never missed a beat on refilling our waters, or asking if we needed more drinks. 

Stellar service as always, stunning views, and nostalgic ambiance brings me back here every time we crave seafood or a romantic date night.  Although, I will gladly tag along anytime hubby has clients to take out.  I'm also the best city tour guide besides Emperor Norton hahaha.  I love meeting new people!  Highly recommended, be sure to visit their other locations.
author: Christine R.

description: I don't think I'll be coming back! Crab soup tasted like feet and the crab was not only the worst crab I've ever had but was burnt!!! Sad to say McDonalds would of probably been better!! $90 on the worst meal I've ever had!
author: Cassandra D.

description: This is a restaurant with a great view of Alcatraz and the bay. Great place to try if you're a tourist visiting San Francisco. Food was average for me. Although I really loved their crab fondue. We had the shrimp and crab platter, oysters, calamari, hamachi. All we're good but I had better at other seafood restaurants in San Fran.
author: Jeanette B.

description:
My family had reservations for our party of 6 at 5:30 for my uncles birthday. We arrived and got seated right away. 

Our server came and got us water, took our order, brought our food out and we never saw him again. The busser came and cleared our table before we even got the bill. That's how slow our waiter was. 

We ordered a salad plate, the fish plate choice of 1 fish and a way it is cooked, alfredo for my siblings, buttermilk battered chicken, and dungeons crab.
The food was pretty good but very expensive. 

2 stars for service 
4 stars for food 

Al
author: Erika N.

description:
This location is a 5 Star View with a 1 Star Service and 1 Star Food.
The Waiter was slow and antisocial. Our order was wrong "they brought mussels when we ordered garlic steamed clams" then argued with us about it being wrong. The clams arrived 15 minutes later and we had already finished the other food. The clams were tasteless and had sandy grit in it, a sign that they were not properly cleaned. The Crab Chowder was also tasteless and had almost no crab on it. I should have stayed with just a bowl of clam chowder.
I expected the overpriced food due to the location, but at these prices you deserve quality service and quality food, both of which are lacking at this beautiful location.
Note - This is the second time here and the second time with the same results so I am comfortable saying to go to another local restaurant and do not waste your time or money here.
author: Douglas F.

description: Speedy & delicious beignets! As a vegetarian I couldn't eat any of the seafood so qot coffee and dessert instead!
