author: Tania B.

description: Pretty cool place down on the Wharf. We had pop in to try some food. Place was crowded and we was able to score a table. We shared some calamari, some garlic fries. Food was good, we will return to explore more things on the menu.
author: Dennis B.

description:
After having clam chowder in Fisherman's Wharf, we decided to take a stroll along the bay and originally, we passed by Franciscan without any thought. After taking a second glance, we realized that they serve "fresh" beignets here after seeing it advertised on the awning so we decided to stop by and check it out.

The beignets came out super hot; they just deep fried them as soon as we ordered and coated it with powdered sugar. While the beignets were warm and fluffy, I wouldn't say the dough was the best I've ever had. To be perfectly fair, some of the best beignets I've had were at Disneyland and those were amazing. The beignets here were average and nothing special; I wouldn't go out of my way to get them here.
author: Jason L.

description: Let's be honest. You come here for the ambiance and views. Hence the 3 stars. Service was good, but snobby. Got the Prix Fixe deal. Wasn't disappointed with the clam chowder, although the salad my father in-law got was lacking. We both got crab legs. Definitely over cooked and dry. Nothing to dip your dry crab meat in because the butter on the skillet is browned out and kind of gritty. The custard ice cream was the best frozen anything I've ever had. Tasted like whip cream. My wife got chicken and chips, which was more like soggy fried chicken strips and a dry, yet soggy mix of smashed potatoes and yams. Her plate looked old and skipped over many times. The ice tea was practically black and sour. The inside of the place is awesome and makes you feel like you traveled back in time and there's going to be Frank Sinatra eating in the corner booth. The views are pretty amazing also and they provide binoculars to see even further. They could use a little work in the kitchen and more training with service. Won't be back because I wasn't impressed, but you should give it a try just for the ambiance.
author: Drew B.

description:
I've probably passed by this restaurant a million times just walking around Fisherman's Wharf, but with all the other food places in the area I never made it in. I finally got to try it Thursday night and it made me wish I had checked it out sooner. 

The building itself is amazing. It's this massive ship inspired structure with these huge windows, so guests are treated to a panoramic view of San Francisco Bay. That being said, this place gets pretty busy - lots of tourists. Thankfully we had a reservation, and were seated right away in a nice little booth facing the water. 

Everything on the menu looked good, so it took us awhile to figure out what to get. We ended up with the crab & smoked salmon bellini, the sea bass in a lemon butter garlic caper sauce, and the seafood fettuccine. The sea bass was a tiny bit over cooked, but it was nothing to complain about as it was still absolutely scrumptious. The pasta was made perfectly, and the bellini appetizer was light yet satisfying. We were planning on getting dessert, but we were so full, we had to pass. We'll definitely be back though.

Tip: Incorporate the Embarcadero traffic into your travel time. 
Good news: They validate parking for the first 2 hours and there's a lot right in front of the restaurant.
author: Mica G.

description:
Great choice by the coworker for bringing all of us here for our dinner! The place has high windows and neon lights in the front. It has a great view of the bay and street lights of the Embarcadero. 

We ordered the octopus carpaccio, calamari, some raw oysters, and crab fondue. Although I didn't try the fondue, it looked creamy and delicious. It was my first time having octopus carpaccio and it was pleasant. I wasn't a fan of the texture though. The oysters were perfect! The calamari was slightly spicy which made it different from other places. 

I ordered the crab louie salad which was larger than I thought from the picture. The crab was generous and the olives, tomatoes, boiled eggs, and avocado were all great additions. For dessert I tried the frozen custard which was crazy addicting. It had a smooth texture and wasn't too sweet. 

Needless to say that everyone finished their meal. This place is a go-to if you're looking for some bomb seafood, especially for some crab. I cannot wait to come back again!
author: Jenna T.

description: I'll make this simple. Terrible workers with bad attitude. Food is average. Do yourself and go across to Boudin.
author: Daniel W.

description: I came here for the crab. It was really good.  I was so full.  I love the ambience. We had a great water view.
author: Nikia B.

description: Delicious meal and good service.  The filet mignon was tender, cooked perfectly and seasoned nicely.  The crab was steamed to perfection and deliciously fresh.  The ambiance is nice, but the jazz style music was a little loud for my taste.  All in all, a very good dining experience.
author: David R.

description:
See the lower ratings so thought since our experience was 5 Star I would rate
Great crab. We had the crab cocktail and enchilada
Perfect service
Fun atmosphere 
I would recommend
author: Douglas A.

description: Decided to give the San Franciscan another chance. The food was awesome, especially the yellowtail carpaccio and the crab fondue. We went around 2 p.m., which was a less crowded time and had an excellent view of the water. The food came out looking very appetizing and our waiter was very kind with a smile on his face. It made me enjoy my visit again to the Pier. Thank you Franciscan for an amazing late lunch.
author: Leanh E.

description:
Favorite sea food, so far from San Francisco! Big place and very simple with delicious food and fast service! Can't complain at all. Food came pretty fast ,cocktail also! Highly recommended this place for a lovers of sea food and pasta food :)
I would definitely come back again!
author: Veronika K.

description: Delicious food with an amazing view great place to take the family! The waiter was very pleasant and polite. I can't recall what out starter was it was tomatoes onion and a ves other vegetables marinated with crouton like bread it was great still not sure what it was, of course they brought out bread and butter it was delicious, We got two orders of the double crab, double shrimp I personally ordered a cup of clam chowder it was EVERYTHING! I may of had a cranberry and vodka as well lol. We also ordered the potatoes witch were amazing as well as the Cheese cake for dessert perfection might I add it comes with a glass of ice cream. You have to go at least once in your life time !!!
author: Naomi M.

description:
Expect to spend 150$ for two people on food only. We spent $110 (before tip )for two adults and one child no drinks but we only got one appetizer. The main dish portions are huge. You need to get the sizzle plate: 
The crab is pretty good. The shrimp is better than average. 

The "choose your own fish plate" is highly recommended. You get to chose the fish sauce and sides for $28.  It's very good for picky people who like choices. It's one of the few times I didn't substitute or ask them to take out anything. 

It's very crowded Bc it's in a touristy area. It's supposed to have amazing views but I only rate my reviews based on food and service ONLY ( not on parking or views etc). 

The hostesss and host were not very nice but I got one real smile from one host after I said I had a reservation.  the wait staff and bus boys were sooooooo nice ! Extremely busy on a Friday night even late at 8 pm. We would definitely return but at an earlier time Bc after 6 pm I think it gets crazy and wait staff isn't as attentive. If they had been more attentive and came around more then we would have gotten dessert but it took them 15 minutes  to clean up our plates and we were figuring it would take them another 30-40 minutes for coffee and dessert and check so we just left after main course. It's not a fancy place but you should definitely dress something in nicer than jeans. If you go on the weekend nights it's Not good for kids younger than 4 Bc it's very crowded loud and can be a bit dangerous with all the sizzle platters on every table. 

Again, excellent wait service, genuine hospitality and good food on 8/25/2017. 

4.5 stars !!!
author: Marwan Y.

description:
We try to make it here at least once a year. Our ritual is to ride a tandem to Tiburon and take the ferry back, timing it so we arrive here for a reservation ~30 minutes before sunset. All seats have a wonderful view of the bay. 

This trip, the Clam Chowder was spot on and the Cesar salad was well made. But the star of the show was the sizzling platter of crab in garlic sauce! IMHO, No other crab compares to Dungeness, it is sweet and delectable while further enhanced with their secret sauce. Throw that on a sizzling platter and get out of my way. 

Toss in a bottle of Stags Leap Merlot and you have perfection. You just have to be careful about the glass slipping out of your hand that is dripping crabby goodness. 

Yes it is expensive, but quality ingredients always are. And yes, its touristy but guess what: we are all tourists.
author: Brent B.

description: I had dinner with my husband last night. I like the food here but it's  over price. $3 each oyster and they are too small! The mussel are bigger. The service is good. We had as an appetizer Fondue and oysters. We share a skillet combo that was delicious and enough for 2. Drinks: Mojitos and beer. Total with tip $170.
author: Fabiana P.

description: Excellent food and service. The seafood platter was delicious. The waiter (Azriel) was wonderful and so was Marceleno the bus boy. The view is spectacular.
author: Sharron D.

description: It takes a lot for me to write a negative review but this place really missed the mark tonight!! I walked in with two children under 6 and asked for the children's menu and to sit on the balcony outside. As we ordered I was literally ordering off of page 26 the children's menu and asked for two fish and chips. We waited some time for the food and when It came two full adult size portions and plates arrived not only with huge portion sizes but seasoning and potato's the size of golf balls with onions and olives baked into it all. I explained that I had ordered the children's fish and chips and had mentioned to the hostess that only the kids would be eating and we were fine outside. It was a little chilly out and not packed outside. Anyway when I called the waiter back over to the table to ask if these were the adult portions he said yes that's what you ordered - I asked you if you wanted two adult portions and you said yes. I looked at him dumbfounded as he made me out to be the one that had made the mistake - clearly he doesn't have two kids as a single care taker as I said I was ordering for two children multiple times. do these two five year olds look like they can eat this much food? I asked? He said no mama and offered to take them back and place new children's plate fish and chip orders - he left with the food only to return less than two minutes later with one of the adult meals split in half and put on two smaller plates and the seasoning side of the fish turned over so you couldn't see it on top. I again called him back and asked if this was the children's menu and he said yes. I didn't argue this time. We just left underwhelmed - since when does a child's fish and chips not come with plain fish and French fires ? The veggies had baked black olives and small. Circle onions with potatoes the size of golf balls - needless to say we didn't wait for him to fix this again we scraped off the seasoning eat the fish and left the potatoes.  It was a waist of $40 and a disappointing experience to say the least! Why have a children's menu if you don't make kid friendly meals?
author: Debbie L.

description: I have to give this place 5 stars because the dungeon crabs were amazing and their house salad was delicious. Came here for dinner after we biked to the Golden Gate Bridge. My boyfriend ordered the crab sliders and I ordered the seafood fettuccine for our entrees. We shared a house salad together and half an order of crab. Love love the house salad and crab. Salad was perfectly made with dressing and bite size lettuce. Crab was soft and melts in your mouth. They bring you the tools you need for your crab at the table. My boyfriend and I were pretty full by the time we got our entrees but we did our best to eat most of it. Their entrees size was big so we know to share stuff here next time. I loved how they give you pictures on the menu. It helps a lot when you order. The view was spectacular where we were seated. I definitely loved this place and will come back or recommend it.
author: Donna P.

description:
Decided to make a spur of the moment trip to the Bay Area. The last time we were here, it was this restaurant that we said we'd definitely come back to. I guess a lot can change in just a few years because we were so disappointed this time that I seriously had to pray about it. Food is nothing short of tasteless. Clam chowder in a bread bowl is an expensive $13 joke! They cut out a very shallow hole and fill it with maybe five spoonfuls of runny chowder. I ordered shrimp & chips. The shrimp tasted frozen (like that nasty frozen taste food gets from being in a freezer that someone forgot to put a box of Arm & Hammer in), and was so oily. This place is right there on the Bay, and not only is their seafood not fresh, it is way too overpriced. 

Then there was the waiter who spoke English with a Cesar Milan accent but claimed to know very little Spanish. I'm not ragging on Cesar's accent either. In fact, my husband speaks English with a heavy accent. It just bugged me to see someone so blatantly ashamed of their heritage. How much more effective he would be if he used his ability to speak multiple languages especially when interacting with the public in touristy restaurant like this one? 

Anyhow, everything about this place doesn't even deserve the single star I've given it. Maybe the star is just for the nice view of Alcatraz but that's about it. 

Oh, and if you want your parking validated, you have to park in the lot directly across from them, next to Boudin. We parked in the Pier 39 parking structure. They have signs that indicate they honor restaurant validation but don't indicate that only from specific restaurants. 

Finally, the restrooms are so horrendous, I decided to wait to get back to our room. Any restaurant with dirty facilities always concern me. My thought is if your bathrooms are unclean and unkept, what does your kitchen look like? The kitchen where you're preparing my food.

Tony Bennett sang he left his heart but we left too much damn money in San Francisco, starting at this crappy establishment. Never ever again.
author: Joanne H.

description: Our first stop on the way to Pier 39. We had just left the Golden Gate and were ready to grub. Yummy yummy. I highly recommend this restaurant. Great views and relief from the crowds. Can't wait to visit again.
author: Jackie M.

description:
This has been an excellent experience.
The food was superb and Bianca and Ruhy
were awesome!!! I shall be back.
author: Agnes T.

description:
Food was decent. Definitely better options for the price. I think people go here for the view which is amazing. 


I saw quite a few people with binoculars with tables facing the windows so maybe it's a good bird watching or boat watching spot?

Has a great view of Alcatraz 
Calamari is good here. If you park here they validate so the first three hours are only 3 dollars I think. 

Bathrooms are clean 

Probably won't go back as there are better choices nearby for the price.
author: Justin D.

description: Server was nice, but very slow. Crab was okay, but nothing special. Lemon cake dessert bland.
author: Amber S.

description: A tourist trap worth going to. The food is very good, the service is more than adequate for this size of restaurant that caters to tourists. The view is nice so ask to be seated near a window. Just remember it will cost you but not as expenses as some places in SF
author: Emile K.

description: My boyfriend and I sat at the bar. We ordered the shrimp and mussels medium and it came out fast! The view was great of Alcatraz and we were in and out pretty fast. Good service and good food. Overall good experience!
author: Madeline L.

description: Really enjoyed this place. My new favorite among the Wharf restaurants.  Large variety of ways of cooking and presenting your food. Whether you want shellfish, fin fish, or even steak or chicken. Standard kid options for picky eaters, too. REALLY APPRECIATE that most of their soups (including the chowders!) are gluten free!
author: Scott K.

description:
If you feel like you have extra money to spend, The Franciscan is a great place to do it. Once you get over the sticker shock you can settle into the ambiance. The restaurant has a beautiful view of the bay. When you're waiting for a table they have an outdoor balcony you can hang out on that overlooks the wharf.

Overall, food was delicious. How can you not love a place that gives you bibs so you can attack your shellfish dishes? We made sure to keep the bread flowing at our table. It was the perfect compliment to the buttery sauces our seafood was swimming in. I would love to go back for another "treat yourself day".
author: Christine L.

description: The food is awful and overpriced. I can't explain how bad it was. The restaurant doesn't have enough staff. We saw the waitress only for order and check.
author: Saeid M.

description: One of my favorite SF stops!  Great food...great service!  The iron skillet with shrimp and crab is my favorite!
author: Jeremy B.

description: Yummy. Order lotsa crab. So good! They cook their crab to perfection with just the right seasoning. We eat here almost every time we visit San Francisco!
author: Krista P.

description:
I went for simple fish and chips on early Saturday afternoon. Opted to sit out in the sun after 2 days of rain. Fish nicely done, slightly crunchy on the outside, moist and soft on the inside. Portion is huge for one person, just nice size to share though. 

It's the location that's ideal. Great entertainment from street music to scenery. Best part? Parking validation just across the street. Spend $10 on fish and chips, save $45 in parking. Sweet, no?
author: Moushumi K.

description: The place was good, the service was great. The chicken Alfredo was lacking seasoning, plus they never asked to refill our drinks. Other than that the food was pretty good. One of the best steaks I've ever had and a very beautiful view of Alcatraz island. Highly recommended for anyone out of town wanting an easy to find seafood place with grub for the whole family.
author: Eric S.

description: Loved it! The restaurant is in an awesome spot on the wharf. We had no problems making reservations. We ordered the whole roast crab and the crab chowder and loved them both! Great service as well.
author: Amanda B.

description: Great view.  Great fish.  I had the halibut and it was perfect.  The clam chowder bread bowl was simply amazing.  Good service and easy in without a reservation was a big plus
author: Jared H.

description: All I wanted in Fishermans Wharf was a strong drink and a bread bowl. I got exactly that at Franciscan Crab! I ordered the Mermaid Iced tea (their version of a Long Island with Chambord-100% one of the best drinks I've ever had). The clam chowder bread bowl was delicious. It's an upscale restaurant but it was worth it and the views were incredible.
author: Kacie D.

description:
Service was excellent!
Food was amazing!
Atmosphere is out of this world!

I will return to eat here next time I am visiting San Francisco.
author: Christina H.

description: Super fresh seafood, and wonderful Bayview's. One thing is that the menu could not be more confusing. It's more of a menu/cookbook and does not give you the sense that you are ordering at a restaurant but more looking at a book of art. However if you have out-of-towners coming to visit I would recommend making a stop here
author: Seth R.

description: Food is amazing . Calamari appetizer is the best..huge portion enough for about 6 people. The crab chowder is also delicious. Our waiter Aron was really attentive to our table ..I am giving this place 5 starts because it was my first time here and everything went well.
author: Martin A.

description: Had 6 beignets and a cup of coffee while looking at Alcatraz. Pretty dope! If you come check it out sit outside!
author: Boris B.

description: I wish I could rate less then 1 star, no service very rude when we could get someone food sucked food really sucked will never ever go back and its very spending.
author: Ginger B.

description:
I went here Saturday afternoon on a weekend trip and surprisingly it was pretty empty. We sat on the second floor next to windows with a binocular on the window pane so you can look out and see Alcatraz island from afar and the San Francisco waters. I loved this view; it made the dining experience very memorable for me. I ordered clam chowder in a sour dough bowl, seafood pasta in squid ink, whole Dungeness crab, black mussels in a white wine sauce, and seafood cioppino. I thought everything tasted good and had good flavors to them. But, I do feel the price for some plates were pretty expensive such as the whole crab. It was a pretty small crab and didn't have much meat on it but it was costly. 

Service was good. Our waiter was nice. He was pretty quiet and seemed shy but he was attentive and checked up on us often. Maybe because the restaurant was also empty, service was better than other reviews I've read. I'm not sure. But I would come back here next time I take a trip to the Bay Area.
author: Tommy N.

description:
Best dine in restaurant on the Wall
Wharf!  Excellent view of Alcatraz and the Bay, outstanding food, and exceptional service.  At first glance, the cruise ship design of the restaurant appears to be very touristy, and dated, but this establishment has been in business for over sixty years for several reasons:  one of the best views of the bay and Alcatraz island.  Classic Italian style foods, especially loved the calamari appetizers.  The clam chowder is unique and has a strong potato flavor, less creamy than the other Wharf restaurants nearby.
For the best value, order the prefixed menu:  choice of soup or salad, 1/2 dungeness crab, and dessert  (vanilla custard).
author: Richard H.

description: If you have never been to the Franciscan Crab Restaurant then you have no idea on what you're missing out on at this gem. I absolutely enjoy their spicy shrimp pasta and the crab chowder in a bread bowl. They really know how to work with the meat to get all the natural tastes of the crab without overpowering it with a bunch of unnecessary things. That crab chowder is delicious and quite unexpected. I also enjoy their crab louie dish. What can I say? If you are looking for a good place to get seafood then the Franciscan Crab Restaurant is not for you...this restaurant is not good...it's phenomenal!
author: Jessica R.

description:
The bread and butter are are literally perfection. The sourdough is moist and soft and the butter is soft rich with a touch of sea salute on top.  It does not get much better than that.

The sea bass I lemon caper sauce is Devine.

The only reason I did not give 5 stars was because they use Lipton machine ice tea instead of brewing it fresh.  It's really lazy, cheap and a travesty.  We are not at McDonalds.  Come to think of it, even McDonalds brews their Ice tea.

Also their lemon tort is alright.
author: Michael C.

description: This was one of the restaurants that stayed open past 9 pm so we gave it a try.  The wait staff was overstretched, thus they were not able to provide quality service.  We constantly had to ask for little things like crab crackers, crab forks, water refills, etc.  While the crab was descent, there was not a lot of garlic sauce so we could not dip the crab to get the additional flavor.  The crab chowder was plain and overly salty.  The oysters were tasty but not fully shucked from the shell and cocktail sauce and horseradish was not provided, and which again we had to ask for and wait.  I guess I shouldn't have expected more from this tourist trap.
author: Dave H.

description: Portions are acceptable and taste is OK while the view is awesome, but the staff  has no manners. Andrea the host is very rude, and did not know how to accommodate a party of 17. She gave us the hardest time trying to seat us properly. No apologies no polite smile, just hurrying us to be seated. Not only that, when we had 12 of 17 people wanting to be seated, while the other 5 were in their restroom, she wanted all 17 of us there before she could seat us. Mind you this was right at their opening time, so it wasn't a full house. I should've just stayed with my go to Fog Harbor, not sure why I gave Franciscan a chance, never again with their snotty servers and hosts.
author: Jeff T.

description: Decided to try this place while visiting my sister in the Bay Area. And I'm so glad I did. The food was excellent; pricey but definitely worth it. We had the octopus carpaccio as an appetizer and it was outstanding. I had the whole crab as an entree and I can honestly say it was the best crab I've ever had. Their merman island iced teas were delicious and strong. Our waiter rarely smiled and didn't seem too friendly but the service he provided was top notch. He was all business and very knowledgeable on the food. So I'm ok with his stoic personality. Over all this place is a must try. I can't wait to return to San Francisco and visit this place again.
author: Rose A.

description: First night in San Francisco and I decided to eat here after recommendation from some ppl on the wharf. Restaurant was very busy, nice, and clean. The atmosphere was great. Nice view, couldn't enjoy the water view as I would have like because it was dark but I knew I'd go back to the wharf so it didn't bother me. Now on to the food. Blah blah blah. I ordered the shrimp Alfredo with mixed vegetables. The shrimp were the only thing on the plate that I enjoyed. The pasta was horrible and the sauce was very bland. Vegetables were ok as well as the bread and butter they served. Maybe I ordered the wrong thing but I figured "who can mess up shrimp Alfredo" when ordering. But on the bright side everything and everyone else was great.
author: Joiya A.

description: I know, I know, it's on the Wharf - the tourist trap of San Francisco. My husband has never been to San Francisco, so I had to allow him to experience the chaos down there. So, on our way to see the sea lions, we decided to stop for lunch at the Fanciscan. We got there around 1pm on a Monday afternoon. We were promptly whisked away to a table overlooking the bay. We had an amazing uninterrupted view!! We decided to grab a glass of wine and share a few appetizers. We ordered the crab fondue, shrimp cocktail and a bowl of clam chowder. Man oh man - we really enjoyed all of them. The crab fondue was so creamy with a ton of flavor and came out hot hot hot! The shrimp were pretty big but we could have used a little bit more of the delicious cocktail sauce. My husband thoroughly enjoyed his chowder. The service was good. We were only one table of three at the time, so it would have been hard not to provide great service. With so many amazing restaurants in San Francisco, I was a little leery of this place just based on its location, but it didn't disappoint!
author: Heather H.

description:
This restaurant is in very great location.

I ordered crab(for 3 share) $89.95, it was very good.

Alfredo fettuccine for kid meal was bit milky but my girl like it.

The fresh oysters were really fresh and small(which I like it).

Please try the desert: chocolate truffle mousse cake, it was really really yummy.

After all, I had good experience in this restaurant and yes, I will be back next time.

Thanks for reading my review and have a wonderful day.
author: Novie S.

description:
Came to SF for the Labor Day weekend. By far, the best place I went to the entire time. Unique restaurant with white tile & red seats everywhere. 
Cramped but still an enjoyable experience because the food makes you forget that immediately. They have a nice looking bar but like I said it's very cramped inside so elbow room is nonexistent. 
I ordered the Dungeness Crab, Mussels & Shrimp, all in garlic sauce. Everything was served on a sizzling skillet, drenched in all kinds of garlicky goodness.
Oh man! Best crab I have ever eaten. The sweetness of it just blew me away. The calamari was just ok. They use cornmeal & I think Old Bay seasoning for it which aren't my favorite things. But it was cooked really well & not chewy or gummy at all. 
The draft beer is very good. I prefer mine colder but the Stella I ordered was right on. Great atmosphere, situated right on the Pier (41 or 43, I think) right across from the Boudin Sourdough Bakery. 
This is a great place for a family dinner. Not so much for romance because the indoor seating is LOUD. The patio seating is small & the chairs aren't the nice ones inside, but u'll enjoy the better view. 
Inside seating by the windows in hopes of getting a romantic sunset dinner will always be threatened with the legendary fog of San Francisco... 
So sit outside, enjoy the breeze & people watch as you chow down.
author: Rafael M.

description:
Seated immediately for a late lunch; service was prompt and friendly. Server was helpful in recommending right size portions for how hungry we were. Ended up having the Bruschetta, Crab Fondue, and a large order of mussels & shrimp for 3 of us. Had a little bit leftover of each, so could have ditched one of the appetizers, but I liked the variety. 

The mussels were outstanding; some of the best mussels I've ever had, and no extra sauce needed. Shrimp was delicious, although pretty heavily coated in buttery sauce. Crab Fondue also excellent, and the tomatoes on the Bruschetta appetizer were seriously amazing.

Fairly pricey for a casual lunch (~$120 for above food and two beers) and in touristy Fisherman's Wharf, but well worth the occasional splurge for the food, view, and service.
author: Chelsea H.

description: A great evening all round! Stunning view of Alcatraz and the bay as requested when we booked well in advance, excellent service throughout and really good food - not complicated but cooked well. Highly recommend.
author: Kett M.

description:
This review is for the restaurant's bottom portion where you pay at the counter and wait for your food number to be called.

I had a lovely lunch at the Franciscan Crab Restaurant! I ordered their Clam Chowder Bread Bowl ($9.99), Combo Fry with calamari, fish, shrimp, and chips ($9.99), and a Corona beer ($4.99). All of the food was delicious, tasted fresh, and had a great visual presentation! The restaurant has ample seating inside and outside and two clean unisex bathrooms. I wish I would have taken a picture of the food, but I was famished and dug in ASAP. I'll definitely return!
author: Jennae H.

description: Two sodas @ 5/each, split the bigger crab option between the two of us for around 70.00. Left feeling cheated and could still eat....crab was flavorless and seemed precooked or something. Save your money and go to Boudin across the street.
author: Charlotte A.

description:
Food:2/5     Price:4/5      Service:4/5       Ambience:4/5

Pretty impressed with this place to grab some fish & chips with bread bowl clam chowder. They have a deli style dining on the first floor, and classy sit-down restaurant on the 2nd floor. We tried 1st floor this time. You order at the counter and wait for your number to be called. You can see all the food displays as well as the open kitchen with cooks frying the fishes. Prices were pretty cheap compared to others, but portions were quite small.  Food was great too! I would probably prefer my fish and chips fried a little less, it was too crispy. The fish was also not as think and juicy as I would liked. Clam Chowder was great, I loved how it comes in a bread bowl. 

Favorites:
* Clam chowder in bread bowl ($9.99)
* Garlic fries($4.45)

Others:
* fish & chips ($9.99)
author: Victoria L.

description: We walked in solely to try out some oysters. They were hit or miss. Did not get that nice buttery, creamy texture that I expect from Pacific oysters. You place your order at the counter and seat yourself, when your order is ready, your number is called out. It took a bit to get our oysters even though there were not that many people there. Does have a nice view of the bay though.
author: Pallabi G.

description: This is my favorite restaurant in Fishermen's Wharf since I was a kid. Great food, beautiful setting right on the water with terrific service.
author: Geri N.

description: I like the location but there isn't much food and I can't really relate it to other restaurants.
author: Jesse L.

description: Delicious but way too expensive for what you get, and their menu is bizarre. Maybe I'm missing something, but I'm much more interested in comprehensive menu choices than the vague recipes to make their dishes at home, which is all the more information they provide. The view, however, was second to none. You can see the whole bay through a legitimate wall of windows and if that's not good enough, they provide binoculars at every table! A great experience overall, and the Dungeness crab was perfectly prepared.
author: Mandie M.

description: First timers... walked in and saw 3 tables available by the window. Very beautiful views but when seated we were taken to the back so I asked if we can sit at table by the window because we were celebrating our 5th anniversary. We were told no it would take 20-30min before we were able to get a table by the window. Kind you there were 3 tables open... I said we would wait but he sat as at the furthest table from the window anyway and told us the view was from all tables... I then told him the why would it be a problem for us to get a table by the window. He then said they were on reservations only but when we walked in I asked if seating was based on reservations only I was told it was first come first serve... it's a pretty pricey restaurant to not give customer seats they are requesting especially for such. Special occasion... I had waited for my husband to get out of the restroom so we can order... kind you this is already 30min in of waiting... and still no one sat at the 3 open tables by the window! so we chose to leave the restaurant and go to Bubba Gumps! Where we were given a table by the window as we requested!
author: Kala M.

description: Barely average food. Waitress was polite and attentive. Fish and chips? Piece of very thin fired white fish and roasted potatoes. Meh.
author: Steve P.

description:
Great service, gorgeous views of the Bay, and food was great. Got the prefix menu, which is a great deal, you get soup or salad, main entree, and dessert for $49.99. 

Got the clam chowder, which was decent. I'd rate it a 7 out of 10. Then for main entree got the crab fettuccine Alfredo. This was pretty good. Could have used a bit of garlic, but noodles were fresh and bought locally and the crab was devine. Lastly, we got to top things off with their vanilla custard icecream. For being vanilla, it was actually really good. 

Would come back, and maybe try something different. Decor is a bit outdated. But overall experience was great.
author: Dee H.

description:
Beignets - Yep - they have them!  What a surprise....

Super excited to munch on some of these tasty treats.   Sadly, not as good as New Orleans. 

They didn't really have a wide selection of coffee.  This is definetaly a tourist driven place to eadt.  They do have some solid views if you like people watching and tables tend to turn very quickly.
author: Chris M.

description: This is probably the worst restaurant I've ever eaten in my life. I'm writing this on the toilet now. I've just vomited a chowder and now I'm in the middle of it. Don't eat their steak. It's Fking disgusting.
author: Jiaming F.

description:
In for a stop to a restaurant from my childhood days. They've remodeled to a contemporary style but preserved the great views of the bay and city. The hostesses were stoic at best.  The wait staff weren't much better. The impression received was that they didn't want us to be there. The restaurant wasn't clean there were food remnants on the carpet and under the table. 
Ordered the calamari which was very good and done very well. The crab was overdone as well as the potatoes and corn. The dessert looked great. Hopefully they'll get back to where they were back in the day.
author: Kevin W.

description: Great customer service and amazing food and wine selection. The views from this restaurant are incredible, perfect setting for any occasion. The staff was supper catering to my vegan lifestyle, they made changes for all my orders. Will be back soon.
author: Brisa E.

description: This place was amazing. At first I thought it was going to be a little to fancy for how we were but we fit right in! The decor was fun and touristy. We got lucky and got a table right by the window over looking the bay. We ordered the octopus for an appetizer and it was amazing! Very fresh! I ended up ordering the Louie salad with crab $10 up charge. The waitress we had was very nice and helpful with the menu. Overall a great experience in a very touristy area.
author: Lydia Y.

description:
Did I really just spend $150+ for this meal for two?

Despite the 3.5 stars, I decided to give this restaurant a try based on the aesthetically pleasing photos posted online. I shall quote Julia Roberts' character Vivian Ward in Pretty Woman regarding my decision to try it anyway:  "Big mistake! Big. Huge." 

I ordered the Prix Fixe three course meal. I chose the clam chowder as my starter. It was not good, putting it nicely. It tasted old, as though it had been simmering all day. Campbell's makes a better clam chowder and packages it in a can for $1.59 at the local supermarket. 

My main course was the crab alfredo. The crab alfredo was more like crap alfredo. As much as I hate to admit it to myself, this dish paled in comparison to a national seafood chain restaurant's crab alfredo. The linguine did not have enough alfredo sauce, and it was lacking flavor. I tried to keep reminding myself that this was Dungeness crab rather than snow crab, but the food was disappointing nonetheless. 

The service was awful. We dined close to closing time, which is never a good idea. The server was absent for the majority of the meal. We had to ask other employees for refills on water and soda several times. We had to remind the server to bring our desserts that were ordered at the time of the main course, and we had to ask for our check when our dining experience was over. 

The vanilla custard ice cream and the strawberry banana sundae with chocolate syrup added (per our request) was the absolute best part of this meal. If we had not had the desserts, I would have given only one star. 

Bottom line:  The dining experience was fair.  The music was delightful, as it offered a nostalgic mood. The dessert was delicious. However, the cost does not reflect the service or quality of the food.
author: April W.

description: Awesome. Great views. Great ambiance. Awesome food. Good service. Had coppa appetizer. Clam chowder. I had the abalone. It was tremendous. Even the vegetables and pasta with it were tasty. And plenty of it. My wife had the filet mignon. She gave me some. It melted in my mouth. Very pricey, but that's expected. Bring your wallet, but definitely go. A real special place.
author: Erik B.

description: We dined here for the first time and it was amazing. Both Katrin and Jay made our experience so amazing, they combined knowledge with attentiveness and hospitality to give us a very special family dinner. The views from the restaurant are breathtaking - you can see Alcatraz so clearly - but it was the two members of the team who created the ambience to make it even more memorable. Thank you.
author: L C.

description: When I walked in the first impression was, wow awesome view, woah Alcatraz, crab display nice. Then as I actually looked, it was hot inside, busy so the floors were dirty, and the prices are a bit scary. The experience over all is exciting as a tourist because you get binoculars with your table to spy on sailors and watch guard for make believe prisoners escaping Alcatraz. The food is presented awesomely, and the staff is super nice, it's pretty good, and I personally (being very hungry from the trip over and looking for good food) couldn't find any touristy places that are better.
author: Arshan A.

description: We had the Dungeness crab here for lunch before touring Alcatraz. While the food was good and the staff was friendly, the cleanliness of the restaurant was so so.
author: Jessica P.

description: Not sure why this place has mediocre reviews. The food and service was SUPERB!!! I didn't have to add salt, or any other condiment to make the food taste delicious! The food came out at my table of 8 on a timely manner. No one really had to wait for everyone else's food. Considering that San Francisco can be a race-conscious town, the server treated my dinner guests with the utmost prompt service and respect! I had the Fetuccine, and it was so buttery, creamy, and flavorful! My companion had the mussels, and I tasted the garlic butter which I used over my bread, and it was tasty! The drinks are good too!
author: Adunola F.

description: Although we had to wait a while, the crab Alfredo was delicious. I highly recommend the dish. Alfredo will never tase the same. My BF ordered the crab and he stated it was delicious, but felt like it was not enough. The view of the bay was gorgeous and the service so-so. The waiter failed to check on us often and I was done with my meal before I ever got a water refill.
author: Jenn D.

description: For 60 bucks you can get a double order of muscles and crabs to share and it's the perfect amount of food. Great views in a nice atmosphere.
author: Bill M.

description: **CREDIT CARD overcharge! Went on Friday to celebrate my husbands Birthday & I paid cash for most of the bill and the remaining balance on credit card. Come to find out, the waiter billed everything on my credit card and took the cash. I will be calling the restaurant as soon as they open and speak with management. I am so upset.
author: Anayency P.

description:
Super fast device, good food and drink.  We walked in at 7:30pm on a Thursday, no wait.  Most seats have good bay views.  The waitress came to the table right away, we ordered, and food appeared in no time, faster than Wendy's.  They really know how to move things along.  

We had a whole crab, oysters, a Splash (Champaign with guava juice). Everything was great.  The crab stayed warm longer than at most other restaurants. The only thing I am not excited about is their decor, 50s dinner feel.  And the price is at the same level as the fancier looking restaurants such as Fog Harbour or Chart House.  

I would definitely go back and try other dishes.
author: Stella S.

description: I'm giving this place 5 stars simply because I have nothing bad to say about it food taste great portion was big service was great great view.. Little expensive but Hey you pay for what you get in life
author: Mateo M.

description: Seated quickly... no reservation... with a beautiful view. We had the calamari which was so fresh and delicious . We did have the fried calamari at other restaurant in the same area ... and it was cold and chewy.... but not here is was THE BEST !!!! Everything was absolutely delicious and we had such a nice server she was so fast and so efficient her name was Catherine and we had a wonderful time .... totally will come back. The best meal we had here in San Francisco.
author: Ann O.

description: This place is right at the wharf so you can take a stroll after u eat along the water front. This place had great great views of the waterfront and Alcatraz.  Very large place very good seafood . Dungeness crabs garlicky broiled and very sweet. This place is pricey but worth it.  A small portion of the check goes to pay for the workers healthcare, its on the bill. A happy worker is a good worker.
author: Marsha D.

description: I came here because I was craving a Dungeness crab on the wharf and the garlic butter sauce they had on the menu got my attention as a walked by. Got a reservation on open table easily and walked on in. I ordered oysters and the whole crab. The staff was very attentive and very nice. The oysters came out fist and were bomb.com. I thought they were the best oysters I had of the trip. Very sweet and not salty one bit. I was so surprised I ordered another round of them. The crab was perfectly cooked and the garlic butter was super tasty. I was pleasantly surprised by this place and the cherry on top is the killer views. I would definitely come back.
author: James W.

description:
My family are on vacation in the area.  This restaurant was just across the street from the parking lot and being it's Good Friday we decided to eat here.  
We stood in front of the hostess for a few minutes before she greeted us.  
The restaurant was busy (around 7pm) but we didn't have to wait too long before we were seated.  The hostess showed us to our table, i said thank you and there was no reply back.. 
The waiter came a few minutes later took our order.  Our food arrived in less than 10 minutes and I must say, the food was good.  The seasoning is perfect for those who like more of a favorable/saltiness. 
Also it is a little pricey for the dish portion. 
A meal for 4 people (no drinks) just water and one soda cone to $160.
Not once was our soda/water was refilled. 

I didn't give the restaurant a five star because of their lack of service.
author: D. N.

description: Best restaurant ever existed in the history of mankind. Get your crab soup, crab cakes, lotsa crab and you're set for life.
author: Hanna N.

description: I tried this due to the history of this restaurant.  Look it up plz.  I was solo, but ordered the crab for two.  Handled it.  But I would recommend ordering for two!
author: Spencer J.

description:
Great views
Loved the filet and it's texture
The garlic mashed potatoes that came with the filet were awesome with the sauce of filet
Clam chowder rating 3.5/5 per the family seafood experts :-)
Very friendly staff
Wine pairing- would recommend the Pinot noir meomi for the steak
author: Umesh L.

description:
When we're feeling like serious crab, we usually end up at CRAB HOUSE ON PIER  in the city.  We've also tried R&G near China Town which was memorable and would like to go there again sometime.  Never done PPQ but have heard they're pretty good too.

If you're in the South Bay and don't want to venture out, we have found KING WAH in Milpitas to have some pretty righteous crab - especially in season.

Last weekend, we wanted to try someplace different and wound up at Franciscan Crab.

Wide open space with lots of seating and ocean views.

Here's what we got:

WHOLE GARLIC CRAB (5/5)  Tasted on par with CRAB HOUSE on Pier 39.  The server cut the crab up for me at the table to make it more manageable.  Great flavor, could have eaten more but I would have been called a pig or a glutton and didn't want to risk that.

CRAB ALFREDO (5/5)  My daughter's dish but I tasted it and it was rich, simple and very tasty.  High in calories I'm sure, but I think worth it.  Wish it had more crab in it, but I wish that for every crab dish I've ever eaten or will eat in the future.

YELLOWTAIL CARPACCIO (4/5) Thinly sliced pieces in a tangy soy-sauce mixture.   Pretty good, hard to go wrong with yellowtail.

CLAM CHOWDER (3/5) Completely edible but not my cup of chowder.  It has a sourness that I didn't care for.  

CRAB CHOWDER (2/5) Way over salted, we sent it back and it was comped. Lacking crab flavor.  Not creamy, one note.

PROSCIUTTO W/BURRATA (4/5)  Sliced prosciutto served with  a very creamy burrata.  Comes with some bread for spreading.

GARLIC NOODLES (added crab) (1/5)  Again, way over salted.  My wife's dish.  She didn't eat it.  She didn't want to send it back but didn't because she had just sent the CRAB CHOWDER.    She said it tasted like the crab chowder was the "sauce" for the noodles and I think she was right.

PARMESAN/TRUFFLE FRIES (5/5) Addictive and enjoyable.

Service was good, although the place was pretty empty.

We got burned on a couple dishes (crab chowder and the noodles), but the other dishes were all enjoyable.  

On the water, kind of feels like a special place, worthy probably of a round-up to four stars.
I'd go back for the WHOLE CRAB and the ALFREDO for sure.
author: Darien R.

description:
WATCH YOUR CREDIT CARD!!!
We eat at this restaurant five or six times a year and have been doing this for quite a number of years. The food is excellent. We recently went with some friends who have gone with us a number of times; they also eat there a number of times a year. The last time we went we paid for our bills separate, our bill was about $120 and we paid cash and gave the waiter more than a 20% tip. The couple with us used a credit card. Later that day our friends received a text from their credit card company that they had two separate charges from the restaurant. After calling the management we found out that the waiter stole our cash and billed our friends for our check amount. It took a number of days to get the extra charge off of their credit card. Restaurant management did tell us that this was not a mistake and they have had trouble with the same waiter before. Needless to say we will not be eating there again; there are too many other good restaurants in the area.

Update: Management apologized and sent us a voucher to entice us to try them again. So we did; you really can't beat the view and the food when it's on point. However this experience again started out disappointing due to a dirty water glass brought to me which had bright purple lipstick stains (not mine). I turned it out so hopefully the waiter would notice (it was that obvious) but he never did; I never said anything; I didn't see the point. The waiter was not friendly at all and provided the least amount of service possible; maybe due to a language barrier; we only speak English; he seemed uncomfortable in his server role. All in all, not impressed with this restaurant anymore; it's not worth the premium prices they charge. Much better food and service is around almost any corner in the city. I never minded the empty wallet before, the experience was worth the price. Sorry it's not so anymore.
author: Lorna P.

description: Toooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo Goooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooood :) The Best Fish and fries in the Pier!!
author: Kranthi N.

description: We weren't sure about this place as it was 3.5 stars but we were pleasantly surprised at the great service, the food , wine, and the view. Great crab cocktail, crab enchiladas and shrimp Louie. I'd come back again.
author: Nadine R.

description:
Beautiful location, friendly server, but it's a tourist trap!!!!!

First, the host gave us a hard time when trying to sit with our family who arrived earlier than us. I can understand that though since the timing was off. I just wish they were more polite and accommodating about it. 

More importantly, the crab prices are astronomical for such little food! A half crab... literally a half of one crab is $30! I think I had like 4 bites of food. I left starving and just grabbed some seafood down by the pier. 

Bread bowls of clam chowder are delicious and the bread is fresh just like everywhere in SF. 

BLT salad was incredibly underwhelming. 

Our actual server was very kind and she did a great job. Overall, not worth the $$$!
author: Joyce S.

description:
We decided to go on a local stay-cation in SF and wander around like tourists for a couple day.  One of the places we kept seeing on the hotel tv program were various local restaurants that the reviewers were raving about.  One of those places was the Franciscan.  We tried it tonight...  to keep comparison somewhat consistent, we tried dishes that we'd find in other places - fried calamari, fish and chips (well, potato not fries) and shrimp/mussel combo.

Well, for the high price you pay - yes it's a tourist location and has a decent view - and all the brilliant reviews, I expected great flavors and quality.  The fried calamari was so-so.  The flavor was off and I've had a LOT of fried calamari in many different places.  The fish and potatoes was also so-so.  Maybe it's personal preference but I'm used to cod/haddock for the fish but this was something like else (at least it tasted very different).  The potatoes looked overcooked and just unappetizing.  The mussels were decent but not the best I've tasted.  Shrimp was over-buttered and greasy.

I had some fish/shrimp/chips at a very casual nearby joint and that was delicious.  Sometimes, price does not equal quality.

I'm not dismissing the Franciscan as a restaurant overall but this is just my opinion of the dishes we ordered.  We went in HOPING it was more than just a tourist spot but we didn't get any evidence of the opposite.   I've read many reviews advising people to avoid most restaurants (at least the more expensive sit-in kind) in Fisherman's Wharf and to try much better alternatives (and more affordable) elsewhere in North Beach, etc.  I plan to do that in the future.

I would have given this a 3 star but for the price we paid I think I didn't get enough quality food.
author: J B.

description:
Pros:
-Unlimited free bread and butter
-Nice views, good for taking pictures outside
-Fish was fresh and flaky
-Good for large groups - tables can fit up to 10, 12ish people

Cons:
-Food was extremely greasy and oily, yet insanely bland at the same time. I probably reached for the salt shaker about 5 times during my meal
-Overpriced. ~$35 for a measly plate of fish, pasta, and fried potatoes? I was still hungry even after eating all the free bread
-Definitely a tourist trap
author: Patricia Z.

description:
The Negative = Service 
We Stopped in for a few drinks and appetizers on Saturday afternoon and what I witnessed was a little disturbing. 

The restaurant was busy as it should I have been on a warm holiday weekend however as we sat at the bar we noticed immediately that it is was very difficult to get recognized by the "ONE" bartender working that shift. 

It was easy to see that he was the only bartender working the entire restaurant, which truly blew my mind. He was trying to service the bar and fulfill all the table orders by himself. 

however... 

What was strange is once the bartender recognized you and took your order he was accommodating however he would clearly ignore the next six couples that sat down next to us, even when it seemed he had extra time to take their order. 

I don't see how a popular restaurant like this right in the middle of a major tourist area could be so mismanaged.  All they had to do is put someone bending the bar to take food and non-alcoholic beverage orders to keep people happy. 


The Positive = Atmosphere 
The view of the bay and Alcatraz is very nice, the calamari was pretty good and the drinks average
author: Eric C.

description: First time here at this restaurant. My cousin and her kids brought me here. We ordered clam chowder, fish and chips and calamari and chips. The servings were big however, we were able to finish them all. The kids have good appetite. Food is great. We definitely are coming back.
author: Therese M.

description:
San Fran fan! Been here many times! However the Franciscan was our 1st & last. 
Unfortunately NOT good for kids under 10! The Children's "menu" is in fact not. All of 4 items to choose from normally not that much of an issue however the "Fish & Chips" is not chips at all. This restaurant doesn't have French Fries! Not even "chips"! Instead your children choose from a succotash combo with cubed potatoes, mashed potatoes w/zucchini or pearl pasta w/ snap peas & tomatoes or steamed veggie mix. For most some healthy options however don't state you have Fish & Chips if it's actually Fish & Veggies. And tell me if you have all these potato side options then why can't you cut up some French fries...seriously not that hard. And we know you have a fryer since the fish is fried. There ware a few other unhappy moments but I don't want to name names. Probably should have left when there wasn't French fries. But it doesn't stop there.....the grown up food was so.....so. I wouldn't brag about it by any means. Pasta dishes left something to be desired. And the chowders....we've had better. Go to Boudins for that! So all and all we won't be returning.
author: Catherine C.

description:
I feel 3 stars is being generous and it's only because our server was great.  I wish I got her name but she was attentive,  pleasant and accommodating.  
Myself and 2 friends were here at 6pm on Thursday March 1st. They sat us right away at a window seat which was nice.  Wish the windows were cleaner, they had bird droppings dripping down the glass which didn't make good pics of the view but I understand this might be the norm for any ocean view restaurant. 
I started with a martini, the Ariel, which was delicious.  It had fresh cucumber, vodka, pineapple juice...very refreshing and yummy.
Started with the prosciutto & burrata cheese which was tasty but the presentation was amateur.  The prosciutto was place on a small plastic cutting board with the paper still under it, the burrata was in a metal condiment dish (like the ones you get when you ask for ketchup or mayo), a drizzle of olive oil. It would have been presented nicer on a bread plate & easier to get the burrata if it weren't in that cheap looking deep dish.
I ordered the crab sandwiches, which came with three small servings. The bread underneath was soaking wet with juices that came through from the crab so I couldn't eat it because it was so soggy. There were still shells throughout the crab so I'm glad I didn't bite into the sandwich  as  I was picking through it. I ended up just eating the crab and avocado out of it. The vegetables that accompanied the sandwich were basic and nothing to rave about. 
I don't get to the City often so I was excited to try a new restaurant as the City offers so many amazing restaurants. This was a very disappointing experience and I would never go back based on the prices and the quality of the food as well as the poor presentation. The prices do not reflect the quality that is being served. They are very proud of what they were offering by the prices they were charging but the product didn't match up.
author: Kris L.

description: I realize crabs are not in season. But when I asked if the 3lb crab was the whole crab and told yes and it was fresh, and then it arrives in pieces, it was disappointing. And it was definitely previously frozen, I could taste the freezer. Oh, and although they validate parking it's only in a specific lot. And that is no where on their website to know which lot. $200 mistake today.
author: Anne W.

description: Nice view but the beignets were disappointing. They were bland and needed some flavor - cinnamon, extra powdered sugar, something. Also they came with a container of butter in the middle.. strange. Maybe I'm spoiled after eating beignets in New Orleans, but these aren't worth it. We didn't try any of the other food (which looked pretty good) so I can only rate on the beignets.
author: Molly H.

description:
I am somewhat of a local and came to Fishermans Wharf with family.  I've never got up Franciscan and I won't miss it next time.  We ate in the cafe. You have to be up fried food, but wow was it good!  The fish was nicely done.  The clam chowder was the bomb and the bread bowls met expectations.  

4 stars due to no non-fried options.
author: Debbie C.

description: Overpriced! Ugh. Another tourist trap. The octopus was pretty good, but not worth the trip. I would probably avoid the entire area at all costs.
author: Salem F.

description: There is a lot to say about this place but I will keep it simple. The view was amazing. The food was off the charts. I had the seafood fettuccine. The plate was huge and gave me a lot of different choices. I also had the oysters. My wife had the crab chowder and the Louie salad with shrimp and we finished off with a strawberry banana sundae. This is a must stop. To top it off our waiter Isaac was great. I couldn't ask for a better time!
author: Josh M.

description: Honestly I come and eat a food not very bad and not very good but when it's cold or windy, it's a great place at this part of the West SF bay. I eat my first chowder here. Hot and I take with me the bread;you know, the sea food soup is served in a bread as a bowl. Seafood fried is good, oil for fried is changed often I think but perhaps not a quality oil.
author: Marie-Claire L.

description: I seriously was in a SEAFOOD coma after my lunch! Crab is definitely my fav seafood! Great service. Great place and I love our view. I know this place is not for everyone but I had a great experience and I enjoyed myself and food was delicious! I savored every minute of it...until my face started itching because I'm allergic to my fav seafood...no worries I had Claritin to the rescue...popped 2 pills and I was good but it meant it was time to stop eating!
author: Anne M.

description: Cute atmosphere, friendly staff, and food is average. If you want a nice view of the ocean then this is the spot to be other than that, nothing else stands out.
author: Jackie O.

description: The Franciscan Crab is reasonable with pricing, prompt with service, and gives you a great view of Alcatraz. Make sure you try the cioppino chowder in the bread bowl. The garlic fries are also a tasty treat!
author: K S.

description: They handled our big tour group as smoothly as possible, and the food was delicious! Clam chowder, salad, ribs, salmon, crab legs -- EVERYTHING was amazing. Attentive, friendly service and a beautiful view of the bay made this evening perfect. We'll return here for sure!
author: James M.

description: It's fisherman's wharf. You need to wait during dinner time. Three people, ordered 2 crabs and one seafood rice. That's a lot already.
author: Kathy T.

description: Hands down one of the best views a restaurant has to offer, you can literally see Alcatraz from your table and theirs binoculars as well! The food is also amazing!! So so recommend to anyone visiting San Francisco! This place is awesome!
author: Michelle R.

description:
Came back to this restaurant over the Christmas break holiday. We live in L.A, but we always come down to Pier 39 and end up eating around here several times a year.

This restaurant, even though is on the expensive side, in comparison to what's available at the Pier... always has good food. 

However, the service is BAD.

This time, to be fair, our server "Leonard" was attentive, when he was around. The problem is, he was not around that much, and the food constantly got dumped on our table by the staff in the kitchen, without the existing food and plates being cleaned off first. So while we are still eating our appetizers, the new food comes in and they drop it off and there is no room. We are trying to give them empty plates while they are walking away. It was very frustrating. 

Last time I came, the service was so bad that we wanted to walk out. We came back again because we really like the food. If it wasn't for the good food, we would never give this place a second chance. 

Management, please do something about your operation. Your food is great but service is horrible. and for the price you charge, I expect much, much better.
author: Sarah S.

description:
For some reason this was a four-start rating, $$ price level on yelp when I went there a few days ago, but now it shows $$$ and 3.5 starts. 

Went there while visiting fisherman's wharf, knowing the view would be fantastic, just to find the view might be the only pleasant.

The staff working there seem not happy. We got in and stood by the host desk waiting to be seated. It was 4pm and the restaurant was still quiet. The host was talking to another employee for half a minute before he turned his face to us, and he looked unhappy with eyebrows twisted. 

I said we're a party of 3 and he confirmed "3?". This is the only word he ever sais to us. He then took us to the seat in silence, put the menu down and left.

They we had to keep sitting there for 10 minutes before our server came to ask what we'd wanna drink, btw he didn't look happy neither from what I could see on his face. Again the restaurant was not busy at all and there were a few people passing our table but none stopped or informed our server until 10 mins past.

Then we ordered a big combo, octupos cappaccio, crab chowder in bread bowl and a seabass. The food didn't take long to come, but interestingly the server came to ask "is everything okay?" When the food runner was placing dishes on table. How would I know if it's okay when my dish was still in your runner's hand???

As for the food, there seabass read decent, octupos cappaccio was okay, and overall all the dishes were kinda salty, especially the crab chowder and grilled shrimps. The saltiness covered all other flavours. 

Our server never came back to the table. Another lady server passed by a few times I asked her fee for the check when we're done. She approached the table, heard what I said and nodded, when brought the check, took my card to swipe and brought there check folder back. She had a smile on her face but DIDN'T say a word during this entire time! None! It was silent again.

It was just wired, like I said the staff didn't look happy at all.

I still tipped 15% but honestly, I won't be ashamed even I didin't give a dime, for this kind of "service".

Btw, yes I know you might be really dissapointed to hear this, this is not the usuau case of your level of service, you take issues and concerns seriously, and you strive to provide excellent experience to every guest.
author: Keyi P.

description: I rate my experience 10/10 because it was perfect and just had great seasoning and it was so good I would come back every day if I could:) My name is Quinn and I'm 8
author: Colin M.

description: Excellent crab, amazing view of Alcatraz, but poor service. Waiter was friendly enough but after we got the crab he didn't come check on us for about 30 minutes. Gave one of us a drink refill, and then we didn't see him again until the check came. Besides this, our meal was delicious and the view of Alcatraz was so cool! The atmosphere and decor was awesome with retro style booth seats and photos covering the walls. The Lots-a-crab wasn't quite as much as we had hoped for but as I wasn't starving, it was plenty. The potatoes were ok but not exactly good and I only ate a few, enough to not feel bad about ordering them I suppose. Enough negatives, the crab was delicious and came out quickly. The sourdough bread was also very good, I definitely didn't need to eat it before the crab but I tried it and then tried again. Maybe one more time, and it was just as good the third time. Pretty pricey but a great place for a treat yourself dinner.
author: Cara H.

description:
The views during dinner were fabulous on a clear evening!  Are you paying for the view? Perhaps but remember, you get what you pay for.  

The dinner menu is a recipe book that you can purchase.  Trying to watch my budget, I enjoyed the spicy shrimp pasta (see photo) along with a glass of wine.  The serving size was appropriate and I enjoyed the dish, although the spiciness was not there.  For dessert, I shared the giant serving of strawberry frozen custard homemade ice cream (please see this photo).  It was gigantic and soooooooo good.  Needless to say, we ate it all (there were three of us)!  Wow; it is always a great day when dessert makes you happy! 

Why only 4 stars?  The restaurant assured us they had no problem with separate checks (we had a part of about 10) but at the end of dinner, it took 45 minutes after dinner for them to get the checks to an agreeable, somewhat individualized format.  This seemed to be the going trend in San Francisco the week I was there.
author: Michelle B.

description:
Dining at Fisherman's Wharf wasn't my first choice, but we can't always get what we want, can we?

Going in, I knew our meal would be overpriced, but I at least hoped it would standout. Unfortunately, it was overpriced and average at best.

We hung at the bar while waited for our table and perused the menu, which was more like a catalog; full of pictures, recipes and quite wordy. The ambiance of the overall place is bright, almost too bright; I think some softer lighting would give it a warmer feel.

Two of us opted for the prix fixe option. In all the wordiness of the menu, they neglect to mention there are absolutely no substitutions for the prix fixe. You want some chocolate sauce on the vanilla ice cream dessert - nope. Even if you want to pay, the answer is no. You ask if you can get chicken instead of shrimp on the alfredo (on the regular menu) - sorry, Charlie.

I started with the house salad. I was told the vinaigrette is homemade and very good. Frankly, I was unimpressed with the salad and found the dressing bland, as if it was heavy on oil and light on vinegar. My entree was the crab alfredo. It was good, but very heavy and rich as most alfredos are. The portion of crab in the dish was very generous, but I got crunchy bites more than once. I imagine it's hard to keep those out. Dessert was the vanilla ice cream, served in a highball. The presentation was vanilla (pun intended), buy the ice cream rich and very tasty. The portion is smaller than what's pictured on the menu, but it was more than enough for us. The person who opted to order from the menu got the chocolate sundae and it was huge, definitely suitable for two.

Personally, if I'm going to drop money on seafood in the Wharf, I'm probably going to Scoma's. I prefer the food and ambiance.
author: Mary T.

description:
Terrible service.  

When a reservation is made for 7:30 pm we shouldn't have to wait an hour.   They intentionally overbook and that's just bad business. 

Good very oily and greasy. 

Portions to price is a bad value. 

They lack enough waiters.  

Plates and silverware dirty.   Probably lack dishwashers too. 


They really do care about the service they provide.  

A few weeks later they invited us back for a mulligan and this time everything was perfect.  

Thank you!
author: John S.

description: The waiter and busser Marc and Evan, the Irish young lad, did an amazing job and were very friendly! These young men were very attentive and quick to acomadate our needs. They definitely made our dining experience more enjoyable. Overall there was Great service, delicious fresh crab, a spectacular view of Alcatraz, and a lively atmosphere. This restaurant is Definitely is a must! :)
author: Bianca S.

description: My mother was visiting for the weekend and wanted seafood at Fisherman's Wharf. I knew it would be busy and we didn't mind the wait, but the attitude at the front desk was enough to make is change our minds. Just plain rude.
author: Melissa H.

description: Beautiful atmosphere disappointed with the food  muscles were dry    Clam chowder had very little clams  in  it     Cesar salad was very bland no tartness to it    Over all very disappointed
author: Mike S.

description: My daughter and I had the pleasure of dining here for Thanksgiving dinner. The service was exceptional. Our waitress was very pleasant and made excellent recommendations. My daughter had the Crab Pasta and I the whole crab and a side spinach salad. It was absolutely delicious!! I strongly recommend.
author: Tonya B.

description:
As we were walking the piers in San Francisco, we decided it was time to put some seafood in our belly. We noticed a crowd in and around this restaurant so we decided to give it a try. (Side Note: we did check the ratings on YELP.. excellent) As we entered and headed up the stairway, we stopped to see all the photos on the walls of Hollywood's biggest and best actors/actresses of the past. Wow..very cool. We were told it was going to be an hour wait, but if we wanted to sit outside they could seat us immediately. We chose outside, which allowed us to see the entertainment on the boardwalk too. We were seated and offered water, and menus. While reading our menus and watching the entertainment, we decided which drinks we wanted and began choosing our menu selections.
My husband had the crab legs and mussels (double order I believe) I had the clam chowder bread bowl... how could I spend a weekend in SF and not get the famous Boudin bread... so that was my choice. (I knew I would sneak some of the hubbys anyway)
The waiter showed up and asked what we wanted to drink, and off he went before we could order food too. No worries we figured he would be back soon with our drinks anyway. Well... that was definitely not the case. It was at least 10 min. before he came back and then he took our order. No big deal right? WRONG!!! While the food came out pretty quick, but we had asked him for silverware and he never brought it. My husband had also asked him for hot sauce, again he never brought it. My husband, tired of waiting to eat decided to get it himself. He managed to find hot sauce, but had to find a bus person to find us silverware. Our waiter never came back to find out if everything was okay. Which by the way, the crab and mussels were outstanding. The buttery, garlic flavor was quickly rising as one the best seafood feasts I have ever had. My clam chowder was creamy and full of tasty clams. Whole clams not cut up pieces. The bread was outstanding, and made me want to eat the whole thing. Which I almost would have if not for the hubby wanting some bread with his food. (another note: everyone else had bread on their table while they waited for food, but alas not us) Had it not been for the amazing food we inhaled, I would have given this place -4 stars.
We finally saw our waiter again, but only to bring us our bill. Maybe it was because we opted to sit outside, but service should remain the same regardless.
author: Michelle G.

description:
When I wrote the review below i was extremely disappointed as you will read. 
-that said. The management staff contacted me personally and apologized for the experience. I am quite impressed with how they handled the situation and I WILL be back to give it another shot. 

will say that when I took my wife to the city (a three hour drive) for a great meal on her birthday I expected so much more. Maybe that's why I was disappointed when the waiter was beyond unhelpful and rude. The food? Basic. You could go anywhere and get what you could get here. And what you can't get elsewhere is pre made and waiting to be dished on to your plate. When I pay prices like this for a meal I expect it to be made to order. I was extremely disappointed in the restaurant, the food, and the service. My wife and I actually stopped on the way home and grabbed a real dinner and gave our left over pre made mess to a very happy homeless man. 

That's the only good that came from this experience. The dinner for my wife's birthday, That we were looking forward too, was the worst meal of our entire trip. Truly disappointed.
author: Gabriel F.

description: Wow! For such a "touristy" spot the quality of the food is amazing! Went for lunch on a busy weekend and the service was great! Everything was very good from the crab fondue to the skillet shrimp (A MUST) to the fish and chips! Would highly recommend!! Great views!! And we are PICKY and JUDGEMENTAL!!  :)
author: Michaelann B.

description: I came here for dinner and had a great time. The atmosphere is very relaxing and the ambiance of the restaurant was very casual but classy at the same time. The inside of the restaurant reminds me of a very fancy dinner with stellar views of the water. The food was great and a good portion size as well. I would definitely come back here for lunch or dinner!
author: Lisa B.

description:
The best crab soup I've ever had !
The next time I'm back in San Francisco I will obviously be coming back here to get my fix. The restaurant is very pretty as well with a very nice view of the bay and Alcatraz island. At the tables they have binoculars for you to look around at things in the bay.
author: Chloe M.

description: Just had such a good eating experience here.  The clam chowder was delicious as was the fish n chips.  We had the double shrimp and crab.  Saul was the best!!!
author: Nichieli F.

description: Bad service , did not refill water and soft drink , manager didn't want come out when customer requested. I will never come back and I do not recommend anyone come this restaurant because they will make you and your family upset
author: Le D.

description:
As all the reviews state, the views are spectacular. After that, everything else was a step worse with the service being some of the absolute worst I've ever experienced.

We had a group of 6. Dinner on Saturday evening. The restaurant was busy, but fine I would think for a restaurant this size in this city.

Our waiter arguably didn't serve us. We saw him 3x during a 90 minute dinner - he took our order, came when we asked for someone to send him over, and brought the bill.

He didn't bring one item out ("sorry I forgot" and brought out an entree not prepared as requested - which he admitted was a mistake.

The crab was great. A bit greasy, but it is crab cooked in butter - yum.

Will not return.
author: Mike M.

description:
Played tourist today with 3 friends and when we chose this restaurant I didn't have high expectations because I thought it was an "old time restaurant" since it has been here for many many years.  The nice waiter told us that the restaurant had changed owners about 5 years??? ago.  Thus I believe the menu choices changed and were updated to center around mostly seafood and the name of the restaurant emphasizing 
"crab" which is definitely in season this time of the year and appeared prominently on almost every page of the menu.

The view is one of the best overlooking the Bay in the Fisherman Wharf/Pier 39 tourist area.  And it's directly in sight of Alcatraz and on this clear day it was so relaxing to look outside at the Bay view.

The food we ordered included, mussels, crab melt, bay shrimp salad, and a pasta dish acini di pepe pasta.  Fresh food, solidly delivered in taste and variety. Skip the salad unless you are a salad lover and go straight for seafood/crab choices.  Above my expectations and I'd come here again.  Prices are a little high but what you'd expect in this highly touristy area with fresh seafood as a specialty.
author: Julie S.

description:
We had our New Year's Eve 2017 dinner here.
We had a great night (though the place was too crowded). Good thing we were able to make a reservation. We were seated after 10mins passed our reservation (well that's ok). We were seated near the window with the bay view as what I have requested in our reservation. Thanks 
We had the following:
