1. 1 whole Roasted Garlic Butter Crab 
4.5 stars - size is good for 2 adults and 1 kid who loves fresh crab meat.
The Crab is cooked perfectly and tasted so fresh.
2. Clam chowder in sourdough bread 
3 stars. 
3. Iron Skillet Roasted Mussels. 4 stars.
We had a very satisfying dinner. 
We're also thankful for the free toy to make our daughter not bored while waiting for our food.
Place is well maintained, with 2 hours parking validation. Friendly customer service. Price is acceptable.
author: Anna A.

description: This seems to be a great place for the view which is AMAZING but the food is very overrated for the price. We got the double double shrimp and crab. The shrimp were very small and had to be peeled then had almost no flavor after struggling through the peeling process. The crab didn't have much flavor unless doused in butter sauce. The fish and chips were terrible..the fish was thin and had no flavor and the chips were boiled soggy potatoes that were deep fried with onions and olives. Yuck. I got the crab soup..it arrived lukewarm and almost no flavor. The vegetarians at our table seemed to have the better meal with pasta. Go there for the view but not the food. Save your money and go to the fish stalls.
author: Deborah E.

description: Like other reviews have said, the appetizers were better than the entrees. The yellowtail carpaccio was amazing, and we were tempted to get another one. The sizzling platter was good, but felt like I could get that anywhere.
author: Jonathan L.

description: It's a beautiful and strange futuristic outer space cruise ship kind of a place overlooking the wharf.  We hung out at the bar, with the wonderfully friendly JD. The prices were a little high, so we didn't eat, but we got drinks. Cool selection of $13 cocktails-- I especially liked the redheaded floozy... it goes down like a strawberry shake, and then you will like you've had two shots. My $4 diet coke tasted like flat Robitussan, but the good news my cough was gone.
author: Glen N.

description: Atmosphere is great. Shrimp was over cooked in the shrimp cocktail.  Too two crab was great and fed 3 people. Halibut was good.
author: Tony M.

description: Very salty food that's expensive and portion sizes are small for one. It was difficult to finish the crab chowder with sourdough bread. Double mussel and crab entree is more of a snack for an adult.
author: Megan Y.

description:
We were entertaining family during this holiday season and spent an evening at Fisherman's Wharf and we dined at the Franciscan.  My wife and I ordered from the Prix Fixe menu with our guests ordering other items.
I will note that they were busy and it was a while before our entrees arrived and when they did arrive I was wondering what happened to the soup/salad first course?  It came afterwards!  My wife's salmon entree was delicious and my crab legs in garlic sauce was so so.  Not sure it was suppose to be served cold but it was and I would have preferred to have tasted warm to hot Dungeness crab legs.  My wife's 2nd glass of wine was not served in a timely matter and was blamed on the bartender and there was a club soda ordered from the gun that took too long to be delivered!
My wife dropped a good chunk of $$$$$$$$+ and the service could have been a lot better and I will not get the crab legs again as well as not patron the Franciscan again!
The views and ambiance are fantastic.
author: steven r.

description: Very busy place.  Nice view on the waterfront. On the spendy side. I like my crab with butter to dip it in, not served that way there. Good bread. Clam chowder was fair.
author: Katharine W.

description: Delicious food; I ordered the crab chowder. It was delivered very warm not hot as you'd expect. Delicious nonetheless. The wait was a little more than I was anticipating since we arrived before the dinner rush. The portions are something else. We asked the server for a recommendation on a meal that's filling; our server recommended the shrimp linguini. The meal was small and not filling..delicious but did not live up to expectations
author: Mike A.

description: Yummy.  Well, I'm not the seafood oficionado in the family, but this place exceeded expectations for a busy business in the heart of the hustle and bustle. Wonderful assortment of varied plates on the menu. Tables were a little tight and it was a little noisy, but it was worth the wait.
author: Joseph M.

description:
TL:DR The food isnt worth the prices and the wait staff are subpar. 
We were sat quickly but then quickly forgotten. The waiter stopped with water and asked if we were ready and we said we needed more time. More time did not mean leave our table alone for over 20 minutes. The food is expensive for serving sizes and the quality doesn't warrant the price. The waiters also ignored us the entire time we had our food which meant many of us went with a drink. They also cleared the table and cleaned it while we were still sitting here right while we were waiting on the check.
author: Kristen V.

description:
This place is nasty. Food has hairs, restrooms are filthy, dirty and stinks. You'd see toilet tissue on the main dining area. Servers dress, serves and communicates unprofessionally.  
I should have took pictures of the whole facility.  Looks like garbage. I feel sorry for servers that works 16 hours shifts.
author: Luisa B.

description:
So we were parked on the lot near Fisherman's wharf and noticed that we get a 3 hour parking concession if we ate at one of the neighboring restaurants. Made the mistake of not checking yelp.. Boy oh boy, little did we realize we fell in a bigger $ trap to save few bucks :D
Everything was bland and overpriced. Waiter wasnt friendly either.
author: Santhosh C.

description: We weren't very impressed with the food at this restaurant. The restaurant itself and location were very good. The service was good, but I wouldn't say great. My son ordered "fish and chips" but they didn't have the "chips" part. My wife ordered the halibut in the lemon butter garlic caper sauce. She was not impressed and much flavor. She said the vegetables that came with it didn't taste fresh. I had the crab melt and it was just ok. The bottom layer of sourdough bread, my sandwich came on, was pretty soggy. I was excited to try the crab chowder, but it was pretty un-exciting when I ate it. Probably won't make it back to this restaurant.
author: Jason S.

description:
This place is excellent. Each item was fine dining - either just as I expected or exceeded my presumptions. 
Family was happy with their seafood salad, seafood fettuccini, crab chowder...the prefix menu I had with short rib, veggies and (subbed in) small/whole potato side dish...whoa, superb flavor.
author: Paul Y.

description: This is not a fancy restaurant, but it's good for a quick, tasty meal. I had my first cioppino (tomato-based seafood soup/stew) here, and I loved it! My boyfriend had a beignet and said it was ok. He liked the cioppino a lot though.
author: Felicia C.

description:
One of the best places on the pier. Food is expensive but worth it. Tried fried calamari and veggie pasta(asked them to add shrimp on it). Both dishes were tasty. Many people were seen trying crab, which seem like a speciality. Must be good. Overall a pleasant experience of enjoying a dinner by the pier with Alcatraz prison view. 

Parking tip: you can park right opposite to the restaurant at the open parking space called "central parking". Restaurant validate free parking for 3 hours.
author: Anup B.

description: Love the basa with the garlic was really good. Real soft texture. The vegetables create a flawless finish that aligns well with the basa. The restaurant has a great view. The service was also very friendly water was refilled as soon as it was quarter down. Did I mention the view?
author: Maria R.

description:
I am glad we finally gave this place a go but we probably won't be back. It was overcrowded and not really worth it. The prices are pretty high and I can get much better good, in a much better environment for a much lower price. I was not impressed by the chowder or the crab and the crab spinach fondue was like fishy flavored spinach with cheese...fondue should not have epic leaves of spinach - that needs to be chopped up. 

The one thing which brought them up from a two you ask? Their custard ice cream...oh dear lord I could write sonnets about that ice cream. It was pretty close to heaven.
author: Mikhail H.

description: Service was good i got the crab and mussels with shrimp the crab was great the shrimp maybe a bit over cooked but overall it was good
author: Marlene V.

description: It was busy as expected when we arrived. We had a 30 or so minute wait but decided to have a few cocktails. They were made well and super tasty! The bartender was polite and made nice small talk while we waited. When we were seated we got a cup of clam chowder to share and it was perfect! No compaints except I wish I had more (my fault for ordering the cup). We decided to get the whole crab and filet mignon with mashed potatoes and vegetables. The crab was delicious and buttery! The steak was the best steak I have ever had before! The potatoes were decadent and kept you coming back! Over all a perfect experience from the food to the service and the views!
author: Myframe Z.

description: Was a long line and crowded on Friday after Thanksgiving day but the fish and chips was amazing and 10.84, loved the way I could see in front how they look like with their names on them before ordering. Seemed good quality and felt great after eating.
author: Shiva M.

description: This place was one of the best places that I have ever been to. The view is wonderful, the service is absolutely fantastic, and the food is killer. The crabs are great, and there is always someone to take away whatever you are finished with. The workers are really friendly, and it's such a clean restaurant. We will definitely be back here in the future, and I recommend most definitely if you are looking for an amazing restaurant with a gorgeous view and the most amazing service, go to this place!! It's wonderful! The busser boy was my favorite, always there to help, and I honestly think he should get a raise, because he is so amazing.
author: Bentley Y.

description:
Delicious food. I enjoyed the oysters. Great environment and nice view of the bay.

They will validate parking from the lot across the street, which is nice. 

For the tables by the window, they provide binoculars which is a nice touch.
author: Taylor B.

description: The best seafood restaurant in San Francisco! Large and tasty servings.
author: Dmitriy K.

description: We had 7pm reservations for 10 on 12/26 and had to wait 40 minutes before we were seated. The waiter forgot one  if the kids meals and we finally had food by 8:30pm. The dining experience was rushed and the food was average and overpriced.  I recommend trying a different restaurant when visiting Fisherman's Wharf.
author: Iris S.

description: Pricey,But first class food. Crab fresh tasty. Musscles very good. Will come back next visit.  Service not so good . We sat outside. Brought the food. No bread n butter and no tools for the crab.  Asked for hot sauce for the musscles never got it had to go get it myself.  Food wow.   Service Boooooo.
author: Earnest G.

description: What an experience! I took my family of six on Christmas night, had a reservation for 7:30pm, and we had to wait a bit because it was so busy. The staff was amazing! They were so nice. A big THANK YOU to them for working on Christmas. They gave us a great seat, and we were quick to order. The crab feast was so delicious. Fantastic! We loved this place.
author: Brian W.

description: Came here to celebrate my cousins birthday late September and we enjoyed. We came early and it wasn't busy, but it picked up once we finished our meal. We came during lunch time and it was a hot day in the bay especially in the pier area. I don't think this restaurant has A.C because it got really stuffy inside and people were sweating and complaining. This restaurant was good about seating huge groups and I love the decorations in the building. They have a fresh bread station and they bring some to you while to wait for your food. We ordered a good amount of food and I really liked that their menu did include pictures of the food they have. Therefore you don't have to pull out your phone and yelp out the dish. You could easily decide what you want by looking at their menu. Price was on the expensive side, but do know that you are in the Pier in the tourist area so things will be expensive. I did like the crab was fresh, but the shrimp was on the smaller side. I did order crab sliders and loved it. I was so amazed with the decor and food I ordered. The view of the water and bay area was amazing in the day time. I would definitely like to come back again during dinner time to adore the view of the bay area and food. If you have time and money to spend for a nice meal with family or date do give this place a try.
author: Danika P.

description: This is a great little place for lunch.  We had some beignets, fish and chips, and a crabwich.  The fish was fried to perfection, not too greasy.  The fries were soft on the inside, but crisp on outside.  The sauce on the crabwich is wonderful.
author: Sam Q.

description: Great place for pasta and seafood! It is pricey but it worth it. Good service and attention.
author: Paul A.

description: Everything about this restaurant was excellent.  The staff was friendly and efficient.  I ordered the crab Alfredo and it may have been the best I have ever had.  The pre fix menu is the way to go.  My pina colada was perfection.  My husband had the short  rib and raved about it.  My daughter ordered chicken and chips and ate everything but the weird pearl onions.  When the pre fix desert came, our waiter brought her one as well.  Well done! This place is all class and I would eat there again for sure.
author: Kiley H.

description: Great lunch with a better view. Sat in an outward facing table in the bar area so we could look at the water. The crab sliders were delicious, as were the crab enchiladas. Service was fast and super friendly. It's in the very touristy area by Fisherman's Wharf but it didn't feel touristy. Great spot.
author: Christin Y.

description: I just wanted to let everyone know this restaurant customer service is horrible. Im going to began with when we sat down and had to wait  a while to just get a glass of water. So, I order the fish and chips and so did my mother in law. The wait for the food wasn't that long. I so five them that but while we waited they gave us some bread that been sitting out where anybody can touch by the tables. So, when they brought the food out, I was puzzle because I asked for fish and chips not fish and potatoes. So, brought up my concerns to the cook that brought out the food and he said they recently changed the fries with potatoes but he can go downstairs and get us fries after looking at our face expressions. We was really thankful  for him doing that. But, then the manager came and stated she can't send her employee downstairs to get the fries and she can substitute it for mash potatoes or an salad. WTF, I want what I order. So, my mother in law was like naw, we going some where else because  Im not paying for something that I didn't want. She saw we about to leave and she hope on her phone and said never mind she going to get us fries. What! So, you came and talk to us for what. To waste our time and yours to give us what we wanted in the first place. You need to put that its fish and potatoes because last time I checked fish and chips is fish and fries.  Not, only that the waitress never came once in checked on us. We had to ask who ever walk by who work there cam the bring us something to drink. She should know why the cook who went out his way for us got her tip and not her.
author: Adrianna R.

description: Food was not great and EXTREMELY expensive. Got a smallish plain salad for $22!! Such a tourist trap. Do not recommend.
author: Julia M.

description:
When in SF, one must have crab, especially during crab season! We had the garlic roasted crab for 2 and it was just dee-lish!!! The crab came on a hot platter with the garlic butter drippings on the bottom of the pan. Oh the aroma was just all around us ( most of the tables around us ordered crab too). 

We cracked and shucked our savory crab legs and wiped the sauce off the platter with each piece. The crab was cooked to perfection and the three of us were just in heaven! 

The restaurant had tons of black and white photos of famous celebrities. Lucille Ball was in the booth with us while we savored cracking crab, catching up and enjoyed our view of the sailboats sailing around Alcatraz. I made reservations in advance and they were quick to seat us even before our designated time. 

This is a wonderful restaurant where you don't feel rushed to have your meal and service was excellent, attentive and most helpful with tons of wet wipes for our crab drenched hands. The table was efficiently bussed after we finished to make room for dessert. 

Yes, you could go downstairs and grab crab for cheaper at one of the many crab stalls, fight off the pigeons and eat in the wind. But it was so worth it to dine in a beautiful restaurant, enjoy our food, company and the to-die-for view. I would definitely return the next time visitors come to town.
author: Carlyn C.

description:
Authentic clam chowder by the Bay! Fast serving so there is no wait! 

FOOD: My friend and I shared the clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl ($10). It came with a small pack of biscuits. The consistency of the chowder was very thick but there wasn't too many pieces of clam meat in there... It was a lot of food! Definitely enough to feed TWO ADULTS. My friend also taught me to eat the left over bread with mustard, which tasted surprisingly good. 

PRICE: $10 for a bread bowl is pretty typical in Fisherman's Wharf. We saw cheaper ones but there weren't seats. 

SERVICE: You order up front in the front of the restaurant and they'll call your number when your order is order. We got the food within a few minutes, which I was very happy about. But honestly what more did they have to do other than cut up a bread bowl and pour in some soup? Lol.. 

SETTING: There were seats inside of the restaurant and outside. My friend and I sat outside where we could see the North Bay and ferries, which was pretty nice. There was also a restroom inside. 

OVERALL IMPRESSION: Pretty good clam chowder! But if you want better service (aka served by a waiter) you should look into another place.
author: Wendy F.

description:
Franciscan Crab Restaurant has a great location which afforded us a view of Alcatraz Island and much of the bay on a very clear night. The menu is almost the best part of this place as you feel as though you are flipping through a Williams Sonoma catalog of food. The entrées are presented on white china and are of substantial portion size. There is a substantial wine list, which includes a healthy list of California wines as well as European. The desserts include Italian cake, cheesecake and several sundaes. 

If you are in the San Francisco area, I would recommend this restaurant to tourists and locals alike!
author: Steve N.

description: All the way from New York, food was Excellent, wonderful view Marvelous staff exceed your expectations ... if you visit SF you must come and eat @ this restaurant !!
author: Majed M.

description: View is what your paying for, amazing background to a good lunch. Oysters were fresh and delicious. However, I had the crab Caesar salad for main and crab was fresh tasting but dressing left a lot to be desired. Service seemed a bit slow, and others around seemed to be complaining of the same. Didn't meet the experience you would expect for the price.
author: Bryan C.

description:
I dig this joint. Sure, its touristy but I've never had to wait for a table, and you cannot beat the bay view. 

During this visit our waiter was very nice and accommodating. He forgot our prosciutto appetizer so the main dishes beat it out but he was fast to produce it once reminded.  Acme bread and clam chowder hit the spot and the octopus carpaccio w/ burrata was awesome!
author: Jaime M.

description:
I wish I had eaten a full meal w/ appetizers at this place, but I had eaten a bit earlier and really wanted to try something here.  I had the fish & chips and believe me, I wished I had gone here for dinner rather than a couple of other places I chose to go to!

The fish fry seasoning had great flavor and the size of the piece was terrific. 

The setup/arrangement of the place and the seating is wonderful and the view is fantastic!  I would love to return to try more dishes.  A bit overpriced, bu you pay for the location as well.
author: Rolena I.

description:
One of the most iconic dinner along the wharf area is the Franciscan Crab Restaurant. Photos inside reflect just how old and how many famous personalities have dined here over the past 50 years. 
Great views of the bay and terrific atmosphere inside. 
The service and the variety in the menu's could not be faulted. 
This is a good option when you visit Fisherman's Wharf in San Francisco.
#ResearchAndTravelServices
#facxual_events
author: Jim D.

description: This place was great! Went here with some family from out of town. Fish and chips were BIG portions! And the clam chowder bread bowl was great! A friend also had the skillet crab legs and it smelled delicious! Would definitely come back! Beautiful views!
author: Katie C.

description: This restaurant is not the worst and not the best. I went on Christmas day to try beignets. We ordered 6 beignets, a basket of mixed seafood and some coffee. There was a huge rush but we got our food pretty fast. The food was not fresh but cold. The taste was not bad and maybe on a less busy day could be better. Overall, probably would not visit again. Side-note: they use canola oil and can work with food allergies.
author: Rida S.

description: Great service, amazing organization of staff taken into consideration size of restaurant. Crab was fantastic and delicious sauce goes well with fresh bread. Crab chowder for starter is good choice. Awesome view. Place to visit.
author: Davor B.

description: Delicious selection of Iron Skillets, definitely try any of them, you can't go wrong. We have ordered some salads, small plates, artisanal salumi burrata bar items in the multiple visits and they were all delicious. A bit of 60's diner atmosphere with a superb location in the heart of Fishermans Wharf. Try to get a booth seat that faces the water if possible. The prices are a bit high but you are in a tourist hot spot, so what do you expect. Bar seating is very limited. They also have happy hour as well but not a whole lot of selection for it.
author: VJ H.

description: Nice view, food was ok/good depending on what you get. Giving this place 3 stars for the food and view. Service was OK, my waiter could be nicer, I felt like anytime I asked my server anything he didn't seem pleasant. Always giving me and my boyfriend a weird look.  My check said the severs name is Alberto, so I'm assuming that's his name, he gave out a very arrogant vibe.
author: Trang N.

description: We've been passing up this restaurant on our way to our hotel because it was always busy and full of people. On our last day, we decided to give it a try.  The line looked long but our order came pretty quickly!  We got a table by the door overlooking the bay, and we truly enjoyed our meal!  We ordered clam chowder soup, calamari and chips, and beignets & everything was super tasty! The restaurant itself looked very vintagey but I think that only added to the charm! The staff are super busy but they were friendly & got the food right! I greatly recommend this place!
author: Kate G.

description: I LOVED this place! We are visiting from Seattle and tried this place without knowing anything about it! Atmosphere was great, food was great and service was great also. I ordered a half a crab! It was tasty but a little dry. I didn't care, I will definitely be back next time I'm in town!!!! The view is amazing! We had so much fun!
author: Bekah A.

description:
Nice views but in an almost empty dining room with a diffident staff and dead-looking (and as it turns out), plastic baby palm trees.

In all fairness, I couldn't figure out if the baby palm trees were real or not. I asked one of the staff what was the story and he smilingly bent a fake branch and a pillow of dust popped off a fake limb.

We both laughed. Oh well.

It's a shame the faux-foliage detracts from the otherwise retro-cool interior. I loved the red leather booths, black and white, framed celebrity photos and maritime paraphernalia. 

Sadly, most staff lacked any hospitality and had this slightly lost look like they didn't know what they should be doing. 

Our server, however, was relentlessly attentive and sweet, doting on my little boy like a woman who has a child that age. I gave her a huge tip.

But the real point of it: The food, hmmmm....

While the Crab Alfredo was outstanding and perfectly executed, my son's meal and the soup appetizer were disappointing. The food was uneven like the service: One great experience with puzzling stumbles. 

The cup of crab soup had a broth so thick it tasted like an enormous amount of flour had been measured into it. I was informed it was potato starch. Whatever it was, it overwhelmed the delicate Dungeness crab, at $12.95 a cup. 

(Even at the Wharf, the prices were sticker shock).

The crab Alfredo was on par and decadently delicious since it was made with a copious amount of fresh Dungeness crab, clarified butter and heavy cream. It was a smaller portion yet I could only eat half.  It was rich and delicious. 

My little boy had the children's  portion of buttermilk fried chicken. It was chicken fingers; it wasn't buttermilk fried chicken. The corn on the cob and roasted potatoes that accompanied it looked dried out and unappetizing. My little boy didn't touch either and only ate a small portion of the chicken. 

One appetizer, two entrees (choosing the least costly) and one Anchor Steam: $63 + tip.

I wanted it to be worth it. Sadly, it wasn't. 

If I splurge again at the Franciscan, I'll skip the soup and go right for the shrimp and Dungeness crab platter. Other Yelpers say it's off-the-hook.
author: Jennifer O.

description: I did not get a chance to try the crab here, we just stopped by their bakery for some fresh made beignets and macarons. The beignets were light and very fluffy served with a side of vanilla whip cream, yummy. The macarons were not my favorite, but they still had a good unique flavor. I actually prefer mine not so crispy on the outside. The restaurant itself has a nice view of the water, and next time we're in town I will be dining here.
author: Simone T.

description:
I love this place!! My husband and I came here a couple of times and it was just amazing each time. Everything that we ordered was so good! 

We never make reservations, so we always come as "walk-in" customers.. We never have to wait that long. The longest we've ever had to wait was about 20 mins. 

While looking at the menu, I never know what to get. Everything looks so good.. I always end up getting the crab Alfredo or the crab melt. So while waiting for our food, they serve us with free bread and butter, which always seem fresh and right out of the oven! 

The views around the restaurant is absolutely stunning.. Every table you get, has an amazing view of the ocean. They even have a little outdoor seating which is fun on a nice day. 

They are very accommodating with large parties too! I had my 30th birthday here and had about 30 people attending. I didn't have to do a set menu. Everyone was able to order off the menu, which was great! 

I recommended this place to a couple of out of towners and all of them had something great to say. Nothing was negative! I would definitely be back!!
author: Darlene M.

description: Had a wonderful lunch today, while watching vthe Blue Angels.  Cioppino was our favorite.
author: John S.

description: Crab is very tasty, I would recommend 2 person for a half, otherwise it will taste a little greasy.
author: Tianzhou Q.

description: My best friend and I absolutely loved this place! If you've never been, grab a seat by the window! We were lucky so many times during our trip to San Fran and everywhere we went we were seated with a great view! We shared the clam chowder and LOVED it. We also shared a few mermaid cocktails that were yummy, maybe not worth the price but they were tasty nonetheless. Our meals were great, I had the clam fettuccini and she had the garlic pasta. Yum! I docked a star because the bathrooms were atrocious and the water in both sinks were clogged and overflowing. They were pretty gross but I gotta say the view and food made us forget that experience!
author: Brittney F.

description: Extremely great view. Celebrity photos outline the walls. Great interior and seating. Ok service. Pretty overpriced though.
author: Savannah M.

description:
Fact:
The restaurant is on the second floor.

Fact:
Our fish was extremely fresh!

Conclusion:
My kids put two and two together... the restaurant is on the second floor because they have fishermen on the first floor catching the fish and handing it off to the cooks after we place an order. Yep, that's what my 8 year old said while we ate, and we're going with it!

Everyone, including our 3 kids, loved their dinner! Super fresh and tasty dishes! We received prompt excellent service and loved their table to ceiling windows to get good looks at the Bay! 

Can't wait to go here again!
author: Esme C.

description: Great crab, fantastic views of the bay and consistently good service.  Parking is easy too. Always a pleasure to come here.
author: Jon W.

description: I was visiting my boyfriend and he was showing me around the Fisherman's Wharf since it's such a tourist attraction. There were plenty of seafood options, we eyed the lobster rolls from the food cases but wanted someplace we could sit down. After scanning the various menus of the restaurants, we settled on the Franciscan. This was the best choice since it was cheaper than Alioto's and with no wait to boot, it also had a great view into the harbor with Alcatraz directly within view. It was mid-afternoon and their large windows provide every seat with an amazing view. We ordered the Shrimp Alfredo and the Fish & Chips. The Shrimp Alfredo was delicious and buttery. For the Fish & Chips, the fish was cooked perfectly along with the chips being comprised of smashed potatoes, sweet potatoes, and corn. My boyfriend had ordered a small Blue Moon Beer (but the small was pretty large and was the same size as the glass of water they gave us). We noticed later that there was something stuck on the inside of the glass and they made sure to give us a fresh new glass filled to the brim this time with beer. I was a little disappointed that the lemonade wasn't fresh but rather that Minute-maid stuff but it was still good and came in a glass larger than what the beer was in. The menu is odd and feels like a child's menu with all of the pictures and outdated Photoshop but it did help us realize what exactly what we were getting. What was also disappointing was that the bread was obviously sitting out for awhile in front of us pre-plated which didn't look that appetizing especially since the bread was a little tough to rip apart.
author: Isabelle C.

description: The restaurant is right on Fisherman's Wharf and has a cool entrance. I ordered the fixed price menu and chose the chowder soup as my appetizer, crab legs for entree and was served ice cream in a cup for dessert for $39. Overall it was a good experience. The crab legs were served hot in a skillet with butter. There was at least half a crab which was a good size for the price. The soup was also quite delicious. However I was slightly disappointed by how cold the bread was that was served in the beginning. My partner also ordered the fish and chips and it was not as expected. There weren't any fries! It was a just potatoes with olives and a piece of corn. The fried fish also wasn't drained/dried so it got super soggy fast. But he said the flavour wasn't bad and was overall decent.
author: Evelyn Y.

description: Great service and food.  Restaurant could use some updating but that is normal for most places in San Francisco Fisherman's Wharf.  Soup was just ok but Spicy Shrimp was great.  I recommend giving it a try!  Be sure to make reservations on the weekend...
author: Micah B.

description:
I have to say that when it comes to Customer Service, Shannon, the manager of the night gets a standing ovation!  

I called this evening to reconfirmed my group as I was paying for their meal  and was not going to present. She could not locate the file I had previously sent, but instead of giving me the run around came up with a solution. She was attentive to my needs to make this a memorable experience for my group. She made sure the table was ready before the group arrived so they didn't have to wait and provide an amazing view for them.  

Thank you Shannon for taking customer service to a new level!!
author: Debie M.

description: Still great food and view! But service is horrible. We were served by Martin. He has zero customer service skills or personality. Besides poor service, it took him 20 mins to charge our cards. He couldn't figure out how to split a bill between a few credit cards. Our table was also assisted by busboy Jose and I think he is a superstar of service and keeping customers engaged.
author: Daria P.

description:
This place ain't a bad stop, that is if you're ridiculously hungry and your tummy can no longer wait for Fisherman's Wharf. Brian and I came here on a rainy day after having our shoes damped and feeling exhausted.

Location:

It's within the Fisherman's Wharf area. There's parking you have to pay for, but if you find a parking spot for free, good luck with that! Other than that, the restaurant is right by the bay and pier where you can enjoy the bay views and seagulls trying to hustle it up for some bread.

Ambiance:

I'm kind of confused with the decorations. It's almost kind of obnoxious actually... There's Italian with tourist decorations and Latino decorations... It honestly sounds like this poor restaurant is experiencing an identity crisis. However, you order at the front of the counter and pray to the lord you actually find a good seat especially during the lunch hour.

Food:

Brian and I had the Clam Chowder in a bread bowl. Sadly, I'm not a huge fan of the clam chowder. Even though I love the flavors combined, it was a bit too mushy and chowder-y for me to handle. It's not ideal for the individual who likes to slurp more on the soup rather than chew it like it's curry. The bread on the other hand was really good. I liked the inside of the bread bowl because it soft and wonderful to enjoy.

Customer Service:

I have to give props to the ladies for their customer service. They were extremely friendly and offered us suggestions on what to order on the menu.

Overall:

I'll probably come back to try something different, but for now, I would rather walk another 10-15 minutes for some street seafood along the popular tourist trap.
author: Aubrey D.

description:
Wow, where to start?

How bout the beginning... Traffic... There is so much around the area with tourists, cars, and buses, it's better to just walk.  

Parking... Supposedly you can park across the street in the lot, IF they open it... The entrances to the lot were blocked by cones, and the attendants open the lot periodically.  So you have to time it, we missed our chance and got stuck in traffic again for another 30 mins.  

We had a 4:30 reservation, but they told us they wouldn't be able to seat us until a half hour later, and w/out the window table we requested for my Mom's birthday. Huh? Really? You mean we gotta wait AND we don't get a window table? 

I've worked in the industry. If you have reservations, you plan for those accordingly. Front of the house needs to work on that. 

Restaurant Service... Slow and very forgetful.  Other than our dinners, we had to ask multiple times for things that we needed.  

Food... Bland.  The Clam Chowder which was okay.  But they're pick a fish options were bland along with their pastas. 

The Crab Louie was whatever, there was barely any crab in the salad.  

This restaurant was DEFINITELY not worth paying 3 dollar signs. Being a local, we should've known better than to travel to Pier 39 for dinner, especially this one.

Don't go here!!
author: Peter K.

description: Very pleased with the service and the meal. Food came out fast and was delicious. Our waitress was very friendly and fast to bring drinks and bread. The restaurant is covered with cute old photos and the view is nice, looking out to the ocean while eating our seafood dinner.
author: Tara M.

description:
Great food and the mojito I ordered was amazing.
Our sever Victoria was great she explained the menu and made sure we where well taken care of. I would deffenetly recommend this restaurant. I do have to say it is pretty pricy but all in all I would say very worth it.
author: Rashawn W.

description: This is one of those places that I just have to go to when I'm in SF. Overall the place is clean and the employees are very nice and their service is good and fast. I think the prices are pretty fair for being a seafood restaurant near the ocean. Their filet mignon is very good, tender and juicy. The mash that comes with it is so goooood. I've tried their calamari, yellow carpaccio, their iron roasted skillet seafood, sea bass, and seafood fettuccine. All very satisfying. But my all time favorite is the spicy shrimp pasta, hmmm the flavor. I ordered that about 3-5 times already, can't get enough of it. Btw not sure why it's called spicy, there is no spice to it lol, but still very yummy!!
author: Lai P.

description: Used to come here a lot and the staff is always amazing! Seafood is always super fresh and the clam chowder is to die for.
author: Mina A.

description:
So everything about me wants to scoff at tourist trap Fishermans Warf restaurants.... and I would not describe this place as your apex artistic dining...  BUT it is perhaps one of the best appetizer / drink spots on the whole of gods green earth. 

Order some crab... add a bloody mary or martini... or a nice amber beer... or...or...or... and... such sweet delight... that bread... that glorious San Francisco bread. 

And loose yourself beyond the alcatraz of your mind to the infinity of the ocean... 

It is sublimely perfect. 

There is almost no were on earth better to relax and noon-sundown drink, perhaps... in the world.
author: Eric T.

description: Had observed the Franciscan Crab from a distance over many years, but never dined there because of my perception that it appeared to be a schmaltzy tourist trap along the wharf.  I'm glad we decided to give it a go.  The entry was filled with nostalgia from all the celebrities that had dined there throughout the decades.  The interior was brightly lit and had a joyful, fun ambience.  Yes there were many tourists there, but it was nice to be among them and enjoy the vibe, and they were there for a reason; excellent, fresh sea food!  The locale is quite spacious with plenty of seating to choose from, and there is few validated parking with the lot directly across which is a real bonus at the wharf. Of course the most famous dish is the local Dungeness crab which was presented elegantly with signature garlic butter sauce on a tower with shell bowl beneath.  The crab was cracked, clean and ready to eat.  Extraordinarily fresh and highly recommended, but only when in season and fresh; never frozen!  Prior to the crab, we had paper thin slices yellow tail carpaccio which was quite good, but it was saturated in too much olive oil and balsamic.  One of our friends had the fresh halibut which she really enjoyed.   Salad was a bit wilted and not very green; could be improved.  To end, we enjoyed complimentary vanilla ice cream. There were no corkage fees for our wine which was a pleasant surprise, and we enjoyed a beautiful view of the wharf and the bay.   UPDATE: Fourth time here was a miss.  Upon entry, we inquired with the host as to whether we may have a table and preferably one with a view.  Host not pleasant with reply and not many smiles with the wait staff.  Service not as attentive; had to ask twice for lemon and drawn butter; never did get the latter, crab was not cracked and no ice cream at the end :(. Will give it another try and hope it will be better next time.
author: Roy A.

description: My friend and I had a wonderful birthday lunch yesterday. I had the sourdough clam chowder bowl, which was very delicious. A glass of pi not noir and complimentary sourdough bread with butter was a terrific start. We also were given a yummy bday treat following our meal. The staff was great and our waiter, Loren, was very kind and attentive. Excellent customer service here!
author: Alicia A.

description: Awesome experience! Ordered prosciutto board and oysters to start. Got the double mussel and double crab as a main dish - comes out on a sizzling grill! Very good and reasonably priced compared to other places.
author: Ash J.

description:
Nice enough place. We had a bit of a wait, but that was expected on such a busy day in SF. 

We sat in the corner with THE best view in the place. They're nice enough to even include binoculars at each table. Nice touch! 

The food was excellent. Well prepared and a nice selection. 

My only complaint was that the place was FREEZING. Every table around me had their coats on. I actually kept my sweater and coat on throughout the entire lunch and couldn't get warm enough.
author: Jason D.

description: Thought the meal and service was great. The food was good, I prefer crab with no dressings and then dipping into butter but it was different to try garlic crab. The clams were amazing and so were the oysters.
author: Brielle W.

description:
Very disappointing! 
My husband and one year old son were in San Francisco for the weekend, and we wanted some good crab, so we chose Franciscan Crab Restaurant after reading the good reviews. 
The first thing I noticed was how FILTHY the floor was! I know it's a restaurant and people drop food, etc. but I have never seen such a dirty floor at any other restaurant. Their carpet is bright red, so maybe that causes whatever is on it to stand out more, but it's not a pretty sight and definitely negatively impacted my first impression. 
We got seated and then noticed how HOT it was in the restaurant! I mean, GROSSLY hot, not just a little warm. Our waitress came by and was visibly perspiring on her face. We told her to please let the manager know that the AC needs to be turned on and she agreed about how hot it was and said she'd talk to her. 
We had to change our son's diaper, so my husband went to the restroom with him to take care of it. (BTW, the bathroom was obnoxiously far from our table and the route to it is through the bar area so there are a lot of people standing around and having to go through the crowd is pretty annoying.) My husband finally returned just to inform me that there is no changing table. So I took my son and went to the ladies' room and, sure enough, there is a changing table in the ladies' room. I cannot even BEGIN to describe how enraging that was!!! I'm sorry, are we living in 1952?! You're basically saying that a MAN is NEVER alone with a child that needs a diaper change! It's outrageous. 
The manager came by to speak to us because the waitress had told her about our complaint regarding the heat. She was very nice and by that time, the AC had been turned on, so it was much better temperature wise. We mentioned to her the changing station issue. She said that she apologizes, but the restaurant was built in the 50's. Well - maybe that's  an update you should make! That's not an excuse! She said she's happy to have my husband go and change our son in a side room of some sort and we told her no, it's OK, I already changed him (because, you know, I'm the woman and it's clearly my responsibility). 
We were only able to get drinks and appetizers because our son was starting to melt down, and honestly, the food was... meh. Expensive - so I would expect more than "meh". We got the fried pearl onions, which were just bland and sort of tasteless, and also the crab and spinach fondue, which was much better. 
All in all, I would NOT recommend this restaurant based on my personal experience. Especially considering how many fantastic seafood restaurants are in that area.
author: Marta H.

description: We had the skillet combo, which was expensive, but really good.  Our friends, who kept kosher, didn't love it as much, as there were fewer options.  I loved the view, plus the architecture of the building made it kind of fun!
author: Sarah S.

description:
SEAFOOD GALORE!  First time eating at this place and I am glad I tried it because it was delicious! 

A lot of tourist, more adults in the restaurant but definitely kid friendly.  I just would be extra careful bringing your kids and ordering the iron skillet, they almost dropped it and our glass of water spilled all over our friends lap  glad it wasn't the Cabernet.

We ordered the: 
Famous roasted double crab and double mussels- 4 stars! 
Famous roasted double crab and double shrimp- 4 stars! 
Calamari to share- huge portion and very fresh! One of the best calamari I've ever had! - 5 stars! (They only served it with marina, no creamy sauce) 
Clam chowder- for a seafood restaurant I had high hopes for this but maybe I'm comparing it to (Hogs island clam chowder, which is a 100 stars). It was just ok. - 3 stars for this. 
Sea of the sirens cocktail - sweet and delicious - 4 stars. 
Cabernet Rutherford - 4 stars 

We were given a table with a spectacular view. They even have binoculars, pretty awesome! 

I definitely want to try their pasta dishes next time.
author: Kathy B.

description: Do not go to this place. The bathrooms were filthy. They offer Seabass that my wife ordered and it was not real Seabass. The Seabass they are serving is actually black Seabass notChilean Seabass. For $40 you expect the real deal. I ordered crab that was not good. The only thing that was good was the fried calamari and bread. This place reminds me of in and outThat they're just pushing food in you and not taking care of the customer with the prices they offer you should expect more.
author: Laura H.

description: Stunning views of the bay and amazing seafood!  We came without reservation and had a rather large party of 10 people, I believe it was early Friday evening.  Seated without an issue, so a good start already. Did I say the views are stunning?  Oh man, we had a prime spot in a middle of the restaurant so could not help but stare at that window. Lots of options on the menu, something for everyone, whether you like seafood or prefer other food.  The bread is delicious.  The soup warmed up my soul as we have not envisioned how cold SF could get in the summer evenings.  We ordered the platter that had a little bit of everything to be shared between two people-it had shrimp, mussels, scallops I think.  It was definitely enough food for two people and my nephew who came in later, joined us on it, well, with his help, we finished it, then took a small break and ordered another one.  The desserts were also terrific.
author: Baby S.

description:
Went here this past weekend while I was out in SF. We ordered all cheap options they had and gosh, they all tasted bland, borderline terrible.

My brother had the Clam chowder - Standard
My sister had a veggie plate of some sort - Bland!
I had the single enchilada - not good.

Nice view though.
author: Helen A.

description: Charging 4.9% for some BS "cost of doing business and government mandated expenses" is completely crap! Coming from the most liberal city in the world is laughable! It's a complete scam and they should be held accountable! I will be writing a letter to the BBB and everywhere else I can find to make sure they are notice for the fraudulent charge to their customers.
author: Rick B.

description: Oysters were great. Crab sandwich was awesome. Service was friendly but timing needs work...beer arrived much later than my oysters.  Beer selection could stand to improve
author: Chris L.

description: I took my wife here for our 39th anniversary. We made the drive from our hometown of Sacramento for this special event.  I had been here a few years earlier with a business colleague and we really enjoyed it. The crab was fantastic. However, on this occasion, I was a bit disappointed in the taste, quality and portions. It is an excellent location on the Embarcadero, so I expected it to be a little more pricey. But the quality has gone downhill here. I wish it hadn't as I was really looking forward to returning. You may want to try a dry run with appetizers before you plan anything special here. Just sayin.
author: Jack N.

description:
Very nice restaurant,  located right off the pier.
Can see the view of Alcatraz from the dining area. They provide each table by the window with binoculars.

I had the Shrimp Alfredo which was REALLY GOOD.
You can tell the pasta is fresh and homemade and the Alfredo sauce is made from scratch. Nice and creamy.
I'm definitely going back.

I felt very comfortable. I thought I had to be dressed up but most people, like myself, was dressed very casual.

It looks even better at night.
author: Kay M.

description:
We went here for Father's Day and my daughter's college graduation.  Over the years we have called this our special occasion go to spot; however, we had a bad experience with our waiter on our last visit, however, we wanted to think it was an isolated event.  While making the reservation we could NOT reserve a table for more than 8 people were 9 so we had to boot my daughter's Godparents.   

When we arrived our table was ready; however, the restaurant floor was very dirty with spilled food items.  This should be a job for bussers or hosts, really bad presentation for us and our guest. We there from about 5-7pm, our table was right next to the bathroom and door to patio seating.

Our waiter was friendly and efficient, however, his hands were absolutely a problem.  Both had large cratered sores on them and were very red.  Additionally, his fingernails were lined with black material of some type.

Our food was prepared correctly though we had a long ticket time(time from order to the table) and you could tell the dishes may have spent a few too many minutes under a heat lamp.   

These are all human-centric issues that could be resolved if management decided to fix; therefore I fear that there are more issues of quality and cleanliness that were not seen from our view and that leads to a lack of confidence in the general operation and quality.
author: John P.

description: It was pouring rain on my friends birthday and we ended up here  we had the crab roll (not recommended). My first time trying beignets I'm not sure what there suppose to taste like but they were amazing. Garlic fries were delicious. Probably one of the BEST fish and chips ever! The calamari and chips were average. The service was quick, they got busy real quick...I make sure while in SF to sto by again
author: Milee T.

description: We walked to a large staircase and it was very crowded. Since we were seated it took around an hour to get bread and water so simple don't you think. The waitress had an attitude and she was disrespectful to me and my family. The bread was very cold. And the food was mediocre. I give this 1 star for its average food and horrible service.
author: Ethan K.

description: If you visit San Francisco you most dine here. Excellent service, beautiful view & food is so delicious that you can't stop eating. Best food in town. Specially sea food
author: Elizabeth S.

description: The food was really good and the view of Alcatraz is great. The portion size is really big. The service was a bit hit or miss and it is pricy. If you have a reservation they won't seat you until everyone is there even if there are a lot of empty tables.
author: Brian R.

description: First time here..love the view of the bay. I would suggest you make reservations as it's a very busy place. Oh and parking sucks but that's to be expected in pier 39 area. Now about the food. We orders garlic crab, garlic shrimp, crab chowder and crab alfredo..yes we went crab crazy. The crab is amazing because it's fresh. I think would prefer their sister company "The Dead Fish" over this place. The food just has a better taste!
author: Joy G.

description:
I'm not sure how you can stop here and not have an enormous portion of the dungeoness crab. That's exactly what we did when we got here: crab cocktails, mussels and crab, and a lot more crab!

The crab cocktail was excellent and loaded with horseradish, giving you a stong kick with each bite.

The crab is delicious and stands extremely well on its own in terms of flavor. It is served with butter sauce and a lemon sauce. Both these sauces are needed more for the mussels than the crab. The ends of the crab gather the flavor of the grilling sauce. When eating, put on your bib and get dirty!

Service was lackluster. We hardly saw him and were worried we would qualify for AARP by the time we got our check. Drink service, delivering what was ordered, general attention, and urgency were all lacking on the part of our server. 

The building itself boasts an amazing view of the bay and Alcatraz, which is one of the best parts of visiting this location.

The Franciscan is worth the experience for the great crab and view, but our service experience was awful. Hopefully, you'll get more attention than we did.
author: Aaron T.

description:
The view and atmosphere was great. The food wasn't fantastic. The oysters were fresh but lacked condiments. I guess simplicity was the point. The garlic crab was a bit dry and the garlic was overpowering.  The soup was a bit too salty. The salad, well, it's hard to go wrong with the simple ingredients of a Loui but the three over ripe slices of avocado wasn't pleasant.  Presentation at that price point was lacking.  
The service was great by the waitress.  She cut the crab helped the runners direct the food to the right people.  One thing that did bug me though was that when we were getting ready to leave the busboy kept on asking me to pass over cups and utensils.  If we were staying for dessert, I wouldn't have minded. But I don't necessarily go to $$$ restaurants to help clean unless it's a self serve tray kind of place.  He could have waited two minutes until we got up and left.  Ok food will still bring me back but bad service definitely won't. This place is walking on glass when it comes to service. It's good and it's bad.

There are dozens of restaurants in that area that serve crab the simple way. They may not look as clean, but I think cheaper basic steamed crabs may be more of an experience for a tourist (which I was).

Updated to show 4 stars. Always like to see restaurants noticing customer experiences and responding to their issues in a positive manner.
author: Anthony H.

description:
You are paying for a view. DO NOT forget that.

With that said, the food is decent, but this is a place that is hoping to get your touri$t dollar$. 

My party of four had a "small plate" of calamari, three orders of crab enchiladas, one sea bass, and a "double crab, shrimp and mussels" for the whole table. We spent over $200 before tip.

Of course, the calamari is calamari. It was perfect, but it wasn't worth the price. The crab enchiladas were amazing. I didn't try the fish, but the rest of the seafood was outstanding.

The frustrating thing is that I could have gotten good seafood anywhere -- it's San Francisco, for Pete's sake! -- but my friends wanted to go here. The service was excellent, and the food wasn't bad. I just felt that when my dinner tab is almost as much as my airfare, there's an issue. That's just me.

If you have a trust fund, you'll love this place, with its killer views of Alcatraz and the water.
author: Brian M.

description: Awesome views and great menu options. Fresh seafood. Delicious drinks and free bread. Expect to spend 50-100$ per meal but worth it!
author: Erin S.

description:
Great service. Great interior decorating. Below average food. 

Came to Fransican Crab for a friend's birthday party, and ordered oysters and a crab chowder sour dough bowl. While the crab chowder was average, the oysters honestly did not taste fresh. I was quite disappointed as I had high hopes walking in (based on the two factors I mention first in this review) but it fell way short of expectations. The relatively high menu prices just made it worse.

A popular choice, the garlic noodles, was also uncomfortably greasy.

Really hope this place can come up with better food, as the interior decorating and service were outstanding .
author: Matthew L.

description:
This place was suggested by our tour guide, although he was reluctant.  We went in the mid afternoon so it wasn't busy.  The negative started as soon as we walked in the door. The Maitre'd was flat-out rude and snobby.  He gave a look that was almost  vicious!! The waiter was good, however, and when we told him we were on a time crunch due to the tour and he was quick with service.  The drinks were okay - hubby had wine and I had a cocktail which I can't recall the name of.  

We ordered the platter of seafood - crab and shrimp feast which the waiter kept saying was "a lot of food".  It filled us up but was not good.  The crab tasted kind of old, smelled very fishy which is never a good sign.  The shrimp were dry and old tasting.  We live in Colorado and we get better seafood there.  Neither of us were pleased with it.  The bread was good, however. 

The view is great, the windows dirty.  The place was half empty and the rude guy tried to seat us away from the window. We had to beg for a window seat.  I mean, why are we here?  Not sure why others have raved about the seafood.  Maybe we got the literal bottom of the barrel?  Not worth the money.  We wished we'd gone somewhere less snooty with fresher seafood.  But when you're visiting and on a timeline, you take what you get.
author: Cari Z.

description: The view is beautiful. The crab is ok. The oysters are very fresh and tasty. The calamari is one of the best I've had and not over breaded. Parking can be pricy the lot across the street is the one they validate for. It charges 15 minute intervals.
author: Marigold M.

description:
I've been here a few different times in my many visits to Fishermans Wharf, I can't say I've ever been much impressed by anything other than the view. 

We were here when we were in town for our meeting and service was pretty good. We had a big group and came in right at dinner rush and they managed to seat us quickly. Our server was nice, but didn't know very much about gluten free options. 

Aside from the pure seafood there isn't much someone with a gluten allergy can eat. I settled for the crab and shrimp Louie salad and my server was nice enough to let me read the dressing ingredients, but then as she brought out the food told me the kitchen informed her they then add flour to thicken the dressing... Why do that.. And could you maybe NOT do that for someone who can't have flour?? I was given oil and vinegar which was really terrible on that salad unfortunately.. I picked at the shrimp and crab, which was a generous portion, but left most of it. 

My coresidents and their wives had a variety of meals, the only thing I heard was that both people who ordered the crab melts didn't really like them. The others seemed relatively pleased. 

Prices are expensive, as is expected on the wharf. Portion sizes seem good though which helps make up for it. Service is good and the view amazing.. All and all I probably won't make it a priority to get back here, but it has it's good points
author: Elisabeth P.

description:
We have always  heard awesome  things  about  the Franciscan  Crab Restraunt  in SF! So we had to try it out for ourselves. We were seated by the big window and we could  see the beautiful  ocean..The table came with binoculars  which we thought  was cool..The food was outstanding and even came out on a hot grill! ! We went on a Sunday in February  & the weather  was absolutely  perfect..They also have  an outside  patio that has heaters ! The restraunt  itself  is a a beauty. .Drinks were made perfect  to the T ! Our server was Isaac E  and I would  have to rate his service  with 5stars! We hope you liked your tip! 
I will come to this restaurant  every  single  time in Sf  (:
author: Christina O.

description:
This place is great! I came here once for dinner and another time for lunch. Definitely somewhere to go with friends and family. Their seafood is super fresh and they have a lot of flavor in their dishes. I also had their pink champagne and it was delicious!

The environment wins it all. At night you can see the pier, the lights and also boats. Definitely a great date spot ;) !
author: Natalie L.

description: Well my wife wanted a drink and a small appetizer, so it looked really nice looking. It was but the service at the bar sucked. We arrived at the bar, we were the only 2 at the bar with 3 tenders. The places wasn't even busy and it took about 10 min before we said excuse me we would like to order drinks. The beer was good so was the food. It was 2-24-18 at 3:55 pm when we had our drinks. Then another couple comes. The girl (Marisa G) at the bar gave them all the attention a guest needs since she knew who they were, friends. Meanwhile I'm waiting to get a refill on my Beer. I left my glass in plane view and these bartenders just kept walking by. So much that my wife says my husband would like a beer because I was just seeing how long it would take them. Few minutes later Walter(bartender) I hear him say "only 10 for 200" I know what that means as a former bartender myself. This place I would not recommend to anyone, seems there all about the tips and not services.
author: Leonel O.

description:
I'm reviewing this place on OVERALL experience, not just one factor such as food (3/5), location (4/5), service (4/5) or value (3/5). 

LOCATION: the heart of Fisherman's Wharf is wonderful for first timers (a bit annoying to locals; e.g. New Yorker being forced to eat in Times Square). The view out the back of the restaurant is amazing. All glass, perfect place to eat seafood, have a cocktail and take in the unobstructed beauty. The decor is wonderful. Complete with hundreds of photos of A-list celebrities all over the walls and great booths, stadium style seating so everyone can have an unobstructed view. 

FOOD: they have some exciting fresh grilled crab/shrimp/mussel dishes that you have to roll up your sleaves and get dirty to enjoy. The rest of the menu offers everything from chowder, salads, charcuterie, pasta, grilled fish and steaks. Overall, the quality ranges from B- to B+. 

VALUE: you are paying for the location, view and experience. Great place to bring guests, but can find probably better quality food for much less nearby.
author: Nash R.

description: Stephanie Etienne, the GM, accommodated us during a busy 4th of July weekend when no other restaurant would accept a party of 40. I was in a panic trying to find a water front crab house that was quintessential San Francisco to wow our out of town guests. Thank goodness for Stephanie. When the day arrived, the staff was prepared, the tables were arranged and all we had to do was enjoy ourselves. Our wedding guests were completely full and happy. We kept their choices to the Prix Fixe menu to manage our costs, since my now husband and I were picking up the tab. I was a bit concerned about the portions but the Franciscan doesn't skimp on professionalism or portions. It was more than enough food. I always wanted a crab house pre-wedding brunch and the Franciscan Crab House made my dream come true.
author: Minerva S.

description: Came here for the first time while a friend was in town, had to show him true California seafood. He got the whole crab and said it was very good. I just got a cup of the clam chowder which was very good. They have pretty good drinks but the best part was the view! Right on the water. I recommend grabbing one of the outside ones on the patio if it's not too cold but inside they have huge windows so it's not bad either!
author: Brittany A.

description:
To start off ... Beautiful venue and view of the San Francisco Bay from above at the Fishermans Wharf, especially during sunset. My family and I took a cruise of the bay and topped off the evening with a pleasant, refreshing dinner! 

Very busy and vibrant dining venue. Expensive meal, but you reap the benefits by the taste and in the tummy ;) 

Service is very pleasant. The waiters are mannerful and enthusiastic ... They checked on our table several times, clearing out the plates expeditiously as well. The waiter even gave us a complementary ice cream :) Way to sweeten my palate and heart! 

Now to the main course. I recommend the prix fixe menu to get a comprehensive taste of the place. I ordered the clam chowder, crab Alfredo pasta, and vanilla ice cream for dessert. My family ordered a host of other dishes, including the whole crabs, which are a must try! The legs are full of tender meat. The pasta dish I had was the perfect portion, very scrumptious cream sauce with a small amount of crab meat. Many other options to try as part of the entree ... Now go and explore at the Franciscan Crab restaurant for a fine seafood dining experience!
author: Connie Y.

description:
Spectacular ambiance, fantastic food....service....meh....

I have been frequenting this classic restaurant off and on since childhood; so when my parents and brother just randomly happened to all be free one day, we decided to take a nice little ferry ride over to the city....just like old times...ahhh..

Having visited the famous, touristy infested piers of San Francisco over a million times, you can imagine I wasn't necessarily ecstatic about walking within stampedes of people this day;along with not to mention, the new population of people being deeply engrossed with playing poki man...ugh....but, finally making our way to this dinner destination, made it a little worth while.

Touristy spot or not, I just LOVE the ambiance of this restaurant - Floor to ceiling windows providing open views of the ocean, along with that classic, upper scale 1940's/50's atmosphere..just love it.  

My father is in a wheelchair, so our table choices were a little more minimal; we did however end up getting a nice booth table within the bar area providing those breathtaking views. Service lacked immense attentiveness from the very start. First, after bringing us our menus, he walks away with not even asking if we may, just want something to drink??? We then have to notion someone down that we need our server so we can get started with some drinks. My brother and I, had bloody mary's.  My mother had water and my dad had a coke. And, after he/our server, took our drink orders, we were just about to inquire about something on the menu when he just walks away...really? He finally brought our drinks over which might I say, the Bloody Marys looked stunning! But, he forgot straws?? ugh...then he comes back several minutes later to bring us straws...and mind you, the whole time he has a very impatient, ( not server) little attitude. He was then gone for a while after we had perused our menus to decide what we would be ordering....did he forget he was supposed to then take our orders??? We then had to notion down another nice server ( who I wish was ours) that we would like to order...lmao...he even laughed a bit noticing how frustrated we must be with him. He then comes over and we began to proceed ordering. I was asking him about the " Basa" fish they had for I thought it looked good; I asked him how the fish was/ what kind ect....He said " I don't know"... me " Um, ok, could you possible find out a little more about it before I potentially order it? He then says " Yes, I apologize, I'm new" Ok, I think that fine, but please be a little more apologetic and sincere about it. Anyways, he managed to get some more info about it. We then placed our orders. My mom and I got the basa fish. You can choose what kind of seasoning/sauce to have your fish cooked in - we both chose the garlic butter way. It also comes with potato's and veggies, we both just subed for extra veggies instead. My father and brother got the Halibut. 

While waiting for our food to arrive, I sat back, took in the views, conversed with my little family- all while sipping on my EXCELLENT tasting bloody Mary. Both my brother and I agreed, it was stellar. Food then arrived also looking fantastic. After receiving our food, we had requested some more butter for the bread (that they did not deliver tell just before our dinner arrived)...smh. As well as some napkins and a fork my father needed to you know, eat....minutes passed and he never brought it....had to notion once again, to another server that we needed our server. He finally brought what we needed. Now everyone found their food to taste fantastic, I also thoroughly enjoyed my fish and found everything to be seasoned and cooked wonderfully, however, hating to go back to our " Server", not once did he ever come back to check up on us to see if everything was ok; and after needing some refills on drinks, with our server not being around, yet again, we had to hunt down the same server before, to get our " Server" who was mia and to only to find out he had went on his break....really? You go on a break without letting your customers know?? And at least not letting us know another server will be assisting us while you are on your " break" needless to say, we were all quite agitated by this point ; which lead us to requesting the manager. 

The manager then came over and was extremely professional and understanding after sharing our disappointing experience. She sincerely apologized and agreed he could probably use some improvement;And to accommodate us, she comped all of our drinks. We had a couple Bloody Mary's as well as other drinks that were pricey, so I greatly appreciated that...she also asked if we wanted a dessert, but we were all quite full at this point. 

Aside from the lack of service from our one server, we found everyone else to be pleasant and accommodating; and with the stellar views and decent food, I will probably continue to make frequent visits in the future - hopefully that "Server " will be gone :)
author: Shannon H.

description:
Another late post.. But necessary. 
Visit: Last Saturday night

I hate it when I'm stuck in an area and my only option is a tourist spot. For whatever reason - I can't get enough of the views of Alcatraz and the Bay Bridge either.... which helps make the food here good enough. The price is obviously made for tourist . But if I can get a window seat with the view, a half way decent service with the good enough food - it's whatever. 
But just to explain a half way decent service - the waitress was very mediocre. It just feels like she hates her job. And can't wait to leave. Or she's on her way out and don't give a 'beep'. I feel sorry for the tourists looking for the awesome SF food experience and was serviced or will be serviced by her. For me it's whatever - I don't need a long drawn out conversation or the SF experience. I'm stuck and I just need to eat. 
The mussels and salad were good enough... Then she brings out a bowl of cold crab chowder. We asked her to get us one that is actually hot. It took her nearly 15 minutes to bring us the same bowl and told us it should be hotter because she mixed in the crab and microwaved it. Wait! WTF?!?! You did what? 
I'm working really hard on not getting myself stuck around this joint! Lol.
author: K. S.

description: Friendly hosts and wait staff. Server was very attentive and food came out quickly. Crab fondue was great as an appetizer and crab alfredo was good as well.
author: Ariel B.

description: The Franciscan is one of those iconic San Francisco restaurants that you always pass when you're down by the Wharf, and this time, we actually booked ahead and had a meal.  It was about 4pm on a Saturday, and for whatever reason, the crowd down by Fisherman's Wharf was incredibly heavy - even for a Saturday.  We had just biked the Golden Gate, so we were pretty worn out.  Let's just all agree that the seafood you'll get here will almost always be an incredible experience, and it will be different from any local seafood restaurant that you'll visit back home, wherever you're visiting from.  For me, the only minor disappointment was the "cattle drive" nature of the whole experience.  Due to crowd and noise levels, and just due to the popularity of this place and where it's located, you feel a little bit like you're part of a huge "machine" that brings people in and then shows them the door each day, by the thousands.  These days, I'm more into the intimate settings, where each menu item is carefully crafted by a chef who cares about each individual patron.  You won't get that here - it's just too high-volume.  But, you can't beat the location, the view, and the selection of seafood items on the menu.
author: Tom B.

description: My daughter and I were visiting San Francisco and stumbled on this place. I'm glad we did because I had an awesome view. I got the steak, shrimp, and salad and it was fantastic. My daughter split everything with me and she also enjoyed it. I don't think it's the typical place you were bringing a kid, so if you got children with you you might want to go somewhere else.  The food was pretty good, but nothing that I'll go out of my way to come back for. The ambience was awesome, and if you're looking for a cool place with a good view in San Francisco and you love some seafood, you should definitely check this place out.
author: Ben B.

description: Crowded, noisy, mediocre food.  I went here with my family on a busy evening around Christmas.  We had a reservation and had to wait ~30 minutes because they were swamped.  Was this the first Christmas season they were open?  My shrimp were not good.  The rest of the food looked just OK.  I won't go back.  Leave it for the tourists.  I'll make sure we go to SCOMA's next time we want an old seafood restaurant in SF.  There is so much good food in the city.  I won't return to this place.
author: S R.

description: From appetizers to main course the food is a feast for the belly while the views are a feast for the eyes!
author: Amarita S.

description:
Visited this place in at the end of May 2016 with my husband and our 3 kids for dinner.

Ordered the following and the total with tip was about $130:
-Double crab and double shrimp for 2
-2 kids fettuccine alfredo
-Chicken and chips

Pros:
-They do OpenTable reservations, helpful when visiting during busy dinner/lunch times
-Great view of Alcatraz
-Presentation of crab and shrimp on the skillet - great!

Cons:
-Wait staff wasn't very quick with anything
-I'm pretty sure we were supposed to get bread with our meals, but it never came
-The chicken in my meal was very dry as were the "chips"

I do not think we will give this place another try.
author: Dawn S.

description:
Beautiful ambiance 
You're surrounded by very chic decor and the star is constantly running around attending to hungry patrons.
I made a reservation for my family and myself an were promptly seated despite being 10 min late. 
We got 
2lb crabs
  - super buttery and well seasoned. 
  - waiter cuts the carb into manageable sized. pieces 
Shrimp and mussel combo (Medium) / (comes w butter bowl)
  - shrimp were pump and medium sized
  - mussels were all cooked well and plump
Clam chowder in bread bowl
  - hearty but refreshing 
Seafood soup (Medium)
  - lots of crab meat and very hearty 

(All the dishes names are listed in the photos and videos posted)

I feel like the chef helpers were more prompt than our waiter since we kind of lost our waiter admits the crowd but a chef assistant person was always near by.

The food was brought out all at once besides the crabs which came out first. They were giant! 
The tables are a bit small if you order more than 2 entrees so be careful.

I'll definitely come here to try their cocktails and watch the sunset.
author: Sun K.

description: We had a lovely dinner and I really enjoyed the patio though chilly, heater worked great and I requested patio seating. Enjoyed the view and my tender short rib dinner! My fiancé had the salmon in Cioppino sauce with Israeli couscous. The salmon was flaky and the sauce was tasty, would have liked to have a bit of spice and a bit more flavor in the spice but the salmon really tied it together nicely. The beer we ordered was the local made in Berkeley and it was very tasty. Wish I had taken pictures to post on this but my phone died! I definitely recommend:)
author: Kar L.

description: 3.5.  I only head to the wharf about 3 times a year, but I like the Franciscan and eat there once a year.  Crab is some of the best in the city and the clam chowder is solid.  I also think their spicy seafood pasta is excellent. Can't beat the view either.  We usually go for lunch at somepoint every year.  Great place for  a 2 martini lunch and crab.
author: Bryan V.

description: If you love seafood and you happen to be visiting Fisherman's Wharf, try this place out. I've never had any bad experiences with any of the dishes I have tried here. Is it on the pricier side? Yes. But if you are a tourist and what to have the San Francisco tourist experience, then splurge here for a meal. You can go to other less touristy areas later on to get your chowder or crab fix. Come for the views.
author: Crissy C.

description:
If you are near by I highly recommend you to go to Franciscan Crab Restaurant.
The place is really cool with an amazing views, the service is excellent, prices reasonable and the food is really tasty, probably one of the best seafood in San Francisco.
author: Isaac L.

description: Last Sunday my family and I had dinner at this restaurant. They sat us by the window and the view was fantastic! We sat across Alcatraz on the bay. Jacob, our server, and others gave excellent service and made our meal memorable. The food was delicious! The fish and chips was the best we ever had. The fish was so fresh one did not need to add lemon or tartar sauce. I can't stop thinking about the Italian Sundae. It was vanilla gelato with olive oil and sea salt. I know it sounds weird, but it was absolutely devine! I highly recommend it.
author: Sandra F.

description: One of the rare but awesome views of the Bay Area and live performances right outside! I highly recommend this restaurant. The food was pretty good could be a little bit more tastier on the clam chowder but the service is superb! The meal was ready super quick and it taste good and the music speaker outside was a little loud for the live performance that was going on but I asked the lady in the front to lower it and she was very kind about it and lowered the volume so we could all here! I highly recommend this place and would advise people to eat here for a view and a show!!
