author: Bryan G.

description:
I ate here for lunch.
There was a great view of the bay and it had nice art deco architecture.
I tried the lobster  bisque which was good.
And I tried the garlic crab in pieces which was good but messy to eat.
author: Funtime P.

description:
My friend and I came in to try this today. We ordered the crab cakes, regular skillet mussels, and crab chowder. 

The crab cakes were very good. The mussels were way over cooked and tasteless. I couldn't eat the rest of it. The mussels were so overcooked that when I went to pry open one of the shells, the shell broke into pieces. The crab chowder was mediocre, it wasn't a creamy soup, it was very chunky and the soup was served barely warm.

The view is awesome, food is mediocre for it's price but the staff if very attentive!
author: Jess Z.

description: Food was good. Crab worth evey penny. the butter garlic sauce was heaven. view is perfect. Make reservations if you want a window seat. Wait staff nice
author: K M.

description:
My family and I went to the wharf on the hunt for some great seafood for a decent price. Most of the prices we looked at for the crab, it was at least 30$ a pound, but they were selling them for a pound and a half.. Finally we reached this restaurant and found it reasonable for two people to share an order of around 15 huge crab legs. It was still expensive of course, but hey!!! I love seafood..

The host seated us to our table right away and we had a beautiful and gorgeous view of the bay with alcatraz sitting right in the middle. I absolutely loved the view from this restaurant and it had a romantic kind of vibe and I am a sucker for those kinds of things. Great service from the waiter, he was very attentive and CUTE. I wish I remembered his name, but he was on top of things and gave us a lot of advice about the menu, which I found very helpful. I am definitely coming back to this place when I head back up to NorCal.
author: Jeanneen M.

description: Pricey but good food. You have to be a true seafood lover to appreciate the price you will pay.
author: Vidya K.

description: Sourdough bread was overly dry and not fresh. The crab and shrimp was reheated and not cooked to order. All of the food was drowning in butter and garlic.  Go down the street to Fog Harbor Fish House for some good food.
author: Jeremy L.

description: The food and service was great, I come here several times a year. I would have rated it 4 stars except we asked the hostess for a window seat facing pier 39 and was told we couldn't since we were a party of 4 and the table was a 5-person. It was 11:30 at opening only 4 tables filled at that point. Disappointing that the there seems to be lack of understanding that we pay the high prices for the ambience and experience.
author: Kcammee v.

description: Awesome place. Amazing food and service! Their shrimp and crab skillet is sooo good, a must try. It's juicy, buttery, and flavorful. Definitely a great place to have food, have a drink and enjoy the view!
author: Charlotte G.

description: Amazing food. My family had the Fish & Chips, Crab sliders and the Shrimp & Mussels skillet. The crab sliders were okay. Everything else was perfect!
author: S J.

description: This is usually our favorite Fisherman's Wharf restaurant because of location and service and great food.   Nice old fashion ambiance.  However, I felt that food quality is slipping and portions ok.  Husband had the fish and chips and potatoes and mixed vegetables were almost "cold".  I had crab enchiladas and it was a bit salty.  The short rib entree for 32.00 was skimpy.  Shrimp in garlic butter was good.  The clam chowder which is usually excellent was also a bit salty.   Maybe the kitchen had an off day as I never saw the restaurant so empty but, it was Dec. 20th and maybe a lot of people were shopping.  But, the service quality from hostess to our server remained superb.
author: Maeley T.

description:
This restaurant is a nice venue for first time visitors to the Fisherman's Wharf area. Located right on the pier, you have an excellent view of the bay in addition to Alcatraz and Angel Island. The restaurant provides you with binoculars at no charge in order to do some sight-seeing while you wait.

The customer service is very prompt and timely during different periods of the ordering process and check up. I ordered a calimari appetizer for two and a large mussel and shrimp entree that is good enough to split among two people. Prior to the appetizer being served, there is bread served.

The dessert menu was so-so. The server had the dessert choices on a white laminated card that only mentioned a couple of ice cream and cake choices, as well as others that I wasn't familiar with. I didn't order the dessert at this time yet from the pictures on the laminated card, they seemed appealing despite being limited in choices.

Nonetheless, this restaurant is an excellent dining choice amid many other choices in the Fisherman's Wharf area. I'll certainly be back.
author: Eric T.

description:
People get this place and the fishwich spot which is down below mixed up. 

With that said, this is a pretty good touristy spot on the wharf with a really nice view of the bay.

There are black and white photos all over the place that gives it a home-y feeling and the color scheme makes it feel like an upscale diner. The waiters outfits looks like they could be working in a lab because their coats are so long. You can sit outside on the deck but it was too cold. 

We were seated in a booth, which faced the bay and their windows were from floor to ceiling so you could really see everything. 

I was really craving fries so we ordered a side of fries, crab and a pasta dish that resembled a lot like rice but wasn't.

The fries were really really good and I am very particular with my fries! Acine de Pepe was the dish that looked like rice. It was almost inedible because there was a lot of oil and left as slimy feeling in your mouth. If they weren't so heavy handed with the oil it would have been good because the flavors were really good.

As for the crab, it was cooked well and the sauce that they cook it in was well seasoned. I enjoy crab but it's such a hassle to get the meat out.

This place is one of the better restaurants on the wharf.
author: Jerrica N.

description: BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!!!The food also is not worth the price!!!!Be sure to be well dressed so you won't be discriminated and the servers will serve you nicely....
author: Jessica S.

description: This is located in the heart of Fishermen's Wharf. There is a parking lot conveniently located adjacent to the restaurant. If you dine here, make sure you get the parking validation which gives you 3 hours free. The restaurant seems a little dated but it's pretty clean. There are windows all around so the view is great during the day. The service is very good. I had a cup of crab chowder for starters. For my entree, I tried the mussels, shrimp, crab combo which is served on a hot skillet. It doesn't include any sides.  If you're not really hungry, the combo is probably enough to share for two.  The soup and the entree were both excellent. I will definitely go back next time I'm in town.
author: Morris N.

description:
We were already iffy abut going here because of the outrageous prices, but decided to give it a try anyways. 

Service: Our hostess was nice, she walked up to greet us so we didn't have to walk down to the hostess desk (we had a stroller). She seated us promptly. Our waitress was friendly, but we had little contact with her besides when we ordered and when we left. The busboy(man?) was very efficient, clearly away plates as soon as we were done, filling our water, etc. 

Food: Now here is why I gave the low rating. Between the 5 of us, 2 clam chowders, 4 pastas and a 2 person crab dish. 2 of those pastas were way over salted, and the crab was overcooked. The ice cream dessert we had with our meal tasted like store bought ice cream, nothing special. 

The views are gorgeous here though, but I don't think I would return because it is just too expensive for too salty food.
author: Melissa O.

description:
Incredibly overpriced for the quality of the food. The serving staff is friendly enough but they are just not efficient. The house salad at $10.95 was tasteless and soggy. They offer the prepared fish several ways but my companion and I could not tell the difference between the two as they were both equally bland. A $40 cut of filet was decimated. It was so dry it may as well have been beef filet jerky. 

For the kids my son ordered fried chicken but rather than a juicy drum leg, they brought him tasteless dry chicken fingers, well, fingers without meat - so pinkies? And lastly, I ordered drinks for my kids but rather than bring a kid or normal size drink, they brought a huge drink that they ended up charging me $4.50 for, as was my cup of bagged green tea. 

I would say bag this place. Over $200 later- I desperately wish I would have went to Joe's Crab Shack across the street.
author: Joanne E.

description:
This was one of my favorite meals that I had here in San Francisco. We started off with the shrimp cocktail, calamari, and the salmon & crab meat. Calamari had a fair amount of breading, shrimp were large and the salmon appetizer was excellent (although I preferred eating the crab separate from the salmon bread)

For my entree, my uncle and I split the crab and mussels. The crab poop has an amazing taste to it. After you pick your meat out, definitely re-dip in the sauce. It was so good that I even used my bread to dip into the sauce.

The smoothie was okay. It was a little bit watery and needed a little bit more sugar. That would make it perfect. 

This restaurant has a beautiful view of the bay, and the service is spectacular.
author: Phi N.

description: So, we're in San Francisco for the night and wanted to find an iconic place to eat dinner down at the pier. We decided to try the Franciscan Crab Restaurant. We showed up after 8pm on a Friday night and we were seated right away. We got to see the sunset, Alcatraz and an amazing view of the wharf. But that was completely overshadowed by the service and the food. Our server was great, he understood that 9 year olds won't wait very long for their food and that mom and dad might want to ponder the menu. But seriously the oysters were amazing, so fresh and sweet. The roasted crab and clam linguine were amazing! On a side note, my daughter ordered off the 'kiddie' menu(which is usually terrible, bland food that panders to a child's comfort zone) the dish she got was a fairly sophisticated linguine in a cheese sauce. Thanks for making our night a treasured family memory.
author: Rita C.

description: Nothing special really. We had the Dungeness crabs and their signature sauce overwhelms the crash meat. Anyone visiting Fisherman's Wharf would be better served sticking to the street venders. We wasted a lot of money here as it is very pricey but not good. The crab chowder was bland too and my son only took two bites.
author: RodneyandPatty A.

description: Overpriced and less then ordinary. Service was sub par and the food was horrible for the price. Clam chowder tasted like potato soup. I would never come back.
author: Lauren T.

description:
This is pretty much a bar-only review as we just had drinks.  But I've been here in the past and the food was quite good and we had a nice time.  Sure, it's a bit pricey but you're paying for your view and the location AND the really good seafood.  And you're a tourist, so suck it up.

Went on a recent weekend and just had a couple of drinks at the bar while we cooled off a bit and perused the menu for fun, because we'd recently eaten.  The bartender was super nice and they were very attentive, the view was gorgeous and we had a nice time.  Sure there are cheaper places to drink.  But we were tourists, and we knew it would be that way, and we sucked it up.

I recalled our past dining experience and we renewed a vow to come back to this place for dinner next time we're in SF.  I definitely want to try the crab fondue appetizer!  And the mixed seafood roasts are on point, so we'll do that.  See you soon, I hope, Franciscan Crab!
author: Ann A.

description: We made reservations for 8:00PM we are sitting here with the square alert device and it is 8:34. Do not accept reservations if you can not honor them. I am irate. Will not come back to this place.
author: Daniel F.

description: From the weakest martini my wife has ever had, to the overly priced crab sliders, I'd recommend stay far away and get food from a street vendor.  The potatoes and olives served with the sliders where horribly over cooked, the sliders themselves are supposed to have pepperoncini but instead have jalapenos. The crab legs are good, hence the one star.  Want refills on water, bring your own bottle.  Want bread, you have to ask, oh and it's rock hard because it has been sitting out all day. Horrible place for dinner, eat at Joe's,  trust me you'd be better off.
author: Mark G.

description:
In spite of the touristy feel, Franciscan Crab Restaurant delivers as far as good food is concerned.  The views are unbeatable while the crowds are unbearable.  We were lucky enough to have a nice booth facing the bay as the sun set on San Francisco.

The crabs are amazing and nicely seasoned without being obnoxiously salty.  My wife had a good time tearing apart a two-pound beast.  I decided on the fish and chips.  Well-prepared and deliciously fried, it was a fun take on the British classic.  The "chips" were a bit overdone perhaps from sitting under a warming light a bit too long.  But the fish delivered on flavor and preparation.  The menu is schizophrenic and runs all over the place.  There are crabs, which I recommend, and Italian pastas, steaks and other items from all over the map.

The service was prompt.  In fact, we were shocked at the speed in which our entrees were delivered to the table.  We never had to ask for water and the wine glasses never ran low.

The prices are steep.  If it were not such a task to get a decent table, this place would easily be a four-star establishment.  But stick to the crab for a better experience here.
author: John L.

description: Waiter wouldn't let us change our order 10 seconds after we ordered. Clam chowder tasted like it had been frozen. Over priced and touristy. SO many other good places in SF, stay clear of pier 39.
author: Lisa S.

description: So not worth the price. The food wasn't good and the service was lame. Maybe our food would have been better if it had been seafood, definitely a tourist trap!
author: Cauleen D.

description: Amazing Lunch ... Great service ...... amazing views from the terrace facing the Bay Bridge with handsome juggling act , Kevin pier side ... Ask for Carlos ....best service ever ......don't let anyone tell you Fishermans Wharf is just tourists..... worth the visit ......
author: Stephan B.

description: Dirty plates and silverware, unfriendly service, overpriced rubbery halibut. Made my wife very sick. Not reccomended.  Great view!
author: Billy R.

description: I drove an hour just to come here because I really wanted to eat clam chowder with a nice view as I ate instead of the regular type. I was so dissapointed because they said I couldn't sit by the big window since I was only one person. I asked why not and they just said they need to save it for a bigger party. It was a Thursday. Not a busy time and there was a lot of other seating available. I pleaded with the waiter to let me sit there and he said he would ask. Came back and said they had reservations for those tables. Lies. I gave in and ordered my clam chowder bread bowl. Asked the couple that had just gotten to the table I wanted if they had reservations. They said no they just got there. That was unfair. Paid $15 for my soup which wasn't that special sadly, you can get a better one right around  there for 6.50  and they didn't want to  validate my parking for some reason. They really suck for that cuz I was polite throughout
author: Elena P.

description: This place is terrible. Even our $13 cocktails were disgusting. I had the crab enchiladas and they were bland, my wife had chicken and chips they were dry and over cooked. I had to choke down my beverage because I paid 13 dollars for it. Save your money. Don't eat here. The service wasn't great either
author: Jamie Lynn M.

description: Good dinner for our first night with our kids in San Francisco.  They have a good variety of foods, drinks, and desserts. Service was prompt. Dinner and the view was nice!
author: Laurie B.

description:
Was really disappointed in the crab. It was fried in grease  never saw that before. We ordered a plate of crab like whole pieces we thought would be fresh and it came like fajitas sizzling in grease on a wrought iron skillet. Was terrible. 

Besides that the place is shabby dirty. Very filthy bathrooms. Like a highway stop over diner. 

Would not recommend.
author: Jon D.

description: Very disappointed... seafood is not fresh expensive for  nothing! Clam chowder with minimal to no clam!  tourist ripoff place! Not recommended!
author: Candace M.

description: The food was good. I hAd went with a party of six and all of us enjoyed the food. The wait time for when we were served water and drinks was about 20 minutes. The wait time for entrees didn't take that long. Dessert was quite a wait but it was busy on a Saturday night. The Birthday chocolate mouse cake they gave the birthday person was good. The custard ice cream, crab alfredo, clam chowder, bread, and shrimp was delicious.
author: Latasha M.

description:
Totally overpriced and the food left a lot to be desired. Best thing was the bread they served while we were waiting.

Ordered the calamari, which was okay. Also ordered the dungeoness crab fondue which was watery. Asked the waiter about it and he stated that it's supposed to be like that. I inquired about fondue being watery but he brushed me off.

I then ordered the crab enchiladas, which were okay. Weren't really seasoned inside just stuffed with lump crab and romaine lettuce. 

We also got an order of Bay shrimp and chips. The shrimp were okay but the potatoes were great! 

Will give it 2 stars because the waiter took the fondue off the bill without me asking.
author: Courtney C.

description: Below average service, food is ok. They also charge 0.92 cents for tap water inspite of a $55.00 food purchase while you sit down and eat. Their fish when you order fish and chips is nice and crisp, but the fish sandwich was soggy with the coleslaw. Clam chowder was puréed potatoes more than clam chowder, with few and far between pieces of clam. Over all, not that great of an experience and I wouldn't go again, and the water charge was a big turn off!!
author: Anu B.

description:
Ordered: Braised Short Rib Plate, Clam Chowder Cup, Combo Sizzling Platter. 

Braised short ribs - comes with mash potatoes and steamed veggies. Good flavors, tender , sides are average . Nothing special. Def not worth what it cost. 

Clam Chowder- really good chowder here. Although it's $9 for a small cup (you get a better deal on the wharf.) 

Combo Sizzling Platter - half a crab, 12 shrimps, 12 mussels. Mussels were over cooked, but had an okay flavor. The wine sauce they pour on top really helped that flavor though. Shrimps were so greasy, I had oil dripping down my hands while holding it. Crab , omg it seemed like it was cooked ahead of time then fried before it was placed on the platter. I'm sorry it was so bland and flavorless. 

In total we paid $102.50 for those 3 things ... If you're like me and use to your seafood super flavorful don't go here. 

They do give free bread but it's stale. The service was cocky too , thank goodness it was busy so we didn't have to see how cocky and judging he was with us. The Bay Area is my home and pier 39/fishermans wharf is my place to go for seafood and touristy stuff but I can probably say I'll never be back here.
author: Trinity N.

description: We spent a rainy afternoon at the pier and stopped in here to warm up and enjoy a meal. Nice views and tasty food. A bit overpriced and definitely a tourist's stop. The fish n' chips were crispy, light and delicious. Although they portion size was HUGE.  My husband enjoyed a bowl of warm crab chowder and a beer.  Our server was training, but she did well. If we find ourselves up in San Francisco and sightseeing around Fisherman's Warf, I would definitely go back.
author: Cori K.

description:
I usually lower my expectations to restaurants at touristy locations, so also for Franciscan Crab restaurant, located at Fisherman's Wharf. Luckily I allow others to make reservations now and then, and that's how I ended up at Franciscan. 

We had reservations for 6, but ended up being 11. The restaurant is huge and they quickly accommodated us all. They also kept track on all our bookings and we did not have to wait long before the dishes were served. 

I had oysters, fresh and delicious, yellowtail carpaccio (another treat that melted in the mouth) and Crab Alfredo pasta, which reminded me of fish au gratin. 

We had reservations for late night dinner, but during day hours you will have a wonderful seaview. The premises was a huge diner, which is not my favourite, and it was a bit cold. However, the service was nice and efficient and all in all it was a very good experience.
author: Hildegunn N.

description: You would think this restaurant has never been open on Christmas before today. Despite having a reservation for 4 at 7:30pm, we were not seated until after 8:30pm. When we inquired about the lengthy wait, we were told they just got behind as patrons took longer than expected. The problem with that excuse is that this IS their business. You pay restaurants to provide good, safe food AND an experience and ambiance. They should be professional in all facets of their business and this includes scheduling appropriately. I recommend doing business with establishments that show better respect for their customers, and this doesn't come close to meeting even the lowest imaginable standard.
author: Kurt M.

description: Proportions are a rip off.. Ceilings are dirty.. Bathrooms nasty.. And the food was gross... 30$ for a half crab. And it was a skinny crab.. Place off the bay should have healthy crab portions..  When our water was topped off it was warm. With no ice.. Gross place.. . probably has roaches in thier kitchen... Deserves 0 stars
author: Rico D.

description: I never leave a visit to San Fran without a stop to the Franciscan. The service has always been just as lovely as the food. Obviously, you're at the Wharf so you're getting the freshest of everything but the chefs take on these fresh dishes are where they knock it out of the park. Yes, it may be touristy but you're in a tourist area so some things such as higher price points just come along with the territory.  There is something on the menu for anyone and everyone, the portions are huge, and they start you off with a fresh sourdough baguette so bring your appetite. Not to mention you get one of the best views you could ask for during a dining experience. I recommend the Franciscan to anyone and know I will definitely be returning on my next trip to the Golden State.
author: Shalyn B.

description: What a wonderful historic location. An establishment known by the Hollywood in crowd. Great seating in just about any seat. We got a table as soon as we came in. The food was spectacular and fast. Sea food just the way you would imagined it should be. Will need to keep coming back just to try all the different meals they have to offer! Highly recommend for any reason.
author: Mike W.

description:
Great view of the wharf and the architect of the place makes it look almost Jetson-like with its curvy space-ship design. The space is pretty big.

4 of us go a table by the window and we proceeded to order everything crab. Got to say, it was all good, but not sure if you can do steamed crab wrong. We shared a decent bottle of white and the price was excellent (in other words, not wallet-breaking).

I think as a tourist, once you hit one crab restaurant along the wharf, you've tried them all. Wouldn't come back here though as there are so many other restaurants to try. However, had a great time here. Food and service was great.
author: Charlotte W.

description: I had to book a seafood restaurant for family visiting the area and settled on Franciscan. Honestly I had low expectations considering it is in a very touristy area. However I was pleasantly surprised . First the restaurant really has a beautiful view on the water. Second the food is actually quite good. The fried calamari appetizer comes in a big plate, the cioppino was tasty, and the mussels were fresh and flavorful. Overall it wasn't the most inventive or delicious food ever, but it was good, fresh, well executed seafood with a beautiful view and that's why you go. Service was friendly. The only downside to me is that they put our party of 6 at a table that for me should really be for four, and they weren't even full.
author: Helene P.

description: Thank you Jose C. Manager for replying to my review. I am surprised you have time to respond and make comments.  :-) Not many mangers from my experience does that, so thumbs up on actively continuing to improve customer service and restaurant staff. Sure you can save my photos for future use. I like your glass fish decorations above the restroom entrance. Overall in my observation and the feel of your restaurant, I feel it is a good place to take out of town guests to inorder to give them a taste of what it must be like to be like those people in black and white photos being social and enjoying their dining experience and views of lovely history San Francisco!
author: Priscilla L.

description:
Took a ferry Oakland, CA to Pier 41. Saw this restaurant many times and finally decided to try it out. The items are expensive--small plates run from $15-$24 apiece. The entrée had choices from burgers, sizzling seafood platters, to pasta. First off, the waiter was good. He was attentive and quick. We were seated quickly. 

Secondly, food--I had the pre-fix $39 meal with clam chowder, salmon with a slight variation of a cioppino sauce, and the ice cream. The bread was extremely hard to break apart so it wasn't a favorite. It could be because it was stale--I don't know but I would think having bread out in the open for awhile would cause the outside to get harder than it should be. The chowder was good--outstanding? No, I've had better walking along the pier. The salmon was delicious--perfectly cooked but the sauce was a bit salty. 

Now the dessert --what a disappointment for this quite expensive meal! I've had pre-fixed meals that were not as expensive but the dessert was delicious. But not here. We were served vanilla ice cream in a small water CUP! Nothing grand about it. I stopped eating it after my friend found a chunk of frozen water in her ice cream. Yuck! For such a fancy restaurant they mislead customers about the fancy "custard" vanilla ice cream that was reminiscent of a generic grocery store type of ice cream that can be found in a plastic ice cream container. 

Would I come back? Maybe but not to order the pre-fix items or dessert. Would I recommend it? Maybe if there weren't other restaurants around.
author: Nancy V.

description: So I came to Fisherman's Wharf and stop for shrimp and chips!  I think they confused the shrimp for Mrs. paul's. Not that I have anything against Mrs. Pauls but I could have gone to the frozen section at my supermarket and got the same thing.  Overbreaded and no taste. I hope their other items are better.
author: Maria G.

description:
The best crab Louie that I have EVER had. Pricey but worth it!
Friendly services, beautiful restaurant - if you are looking for a San Francisco experience, I definitely recommend this Jen.
author: Shari T.

description: Great place for seafood in San Francisco. Everything we had was good. Highly recommend if youre in town.
author: Darrell P.

description: Beautiful view, elegant service, wonderful food!  What more can you ask?  We loved the crab sandwich, roasted vegetables and lovely shrimp cocktail.  I loved our lunch there after our harbor tour.
author: Susan C.

description: Wow. I was so amazed with this restaurant.  So we came to SF for 5 nights, and we knew that Fisherman's Wharf was going to be a total tourist trap.  We tried some other places that were complete crap like the Crab House at Pier 39. On Thanksgiving, we didn't have any plans, so we happened to walk by this place and do a walk-in, and there is no bad seat in this restaurant.  We sat it one of the booths that faced out towards the water, and we could see Alcatraz, birds, seals.  It was so great. I really thought we'd be moved somewhere in the back next to the bathroom and overhearing conversations about how much people hate their job on Thanksgiving day, but no, it was awesome. The food was delicious too. Our favorite was the crab enchilada. The only thing I didn't like was the crab soup because it tasted generic like it was microwaved/packaged, but other than that, the best restaurant we went to in SF.
author: Captain C.

description: We had a great experience here. Service was very fast, view was so lovely, very close view of Alcatraz and rhe Golden Gate Bridge wayyyy in the distance. My clam chowder in a bread bowl was delish, and my husband and kids fish and "chips" (roasted potatoes and veggies) were a big hit. Yes, it a little overpriced, like most everything in that area. Our bill was $77 for four people, no drinks or desserts. We had an awesome meal though with an amazing view.
author: Jill B.

description:
Noisy and way overpriced.  We were told this was the quintessential San Francisco restaurant. What a disappointment! The calamari was super salty and the "secret sauce" on the crab was disgusting. Some of the worst crab I've had in my life and I paid $50 for the crab alone- no bread, nothing. 
Skip this and find a better seafood restaurant!
author: Kris F.

description: My first choice would've been Crustacean's, but they weren't open for lunch. While the chowders were still good, the crab was a big disappointment. It was dry with no flavor. For the price they charge I think the other street food on the Wharf would've been better.
author: Bala V.

description: Great seafood. My hubby had crab legs and I had the crab fettuccine, delicious. Wait staff was attentive, view was spectacular and ambiance beautiful- very old Hollywood glam meets the wharf.
author: J K.

description: Traveling from the airport to another location, we decided to stop in San Francisco and look for seafood. This was a good choice. The downstairs part is take out and we were looking for more of a fine dining experience. We went upstairs to the dining room and had a great meal. The view of the bay and Alcatraz was spectacular. Our wait staff was terrific, friendly and knowledgeable, and helped us choose a great meal. I had the halibut with butter and capers and oysters on the half shell. The restaurant validates two hours of parking, so parking was free. That's a big deal in San Francisco, lol.
author: Diana B.

description: Ambiance and location (on pier) is great. Food is served to appeal.  The taste leaves a lot to be desired. Bring your own seasoning salt.  I wish it had been better because I love seafood, so I left feeling slighted and as if my money had been wasted.  Next time, I know EXACTLY where I won't be eating.
author: Allison S.

description:
Visiting the Franciscan was one of my favorite restaurants I visited on my trip mainly because of the friendly staff and the relaxed positive atmosphere.
I sat at the bar with my mom and were greeted by  Ernesto, Raul, and Miguel, all busy but made it clear if we needed anything to let them know. They all took time to chat with everyone and just seemed as if they really enjoyed being there. They were friendly, helpful, and professional. They make a great mermarita as well!
I happen to be allergic to shellfish, I know why go to a crab restaurant, but I always find something on the menu. We ended up with the heirloom tomato bruschetta with the burrata (I think it's called ) it was phenomenal, my new favorite cheese! I also ordered the noodles off the kids menu, who doesn't like noodles with creamy cheese sauce. They made sure to go back and let the chef know I was allergic along with putting in the notes which I thought was very thoughtful. Prices were very fair and I thought the souvenir menu with the recipes is a great idea (I think it was $7). Everyone at the restaurant seemed to be enjoying their food and the service! I was a little bummed there were no more souvenir wine glasses so I will be back in a few months and hope to pick some up.
author: Brittany S.

description:
We had the fried calimari, clam chowder, and crab chowder in bread bowls, and everything was delicious and tasted so fresh! I have never had calimari so good, but that's probably because I come from a landlocked state that doesn't have the freshest seafood. 

The view of the bay was amazing, each table was equipped with binoculars so you can watch boat traffic and get a peak at Alcatraz.

Great service, delicious food, beautiful view!
author: Kassiah W.

description: This place was recommended by many, and it did not disappoint. The view can't get any better. Your literally facing the water and Alcatraz. The seafood was delicious! Everything was fresh as can be. The Dungeness crab is what they are known for, and it was out of this world. It's a bit pricey, but so worth it.  I also recommend the shrimp cocktail and the crab cakes.
author: Elina D.

description:
This place is pricy. It's on Pier 43.5 in Fisherman's Wharf. Expect the priciness.

We had a great server. She was really attentive and friendly. She checked on us regularly, tied my bib on me, helped my dungeness crab eating excursion begin, and kept the wet naps coming.

They serve you some dinner bread with butter. In addition, we ordered the calamari and the surf & turf. It was a whole dungeness crab as well as steamed vegetables and mashed potatoes with a short rib. It was $60, and I think it was worth it. The crab was already cleaned out, so it was really easy. It was buttery and tasted just divine. It was also fun to eat. I don't eat beef, but I was told that the meat was worth $25.

The one thing is, if you don't like crustaceans, don't go here. They basically look like they were plopped from the ocean to the pot. They still have their crab fur on their legs and shell. They are crawling at this place (see what I did there?). But, it seemed like everyone went there for the crab.

The decor is really tacky/vintage/charming with amazing views of the bay. It has floor to ceiling windows that span 3 sides of the restaurant. 

Oh, and did I mention that they also have heated patio seating?
author: Kira W.

description: Thourouly underwhelmed. The service was good. The food mediocre. The prices exorbitant.
author: David T.

description:
View is exceptional but the food was bland and ordinary. Nothing special and not worth the price tag. I had the spicy shrimp pasta and had to add salt and pepper, but it was still very bland and greasy. 
Doubt I would dine here again.
author: Paule B.

description: Horrible horrible experience! Was waiting 30 mins for our food. Wouldn't mind the wait if everyone else was waiting but the guy that sat behind us had received his food even when he wasn't sat until 10-15 minutes after us! Worse part was that I heard our waitress' conversation with the manager and she didn't put the ticket in. After having told us she checked on it multiple times. She then approached our table saying she was sorry she's having her manager check on the food for us and that she would be with us shortly to talk. No manager ever came to apologize. Soooooo unprofessional never again coming back to this place. We lost our appetite and ended up just leaving and going to a different restaurant which served us way quicker and was busier at the same time.
author: Andrea W.

description: *Visited the lower part of the restaurant* Overall, speedy service, friendly staff, and was really clean. I enjoyed the calamari and fries-good flavor. The gigantic fish sandwich didn't have much flavor at all (unless you put extra condiments on it) and the bread was longer than the fish itself.
author: Heather C.

description: This place is the best! I come to San Francisco once a year for work and my first stop after the plane lands is always The Franciscian!! Service is amazing, ask for Bianca! And the Cioppino is to die for! Thanks again for yet another amazing meal!!
author: Shannon M.

description: Spent 3 nights on the wharf in San Francisco and this place was great. The crab fondue is excellent. The setting is great with open views to the bay centering Alcatraz. The staff was nice and helpful.
author: Steve B.

description: The food is good and the view is great! A little touristy but still good seafood and service. Only two things to note: ice tea is crazy strong.... get a water to cut it with and the seafood plate where you pick the fish and sauce is good but has limited vegetables. All in all, would recommend.
author: Lee Ann K.

description: Very touristy. Very busy. But great view if you get a seat by the window. Of course, indulged in the crab. It had a fair taste but was expecting wow. Can't stay long very hectic and tad noisy. But a must do if you are a tourist. tick.
author: Paula M.

description: The delicious food and charming ambiance paired with a breathtaking view of the bay made for a perfect dinner with my girlfriend. The prices are reasonable given how good the food is. Our waiter Isaac and the rest of the staff that waited on us were friendly, attentive and professional, making for impeccable service. I would definitely recommend this to friends and family. You're missing out if you don't get the clam chowder, by the way.
author: Robby G.

description:
Other than the hostess, terrible service. None of the guys on the floor seem or had the attitude of wanting to be here working. Harsh on ordering. Slow on bringing the requested items. 
Not even the simplest dish, crab/clam chowder, was good. Potato based soup for crab/clam chowder?? Since when?! And who suggested this?! Other than the boring dirty view of the pier deck and Alcatraz.. Not a place for eats. No thank you. Never coming back again.
Try it for yourself.
author: Ray W.

description:
I mean, crab is in their name, but it was nowhere to be found in our "crab chowder." It was more of a potato soup with a few slivers of crab thrown in to prevent it from being a total lie.

The octopus carpaccio was OK, but not seasoned in any particularly interesting way. The oysters were OK, but not really worth it, and the garlic pasta was at least halfway decent.

All in all the setting is beautiful and the food is edible, but not really worth the premium price tag.
author: Sabrina R.

description:
Soooooo not only is this a crappy tourist spot that smells like burning oil and sounds like screaming children. In other words, NOT FIT FOR FOODIES. Gross

But also when we arrived for our reservation made through Open Table, they told us to wait..... "How long?" we ask.... "Uuuuu 45 minutes at least" they say.... ok sure its Christmas eve and they are busy but Isn't That what reservations are for?
author: Inga S.

description: Great place for ocean viewing as you enjoy their delicious food!  We sat by the windows and could see Alcatraz and all the ships coming through....was so nice and relaxing. Ordered Shrimp and Crab Louie, Crab Fondue, served with fresh sourdough and butter.  Both excellent!  Save room for the Ice Cream Sundae, though....it is to die for!  Served in a huge goblet, it is coated on the inside with chocolate fudge sauce, vanilla custard ice cream in the goblet sits atop a surprise brownie~cookie at the bottom, topped with real whipped cream and a cherry!  Sooooo Goooood!  Oh! Also, there are binoculars attached to each table, a very nice touch for viewing!  Highly recommend.  Service was great!
author: Maria B.

description: As a visitor to San Fran, the concierge at my hotel recommended this restaurant as a "must try" for seafood, especially Dungeons Crabs which were in season at the time. I was told that this restaurant had been here a while and it certainly looked and felt so. It was as if I was transported back in time to the 1950's (and not in a good way mind you). The place is in desperate need of a face lift to either achieve the nostalgic ambience it is so desperately trying to maintain or to bring it into the modern era.  The food was ridiculously over priced.  For two people, a half serving of Dungeons Crab (two pieces), a chicken fettuccine Alfredo dish (which left much to be desired) , two Sprites and a shared desert amounted to a bill of $111.00.  Not worth it.
author: Dennis J.

description:
We dined here on Tuesday the 18th, our first night in San Francisco.   Called the restaurant around 6 to make reservations and they said they were not taking them.  They said just come by, and we will be seated. 

Our hotel was in walking distance so parking was not an issue.  Arrived around 7 and we were promptly seated with a fantastic view of Alcatraz at sunset. 

Appetizer: Calamari Fritti.  I'd skip it if I ate here again and get more crab.

Main: Double Shrimp & Double Crab.  My father and I split this.  This was my first time ordering crab.  The waitress was kind enough to show us the proper technique and put the bibs on us. The shrimp had too much shell  on it.  A lot of the sauce it was cooked in was lost when you de-shelled them. 

Dessert:  Didn't have it.  Not sure if the Fisherman's Coffee is an actual offering or a good prank.
author: Scott M.

description: My husband and I decided to take the farry to sf yesterday and when we jumped off at peir 41 we were starving. As many times as I've walked passed this place I've never tried it. So I said I see they have a great view so let's give it a try. The place is old style art Decco with awesome views of the bay. Nice quite atmosphere which I love. The waiters are very attentive. We ordered the double shrimp and crab , I'm not a huge crab fan however this crab was great. Plate was hot and not over cooked. We also ordered a cup of clam chowder and I have to say it's the best I've had in the bay area. And we eat out a lot. So for this I've give them 5 stars.
author: Jenny G.

description:
Came here a little while ago and threw my boyfriend a surprise dinner! It was awesome--stressful, but awesome at the same time. 

I organized the dinner for 20 people with the manager, who was phenomenal and making sure all my needs were met. This included holding my boyfriend's cake in their refrigerator,  putting tables together in a certain way, and seating us in a semi-private location away from everyone else.

The event turned out lovely! We ordered the crab chowder (bomb!) and the main course crab feast for two! I think we ordered fries on the side, which were some of the best fries I had had in lonnnng time. 

Overall, wonderful experience, and I would certainly come back again. Thanks for a memorable experience!
author: Sylvia O.

description:
Favorite view , food good, usually my favorite waitress Bianca , but today she is off.
Always make reservation , but today I call they told me no need just walk in , in 10 min coming to the restaurant they said wait time 30 min - 45 min. So make sure make reservation.
author: Sukmawaty W.

description: This is my first review.  I normally don't feel strongly enough about things to post, but my experience tonight pushed me over the edge.  The service was horrible.  Maybe it was the fact that this was our 3rd straight night at expensive San Francisco restaurants with horrible service. Our server Jose (poor young man with terrible facial hair but the beginnings of a fantastic combover) was the worst. The food was not the problem. We ordered the crab Louie and the salmon with spicy cioppino sauce. They were good choices. Maybe it was the fact we brought our kids for our daughters birthday dinner. Or maybe it was because we had a half hour wait and ordered a bottle of wine from the bar and closed out our tab. In any event, Combover Jose took our order and never came back to the table. Our crab chowders and entrees came out at the same time.  Maybe that was the kitchen's fault. I was a server for years and understand those issues.  But he never came back to see that we didn't have them first.  He never filled our wine glasses. He never refilled the waters.  In any event, the view was great and the food was good, so service is obviously not a priority.  I won't be back. I recommend you avoid it too.
author: Neal C.

description:
I came here for lunch with my friends since we could get our parking validated from this restaurant. It was also the closest and we were hungry, so we decided to just come and grab some food.

The lower level is a much more causal seating and dining place while the upper level is more on the fancy side (I think). Because I wanted to try something new so I got the Shrimp and Chips instead of the usual Fish and Chips. My friends also got the Clam Chowder and the Crabwich, respectively. We wanted to get a bunch of things and to share and to try them all. We quickly ordered up front and just waited for the serves to call our numbers. It wasn't long before our orders were out, which was nice.

When we got our food, I was a little disappointed at my own plate of Shrimp an Chips. I thought the Shrimps would be battered shrimps, which it technically was. But these shrimps were the tiny shrimps unlike what I had thought: the bigger, jumbo sized shrimps. I was pretty upset when I saw it and I kind of lost my appetite because I was just so sad looking at those tiny shrimps. But it was decent. The fries were okay, too. 

Onto the other food, the clam chowder was actually pretty good! I had a few bites and they were yummy. The crabwich, on the other hand, was a little disappointing. It was a cold sandwich. We kind of thought that it would be a crab patty, but I guess not. It was like a crab salad with two buns holding the salad in place. It had a weird taste in my opinion, and definitely not the greatest thing ever. 

I don't think I would be coming back. Maybe for the claw chowder and the Fish and Chips (someone else had that and it actually looked decent). But I would rather go to another place if I was in the area again.
author: Wendy Y.

description: Eat downstairs at the walk up / coffee house. Fish and chips are amazing. Everything is cooked fresh, right in front of your eyes. And you cannot beat the price. Under $10 for an order of fresh fish and chips cooked in San Francisco's Fisherman's Wharf area. Services fast and friendly. And when you're done with the fish have a beignet.
author: scott h.

description: Lots of great seafood option, perfect views, a cool old building. The dungey crabs, garlic shrimp, very good. The crab dip was delish. Our server was "ok" but an overall good experience.
author: Megan K.

description: I love The Franciscan, it is always out go to seafood restaurant in the city! The proportions are generous (which is good since your bill will certainly be pricy!) The staff is amazing and attentive. I love their calamari appetizer, and either the clam chowder or crab chowder in a bread bowl on a cold day is the perfect choice! Not to mention the restaurant is beautiful with an old school 50's vibe, the view of the bay with Alcatraz in the distance is so relaxing. Always a delight!  5/5!!!
author: Melissa W.

description:
Came here on a super nice Saturday afternoon to indulge in some seafood while enjoying the view of the bay.

Ordered a dozen oysters and crab sliders for lunch. 

While waiting for our meal, we got some bread and butter and of course I would eat it (I luv bread). 

Then our oysters came out and they were tiny! I believe each were about 2.50 each. Regardless, they were still delicious but if you want more bang for your buck, avoid the oysters here. 

Finally my sliders came out! The sliders came on slices of sourdough bread (I think) and the filling had a sweet taste to it. It was pretty good but the only downfall what how messy it got while eating the sliders. Still good!

Great place to go if you're at the Pier and want some seafood. Otherwise, there are probably other places that are not as overpriced.
author: Anna H.

description: Food was good, view was great, service was horrible. Wait was misquoted (20 mins was really 40 mins) but not a big deal.  Waiter service was horrible. He was nice enough, but he took forever for everything.  He was very attentive to the party next to us, on one occasion, trying to give them the coke refills we ordered. But he took forever with every request and aspect of the meal, ignored me completely when I mentioned the Bloody Mary he brought was the worst I had ever tasted.  Then didn't give me my credit card back, and charged somebody else's check on it before realizing what he'd done.  I unfortunately was in a hurry to catch a show, and was just happy to get out of there. Had to return the next day to get my card.  Was kind of a bummer.
author: Octavio G.

description:
Amazing! Best crab I've ever had, our waiter was so unbelievably nice and the views were the best part! 

I got the crab enchilada (to die for) and my husband got the crab sliders. Seriously exquisite! All of the compilations were so unique and mouth watering.

Highly recommend for brunch where you can appreciate the ocean views along with the Dolphins and sea lions! 

Can't wait to go back :)
author: Andrea P.

description:
What a fun place to eat, and a great view too!

We started with a shrimp cocktail, and small crab cakes.  Both were fresh and better than I had expected.

Then we had the spicy shrimp pasta, and garlic noodle pasta with shrimp.  Both had great flavor and a ton of shrimp and crab --which is awesome considering how stingy some places can be.  I would also add that the shrimp was plump and not over cooked.

The service was prompt and friendly.
author: christopher s.

description: We went to the upstairs part of the resteraunt which offers a slightly different menu...the food was okay, but if we had to do it all over again we would've probably just ate at the downstairs part. I would rate the food 3, but because we had such a nice & helpful waitress I'm giving them a 4 overall.
author: Shekera S.

description: They have good clam chawder, good crabs, good views and thats kind of all I wanted! In a reasonable price too! Super!!
author: Takashi O.

description: This place could be nice because of the food. Unfortunately the place is dirty, the restrooms disgusting. You can come here, eat and don't look to closely. Otherwise, choose differently.
author: Simona O.

description: Good view. Food was fine considering the area but service is terrible - have to ask multiple times to place order, get water, get bill.
author: Roman B.

description: Beautiful view and fantastic food. The crab sliders were particularly tasty.
author: Chris J.

description:
One thing is absolutely true here: you will not run out of crab! The four of us attended The Franciscan Restaurant recently, and we more or less shared everything.

Our orders included:
-Octopus Condito
-Yellowtail Carpaccio 
-Oysters
-Crab Feast for 4
-Bottle of Chardonnay

It was surprising how tasty the Yellowtail was -- I'm sure that was my favorite dish. I do wish there was a variety of oyster selections to sample from (i.e. Kumamoto, Somerset, Miyagi, etc.), but oh well. The Octopus definitely could have been more tender as well, but that also wasn't our primary reason for attending anyway.

The Crab Feast for Four was everything in quantity and nearly everything in quality we hoped it would be. Lived up to par with its expectations, served with individual metal crab crackers for each of us to use. Extremely satisfying in flavor and company.

While we did not get our requested window seat from our reservations, we still had a friendly server, and we were absolutely filled to the brim!
author: Garett T.

description: Great lunch experience! Staff was super friendly, food was great (salad & crab sliders), and the view of the bay from upstairs is amazing!! Would definitely love to come back again, thanks for a very memorable visit!
author: Tim W.

description: I really wanted to like this place.  We knew it would have many tourists but I was hoping for good crab. The crab tasted like it was deep fried. Is that possible?  The mussels and clams were marginal and the potato mix was good but over fried. The food would have been reasonable for less money but it cost 2 adults and 2 kids $180 without tip. The service was good, no complaints there. Just would never go back for marginal sea food.
author: Julie G.

description: My family and I came to see the Blue Angels and picked this Restaurant to finish off the night and celebrate my Bday. We checked the reviews first and they were great. First of all the atmosphere was beautiful. Love the decor,view and bar is lovely.  Not too long of a wait.  My waiter was personable and helpful. The prices are high but to be expected at a tourist restaurant. My lower star markings are due to the fact all of our water glasses were dirty with food on the outside of glasses.The crab chowder was a cream soup. Too salty and no texture.  Our dirty dishes and drinks were never removed during the entire dinner and we had to stack them. Halibut and Crab was excellent however. For a $200.00 dinner for three I would have not expected the other problems.
author: Natalyn B.

description: Great service this time around with a very polite and attentive waiter. The food was great as usual and the view spectacular!
author: Sty S.

description: First day in San Fran was spent touring the city, ending the day in Fisherman's Wharf. In an area crowded with clam chowders and seafood galore, it's difficult to make a choice but I am so lucky we made this one. From the calamari and chowder entree to the crab enchilada- my food was filling, delicious, and accompanied by an amazing view of the pier. Out of all your great dining options in the area, this is by far the best.
author: Noelle F.

description:
We had a 5 pm reservation and were seated right away.  The place had plenty of empty tables but we waited 10 minutes before a waitress arrived.  My wife and I each ordered the Sea Bass and dinner salads.

The sea bass was absolutely delicious.  It melted in your mouth.  My house salad was good but I had several rotten tomato's.  That is unacceptable for $9.95.  

Overall, we both enjoyed our meals and would come back again.  The prices were high but that is expected.  Our dinner view more than made up for it.
author: Jeff B.

description: At there twice while in San Francisco. It was great both times. The Dungeness Crab is what you wanna go for and the Blood Orange Mermerita was a different twist but excellent nonetheless. Right on the water, great service and customer service was on point.
author: Gloria P.

description:
I'm impressed.

Came here on a whim with my friends, celebrating a birthday. We were seated in a nice booth area with a great view of the bay and Alcatraz. I ordered the clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl and shared the iron skillet roasted double shrimp and dungeon crab with one of my friends. The chowder was perfect, the sourdough bread was delightfully fresh (I love that soft bread core!), the shrimp was to die for (full of garlic and herb flavor, roasted in butter) and the crab legs were so easy to crack open. This was by far the best seafood meal I have had in a while. Everything was on point (minus the dirty fork, but they replaced that immediately), our server was friendly and took great care of us, the view was lovely and everyone left full and happy.

The best part came later, when I posted photos on Instagram of the experience and my friends birthday and the restaurant was kind of enough to comment and wish my friend a happy belated birthday. 

Thanks for the wonderful dining experience!
author: Hana D.

description: Went here last Sunday for a late Valentine's date & absolutely loved it!! Made reservations online, went perfect. Had a great waiter whom was super nice & helped us make our decision. We got the platters of seafood & got double crab, shrimp & mussels. With a side of the crispy potatoes. Was all so so sooooo good!! Mussels & crab was my favorite! Even tho it was a gloomy day, we had a beautiful view of the bay while eating our yummy meal. Oh! Our meal came super super fast which shocked us. Can't wait to come here again! Definitely recommend this place if you're ready to splurge on some good seafood w/ a good view!
author: Maryjane A.

description: We were seated at a table with a great view. With Alcatraz in our view we dined away the evening to great service by our server Matt from Miami. His service was exceptional and very much on top of everything. We started the evening with fresh calamari and a sourdough clam chowder bowl. I've visited Boston and tried their famous clam chowder , but nothing compared to the one at the Franciscan. We literally tore the bowl down, it was that good. We sipped the Miami Mojitos and they were delicious.
author: Melissa J.

description: Good ambiance but so so food ... Good service but average food. We had mussels and shrimps. Definitely a place to visit!
author: Nicolas B.

description:
We had the yellow tail and octopus carpaccio. Both good- that white sauce that came with the octopus carpaccio was really really good! i dipped the bread in it as well. Our table also shared crab legs. They went fast so order the largest size.
 I loved the view (though Fog Bay's is also nice, just a fancier interior and menu choices).
It is right in the touristy wharf area, but better than going to the fried stations along the pier. You pay the price to get a seat with that view.
author: Vicky S.

description:
View is amazing and the food is good but the server and service was horrible. I can't remember my servers name but she's an older Mexican lady that sounds kind of sweet but she's actually really slow, forgetful and rude. Seafood was also kind of fishy and you can both taste and smell it. 
Place looks nice and wasn't bad to try since it was something new, but not a must. I'd say save the money or spend it better elsewhere.
author: Kevin V.

description: this cute place is a must in san francisco. Locals even recommend it. It's in the wharf right on the water and the decor and structure are so neat.  The menu has photos of all items and recipes of some items. We have been here twice and everything we've had has been amazing. They serve fresh sourdough bread and butter to every table and the service has always been superb.  The window seats overlook the bay and they have binoculars at your seat to view Alcatraz island.  Highly recommend and will always come back!
author: Stephanie N.

description:
Definitely touristy, being that it's off the Wharf, but this place is legit. 

The island of Alcatraz looks like it's barely three blocks away with the gorgeous view of the Bay. If you want to impress people from out of town, or for a special occasion, this is where you want to go (along with The View in downtown SF). This place has better food though.

This was the last night for a lot of friends I met at the Game Developers Conference this year and their reservation here was a great call. During peak season, I can't imagine how long the wait would be. Even in March, the second dinner time hit, the place filled up fast.

We ordered oysters, several rounds of cocktails, their signature crab, and various other dishes of seafood. The crab was delicious, as were a lot of the fish dishes. The oysters were great, but a little expensive for local fare. The cocktails were also good, but I'd recommend finding your favorite liquor (like Whiskey), and asking for that with a few rocks. The pours are generous - almost like how I pour 'em at home. 

Dinner and drinks for a dozen game developers came out to over 1K. Pricey, but the ambience and quality are worth it. 

Hopefully you stay on the Wharf after a night here, because if not and you party like it's 1999, you're going to be rocked out of your mind. Fortunately, cabs are waiting almost always waiting outside. My guess is that they've been here before, as well.
author: Byron E.

description:
Had diner last night with 6 people. Dolly was the host and was awesome. You can tell she loves her job. We ordered their signature roasted crabs, mussels & shrimp, and the boneless short rib. All were delicious.
Our server was new and you could tell. Had to ask for refills on water and waited awhile for out check. With the restaurant always busy, she'll be up to speed in no time. Will definitely be coming back.
author: Caroline D.

description: We ate here two weeks ago Oysters on the half shell were such a let down. They were tiny and incredibly overpriced. The service was bad. We waited a long time to get our order when the restaurant was not at all busy. Not my favorite place in on the Wharf.
author: Melida N.

description: Very delicious with great views.  Had the crab chowder in the bread bowl and dungeoness crab.  Hubby had the crab alfredo.    Great service too.
author: AlandNana G.

description: Old school fried food. Reasonable prices and generous portions. It doesn't pretend to be healthy or upscale - just a fun, casual place to take the family.
author: Steve D.

description: I order a combination of seafood (crab, shrimp, and mussel) mixed with garlic butter, which tastes pretty awesome. I also have spaghetti with garlic butter. Yeah, I love garlic butter!!! Everything is so good!!!
author: Sotheara H.

description: Visited this place on 27/07/16 and definitely loved the food . Place is Pricey but worth a try. Calamari Fritti, Crab chowder and Crab Enchiladas perfect treat for the taste buds .. Over all I would say Food is awesome!!
author: Flossy M.

description: Love this place as the views and crab are excellent! This is my second visit and this time I drove 1 hour and 40 minutes in San Fran traffic to get here on my last night on the west coast. We may have good BBQ in NC but The Franciscan has the best Crab!
author: A J.

description:
We visited this restaurant with a team of wonderful friends. This was the ultimate touristy thing to do in San Francisco. Restaurant is huge, but we had a great table with a wonderful view of the ocean. 

It felt like we tasted absolutely everything: crab platters, shrimp platters and mussels. As sides, we had french fries and grilled vegetables. This was possibly the best corn I ever had. Servis was very pleasant but a little slow in my opinion. We were waiting for a glass of wine for a very long time. 

Overall good and extremely touristy experience.
author: Michaela P.

description:
Took a long and expensive cab ride here from near the airport since we enjoyed it so much last time 2 years ago.
This time was totally different. Yes, the views are great, but the food was below par, especially considering the prices.
Got the blue cheese salad, taste was not right and ate only a little bit, and I love blue cheese wedge salads. Wife had the crab cakes and raved about them.
She then had the Caesar salad with chicken and the chicken tasted like it came from a plastic bag, like Perdue would sell.
I had the shrimp and mussels which were mediocre at best.
All in all a $100 disappointment.
Won't be back.
author: Michael W.

description: Ok the food and server were great. we got a nice view. We have good time eating the place nice each seating have view of the bay . it a little $$$ not to bad for seafood for this restaurant, but so busy on the weekend will injoy your day be safe love u all take care
author: Miko A.

description: This restaurant receives 1 star for poor service and poor quality of food. I dined at this restaurant with my spouse and friends. We ordered the shrimp and crab combo. The crab and shrimp were warm, at best, and saturated in butter when the waiter delivered the meal to our table.  The crab and shrimp lacked natural flavor. We are optimistic people who give people the benefit of the doubt, so we figured that was the best the restaurant could do and we didn't complain. As our meal neared completion, we heard the sizzle and crackle (like tandoori meat) of the neighboring table's order. We peeked at their meal and, to our surprise, we discovered that they had ordered the same meal as my husband and myself. At that moment my spouse and Myself realized that our food was warm and saturated with butter because it had been sitting. It's likely that the server waited until all of our meals were complete before bringing the meals to the table. The waiter was unapologetic and did not acknowledge the difference in service provided to both tables. I do not recommend this restaurant because the quality and preparation of the seafood is poor and the quality of service is sub par, as well. Save your money and patron another establishment.
author: B A.

description: Delicious lunch time food!  My boys had the chicken and fries and the fish and chips - they inhaled it all.  I had the crab sandwich which is served cold, it was really good but the highlight was definitely the chicken and fish!
author: Rhonda H.

description: A large group of us came here for dad's birthday dinner. Very accommodating and attentive wait staff! Good seating area. Just perfect. I started with a cup of clam chowder and a cup of English tea. The chowder was creamy and tasty..just added a lil dash of pepper to give it a kick. I ordered surf and turf....filet mignon (medium well) and a half of a crab...mmm that filet mignon was amazingly delicious...I was in food heaven and my stomach was sooo happy. The crab was good as well...I was hoping for more garlic flavor as I heard it was all about the secret garlic sauce, all in all, I would order everything again. My hubby ordered filet mignon (medium rare) and the shrimp alfredo. I took a bite of the shrimp alfredo and it was one of the best we've ever had. The wait staff were considerate, attentive, friendly and helpful. I can't wait to eat here again.
author: Jay M.

description:
The views of Alcatraz is definitely 5 stars alone but everything else fell short.

Being on vacation with the BF, we've been treating ourselves to nice dinners and we hoped this one would be memorable. As soon as we get to the hostess stations, three girls look at us cluelessly. A waiter decides to seat us and from there the whole experience was just... awkward. 

The menu had a lot of offerings and it even included pictures so you would know what to expect. I'm not usually indecisive when it comes to food and it took me awhile to see what I wanted. Either it didn't sound/look good or I felt like it was too expensive for what it was. After a huge debate I settled on the sizzling seafood platter with mussels and shrimp. BF decided on the crab alfredo. The complimentary sourdough bread was very hard. Our food came out fairly quick though... probably in 15 minutes. My seafood platter was cooked nicely but was a tad bit salty with the soy sauce. I wish it came with a side or something to really make it a meal. BF was very disappointed in his crab alfredo because the portion size was very small. He even complained to the waiter but all he did was laugh it off. The BF became frustrated after that. 

Unfortunately we left hungry and decided to go to the Chowder Hut afterwards where we got better service and paid a lot less!
author: Linh N.

description:
Great service! Great food! Crab Alfredo is absolutely phenomenal!!! Calamari is very delicious as well!!! I also had the filet mignon, and some dessert! I'm stuffed and satisfied!!! 
Highly recommend!
author: Shazanna A.

description:
Pros:  location 

Cons:  very inefficient staff
            Food wasn't so great
             Very slow service(we had to ask so many times for water and condiments etc)
author: Bayarea K.

description: Location and waiter was gr8 food was ok !! Surprisingly the 8 oz filet was gr8. We had a party of 8 and ordered crab cakes (ok) , calamari (normal ) 2 filets (steaks) ,2 clam chowder soup bread bowls, crab fettuccine Alfredo( had crab shells in it and fettuccine wasn't cooked all the way)  but the restaurant was way cool ,ambience way cool if the food was better I would have given it 4.5 or even 5
author: James G.

description: This place is way over priced. We walked and were seated right away. The has a nice view but it's a little outdated. I sunk right in my chair, super uncomfortable. Our waitress was friendly , gave suggestions. The bread and the appetizer were the only good thing. There  was 6 of us and not one of us enjoyed our meals. I ordered a salad. It looked like someone just threw lettuce on a plate. Someone got soup and mentioned it was way to salty. The shrimp was good. The bill came to over $200. Don't mind paying that when you enjoy your meal. There are way better places around without the hefty price.
author: J J.

description:
Poor service.... Very poor. 
This place is over priced, over rated and we over paid. 
You are paying for the view if Alcatraz.. It's that simple. 

I had to physically walk around to find my server,  twice. 
This place needs help.
author: Malinko ..

description: This was my first time going to San Fran and obviously wanted the cliche sourdough and clam chowder so I went here and it was EXTREMELY disappointing. The clam chowder had very little clams and the bread bowl was cold and had no flavor. I will give them good points for getting the food out to people quickly.
author: Karalexis A.

description: The food was decent and the view is amazing but I'm taking off some stars just because of the overall disorganization of the place. I made a reservation for Sat at 6:30. I show up at 6:30 and there is a long line of people waiting to talk to the check-in desk. Three people on the register yet all of them are dealing with one customer and ignoring everyone else. 10 minutes later I get to speak to someone and tell them I have a reservation for 6:30. They give me a buzzer and tell me it will be a 20-30 min wait (WTF!). I understand that the place is busy and that everyone wants to eat there on a Sat night. But come on, you make a reservation and it's basically just a way to get you to the front of the wait list. I think that's an incredibly shitty way to treat your customers. So, just be aware that your reservation is actually a "reservation".
author: Stephen M.

description: Ambiance is good, service is great, and food was ok. Don't know if I would go back but I would recommend to crab lovers!
author: Marie Alexandra O.

description:
Me and my wife had a great lunch here. 
The clam chowder, shrimps and mussels combo and sea bass dishes were very good and he had great view on the bay. 
Overall, couldn't ask for more.
author: Lev W.

description:
After our adventures at Scoma's restaurant, for a chuckle, read my review.  My cousin and I had gone to the restaurant we initially were intending, the Franciscan.  It is a lovely large building, right on the wharf, and the hostess was kind and welcoming.

My cousin and i laughed about the earlier experience while we had a glass of wine and ordered stuffed shrimp.  Our delicious overstuffed shrimp was beyond our expectations.  The rice and sides were fine, but we gobbled up all the crab stuffing and shrimp on our plates first.  Our coffee came and we were too full for dessert.   We were probably still too shocked, and were happy we were safe in this building, alone.

I can't wait to return to this restaurant again.
author: Irene H.

description:
Several reasons for giving it a 2.
First of all, it is extremely overpriced for what it is, I do get that it has a great view but the dishes are VERY expensive and the place honestly is not that fancy.
The food was just OK. The bread that they brought up front with butter was not fresh at all, as a matter of fact it was hard to chew on. You would think that if they are charging so much for every other dish they would at least have the courtesy of providing fresh warm bread up front (negative!). 
After seeing the prices my wife and I decided to share half an order of crabs and a cup of chowder. The cup of chowder was flavorful and quantity was ok, it was $15 (still pricey, but I would say still ok). The half order of crab was quite literally half a crab for $30. We lived in Baltimore for 6 years and we know crabs, this half crab had nothing on steamed crabs from a Shack in Baltimore. It came on a garlic sauce that was OK, but for $30 the quantity nor the quality was really there! (Failure!!)
I also ordered a mermarita (or something like that), which was there take of an orange margarita and it was close to $15 too. All in all we spent pretty much $70 for what can be considered a couple of appetizers and a drink. WAY TOO MUCH for what it really was (I mean, there was not even a guy playing the piano or any type of live entertainment to compliment the high prices).
My recommendation is to go around the corner and you will find fantastic crab chowder on the bread bowl and it will be much much cheaper than this place. The service was not bad but nothing special either. 
Way overpriced and over rated! Will NEVER come back (not even if money is not an issue).
author: Ricardo M.

description: Have not been here for some time and glad we stopped there when there are so many other wonderful restaurants in the area. Quick service with tasty food you can't beat. Had the Crab fondue which is a lighter fair since we were going out to dinner later. Great view of all the wharf activity and was serenaded by the muscian who was playing to a crowd across the street. My wife had the grilled shrimp which she loved.
author: Stanley S.

description: For the price this place is a HUGE disappointment.  the bread is hard as a rock.  the service is poor - we had to flag down our waiter several times and then he forgot half of the appetizers.  the food was about average.  I would have been better off going to red lobster.  I won't ever go back to this place.  you are just paying for the location because nothing else is good about The Franciscan.  I heard it was once an elegant place.. well, those days are long gone.
author: P G.

description: It is all about location, not about food. It is seems like their chef got great produce and read on-line instructions how to cook it. Beautiful place, great view, food is a disappointment. I forgot to mention service was really bad. We never got any "free bread" and had to wait for servers for a long time. Good we had a lot of time and enjoyed the view. I seen some people complaining about serving size, I wouldn't, octopus appetizer was generous size, we also ordered crab sliders, (very generous size) soggy bread, flavorless ingredients. Steamed vegetables had nothing on it, I mean nothing no salt, butter, oil, anything!
author: Sveta L.

description: My family and I had a great experience here last weekend.  The food was delish!!!  Calamari was yummy, the texture was perfect.  I ordered a whole Dungeness crab and it was good but nothing like I've had before (Boiling Crab)  I really liked their clam chowder.  It was different from the rest out there in the Wharf.  My husband's fettuccine alfredo with crab was superb.  I didn't care too much for their caesar salad.  Amazing view of the bay and the service was excellent.  I'd definitely come back here when I visit SF again.
author: Annie A.

description: The best seafood in the city that I have tried. Fresh and delicious, fast service daytime. Beautiful view. Strongly recommend!
author: Aliya M.

description:
I came here in Friday, and expected way more than what I got. The crab enchiladas were stuffed with crab scraps that included large shell bits, the sauce was more of a marinara sauce, and the price was way above the quality that was delivered. I come to this pier multiple times a month with large groups (10" ppl +), and will forever steer them away from this place. 

So disappointed.
author: Ann W.

description: 3 1/2 stars! I really like this place for its ambiance and quality food. It's a bit pricey and the service is usually good. Our service tonight was a bit lacking, but it was crazy, post-Christmas crowded. We had the short ribs - very tender and juicy. The mashed golden potatoes are great. The spicy shrimp pasta was flavorful but not that spicy. Overall, the views are great, the food is always fresh and tasty, and the retro vibe is fun.
author: Tiffany K.

description: The restaurant was recommended to us so during our visit to San Francisco we decided to try it to celebrate my birthday. We were more than pleased with everything we ate that evening beginning with the calamari appetizer which was fresh, tender, and delicious. Next we moved on to oysters on the half shell...oh my, these were super fresh, a treat on the tongue, smelling of the ocean. We only ordered  1/2 dozen, I wish we would have ordered the full dozen. Next was a Caesar salad which was good. Then hubby ordered a bowl of clam chowder for his dinner, I ordered the crab enchilada. The presentation was beautiful, that first bite and each bite thereafter was fabulous! I highly recommend this restaurant for your next seafood craving, you won't be disappointed. Cheers!
author: Arline G.

description: I was so hesitant to try out this restaurant on the pier, but my friend wanted to give it a try, so try we did. I was not disappointed in the least. The service was speedy and the food was pretty good. I would definitely come back for another round in the future.
author: Tammia H.

description:
My husband and I like to pretend we our tourists from to time.
We decided to treat ourselves to lunch here as I had always wanted to try the place.
We loved the food.  We had raw oysters and ordered from the prix fixe menu.
My husband had the fish and chips which were sooo fresh and tender.  
I had the spicy shrimp pasta, which were topped with bacon and caramelized onions.
The services was very attentive and fast.

There is one thing that detracted from our experience: the hostesses.  They were not friendly at all. They made us feel like we were bothering them when we asked for a table. it was like they didn't want to talk to us, let alone seat us.  And then when we left, my husband and I smiled at them.  But they acted like we weren't there  - they just kept on gossiping among themselves.

First and last impressions are crucial. They leave the first and last taste in your mouth for a restaurant.  We really enjoyed the food and our waiter was very professional.  So if we do ever come back, I either won't expect too much from the hostess or just be as dismissive right back to them.
author: Lo T.

description: Upon being seated you happen to notice the chic decor; very modern with antique pieces. I was seated with an excellent view of the water and to my left were binoculars if I wanted to look further out. Everything from the plating, customer service and vibe were exceptional. I enjoyed the 3 course meal including an avocado salad (which had a scrumptious buttery tone), (from a variety of choices I chose) the short ribs, mash and zucchini and to top it off custard ice cream.
