It was pure stomach joy everything was delicious, very well seasoned and savory. It was definitely worth every cent. I also tried some of the crab enchilada and shrimp linguine both were yummy. Dining here is a must if you are in San Fran!
author: Chanel B.

description:
Jose Cuellar
Yelp Response

Thank you for reading & responding to my review!
Well I have to say that we are not from the Bay Area. We are from Salem, Oregon. We were on a little Thanksgiving break road trip that had us traveling from Oceanside, CA. (Camp Pendleton.) We were visiting my step son Aidan before he gets deployed to Kuwait Jan 4, 2015. On our drive back North we wanted to hit the usual tourist spots in San Fransisco. I would love to dine here again in the future perhaps sooner rather than later. Cheers to endless M&M's & Spicy Shrimp.
author: Melisa G.

description: Everything here is delicious and perfect. The clam tureen was super garlic buttery goodness!!! The spicy fettuccine and crab was also good. Love the bread and butter filled up on that. The prefix menus is a great idea starter, entree and dessert for less than $35.
author: Betsy X.

description: Absolutely wonderful! The iron skillet mussels and shrimp were to die for along with the clam chowder- even the kustard sundae was tasty. Carlos, our server, was very polite and the service was lightening fast. We will certainly return when visiting from SoCal.
author: Melissa B.

description: I only ordered a beignet and it was aight. On top if it is a shit ton of powdered sugar. It comes with a whipped cream dipping sauce which was pretty bland. Id come back tho to try their other food choices. lol
author: John R.

description: This is the second time I've eaten here in 2 months.  As you can tell, I returned.  Love this place.  Wish I had eaten here sooner in the 42 years I've lived in the Bay Area.  The restaurant was at capacity when we arrived but we were seated right away.  Thank God for reservations.  I ordered the double shrimp & crab with garlic noodles.  My husband ordered the short ribs, Yukon mashed potatoes and veggies.  My husband not only ate his dinner, but he kept eating my seafood.  The food and service was excellent.  The only thing that bothered me was a man who was with 6 other people.  One person in the group monopolized the whole hour of conversation.  The group spent an hour drinking before they ordered food.  The more this man drank, the louder he talked.  My husband didn't mind, but it really annoyed me because everyone could hear him and he never let anyone else talk.  You know the type.  No fault of the restaurant.
author: Liz M.

description: Went on a trip recently from Denver with some friends to visit San Francisco. We wanted to enjoy a "fancy dinner" one night and chose Franciscan. We dressed up and were excited to eat some nice seafood. Our experience was AWFUL! Our waitress was not helpful with questions regarding the menu and showed an extreme lack of customer appreciation; not friendly at all. We all decided to share a full crab (very pricey) and mashed potatoes. When it arrived at the table I asked for butter. She said "which kind?" Confused I asked, "well what kinds do you have?" She just said "I'll just bring them all." When she brought them we asked what one of the butter's ingredients were and she just stated that she didn't know and didn't offer to find out. We had to ask for our waters to be filled-the restaurant was not busy at all and she only checked on us about 2-3 times over the course of 1.5 hours. The food got cold immediately and the crab was not flavorful and I was told it was not even from California, but Seattle! As I was still trying to finish my meal, (my only motivation was because of the expense, not flavor) one of the employees came over to me and asked if I was done as my fork was actively getting food off my plate! We asked our waitress to speak to a manager and after we were all done eating she came over and let us know what was in the butter after we complained to try and redeem herself. The manager finally came after an extended period of time and we let her know how incredibly disappointed we were with our waitress as well as the food. She told us that our waitress was "the best waitress they have." (Ha!) And she didn't even offer to compensate any of our meal to make up for the awful experience. The waitress made one last appearance to start clearing our table and didn't even apologize. We still talk about this experience today with each other and hope that no tourists, or locals for that matter, give their money to such a company! Very disappointed!
author: A C.

description: We had a large group celebrating a wedding rehearsal and The Franciscan was able to accommodate us last minute. The service was great and the food was excellent. Plus, it's a cool location with a great view. I highly recommend this restaurant.
author: Camille P.

description:
We are locals and usually stay away from the Wharf but my friend had a hankering for crabs. Yelp led me here (and the lure of Irish Coffee at Buena Vista nearby) and it did not disappoint. Our server, Marta, was very attentive, warm, friendly and accommodating. She spoiled us!

We had the crab chowder, arugula salad with avocados (special request) and their famous Dungeness whole crab (good for 2) cooked in their secret garlic sauce. And we asked for more garlic sauce. And more. And butter. What a delicious feast!

Capped the meal with the surprise birthday cake and ice cream and a birthday song to boot! Marta was on top of everything and gave us great customer service.

(After all that crab and butter, walk it off and go to Buena Vista for Irish Coffee)
author: Reena C.

description: We came to celebrate my daughters birthday and tried to get a reservation beginning at 8 am. Left a message and called all day to receive a recorded message all day. We asked our concierge at our hotel to try and she got through and they no longer had tables. We decide to go and put our name in and waited 40 minutes for a table. We had a nice table in the corner by the window and in looking around I was shocked by how dirty the windows and kinda run down the place was. Our waitperson was unprofessional and odd. I ordered the crab and it was flavorless and cost $50. The clam chowder was good. I did not care for the crab chowder. My daughter ordered the filet and got the short ribs. I paid $430 for 6 people, received below average service, below average food in a clearly dirty restaurant. All in all a huge disappointment. I will never go back. Oh and I hadn't mentioned that in the very small wait area there is a beautiful butcherblock buffet for slicing bread. It was not clear if this was for customers to slice off some bread while you wait especially where it's located. A few customers took a knife and sliced a few pieces. A few of the staff noticed and told them to stop. Another unsuspecting patron helped himself and an angry waiter came and picked up the knife threw it and the bread in the drawer, slammed it very hard and used profanity directed at the customer. There is not one sign to tell people that the bread is not for customers or to not "help yourself." I wish I would have left right then and there.
author: Mary M.

description:
We usually don't like to fall into the tourist traps in the Fishermans Wharf area but it is still a draw for out of towners and you have to keep family happy right?

We stopped here for an afternoon lunch with my wife's aunt. We didn't want a formal sit down and the downstairs here for the bill. We got an obligatory bowl of clam chowder, garlic fries, fish n chips and a crab Louie sandwich. The fish and chips was pretty goo, fish was moist and batter had a bit of crisp but to me needed more seasoning. The garlic fries were pretty good, not over powered by garlic and were crisp, so often they get soggy and can disappoint but these were pretty decent. The crab Louie sandwich was ok but I wish the bread had been crisped and it had less mayo to let the cocktail sauce shine a bit more

Clam chowder should be good, I mean we are in seafood country. It was just ok. It needed more seasoning and given I like mine with the salty and smokiness of bacon, more bacon would have fixed it for me. None the less it tasted ok and had a good amount of clams

In short I would return, but only if I needed to bring guests to a San Francisco seafood experience. But nothing to draw me back by myself
author: Scott P.

description: I consider it the quitisentia San Francisco experience.  Whenever we have friends in town,  I love to take them here and they always have a great time! Best garlic roasted dungeness crabs, fun location, great view, good lively bar and good service. What more can you want? I live in the City and still love to come to this place, mingle with the tourists and appreciate our great city as though I'm visiting on vacation. Side note - great custard ice cream as well. Enjoy!
author: Cindy W.

description: This place is the best for the food and the views. Offering the classic view of the San Francisco Bay and supremely prepared crab and other seafood treats. This is always the required first stop in SF when my daughter is visiting. You can't go wrong with the chowders in sourdough bread bowls followed by the crab boiled in garlic butter.
author: Scott K.

description:
We had such a wonderful time at The Franciscan Crab Restaurant! 

We came here the day after Thanksgiving with my boyfriends aunt visiting from Reno.  Our reservations were for 6:30 but we arrived a bit early, hungry, and cold from our day of exploring the city.  We were seated promptly with a beautiful view of the bay.

Our server Yuri quickly brought us some waters and bread with butter.  We ordered a whole crab to share with the DELICIOUS Secret Garlic Sauce. I also got a cup of the crab chowder. My boyfriends aunt got a caesar salad and the boyfriend got the crab enchiladas. 

Everything was absolutely delicious! The crab was unbelievably fresh and the sauce was just fantastic to dip the sourdough bread in.  My boyfriend really enjoyed his enchiladas and I really liked the chowder with large clumps of crab meat. 

Our server Yuri was very friendly and quick bringing us whatever we needed.  All of the amazing food plus the gorgeous view made for a wonderful experience!
author: Maya R.

description: First time here & so far so good! My favorite was the salmon with garlic paprika!! Omg that literally gave my tongue the butterflies! The flavor was light but filled with tons of flavor. Our waitress was very nice and always came up to check on us. I highly recommend you try the salmon! Yumm!
author: Tida T.

description:
By all accounts, I was setting myself up for failure when I visited. I was dining alone in a touristy restaurant and I was arriving 15 minutes before closing. 

Surprisingly enough, the meal ended up being pretty good.

I opted for the prix fixe menu and had the clam chowder and crab enchiladas. The chowder was hot and tasty. The enchiladas probably would have gone over better with a different tourist than me. The crab wasn't evenly heated and the sauce doesn't measure up to my Tex-Mex idea of what an enchilada should taste like. That being said, it didn't skimp on crab and the seafood was excellent quality. Chalk it up to me should have known better to order enchiladas in a seafood house.

I'll come back when there is time to appreciate the view and get a crab platter.
author: John D.

description: Ehhhhh, this place is ok !! We had the crab fondue, and the crab chowder . Over priced and tasted bland . The bread that came with the crab fondue was hard as a rock and I thought I broke my teeth.They don't give you ice in your drink . The shrimp and chips was also very bland . The shrimp were about the size of a dime . You're basically just eating here for the Great view .
author: Roger S.

description:
Not only does the Franciscan have amazing seafood, but you get a spectacular view of San Francisco Bay. The upscale ambiance, especially the black and white retro decor is so cool. Even the walls lined with pictures of celebrities from one end of the place to the other is historic. Perfect for any special occasion and very spacious. Although the food is a little bit pricey, the dining experience is definitely worth the splurge and views memorable. Great place for taking tons of pictures and enjoying beautiful romantic sunsets.

For starters, make sure to order the crab cippiono which is a San Francisco original and staple dish. You get a generous amount of crab meat and rich broth is so flavorful and tasty. If you're a cheese lover then make sure to try crab fondue. The Swiss chard, Italian fontaine cheese and heaping amount crab meat is sweet, savory and delectable. Compliment that with their bread and you got a great scrumptious start to your meal.

Since your here for the seafood, I suggest that you get the 2 pounds of crabs served with their secret garlic rub and butter sauce which is awesome. Roll up your sleeves and put on those bib cause it gets kinda messy. It requires a little work picking through all that crab meat, but definitely worth every morsel of goodness and finger licking good. The crab sandwiches are also great. Good amounts of crab meats, tasty and satisfying.

If you still have room for dessert and craving sweets, I suggest Verona chocolate sundae and chocolate truffle mouse cake. I was fortunate enough to try both with family and friends which we all shared. So decadent and sinful. You might need to spend a week at the gym.

Franciscan is truly a great experience and I would definitely come back again.

Parking - 1hr free validation
author: Leo C.

description:
Very nice atmosphere/beautiful view
The seafood was very good but I have to rave about the seafood soup/I believe it's called prosciutto?
author: Cindy C.

description: Thanks to my fellow yelpers, I checked out this place at Fisherman's Wharf. I highly recommend the crab chowder and seafood cioppino! The portions are generous. I was lucky to sit at a table near the window and take in the awesome view. Service is fast and attentive, but the food is a little pricey.
author: Komal K.

description: THIS PLACE JUST CANCELLED ALL JULY 4th RESERVATIONS!!!  I've been booked for weeks and the restaurant called to cancel because they only want walk-ins. How can a place of business do this a week before the date?  Not happy at all, i hope they get no walk ins and learn that it's not good policy to screw people on a holiday.
author: Denise P.

description:
We stumbled upon this place while browsing the wharf and we were glad we did. The views of the water and Alcatraz were spectacular. We loved watching things light up as the sun was setting for the day. 

I had the Crab Alfredo and was quite pleased with the taste. The dish was creamy and the crab was flavorful. While the portion seemed small, I was quite full but not overly full. The bread, however, was hard and a bit difficult to chew (oh, the faces I made trying to get a bite!). And our waiter was very pleasant but not very attentive at all. I'm not sure if it was because the place was busy but he forgotten some things we've asked for and mixed up our check.
author: Diana P.

description: Gave them 5 stars for the very good fish and chips. A little expensive compared to other similar restaurants but it was worth it.
author: Allen M.

description: Loved it!   We just kept ordering small plates...but it was all good!   Smoked salmon blini (cept they spell it bellini ) calamari, mussels, crab cocktail and fresh oysters.    Everything came out in a timely manner, and the waiter was super nice.    It also has a great view from every table!
author: Cindi W.

description: If your looking for a seafood restaurant where tourists and locals eat then the Franciscan is a must visit. This place feels casual and upscale at same time.  The view is incredible. The food is delicious especially the crab, mussels, and calamari.  Always a fun and vibrant experience.
author: Chen W.

description: Great view. Mediocre crab and unremarkable drinks. We had crab for three and a variety of cocktails. The server forgot to bring plates and was slow to ask if we wanted more drinks.
author: Briant P.

description:
This is a tourist place
They know that most of their customers are a one time only customer 
The  location is great
Service is very good
Food is great quality
Prices are high as expected
author: Jack P.

description: Beautiful view, average service, horrendous food. Don't bother eating there. Worth stopping in for a drink to soak up the views. Shrimp cocktail inedible. Crab was dry and briney. Salads average.
author: Michelle M.

description:
Came here for my BF's mothers birthday. Apparently, they always come here for her birthday because it's her favorite place to eat on special occasions. I'm so glad I was able to experience this restaurant with them because I now know why she loves to come here for her birthday every year. Great view of the bay, wonderful service, and amazing food. What more can you ask for?

We arrived late since we were stuck in traffic. The rest of the group ordered basically all the appetizers just to wait for us. Fresh oysters, dungeness crab cocktail, and shrimp cocktail, also the yellowtail carpaccio and calamari fritti. They saved us a bite or two each, once we arrived and I was sold already. It was like heaven in my mouth with each bite. I then, ordered the sea bass with mild curry thai broth and my bf ordered the whole crab with petit filet mignon. Both was SOOO good... my mouth just started to get all watery just thinking about it. My food was super filling, so I wasn't able to finish the whole thing. For dessert, I wanted something small and I got the italian sundae which is basically ice cream with sea salt and olive oil, if I could recall. Seems like a weird combo, but it really wasn't if you wanted something sweet and salty, I definitely recommend this! My bf's family ordered the strawberry banana sundae, which they always get when they come here. 

Nonetheless, this place is worth going to! One of the places to go to on your bucket list of eats in san francisco.
author: Jeankay E.

description:
Breathtaking views from inside. The service is impeccable. Definitely on the pricier side, but hey, you get what you pay for. 

Help yourself to the yellowtail carpaccio, crab feast, and some chowder.
author: David L.

description:
We came for dinner last night. Paid $130 & left hungry!
For service: very bad service.
At the time ordering, we requested water as we had 2 cocktails & 2 glasses of wine. Water never came.
We also asked for capers & chili flakes. Never came.
For the food: as appetizers, we had halibut carpaccio, oysters, crab chowder: they were okay, not so great to order again.
As entrees: we had sea bass & spicy sea food pasta.
The sea bass again was average. But the pasta was very dry. Barely any sauce on it. It was sent back to add sauce. Big mistake: super super salty!!! ( I love salty food but this was unbelievable).
We decided to skip. The waitress offered to take off the bill.
Still 5 min she came back... we were charged full bill.
As if we didn't read, we were paying the full charge.
So many mistakes happened the same evening. We gave tips to our buss boy as he was doing his job. We left $0.01 to our waitress as she performed her job poorly.
Never , never again!

Updated review: The manager sent us a private message to ask for our contact information.
We gave them our phone number. No one called to follow up. Perhaps this restaurant doesn't need customers.
FYI after dining at this restaurant, we even went to Forest cafe near by to complete our dinner since we still were hungry.
Had the charge receipt as proof for 2 restaurant in the same night!!!!
author: Huyen P.

description: Absolutely TERRIBLE service. Our server insisted on telling us his absolute favorite dishes the multiple times he came to our table. He acted extremely pretentious and seemed like he was too good to be serving us. The food was not good at all. Never get the crab enchiladas. They are more like burritos and taste mostly like tortilla. Barely any crab meat. When the bill came they couldn't separate/split the check? What a joke. The waiter couldn't even do simple math to figure it out. He asked my husband to do the math and was a huge jerk about it. Our bill was over $150 and would in turn get a high tip from it... Not a chance. Don't get Nathan with the highlighted hair and pompous attitude.
author: Dana B.

description: The clam chowder was disgusting and tasted like it was out of a can. Come here for the atmosphere and bay views, but don't expect much from the food.
author: Nikki T.

description:
Came back here after the positive experience last time, and what a disappointment it was! There has been a significant decline in both the quantity and quality of crab served.

First, the quantity. My wife and I ordered the "lotsa crab" which is supposed to be 3+ pounds, for 2 people to share. Basically it's supposed to be 1.5 whole crabs, or 15 legs (each crab has 2 claws and 8 legs for a total of 10). The problem is that they served just the legs, and not the main body of the crab. Most of the meat on a crab is located where the legs meet the main body, and those parts were missing. And our platter didn't even have 15 legs anyways. When I called the server over, she proceeded to start counting crab legs. She got to 9, plus the 2 we had already eaten, plus 2 more that were sitting on our plates. She figured that it was "close enough." Well, maybe I should just leave $60 on the table for a $70 bill since it's "close enough"? Bottom line, I know crab and I know how much crab corresponds to how much weight. There is no freaking way that what we were served would come close to 3 pounds, even before cooking. And there is no freaking way that we were served 15 legs.

To the server's credit, she allowed us to change our order and have it remade. We downgraded to a whole crab, which was pretty good in quantity (the legs were bigger and more full of meat). However, we now move on to the issue of quality. They have changed the recipe since last time (late 2014), and the change has been for the worse. It seems that the new recipe is geared towards convenience for the typical customer (tourists?). The crab comes out of the kitchen faster (suspiciously fast, in fact - it was most likely fried beforehand and quickly reheated), but lukewarm instead of sizzling hot. After finishing the first two legs, the rest of the crab was cold. There's also less sauce, which leaves your hands clean, but at the cost of less tasty crab. I remember having my hands slathered over with delicious garlic sauce last time - quite a mess, but worth it for the taste. This time, we didn't even need to use the plastic bib provided, but I'd way rather have to clean up in the restroom than pay premium prices for cold, tasteless crab.

Oh, and we also ordered some mussels. They also came out lukewarm and quickly went cold. Highly disappointing!
author: Bo D.

description:
My grandfather used to work here so my dad generously got me a gift certificate to try it out. My bf and I decided to try a several menu items including oysters, which were the smallest I have seen ever, the 30$ crab, which was pretty much as big as they come without being a king crab, and fish entrees. The drinks were mediocre. The fish though, we ordered sea bass two different ways, was atrocious! So disappointing but I still felt as though we had to eat it, we did order it after all.....the fish was a texture I have never experienced before. Somewhat rubbery and for lack of a better word, slimy. Maybe we ordered the wrong fish or maybe they were past their prime but either way it was disappointing considering the price was about $20 per plate. 

If I were to go back I would stick to the crab and apps.
author: Melissa J.

description: A hot hot hot mess. None of the food was seasoned well. The soup was half cold but it did have a nice view of Alcatraz. I guess that's how they pull it off and survive with the nice views
author: This L.

description:
When we came they told us that there is no empty table inside, waiting time at least 30 minutes.
But outside where still some free tables so we took them. 

But the service is outstanding! Very friendly and professional! Food came very quickly and it has been very tasty. I took the house salad and my friends had pasta with fish and clams . Also positive feedback.

Minus one star, cause the tables outside where not comfortable and we had very little place to sit.
author: Torsten N.

description:
This place is fabulous. There are so many locals who come and bring their families. The ambience is fabulous. Each table has a great view of the harbor and Alcatraz. The service is great. 

THE FOOD IS WHAT THE PLACE IS ALL ABOUT!Its not a view with some mediocre food -It is fabulous food with a great view. The fried calamari is some of the best I've ever had. Tender and citrusy (not rubber or fishy tasting). It has pickled peppers in it, a nice touch. The crab skillet was huge and delicious. My wife and I split a whole crab and it was perfect. It was a very big crab over two pounds which the server assisted in cutting. Truly this is the premier "sit-down" establishment of fisherman's wharf.
author: Douglas W.

description: $100 for the four of us to share 1 appetizer, 2 meals & 1 kid meal. No drinks. Food was drenched in butter (crabs) and way too greasy (fried fish). Service was blah. View of bay gives it 2-stars. Won't be back.
author: SA F.

description:
Came here for a fancy date dinner because my bf knows I love crab, and left disappointed in the crab. I grew up in the PNW eating fresh caught Dungeness crab, and definitely received a different crab product than I expected. What I expect from crab: tender, juicy, and sweet. What I got was crab cooked in butter and served steaming hot. It was: a little over cooked so not quite as tender as I expected, not juicy at all besides the butter juice, which tastes like butter and not delicious crab, and savory!!! The savory part was what got to me the most! The food was still good, but it just didn't taste like crab. And my date was spending a lot of $$$ for crab - I expected it to ya know taste like fresh crab. 
 
Anyways, I was still happy eating my hot buttery crab, if a bit confused. But after brooding for a while, I decided to bring the issue up to my server. "Um... Excuse me. But the way this crab is prepared is a bit odd. It's still good, I guess, but I just am not sure why it was cooked in butter? The butter is overwhelming the crab. It tastes savory, and I sort of expect my crab to be sweet..." To which he responded "well Dungeness crab is supposed to be savory, it's blue crab that's sweet. Have you ever had Dungeness crab before." Unfortunately I don't have a picture of my face at that moment, but imagine the face of the mean girl in middle school when you invited her to your first boy girl, bowling themed, birthday party. A little disgust, mixed with a little astonishment, mixed with a little bemusement. Even though my expression spoke volumes, I was still quick to tell him that I in fact grew up eating Dungeness crab, fresh from the ocean, caught by my dad. And then he seemed to realize his mistake, and so mumbled that we should order the steamed crab next time and ran away. 

Well ok then, thought me and the honey, guess we should order steamed crab next time. And for the rest of the evening I was happy. (It was a good night!) but the more and more I think about how stupid that lie was the angrier I get. I also feel like the servers should be trained to let customers know how the crab is prepared, I can't remember if it is mentioned in the menu, but I know that even if it is we didn't notice it. Even if that's how they want to cook their crab, it's super unusual and should be noted!!!

As for the rest of the food: We also had the shrimp (we ordered the lotsa shrimp, lotsa crab platter (I think that what it's called)) and as an appetizer we had the octopus c-something Italian-. We also both ordered cocktails before dinner, and then split the chocolate mousse for dessert. The appetizer was really good, and I would recommend it. The shrimps were decent. They were also served sizzling and cooked in butter like the crab but that works with shrimp, although I do think they were a little over cooked. The cocktails were decent. The chocolate mousse was really good. 

Ambience wise, while the decoy is a little quirky, the view is super nice. The service, besides the weird and blatant lie, was good. They were quick and responsive. I might come back or recommend just by virtue of the nice view and location, but if I ever do come back I will be very specific about how I want my crab!


A post note, I have actually been having a dream about that crab. In it I grab the cooks collar, bring him close to my face, shake him a little and tell him this: "For gods sake if you love your goddamn butter sauce so much, cook the freaking tilapia in it! Leave the crab alone!"
author: Jessica M.

description: The food here was nothing special. I got the fish and chips and garlic fries, neither was great. I came on a Saturday afternoon so it was very crowded and loud and chaotic. They seemed a little understaffed and the whole meal was just a little stressful. They do have a couple tables out back that look out on the water - it may have been calmer out there. But I definitely wouldn't come back.
author: Allegra G.

description: You guys are awful people who think you can get away with being "better than anybody else".  I will never go here with The customer service that you put forth! I wish I could give you 000000000$!
author: Annie G.

description: Food is not that amazing but the prices are outrageous. Dad paid 30$ for a Louie crab salad MADE WITH ICE BURG LETTUCE!! Come on. Waited for 15 min before seeing a waiter. Then my parents ordered soup basically for dinner and a salad. And i he brought it right away, however i got crab legs which took forever. So I sat there watching my my parents eat, while I was beyond starving. SHOULD HAVE BROUGHT OUT EVERYTHING AT ONCE! DUHHHH!!! Then, still waiting, this waiter is talking to my family about personal life stuff! 30$ for tiny little crab legs. Aweful. Then all of a sudden a new waiter showed up and the other one that started with us disappeared?? So aweful we will not be bak
author: April D.

description:
Wonderful service, spectacular view, classy,eclectic fine dinning.

We were with our children and we all were very pleased! 

I would say that everyone coming to San Francisco should experience this venue!  

Even their house salad was above and beyond! These people take great care in their food and service. 

Returning for sure!
author: Melanie M.

description: This place was just okay.  Definitely don't go here if you are hungry and want a ton of food. The amount of food is not worth the price; although you can't beat the view so I suppose that makes up for it.  I enjoyed my lunch overall but probably wouldn't eat here again considering all of the other options with a similar view.  The service, also, was not all that great; it took awhile to get recognized once we sat down.
author: Patrick K.

description: Ordered the double shrimp and double crab. Service was very prompt and good but food was average at best. Nothing special about entree. Nice location but wouldn't eat there again.
author: Keith B.

description:
This was my first time visiting this restaurant, and I'll say I'm impressed. The atmosphere is classy, the cooks bring your food, and everything is delicious. 

We ordered the cheese fondue as an appetizer, the cheese fondue is amazing. However, it was too much cheese for the amount of bread slices they serve. We resorted to the bread we were given when we were seated.

Then we ordered the clam chowder in the sourdough bread. My mother and I both agreed it tasted like potato soup. I saw all the reviews from earlier posts, and thought maybe they just blended in too much potato. No potato chunks here, it's blended into the soup. 

We then decided to share a plate, so we ordered the crab alfredo. This one hit the spot! The alfredo sauce was creamy and savory, the pasta was cooked to perfection, and the crab meat added that extra oomph to the plate. My favorite so far.

I didn't have a dessert, but my mother ordered a coffee, the chocolate fog. I had a taste, and it's delicious. My mother is a coffee lover, so she loved it. 

All in all, a great location. Our server was nice, she even fulfilled our request to have our bread bowls toasted. Warning though, pricing can be a little steep.
author: Kenia M.

description: Had an extremely relaxing, delicious lunch with an AMAZING view. My boyfriend ordered the crab fettuccini Alfredo and I ordered the clam chowder bread bowl and a Caesar salad. Our waiter, JD was FANTASTIC. Both my boyfriend and I are in the restaurant business as well and we can't help but pay attention to service and details when we go out. JD is a star. He took the time to talk to us and build a genuine connection. You can tell he is a natural people person and THAT can not be taught. Between JD and the rest of the staff, our drinks never went empty (it was a super hot day so that was SO important to us). The food was delicious and brought out soon after we ordered. Overall a very pleasant time and we most definitely will be back and ask for JD.
author: MissCali B.

description:
Get the Famous Fishwich. It is not only cheap ($7.99) but huge and delicious. I am not a seafood person at all - just the occasional shrimp dumplings or crab cakes however, this particular sandwich caught my eye as I walked by and I am glad I stopped by. 

Service was super friendly. I liked that the guy that took my order was cheerful and commended me on ordering the ginormous sandwich for myself. I also ordered the macaroni and cheese for my little one. 

The wait was probably 5 minutes. I grabbed a table overlooking the ocean. It was nice out but a little too windy to my liking but enjoyed and ate away, nonetheless. My sister ordered shrimp and chips and a clam chowder. I don't know how her selections tasted but she tried a bite of my sandwich and couldn't believe how good it was. The fish was flaky, fresh and the batter was fried to perfection. What I love most: the slaw. I did not care for the tiny ass roll that it came on but that maybe just my preference. I did not need any condiments as the sandwich was both flavorful and a tad tangy due to the slaw. I was so sad to box the other half home but you see, I started my "eating only half" quest that day so I had to adhere to it. 

Next to us was a guy that ordered the same thing. He was sitting alone, my sister took a slight interest but was too afraid to go up to talk to him. Results? I talked to him and opened the line of communication. I left for the restroom which was somewhat clean (always have sanitizer w/ you) but I found out after that she failed to get his contact information. 

As we walked out, so did he. He went into the tourist gift shop next door and looked back at me but hell no am I going to follow him for the sake of my sister. If anything, they are both chicken! 

Back to my review. This place is awesome. 

Tip: get the Famous Fishwich!!!
author: Tram N.

description:
We chose this restaurant for lunch based on my 5 year olds' choice.  (And they validate parking). We enjoyed it!  We have taken friends to wharf many times over the past 20 yrs but have never eaten at Franciscan's.

We ordered crab sliders, crab enchiladas, and fish and chips.  All of the food was very good.  The Bloody Mary was also very good.  The service was great.  I look forward to going back.

Why not 5 stars?  It's really expensive.
author: Heidi F.

description:
Went to Franciscan Crab for lunch on Saturday and to watch the Americas Cup Races. This restaurant is a big tourist attraction on Fisherman's Wharf, because of it's big open window and view of San Francisco Bay. The food is way overpriced, parking and access is terrible, but you are paying for the beautiful view. The food quality is good and the service is excellent. We ordered the following items:

Prosciutto ham and cheese      4/5  stars comes w toasted bread 
Fried Calamari                             4/5             nicely battered, good portions
Clam Chowder bread bowl        2/5            worst item served lot's of bread 
                                                                           very little Chowder
Crab and avocado melt              4/5             comes with fries, fresh and good flavor
Crab combo                                  4/5             shrimp, 1/2 crab, mussels sizzling plate
Roasted Crab                                4/5            small portions good taste.
Crab Fondue                                  5/5            best dish melted cheese with crab and
                                                                            toasted baguette
Oysters on the half shell              3/5            fresh but very very tiny and pricey.

The view is awesome looking straight out at Alcatraz Island and the America's Cup catamarans zipping by. Sipping Arnold Palmer's with family and friends well worth the pricey menu. 

Tip: make reservations on the weekends or wait a long time.
author: George F.

description:
We did not have high expectations going into this place because the location was so great that we thought they'd get enough business to stay profitable regardless of how the food was. 

We were mistaken because we had an absolutely great experience. This place is right on the water at Fisherman's Wharf. The entire wall facing the bay is a huge glass window with a panoramic view of the bay and Alcatraz Island that can be seen from almost every table in the place. It was very clean and was decorated in a style that reminded me somewhat of a 1950's art deco Hollywood hot spot. 

Our waiter (I wish I could remember his name, I think it was Eduardo) was great. Very friendly and personable, knowledgeable of the menu and just super professional on all fronts. 

We started our experience with 2 cocktails. A perfect dirty martini on the rocks and a Midori sour which was good (takes talent to mess up that drink anyway). 

I ordered the whole dungeness crab, which was picture-perfect and cooked just right, served with a delicious garlic butter sauce. My date had the sea bass in a spicy cioppino tomato sauce that was also absolutely delicious. For a side we ordered these deep fried pearl onions which were everything that you ever wanted onion rings to be, only better... consisting of thick sweet hardy onion bites surrounded by a tasty thin batter. 

When the bill came it was as expensive, as we thought it would be, but definitely worth every penny!
author: Stacy S.

description: I thought by ordering something simple because we were quite hungry, nothing could go wrong.  The caesar salads were the worst I have ever had and all 3 of us had them. Was annoyed leaving there that we paid 80 bucks for three salads and watery Arnold Palmers. Will never go there again.
author: Sevrine B.

description: One of the few bad decisions we've made in a while.  Ordered the prix fixe each with octopus carpaccio and oysters.  I had the garlic crab and he had the short ribs.  Appetizers were good (oysters over priced) and wine was so so.  Prix fixe chowder was seasoned well but no meat. Entrees were bad: crab was terribly dry liked it had been sitting out; short ribs were tasteless - plastic with au jus.  Then came the ice cream... Runny and pure liquid sugar.  Bill was absurd and all we felt like was that we paid for the view.  I would have rather better food so wanted to share an update since most of the reviews were positive.
author: Lizz L.

description: Located on the touristy Fisherman's Wharf but still a favorite stop for us.  We had the crab enchiladas and crab alfredo which didn't disappoint.  Strong, flavorful cocktails and beautiful views of the bay.
author: Jeff S.

description: Was not impressed, it didn't taste fresh and for the cost... Nope. Would never go again or recommend this to anyone. The view is amazing and that's about it though. We have better seafood in South Dakota, and crab in MD is much better.
author: Lindsey N.

description:
Another great Dinner.
Came to San Francisco to get some great crab.
Ate the night before at their sister Place The Crab House on Pier 39.
The food was equally as good. The service was also great and the views were to die for.
Had The Lotsa Crab Platter for two. 
First off let me say I could eat this till I explode but the wife and I shared and found it to be plenty for two people.
at the price it's a great deal for fresh crab on the Wharf..
There garlic sauce is fantastic. 
The Crab Chowder is very good too.
The wait to get a table is short most of the time at both places.
Samantha, our server was fantastic and made our experience that much better.
For the money I would give this place a 6 Star Rating. 
Give this place and their sister place a try.
But be ready to fall in love with CRAB.
author: Robert Z.

description: The crab chowder bowl and bread are super yummy! Great views of the bay yet pricey though! Good service.
author: Andreea B.

description: Been here many many times, the view is as incredible as the food/service.  Would highly recommend it to anybody down in the Wharf area.  A must go place for me every time I am in the Bay Area.
author: Chris W.

description: I've eaten here twice for their fish and chips. Their fish is the biggest in the whole pier. I don't think this place costs a lot. Everywhere else is the same price but this place simply gives you more. And on top of that, it's not greasy at all!!!! This is the place to get fish and chips and try their fish sandwich as well!!!
author: Lynn C.

description:
Nom nom nom! 
The food here is awesome. I was craving crab and me and my boyfriend decided to try this place on christmas. 
we expected to wait longer and we were seated pretty fast. 

We ordered 
-double shrimp and double crab 
-garlic clams 
-8 orders of fresh oysters 

All of these were awesome!!!! The food melted in my mouth. The crab was fat and juicy and clams were cooked to perfection. Oysters were very fresh too. 

Our server was very nice and checked in frequently if we needed anything. 

Will definitely come back here again soon!!
author: Jo K.

description: Lunch was ok.. I ordered their special for $34.95. You get either a cup of soup or salad and an entree with dessert. I opted for the crab legs. The crab is pretty fresh however their clam chowder was really sandy.. Too much potatoes. Service was ok but not the best. Their price is really expensive. After eating here we should've just ate on the warf.
author: Juddi K.

description: $1.00 for tap water!! Really! Cioppino soup was average. Would give it a 3 star but lost one on the tap water.
author: Fred O.

description:
A very yummy place is you dig seafood. Not only do they have a good selection of food, but they also have a good view of the bay--and who doesn't love watching sea lions pop their heads out of the water while you have a bowl of clam chowder? 

And that's exactly what I did. The clam chowder was quite delicious and the complimentary bread they brought out always even better. The only downside was the price, dang it, I had a tiny bow of chowder for a big chunk of change. I do understand the whole "fresh seafood" and "lots of flavor in little bites", but i wish they'd give you more bang for your buck! 

The service was good and the atmosphere was light and bright. The bathrooms could've used a little touch up, lots of toilet paper and towels on the ground. Overall, it was a good lunch. 

TIPS & TRICKS: 
* Ask to have a window seat, it's a fun view! 
* Take time to look at all of the photos posted around the walls, some fun people make appearances in some of them :)
author: Haley N.

description:
This is my favorite restaurant on Fisherman's Wharf. My family comes here every time we're up in San Francisco. Even though it is pretty pricey, the food here is absolutely worth it. I usually start with a plate of calamari and an order of clam chowder in a bread bowl. The calamari is delicious, and the clam chowder is probably the best I've had on the Wharf. We then usually proceed to order a 'crab feast,' which is a huge portion of Dungeness crab legs meant for 4 to share. Again, cooked just right and seasoned with some sort of garlicky buttery goodness that just hits the spot and fills us up every time. Granted, it takes some work to actually procure the crab meat from out of the shell, but if you don't mind getting your hands dirty, the food is more than worth the work. Plus, what's more satisfying than licking those fingers clean after a hard dinner's work? The service is always great and never disappoints. The bonus? This place is situated right on the bay with stunning views of Alcatraz and the rest of the bay. Perfect place for a celebratory meal.

Ps: the butter here is amazing.
author: Zane K.

description:
We came here about a week ago because of all the positive & 5 star ratings! The place was on the pier, beautiful view from inside onto the water.

Ordered the fish & chips off the kid's menu for our son. It looked delicious. The fried fish must of been good because he eat the entire thing. It came with potatoes, onions and I think .. sweet potatoes.

We shared the Double Crab and Double Shrimp. But honestly, I'm not sure if we even received the "Double" because it didn't look like it. The shrimp wasn't anything special, it was regular size shrimp if not smaller? Everything was spread over a hot steaming pan. The crab tasted OK and the shrimp was okay. We also ordered the crab chowder, which was delicious! 

The server we had, forgot her name (Sorry!) was really friendly. She was nice enough to interact with our 5 year old son. I believe she complimented on his curly hair as well. If it wasn't for her great customer service, I wouldn't of even gave this review 3 stars! It was a bit over priced, maybe you're paying for the location because what we ordered wasn't all that great. I would rather spend $97 at another seafood restaurant.
author: Yee W.

description: Had dinner with the family there tonight, the food was okay, yet very pricey but was very clear that their priority was to turn the table as fast as possible.  Our waiter showed up, no greeting and asked for both our drink and food order.  We did not see him again til he brought the bill.  Food came out in under 10 minutes and they had us with check in hand in 45 minutes.   This place is a factory, I am sure they make a ton of money but for what we paid we will go somewhere else next time.
author: AC E.

description:
Wanted to have dinner near the fireworks show at Pier 39, but wanted to get away from the crowds.

So glad I found this place on Yelp! Everything we had was delicious, and satisfied my seafood craving. The boyfriend and I shared 1/2 dozen oysters, double mussels and crab platter, crab alfredo, and steamed clams!

Not only did we get window seating overlooking the beautiful SF bay and Alcatraz, we saw the fireworks right from our table!

Love their wine menu also, very reasonably priced compared to most restaurants in SF.

Will definitely come back when I'm in the area and feel like pretending to be a tourist :)
author: Ivana Y.

description: I LOVE the look of this restaurant and we had to come and try their food.  We were fairly pleased from beginning to end starting with the retro decor, the views, the drinks and the delicious food.  The only area we felt was lacking was the service.  Our server seemed either aloof or nervous or just plain uninterested.  But we didn't let it get to us too much and enjoyed our surroundings which include an amazing view of the water even though we were seated at high tops and not right by a window.  They provide binoculars for your viewing pleasure which is a nice touch.  Of course we had to order the crab and it was uniquely made in that it is baked with the seasonings on it and not just steamed and served with butter.  So delicious I had to try it at home.  I was told we went during a time (August) when the crab is imported and not caught fresh in CA but we loved our food anyway.
author: Bianca A.

description: Absolutely loved this place, fancy, but casual.. Eveything on the menu looked really good.. Seafood is delicious and fresh, I had clams, shrimp, and crab legs, and calamari... Couldn't get enough.. BOMB  Mmm can't wait  to go back to SF and try this place again.. I'll pick something else from the awesome menu.. And the sourdough bread is great of course.. Made fresh from a couple buildings over..
author: Big Game J.

description: Great Seafood. If you want dungeness crab this is the place. I used Opentable and reserved a table and was lucky enough to get a view of Alcatraz. Easy walk from most Wharf hotels . They do a lot of business and its summer so reserve early. Reasonably priced for San Francisco.
author: A F.

description:
This is one our favorites for food and views of the bay.  With the opening of crab season, our theatre group of 10 decided to go after a Sunday matinee.  We were seated promptly on the second level giving everyone a water view although the sun had already set.  Our server, Laura was simply outstanding. She greeted us with a warm, friendly smile that never left her face.  She took drink orders for cocktails and wine, immediately brought wine glasses which was followed by plenty of sourdough bread and butter. 

We enjoyed our drinks while trying to make decisions on dinner.  Laura helped us to make good choices for appetizers and entrees.  Most of us had the crab chowder in a cup or sourdough bowl, crab Louie's or crab in an iron skillet.  All of it was terrific!  Great food, good friends, Jordan Chardonnay, and our wonderful server, Laura - doesn't get much better.

They called three cabs for us which were waiting as we left happy and fully satisfied.
D, B. G, C, M, J, L, B, J,A.
author: Dennis W.

description: Disgusting food and lazy poor service! Greasy "roasted" shrimp, the likes of which Captain D's wouldnt serve. The views are incredible but this place is HORRIBLE. On the way out had to stop by the restroom and the theme of disgusting was present there as well. Do NOT go here.
author: Terri C.

description: The moment I walked in I got seated and got served water and bread, talk about fast service lol. The view is beautiful, I could see Alcatraz from my booth. Waiter took our orders promptly and the service is ABOVE AVERAGE. Food came out hot and fast. The food was delish and you get why you pay for if you know what I mean lol. Everything was great just a little pricey for my taste but a great overall experience. I would come back. Make sure you guys get the Crab Fondue!!!!!
author: Jonathan L.

description: The service is great  the view cannot be beat. My husband had a mixture of things. He had shrimp cocktail,1/2 dozen oysters and clam chowder. I ordered the crab alfredo. Everything was great. The bread made the meal.
author: Kay O.

description: Broken glass windows, shells broken in the food, hair in the food, poor service, argumentative staff, food splattered on the walls since god knows when... If you're ok with all of this then feel free to eat here.
author: Cody M.

description: Food was very good but our waiter was a little too busy that he forgot to check up on us. People around us that came after us got their food first. Then we All got our food but my daughter's pasta still haven't come out yet. Our food came out an hour later of our arrival. Our waiter didn't even check on the us or check with the kitchen why our food was taking so long. All we ordered was 2 cup of soup, 1 iron skillet, 2 kids pasta and 1 pasta plate. Not happy with the service I got but the food itself is good.
author: Melinda H.

description: Have no complaints about this place. They have some tasty dessert options as well. I had chowder in a bread bowl, can never go wrong with that. My grandmother had fish and chips which she enjoyed as well.
author: Alexis R.

description:
Very good food with good view of the ocean. I had the full crab enchilada, hubby had the crab & smoked salmon bellini and the wharf crabs slider. We shared a calamari as an appetizer. 
All of our food were very tasty, something prepared fresh from scratch. My enchilada was no ordinary enchilada, the red sauce in my enchilada taste like cioppino with very good seafood flavors than the regular enchilada heavy red sauce. They certainly do not skimp on the seafood, all of our food were full of chunky seafood. 
Their ice cream, can't miss that !!! Trust me, the vanilla ice cream was so creamy and milky, with a very intense milky flavor mix with just a hint of sweetness, totally heavenly. A must try !!!!!
author: candace c.

description: View is fantastic. Food is simply ok. No quality here. Overpriced for the quality and lack of service. We ordered clam chowder for each person, fish and chips for the kids, crab enchiladas, which was recommended and a seafood pasta.  The chowder was ok. Within Seconds of getting the chowder the food arrived. We told the waiter we were surprised everything g came together we just got the soups, He seemed annoyed and told us, that's just how it is. We bring it out when it's ready. So by the time we finished the soup the rest of the food was cold. The seafood pasta was good. The rest was extremely bland. The only reason I give this 2 stars is because the window seating was fantastic.
author: Alex S.

description: Horribly disappointed. I took my family if 6. It cost over $150 and that included have 2 kids meals and my hubby not eating. The food was subpar at best. My crab was over cooked. Service was ok not decent and the restraunt needed to be cleaned. Would never return. Very sad.
author: Sara D.

description: My fiance and I visited SF for the first time and were excited for a good meal in Fisherman's Wharf. We looked around at the many restaurants and decided on the Franciscan. When we walked in, there were multiple employees at the hostess stand but no one would acknowledge us. When we eventually got a table, the man who ended up being our server saw us climb into our booth and told us that we couldn't just "seat ourselves". We told him we were seated by the host and for the remainder of our time at the restaurant, he was less than friendly. Our food did arrive quickly, but he never checked in with us or asked if we needed anything. He passed our table countless times and we were never acknowledged, although the surrounding tables seemed to have great service. When we finally stopped him to ask for our bill, he seemed surprised and ran to get it. We had to wait another 10-15 minutes and started to get angry before a nice lady (who I assume was the manager) came by and got our bill. The only positive thing about this place was the view. Otherwise it was just overpriced with average food and extremely unwelcoming.
author: Anna M.

description: Just ordering 24 oysters and a whole crab and the median steamers. 2 spoiled oysters almost upset the whole meal! And the crab is so "Costco" and meets are dried and not sweet. It was my favored restaurant in San Francisco, but the quality of raw materials are giving me another thought.
author: Wilson C.

description: Booth was dirty when I was seated.  It's hard to believe some outdated restaurants still use carpeting, yuck!  Crab Enchilada: Crab stuffed in a tortilla with canned chili's covered in canned tomato "Enchilada" sauce. The best thing about this place is the view & the bread was ok.  I won't be returning.
author: Roger A.

description: Really beautiful restaurant, my husband and I had lunch over the weekend! Very impressed with the staff, attentive and friendly! We started off with the octopus crudo and buratta cheese amazing! Then we shared the combo of crab, shrimp and mussels plenty of food for two and very reasonably priced!
author: Kristan D.

description: The atmosphere and service was amazing. The server we had was Ben- he was friendly, personable and very knowledgeable about the food. We had calamari, crab chowder, house salads, Dungeness crab and steamed shrimp. Everything was delicious. We also were at a table right next to the window. It was awesome to see the Bay while dining. My mom is disabled- although the restaurant was in the second floor- it was easy enough to get around. Everyone was also very accommodating.
author: Lillian Y.

description: Culinary excellence. My dinner was @ $125.00 and I devoured fresh oysters and crab like a king........AWESOME FOOD !!  This was CHEAP for the experience. Hope to make it back here. Shrimp cocktail from heaven.
author: Neal S.

description: My husband and visited this restaurant twice while we were in San Francisco. It is absolutely the best in service and culinary. The restaurant was busy and the waiters  were friendly and attentive. Our cocktails and meal was served in a timely manner. And the restaurant is beautiful with large windows looking out at the bay. The second time we visited we ate on the patio. Same great service and food and we got to people watch. Our favorite waiters Issac and Ruy. Thank you. Anyone who dines here will love it.
author: Cathy A.

description: The food was excellent - the basa was very nice and the cioppino sauce was very nice. The chowder was tasty, as well. Yuri, our server, was truly outstanding. He was efficient, VERY polite, and attentive while being unobtrusive. One of the best servers I've EVER encountered, anywhere.
author: Barry B.

description: Great views, good food and worth a visit if you've got the cash and don't mind wearing a bib in public. The flat iron mussels and shrimp I will remember for years to come. I have since annoyed my dining companions as I can't stop talking about them!
author: Troy B.

description: Didn't have a good experience on Valentine's Day for dinner. Food is so-so. Not to die for. They didn't try to accommodate 4 adults with a baby. Given that I just reserved for 4 adults, but they clearly saw us,  we were struggling to dine in a booth with half of my brothers behind (butt) on the chair, they just ignored us. We asked if we could move right across from us where we could better place the baby carrier but was declined. I wished they could have offered better solution to our ordeal.  Really left a bad taste.  I will not go back here and will not recommend it either.
author: Joanne P.

description: This place was recommended to us, and I reaaally wanted to like it. Especially for the price. Unfortunately, that was not the case. I ordered the crab alfredo, which tasted like packaged Lipton alfredo with stringy, shell-filled bits. It was not great, and for nearly $30, downright awful. My husband ordered the crab enchiladas. I mean this earnestly, not to be a complete jerk; a burrito from Taco Bell would have tasted better for 1/10 the cost. Our server was pleasant and attentive, and the views of the Bay and Alcatraz island were beautiful. For that alone, I give this place 2 stars.
author: K P.

description: Location is prime! Food is mediocre and prices are too high. Yellowtail carpaccio is to die for! Server forgot to put in two of our orders. Clam and crab chowders are much better at fog Harbor.
author: Tyler H.

description: The food is very good!  The view is nice no matter where you are seated.  The food servers are good in covering each other's back and make your dining experience delightful.   It is in the heart of the wharf, so be ready for mayham,  but be patient as their food is worth it
author: Jerry V.

description: What a disappointment! Went here with a group last night and our soups were served barely lukewarm. They did reheat them - but it felt like they just put them in the microwave. The others in our party enjoyed their cioppino and their clams. My breakdown was basically $58 for a bowl of soup, small fried calamari, 4 oysters and a glass of wine. I was not blown away. Would not recommend. Sorry :(
author: Ni C.

description: The food was great! The crabs were flavorful and meaty. I ordered the prefix which is a salad, crabs,and ice cream. The only issue I had was the quality of service.  It was terrible.  She wasnt attentive. Didn't check on us but from a distance trying to read my mouth.  She actually said the they are trained not to go to tables an engage... in so many words. I was appalled. ..
author: Angela P.

description: We were looking for a place for our last meal in San Francisco, and wanted to eat at Fisherman's Wharf. Wr are so glad we chose this restaurant!  SIL and I shared the prosciutto burrata ( delicious!). We then each enjoyed a house salad ( so fresh. The avocados were  really flavorful and the dressing was out of this world). We were stuffed by then, but we had ordered the crabcakes so we forced ourselves to eat them. Boy, are we glad we did. They were incredibly flavorful and yet so delicate. Unfortunately we didn't leave room for dessert, so you're on you own there.
author: Gay P.

description:
Food was okay, absolutely nothing special: shrimps, mussels, crab - nah. Don't think that it's all was worth 200$ bill...

We got: (7 people in a row and believe me, we were planning to go to In and Out which was close by..)

1. Fresh oysters on ice (5/5) - 2.45$ each

We ordered 18 peaces and it was kind of an appetizer for the whole group. 
Oysters were fresh and delicious, can't complain.

2. 2 Crab Chowders (5/5) - 14.95$

According to my friend.. It was REAL FOOD from the whole crap that we ordered (c)
No comments :)

3. Mussels ans shrimps LARGE (2/5) - 29.95$

Shrimps were mouth-watering and yammy! Mussels were kinda different - some were good and well-done, some were small and smelled disgusting, so 2 stars just because of shrimps. 

4. Whole Crab (for the whole family :) (3/5) - 36.95$

Wasn't really surprised.. It was cooked, but it was plain, not juicy. That's why not really worth the price. 

+ we wanted to put 2 tables together to have the view on the Bay and Alcatraz, but the host didn't let us which was pretty grouse, especially when they didn't have that big amount of customers.
author: Olga B.

description: Great meal there while on a short visit to SF. The Dungeness crab was the best!  The decor and view can't be beat. If you're a tourist near Fisherman's Wharf, do yourself a favor and get a meal there.
author: Brian M.

description:
Ate here after a sunset cruise that ended right next door. Mostly picked it because it was the closest place that was open. The food was pretty good. The crab cakes were yummy - stuffed full of real crab without a lot of cracker filler. I had the clam chowder in a bread bowl which was good and a decent portion size. Hubby ate the crab legs which he seemed to enjoy but weren't significantly better than crab legs we've had in other places. Avriel our server was the right amount of attentive and took care of us well the whole night. 

The bay windows would make this a gorgeous place to eat during the day but couldn't see anything at night. 

1 star off for prices - our crab cakes, chowder, and 1 pound of crab legs was over $70 and was mostly average-just above average in taste. Good, but not wow-ing.
author: Kate B.

description:
Wow - such an incredible experience at Franciscan. The location & view is one of a kind, but the service & food sets it apart. 

I dined with my husband & 2 kids (17 year old boy & 11 year old girl). It was our last meal in San Francisco before traveling home to the mid-west. 

Our server was Ben J. He was attentive, knowledgeable & kind. He made the evening 'fun' & ensured that we ordered the right meal based on our meal 'likes'.

We ordered the oysters, octopus, salmon, short ribs, cioppino and seafood pasta. Everything was incredible. We are still talking about it!  Such a treat to enjoy such a delicious and fresh meal with absolutely impeccable service. 

Many thanks to Stephanie, for her fantastic management, props to the master chef and team for the delicious feast and special thanks to Ben J for his 5 star service!  We will recommend this restaurant to everyone!
author: Cathy B.

description: Staff was exceptional and service was prompt. Very nice date atmosphere and upscale. Definitely will be returning and the food is amazing!
author: Nathan S.

description:
Watching the sunset from this place was the highlight of my mini San Francisco vacation. The food was a little pricey but it's seafood and seafood always is expensive so nothing shocking...

LOVED the crab cakes.
author: Erica P.

description: This restaurant was amazing! Omg the endless crab legs deliciously flavored w/ tasty seasoning. It was like a party in my mouth. Ordered the octopus carpaccio, oysters that were FRESH and delicious, a petite filet cooked to perfection, the garlic steamed clams, and their famous frozen ice cream dessert. Everything ordered was on point with flavor. The octopus carpaccio was a creative seafood dish. I was impressed. Service was excellent and ambiance was romantic and relaxing. Highly recommend this restaurant for your next San Francisco visit. A little pricey, but worth every penny. For the two of us it was about $300 but we ordered a ton. Definitely got more food than most places and the view was worth the cost. A huge place, two stories in fact. So I think you can show up without a reservation.  five stars from me!
author: Terri E.

description: My husband and I thought the food was excellent (his salmon was incredibly good) I had a great seafood and linguine dish.  Our server was very attentive.  Very pleased.
author: Denise B.

description:
Yeah, it's pricey, and it is certainly a tourist place in the heart of fisherman's wharf, but the food is excellent, and the service is impeccable.

My daughter didn't care where we went, as long as she could get clam chowder in a sourdough bread-bowl.  But I'm all about the crab, so I chose the Franciscan.  For as long as we've lived in Nashville, I've complained about not being able to get crab enchiladas, so when I opened the Franciscan's menu and saw crab enchilada, I knew we had come to the right place.  They were everything I'd hoped they'd be.  They were stuffed full of meaty Dungeness crab, and then smothered in a wonderful sauce that was just spicy enough, without being overpowering.
author: Larry S.

description: We enjoyed our meal here. We tried the oysters, the crab fondue, the combo iron skillet which has shrimp, crabs and mussels, clam linguine and crab Alfredo. Service was fast and best of all they validate  for 3 hours free parking.
author: Priti P.

description: Love coming the Franciscan! Their fresh seafood is apparent. Recently, enjoyed the Sea Bass, Fish & Chips, Dungeness Crab and Calamari. We had an amazing view during sunset. Service is always top notch here. Great food, you will not be disappointed.
author: Mrs. M.

description: This place is so charming. It's right on the water & is shaped like a boat. I had the Filet Mignon, Whole Crab, and Garlic Noodles. The Filet was the most tender cut of meat I've tasted since having Filet Mignon in Rome! It was like butter!!!! So delicious!!! Came with mashed potatoes in a delicious sauce. The crab was so fresh. Didn't need a drop of butter. Flavor was so sweet. And best garlic noodles I have ever had. Definitely won't be going back to Crustaceans anymore. Puts their boring garlic noodles & previously frozen tasting crab to shame! Sour dough bread was so delicious too. I am dying to go back. My new favorite restaurant.
author: Caity C.

description: Clam chowder to die for! Mussels are superb! This is the only restaurant that has cooked the mussels to perfection. Never rubbery or undercooked. I never liked clam chowder before, until I had it here. Now, I look forward to eating here every time I am in town. Also, today I was served the best Mojito I have ever had!! Service has always been excellent and courteous.
author: Aleida R.

description: Best seafood we had in San Fran! Everything looked so good so it was hard to choose but all our meals were 10/10. We got to see the sunset over Alcatrez while waiting for our meals. The meals were terrific. Really enjoyed and full of flavor. Have recommended to my brother who is traveling there in a few weeks.
author: Emma Z.

description: Outstanding - all around; would come for every meal if we could!! Isaac is unreal! Can't wait to be back!
author: Meg T.

description:
7:15 PM: Randomly we pick Franciscan from the many restaurants around Fisherman's Wharf, only really wanting a last drink before catching the cable car back downtown.

7:25 PM: After making our way upstairs (the main restaurant and bar is located on the second floor), we sit at the bar and are promptly given a drink menu and food menu. 

7:30 PM: Once we order, the bartender prepares our first round immediately. Two guys ran the bar for a 3/4 full house, without delay, the whole time we were there.

7:55 PM: Second round.

8:10 PM: After deciding to order food at the bar afterall, we're brought a bread basket and place settings. To be honest the woman next to us when we sat down was eating crabs so we were doomed from the beginning.

8:20 PM: She orders seafood combo (mussels, shrimp, crabs) and I order fish and chips. 

8:22 PM: Bartender brings over crab crackers, bibs, wetnaps, shell bowl, little fork. 

8:40 PM: Food arrives. We eat and chat with a nice woman from SoCal next to us. 

9:25 PM: I get a third drink. It's vacation whatev. 

9:55 PM: Settle up and leave. 

$$$ - 118. Seafood combo, fish and chips, two draft pilsners, two mixed drinks, and a Corona. 

Drinks - Blood orange mermerita. Basically a tequila sunrise with lime and lemon instead of grenadine. Our bartender was the man. One con is that the bar tab doesn't transfer to the table tab. Eh. 

Food - Seafood combo was overall great. Came out on a huge sizzling iron skillet. Crabs were excellent, mussels were slightly overcooked but good, and the shrimp were overcooked (shrimp flavor washed out by garlic). Fish and chips came with a huge piece of fish and was very filling. While both were very satisfying and delicious, I'm not quite convinced their prices were justified. 

Service - Ate at the bar so this review is limited, but it was very fast and our bartenders were friendly. Not too talkative, but whatever. 

Ambiance - Very classy 50's throwback with black and white photos covering the walls, red vinyl upholstery, marble tabletops, dim-ish lighting with warm red fill. The real kicker for this place is the bay view. ~15-20ft windows cover the entire bayside wall giving you an excellent view. There is even a heated open porch seating area for nice nights.

EDIT: Franciscan was a high 4 to begin with, but any business owner that will follow-up on and consider their patron's experience (as documented on Yelp!) gets a 5th star in my book!
author: James R.

description: We stopped here for a couple of drinks. The bartender was very nice and was prompt. The drinks were pricey but not that bad for San Francisco especially on the waterfront. The views were amazing, and we have the fish and chips. I highly recommend getting the fish and chips it is more than enough food and is totally worth it!
author: Joseph H.

description:
First time, wonderful experience. 27th wedding anniversary and the recommendation from family members gave us a Great start in the city. 
Made reservations for 8pm on a Saturday with Open Table. Location was perfect on the bay and the scenery was magnificent. Open Bay waters with Alcatraz island sitting in the middle. Came early, 7:30pm and seated within 10 mins. Bianca, our waitress was Fabulous, very attentive and patient with the new people. The drinks were very good and the crab was a delight. We walked out of the restaurant full of crab with memories of a Great time.  The noise level was a little high but drowned out by the "cracking of crab". Lovers and special occasions parties, make a reservation and ask for a "Red Booth and a view of Alcatraz" you won't go wrong.
author: John94521 H.

description:
The view alone is worth it. This retro-style restaurant is fancy and expensive. We had spent a day sightseeing in San Francisco when we stopped by for a quality meal. I was wearing a t-shirt from my favorite brewery in Seattle. My advice on attire: if you're bumming it for an adventure day in Seattle, stop by your hotel to change before heading to the Franciscan. 

We had two servers during our dinner. One of them was awesome. The other, not so much. 

The food itself was ok but not grand. The menu is extensive so even if you get an average meal on your first visit, it might be worth exploring the menu on a return trip to San Fran. 

Overall, I liked this place. It gave a sweet finish to our San Fran experience.
author: Sharece B.

description: Totally outstanding! The food is incredible. The service superb. Very fun comfortable place with great views.
author: Ian L S.

description: Nice old school ambiance with great view out to Alcatraz. Lots of boating action on the bay to watch. We shared three small plates and food was very good. Service was friendly and prompt.
author: Norm F.

description: We had two terrific meals here and so enjoyed the atmosphere.  It may have one of the best views at the pier.  Loved the crab louis sliders and crab enchiladas.   Get one of the raised booth seats facing the window by the bar.  You can't beat the experience.
author: Rick R.

description:
Happy to update my earlier review with a visit from this past weekend. I specifically picked this restaurant to take some friends that were visiting from Canada. We loved it !  Yes it is a bit pricey, but you are paying for a lovely location and ambiance. We all ordered different things and loved them all. Clean plates all around. We even ordered desert which I rarely do. YUM!! 

Our entire visit was more than pleasant and the staff was quite friendly. Drinks were refilled on cue which is a big deal for me. I was quite thrilled to be able to share this slice of the wharf area with my friends that came so far away.
author: Christina G.

description:
The good: Open late. Seafood was fresh. Service was great. Food was good. THE YELLOWTAIL CARPACCIO WAS SOOO GOOD!!

The bad: Price / selection of food. We ordered 3 items and paid $60ish. After feeling ripped off by the Golden Gate bakery, my hubby and i were feeling guilty and was hoping for a semi-modest dinner. This was not the place for that haha. P.S. I didn't see anyone eating the free bread - it was not very good and felt like it could chip my tooth if I wasn't careful. 

The food:  
1) Yellow Tail Carpaccio - the fish was fresh, and perfect with the ponzu sauce. I could have eaten two orders of this by myself and this alone made the meal for me. 

2) Cioppino - the marinara sauce was perfect. The crab, clams, and mussels were really good. If I get this again, I'll try to ask for no fish fillet pieces, shrimp or calamari rings. Those took away from the actual eating part more than adding to it although I'm sure they helped make the marinara richer and tastier. I got the regular size (the smallest one) which was bigger than the picture. I could not finish it due to the size. I would not miss the bread slice that it came with.

2) Sourdough bowl - It was ok. Too baconey (the taste) for me. I prefer the seafood and cream aftertaste more than bacon for my chowder. Did I really just say something had too much bacon?!?!
author: Carla A.

description:
Amazing view of the Pacific - binoculars at tables to see out to Alcatraz Island, etc.

The food is 10/10. I had mussels in butter sauce & tried shrimp linguini alfredo as well... so good! Recommend waiter Ben.
author: Kaitlyn H.

description:
I wrestled with giving 3 or 4 stars, but feel that 3 is the best representation. I don't head to the wharf much, but had friends in town who wanted crab and wanted it there. The place was nice, and we were seated promptly. But after asking our waiter for water and time to look over the menu, he vanished for quite a while. That was pretty disappointing.

Three of us ordered the Too Two Crab, which is two large crabs weight about 3-plus pounds, intended for three people to share. It was good, but we honestly expected something to come with it. No veggies, no sides. The waiter didn't even ask us if we wanted something to accompany our crab meat party. 

The crab itself was very good, and we each got a dessert which we enjoyed (I went with the Italian sundae - vanilla custard with olive oil and sea salt). The meal wasn't bad at all, and I imagine we paid what most places up there would charge. But it wasn't special and I would imagine you can get similar at many of the other joints nearby doing the same thing.
author: David B.

description: Ernesto made the most awesome drinks for us..  He never stopped... Anyone would love to have him as an employee...
author: Debbie L.

description: One of our worst experiences in San Francisco!  It was our last night in town. We wanted oysters!  We ate at the restaurant downstairs. After paying, they told us they didn't have horseradish!!!  Long story short, they didn't even have saltine crackers for oysters!!  And the manager said we could leave our information to request our money back when we handed the oysters right back to her!  Absurd . Frustrating. Disappointing. Unbelievable.
author: Juli I.

description: The steamed clams were good, but the steak was yuck.  Beautiful restaurant and view though.  Eat at Crab House!!
author: Jennifer P.

description:
Went for Thanksgiving and part of my frustration is a restaurant on the very busy Fisherman's Wharf should not be opened for a holiday if the staff is not willing to give it their all to their patrons. Yes, I get it..you have to work on a holiday...it sucks. But if you are going to be open for business (and obviously we aren't the only ones who think of going out on the holiday - the wait without a reservation was over two hours), then try to make it pleasurable for your guests.

There were four of us - two adults, a teenage boy and a six-year old. First thing I asked, if they would be able to accommodate making a grilled cheese sandwich or something for the little but I was quickly silenced with a "No, we can't do that"...alrighty then.

We ordered the crab fondue and calamari for an appetizer, which were both quite tasty.
The boy-man ordered the shrimp fettuccine and he was quite happy with it and the hubby and I ordered the sizzling iron skillet, which was really good,.

I ordered a glass of wine and had to remind our server to bring it, but not a huge deal.

Here's where it got interesting...there were about 8000 people at the host stand (not really, but it felt like it) and I asked where the restrooms were. The manager tells me "straight back and to the right" and under his breath...says to the hostess standing next to him "duh, right under the sign that says restrooms". I swear, if it weren't a day for being thankful, I would have told him to shove it, but who knows what battle he faces every day so I just turned and gave him the stink-eye and proceeded with my evening. When I returned from the restroom, all the dishes were cleared and we were asked immediately if there was anything else? My daughter asked for dessert but we weren't inclined to stay any longer.
