Overall, it was an unsatisfying experience and maybe they just had an off day but I'm not in a hurry to go back.

4 solid stars for the food
2 stars for the customer service
author: Sonja T.

description: My experience here was very pleasant! We were told we would be waiting 25 minutes for a table, but my family only waited about 10 minutes. Our waitress was super friendly and attentive. A bit pricey for the amount of crab legs I ordered, but I'm just glad I got some. Oh, and we had an awesome view of Alcatraz! I would recommend this place to any tourists trying to get a feel of fisherman's wharf.
author: Loren C.

description: The chowder was ok, it was crab chowder. I felt that the waitress was annoyed when we couldn't make up our minds on what to eat. I was really tired and really was hoping for a decent but lite Option for something to eat. The atmosphere was cozy and interesting with all the celebs framed on the walls. The food was ok
author: Nancy Y.

description: I would recommend this place especially on a special day if you want to ruin it; because that is exactly what happened to me on Christmas. Our reservation was for 6:15 but for some reason, we had to wait for more than an hour to be seated. When I asked about what went wrong, the reply that I got back was, "We can't force people to leave". This would have been a reasonable excuse if we had to wait for 10 to 20 minutes. By the way, it was Christmas; people want to enjoy their meals with enough time. But an hour? Something else must have been the problem other than that. Also, the service wasn't good. Nobody really explained anything about the menu and the menu was just thrown to us. The crab was hard to eat; and was overcooked. The chowder was okay but nothing special to it. The best thing about this place was the bread.
author: Donghyun L.

description: The view was great and the food was okay. I think it's a bit over priced. The service was just okay
author: J J.

description:
The food is good, not great, and nowhere near good enough for what they're charging. 

By far my biggest complaint is the staff. Nobody seems at all interested in doing their job. From where I'm seated (I'm actually still in the dining area) I can hear employees complaining and making fun of a few customers. But my favorite experience has been the gentleman who delivered my main course. He actually leaned on the bread while delivering the food. That's right, his right hand placed my dish in front of me while his left hand squished the bread on my table. 

With the views and location, this place will always have customers. Don't be one of them.
author: Micky S.

description: The crab was good, the sea base was very good, however the clam chowder was disappointing. I have had better from Progresso. The restaurant and the view are spectacular. The wait staff was good.
author: Lauren O.

description: The food is great. Super fresh seafood, the world famous baked crab is great, the view is fantastic. Place is right on the water. The crab cakes were great and the shrimp cocktail is the best I ever had. I would love to go back again. If only I lived there!
author: Jay R.

description: When you make a reservation and never get contacted before showing up, you expect the restaurant to honor it. We showed up before the time of our reservation approximately 3 minutes and I was told by hostess, sorry we are running 45 minutes to 1 hour behind. She showed to no remorse and literally turned her back on me and walked away. So much for honor, trust or credibility.
author: Dennis G.

description:
Super touristy. Who cares, I am a tourist. I loved the place nonetheless! Seated right away without any reservations. Lucky to grab a window seat facing Alcatraz! 

I tried raw oysters for the first time. It was delicious, so we had to order more! We had the crab feast and it was so worth the money. Crab was easy to crack and was seeping with spices and butter. Delicious. Don't be afraid to rock the bib! Lmao. The clam chowder came in a bread bowl, which in my opinion was just okay. I wish I skipped it and made more room for crab! I was completely satisfied with my meal!

My only regret, not going back to the Franciscan for a second round...
author: Jacqueline G.

description: This is such a HUGE disappointment in having to write this as a one star review. Initially upon my visit I planned on raving about what an amazing place this was, and how delicious the food was! Unfortunately I cannot do that as my husband and I got violently sick with food poisioning shortly after our visit. We ordered calamari, oysters, and the skillet with crab, mussels, and shrimp. I daydreamed about eating at this place since being a kid, and now I regret ever coming. My six hour drive back to Orange County was miserable the whole way due to still feeling ill on Sunday morning. We hadn't eaten anything at all prior to the restaurant on Friday. With that being said, the rest of our trip was a nightmare of having the fear of paying further consequences if choosing to eat, so we opted not to eat. If anything the one star would be to the blonde waitress that was attentive and sweet. Other than that, I would never ever eat at this place again. My entire holiday vacation was totally ruined due to getting so sick!
author: LisaMarie G.

description: Awesome fondue . . great view of the wharf and street lights from outdoor patio.. excellent service. . casual atmosphere with 5 star menu
author: Athenna C.

description: Service 5 stars Miguel was attentive and always around without us having to ask. They have little electronic devices they type the orders into so they come out even faster. I love that. The table was inside and had a nice view of the bay. Scenery 5 stars also because there were binoculars attached to the seat for my use! The food 3/5 nothing to brag about or revisit. Which was disappointing Bc I was counting on good crab legs. Like previous posts they are far too garlicy for my taste and I do love garlic. I would recommend it to tourists because of the views and service. But perhaps there can be better food found elsewhere.
author: Shannon L.

description: Phenomenal service, phenomenal environment, amazing food and the most delicious mashed potatoes I've ever had in my life! Skip the crab chowder. It tastes like cream of chicken soup. Go for the clam chowder instead
author: Misses M.

description:
Came with my boyfriend and his family. I shared the Lotsa Crab with my boyfriend. It was pretty good. We also ordered some bread and dipped that in the sauce that the crab was drenched in and that was delicious.

It was pretty pricey though. It's a restaurant that caters to tourist so I understand the price surge but the dish we had was almost $60. It says that the portion is for two but it barely filled the two of us. We had to go get something else to eat not long afterwards. There's other less expensive options like salads, sandwiches, and small plates. But if you want crab, be prepared to spend at least $25 per person.

Other than that the food was good, the staff was friendly, and the view was amazing. 

The only thing that I didn't like was that when I tried to call in for a reservation for our party the phone was kept busy for over half an hour! I don't know if they purposely kept the phone off the hook or if there was only one line and it was being used the entire time I tried calling but I ended up using OpenTable to reserve a table.

I don't know if I'll be back since I wasn't wowed and for the money that was spent I could be getting better food elsewhere where I'll actually get full for under $60.
author: CK G.

description: 5 stars the view. 3 for the food and that's being generous. Go and have some crab chowder and a drink. Everything is very over priced for the quality but again...the view is fantastic.
author: Ana P.

description: Awesome place with an awesome view.  My husband and I ordered crab legs.  Delicious!  Even our pre dinner salads were delicious.  My husband had the Caesar salad and I had the baby spinach salad with bacon crumbles.  Good selection of cocktails and beer.  Friendly and excellent waitress.  We had about a 10 minute on a Sunday evening.  Looked like the wait got longer by the time we left. So get here early!
author: Christy S.

description: Grabbed a quick lunch here on the bottom/entry level, after doing some touristy stuff around town.  The fish sandwich here is great! Flaky and very crisp.  Good place to stop by and grab a bite on the wharf.
author: Ashley R.

description: The oysters and the shrimp cocktail are really fresh and delicious, along with the cocktail sauce served with it. Mussels fantastic, view beautiful. Nice clean place. 2nd time here and good both times. Bloody Mary is fab. Service pretty good too. Definitely one of the best places in the Wharf.
author: Summer C.

description: Great food, nice location, fancy place, nice views but lousy service for the price we paid for.
author: Jio P.

description:
This place makes crab enchilladas. They are awesome. 

The place is pretty big on atmosphere and the view. You can see the ocean and Alkatraz from here. The food was pretty good. Decent but not as good as I thought it would be. The drinks were not good at all in my opinion.
author: Kevin W.

description: This is a very special restaurant for my lady and me. Love the view and we always order the Lotsa Crab. We think it's the best in the City
author: Phil L.

description: We went here again for the 6th time on our visit to SF last week. Had raw oysters, crab, steak & desserts. Dinner was fabulous and our waiter Reggie was awesome!. We will return again & again!
author: Toan D.

description:
Nothing personifies San Fran more. Service is impeccable, food quality is premium, view is second to none. 

Crab and fish is served well seasoned without beating the hell out of it with spices. Drinks are well balanced. Tables are marble. 

So there it is, be dumb and pass this up- I guess it just means less wait time for me.
author: E L.

description: This place used to be better. It was kind of disappointing when we visited. All the entrees really felt half a$$ed. Also, the crab was intensely oversalted, probably because it was boiled in salt water before then being seasoned again.
author: Alex C.

description:
This is a review of the bar only. 

The best bartenders of the weekend ... hands down! These guys are so friendly and their drinks are over the top creative. My husband and I were in the City for the weekend and we came here 3 times during our stay just to hang out at the bar and enjoy their amazing cocktails, stellar service and of course the best Restaurant view in San Francisco. 

Favorite drink - Basil, cucumber, vodka concoction yet to be named. OMG is was AWESOME!!
author: Christie B.

description: Great food and a great view too.  We sat on the upper level .  Service was great and so was the food.  Very pleased with everything.
author: Matt S.

description: We were seated within a few minutes of our arrival (we had no reservation). We ordered the crab feast plus a half order. The crab was excellent and the service was outstanding! Laura, our server, was very attentive and cheerful, exchanging pleasantries from beginning to end. When we come back to SF, we'll definitely be back!!
author: Robert M.

description:
I have a theory about restaurants in touristy areas: they don't feel they need repeat customers, because most visitors are, almost by definition, unfamiliar with the neighborhood.  Situated right on the coast in the busiest part of one of the busiest tourist attractions on the West Coast, this place is VERY touristy.  But I really wanted to sit down and have some of San Francisco's famous dungeness crab, touristiness be damned.

The menu had a little bit of everything, but not a whole lot of one particular thing.  We all started off with Cokes.  An eternity or two later, we were finally able to put in our order.

I had noticed they had oysters in the cold appetizers section, so I decided to have just a few.  If you eat oysters even on rare occassions, you'd probably know that oysters come in countless varieties: they have different shapes, sizes, and levels of plumpness, brininess, etc.  So when I asked the waitress what kind of oysters they serve, and she said, "fresh-shucked and raw," I could tell they don't specialize in these delicous little mollusks... But I trudged ahead anyways.

I also ordered the clam chowder and the whole dungeness crab.

Really, the food wasn't bad.  I couldn't really taste the clam chowder, though, because they never actually brought it to my table.  (The server blamed it on a computer error, but had she checked on us after they brought our food to the table, this could've been easily resolved.)  The crab was delicious as expected, and I already want more.

The view was also spectacular.  Our table was right by the window, providing us unchecked views of the entire bay surrounding the wharf.

Why two stars?  Well, that takes us back to the "touristy" thing... The food was passable, but nothing to justify the price tag (crab, Coke, and oysters cost me something like $52 plus tip).  The service was horrendous: none of us had our drinks refilled, despite verbally requesting refills.  I tipped a below-average 17% or so, but only because the server cut my crab for me.  If this restaurant were located anywhere but the busiest place in the city, frequented by people looking for the exact item they built their restaurant around, they would be out of business.  Because they probably have very few repeat customers.
author: Jeremy P.

description: A coworker and I chose this place for lunch as he was craving crab. I ordered a San Francisco staple, clam chowder. The clam chowder had a thick tasteless broth with very little clam in it. I couldn't finish it. My coworker's large crab sandwich was filled with crab and a slaw which completely obliterated the delicate taste of the crab. He also left most of it on his plate. I had already purchased a beignet. It didn't taste like any beignet I have had. I have even had homemade ones from  beginner cooks that tasted far better. The ones at Franciscan Crab was as bland and underwhelming as the rest of the meal. Very disappointed in wasting money and time here.
author: Pat C.

description: Everything was delicious. Crab and short ribs, and the crab enchiladas wow. Ben was our server, he was friendly, patient and helpful and tia and Maria the hostesses were great too.
author: Shante W.

description:
I wanted my first 2013 San Francisco review to be special. It had to be a five-star place. Maybe it's the bridges. Maybe it's the crisp, cool air that permeates through my lungs as I walk up and down these hills. Maybe it's the BART. Maybe it's the homeless populations on the streets that clear the pigeons for me as I walk through the Tenderloin. Or maybe, I'm soooo done with the LA life, it's not even funny! Whatever it is, my old boss, Harry Williams said, "Leena, you may be moving back to the Southern California sun, but you'll be back...this city gets in your blood". And 5 years later, here I am, back in my city! Watch out for the new duchess in town ;) 


So let me start by sharing one of my favorite eats in town. This place makes ditching my 2200 square-foot house for a 200 square-foot matchbox studio ALL WORTH IT! The Franciscan Crab Restaurant! Maybe cuz it has "Franciscan" in the name! I first came here with my cousin and sister. After we ate the crab, we were just so happy. See attached picture. We weren't sure what it was but the only common denominator was the crab! I call it... "The Loopy Crab". I'm not sure what those crabs were doing in the San Francisco Waters but they were seasoned so perfectly with lemon zest, butter, pepper, and pure deliciousness! I returned again and the crab just made me so happy again! See attached picture...again. 

Lastly, the service is great, and the view of Alcatraz is breathtaking. Home. Sweet. Home! :)
author: Leena B.

description: Overall, I was not impressed. We were seated very quickly as we had a reservation, but after that the service was subpar. Our waitress took our drink order and disappeared for a very long time so we couldn't order an appetizer or ask questions about the menu. We finally caught sight of her admiring herself and checking her teeth in the mirror on the back wall. She finally returned to take our order and we ordered the calamari (which was impeccable and the highlight of the meal) and she went ahead and took our dinner order as well. Dinner came out before we were half way through the app. My colleague had the Basa which she said was good and I had the crab enchiladas. They were underwhelming with being on the cold side, the tortilla was soggy and chewy and there were large pieces of shell inside. I ended up having to tear them open and just eat the insides, picking through to make sure I didn't bite into a shell again (don't want to crack a tooth!). My first disappointment in SF, won't be back.
author: Wanda C.

description: Not a tourist trap although you do get a great view of the bay! Delicious crab cake. Fresh spinach salad. Would return if looking for spot near pier 39! Server was superb and cute!
author: laura m.

description: Amazing, fresh, cooked to order seafood and chowders with an exceptional view of Alcatraz and the bay!
author: Bryce B.

description: Was visiting in town for the weekend and ended up here for some dinner one night. Very nice views with a fancy menu, and a very energetic staff. Tried the crab fondue with spinach (so good), foggy wharf crab sliders (good), in addition to half order of the roasted crab with garlic (so delicious). Nice place to try, although a bit pricey for me.
author: George P.

description: The food was good  and the view was amazing. A great first impression of San Francisco.
author: Takamashi T.

description: Cannot say enough wonderful things about this amazing restaurant.  The staff is attentive,  food delicious and the chef beyond accommodating to a member  of our party who had a severe allergy.  Yuri,  our server even came back after we placed our order and offered an alternative to the selection based on the allergy to accommodate the original choice,  customized for me.
author: Roberta B.

description: Delicious and great views!!  Be ready to be dropping in garlicky butter!!  Quiet and elegant atmosphere in the craziness of fishermans wharf tourism!
author: Stephanie G.

description: I had the Crab Enchiladas.  It was good, though not "wow".  The waiter was a bit blah. If you like getting exactly what's on the menu with 0 modifications, this is your place.
author: grep w.

description: We had a wonderful experience dining waterfront.  The service was impeccable and they were extremely accommodating to our large group.  Isaac our server was so attentive and the food was excellent.  The crab and mussels skillet is to die for.  Even a nice sweet treat with their homemade custard at the end.  Don't think this is a Fishermans Wharf tourist trap.  It is tremendous.
author: Adam B.

description: I cannot believe ---- I've never been to FCR....Probably because it's down on the waterfront -in the midst of tourism.  The crab feast was excellent as was the hot crab dip appetizer.  Although the Dungeness was from Washington and not from our Bay, I am truly thankful it WAS Dungeness!.  I made a reservation in the early afternoon and they accommodated us ON TIME and the service was impeccable by our waiter. Thank You Steven for all your recommendations -especially the Pinot Noir selection.  Our granddaughter throughly enjoyed her last meal while on Spring Break - and will have memories of a lifetime of her very first visit to San Francisco.  Thank You Franciscan!
author: Bre'a C.

description: I'll start with a positive note. This place has an amazing view!  That being said, everything else fell flat. We waited about 10 minutes before someone came to greet us at the table. Overpriced and under-delivered.  The "crab for 2" was a joke. We paid good money for dry, flavorless, over-cooked crab. Didn't look like "3.5lbs" to me at all! So disappointing!! The crab chowder is another miss. Tasted like too much flour was added in the recipe. Very bland. I won't be back. Money down the toilet. Not one single thing here was outstanding or even "great" for what we paid.
author: Tina D.

description:
This is the epitome of tourist restaurant.  You can tell the locals never go here, and the tourists eat it up.  It's located right at Fisherman's Wharf with an amazing view of the water and Alcatraz.  The walls are adorned with old photos of famous visitors, and it has the perfect amount of cheesy, fisherman decor.  The staff are helpful and friendly.  This restaurant is made for a fun time.

I started with the crab bisque.  It had nice, sweet crab morsels in a velvety broth.  It was a bit on the salty side and after the 2nd bite it became a little one-note, but it was still enjoyable.  Since I was on vacation, I figured I'd splurge on the calories and ordered the crab fettucine alfredo.  This was truely a wonderful dish.  There was an abundance of crab, and the sauce was so buttery and smooth.  The parmesan give it a nice subtle bite as well.  The serving size was quite generous, so I was able to save some to bring home with me.  It was just as good the next day.

Something tells me that even if I was a local, I'd love it just as much as I did as a tourist.
author: Alison I.

description:
Great food but very poor service. If they wanted to insult us, then they did a pretty good job of it. Price was not a problem but with prices like that I would expect good service. Never had an issue with Scoma's and maybe that's where we should have been. 

Served by Eduardo on Oct 19 at 9 PM. Asked wife if she was done with the crab legs while she was still eating. Came in a few minutes later and told us that our next course was ready and brought it over even before we could respond. The food runner immediately cleared away the crab sauce before we could respond. Also didn't clear all the plates away and therefore we knew something was wrong.

Notice another couple next to us.They were being served by another waiter and weren't being rushed. All their plates were still on the table. 

Weren't asked about dessert and would have said no anyway. The only time we weren't rushed was when we were waiting for them to charge my card. It wasn't even that the restaurant was packed. Also the food runner made a lot of noise around us clearing the other tables and setting them especially when we were the only guests around on this side of the restaurant. It seemed absolutely intentional. 

Left a 0 dollar tip but our evening was spoiled anyway. 

Will stick to Scoma's and make it a point to absolutely ensure that friends and family don't visit here.
author: Rajarshi R.

description:
Super pack restaurant even on a weekday, but probably because it's a tourist location. We were seated facing the ocean and woah was I amazed at how beautiful it was just to eat and look outside when the sky is clear. They even had binoculars at some tables for you to use. Total plus for me even though I didn't need it but the idea is just nice since you can use it when you're waiting for your food. 

Service was great! Food did not take too long to come out (this is where all the points are decreasing). My crab chowder was semi cold, so it didn't taste as great. Chowder taste great when it's HOT. Ordered a petite filet mignon with steam veggies. LOVED it, except, the meat was a tad too salty for me but I think i'm just more sensitive on that. Vegetables were perfect. We had the combo mussels, shrimps and carb. Mussel was delicious with the garlic sauce they had. The flavor to the shrimps were good but way to much flavor or salt that I felt like i needed rice or something to tasteless to blend the taste. Crab was alright, not a fan of it. My favorite part was the dark chocolate mousse cake along with the ice cream. it was the BOMB! I LOVED It! Perfect combo. thinking about it makes me want to drool. I would totally come back for the dessert. As for the food, I'm iffy about since I don't like eating cold or even warm food. I like my food hot which indicated it was just cooked and not microwave for a few minutes.

Serve was good though, they always come back to make sure everything is going well. I'm sure if i had asked them to heat my food up they would, but it's just so much of a hassle.
author: Sury C.

description: The yellow tail carpaccio was awesome. Ordered the seafood pasta which had good flavor but it took a while before it was brought to the table. When it finally came out, it looked like it had been just sitting before being brought out. When I mentioned this to the server, he kept trying to convince me it was ok... So much for the customer being right... I did not call on a manager since my time in San Fran was great and I did not want to get this to bother me... For this place being rated the best at Fisherman's Wharf, not sure I'm coming back. If I do come back, I will try their crab,
author: Luis R.

description:
I'm not sure why this restaurant does not have better reviews. We came here last week while on a trip to San Francisco. We made last minute reservations for two. 
Our waitress (I wish I remembered her name) was lovely. Although she was super busy with a huge group she was always around when we needed her. 
My boyfriend ordered a whole dungeness crab and I ordered the prix fixe. I had the house salad (dressing was to die for), the alfredo crab pasta and the dessert. I was so surprised by the amount of crab in the pasta. It seemed like every bite I had a huge piece. The dessert was a house made ice cream which was really good as well. 
I would come back next time I am in town. I was a bit hesitant at first because some of the reviews, but I am glad we gave it a try anyways.
author: Kirstyn V.

description: This is the most delicious place I know of. I go here for my most special of occasions. The food is so good that it sends a wave of relaxation over my body when I eat it. I recommend the Basa fish plate oven poached in olive oil. Bliss!
author: Jesse E.

description: Your typical commercialized, tourist hotspot on Fisherman's wharf. The food is slightly better than the typical seafood restaurant you might find in this area, but it can get a bit pricy. Service is pretty bad too. If you ask someone who's not your assigned server for anything, they say "I'm not your server" and walk away. What up with that?
author: Lauren L.

description: This was an expensive restaurant, but worth the price for us. I had the whole dungeness crab and it was fantastic. It has nice views and a fun atmosphere. The service was great.
author: Gilbert C.

description: Love this place I could eat there every meal! I love love love the place great views and amazing staff as well the food is beyond amazing! For a big place right JN the water prices were great by the skillet topped the charts!
author: Meadow R.

description:
OK, let's start off with the bathrooms. The toilets flush SO loud that I lost my appetite. Also when I went back to my table and sat down I couldn't get out of direct sunlight. I asked the waitress if I could move tables and she said "sorry sir we are fully booked" and they clearly weren't. 

I ordered the crab feast and salmon. The crab feast wasn't that much even for one. I mentioned this to my waiter and she just laughed. This greatly offended me, leaving me in a foul mood for the rest of the meal. 

The salmon was above average but it's a crab place so they could have done better on the crab. Also they had coke products but no sprite, which is absurd. 

The food is overpriced and not great. But really what you're paying for is the view. Almost every table has a nice view due to the tiered style seating. 

I would not recommend this restaurant based on the food alone. The view is nice but not worth the price. Bad restaurant.
author: Isaac M.

description: Beautiful view of the bay and Golden Gate Bridge. The food was delicious and drinks were strong:) We were told it was formal but most people dressed very casual.
author: Jamey W.

description:
Long, long.... long wait during a busy tourist day. The bar was super crowded with others waiting for a table. It's also in this insanely awkward spot between the upstairs door, hostess and surrounding seating. You basically have to "think skinny" every time someone needs to get by you. 

The prices are definitely tourist prices but that's expected. However, I'm still bitter about a $14 glass of decent wine. And by decent I mean tolerable. And by tolerable I mean it didn't cause involuntary dry heaving. 

The food was ... food? Chowders weren't the best you can get in the area. I would highly recommend the yellowtail carpaccio, however. 

I get that being a server here is probably a hassle and a half, especially when it gets slammed. That still doesn't mean you can just drop food and run, only to return with a check when we were actually still contemplating another round of food or drinks. 

I'm sure this place can be a real gem but if you see a line, look elsewhere.
author: Kelsey G.

description: We had a nice dinner here a few months ago and the food was wonderful.  Our server was fantastic and he made sure to keep a close eye on us and ensure that we had full drinks and our food order was all correct.  We had a perfect view of Alcatraz at sunset and it was amazing.  So so beautiful.  I feel that I paid for the view more then the drinks.  Sadly, the drinks weren't that great and were really over priced.  The food was fantastic and worth every penny.  That's why they didn't get a perfect 5, the drink prices and flavors was an issue for me.  Other then that we cleaned our plates.  The Calamari is amazing and I recommend that to anyone!!
author: Keli R.

description: I expected a lot out of this place... and don't get me wrong, it wasn't bad at all, it just wasn't anything special. We ordered some drinks... GREAT. The bartender had a very heavy hand, which is good because they were pretty expensive. The calamari fritti was also great. For our entree, my boyfriend and I ordered the half crab, half shrimp. The portion for $60 was disappointing. Our server especially told us it was a lot of food when we wanted to order more, but we saw the portion and immediately wished we ordered something else. The shrimp and crab wasn't anything special. It just didn't wow me, and we left with unsatisfied stomachs which always sucks when the bill was over $100.
author: Kristine B.

description:
Not a fan.  Not, a fan at all.  The food was very mediocre...my soup was not hot, the pasta was sticky, and the crab tasted like it was borderline freezer burned.  Service was slow and unresponsive.  Bread did not arrive until ¾ through our meal.  Getting a refill of water seemed to really put our server out.

The views are great and if you simply hang out on the patio with a glass of wine and some bread, you might fair alright but I had little luck here.
author: Jim K.

description:
My boyfriend and I arrived in San Francisco at about 6PM on a Friday and after being confined in our car for 7 hours during rush hour traffic we were in dire need of food - specifically mouthwatering crab! I have yet to visit San Francisco and not have crab at Fisherman's Wharf...it's on the San Francisco Trip Must-Do checklist! (Yes I have one of those....). We parked at the Wharf and never having been to the Franciscan we both decided that it looked like a good place to land after our looooong road trip.

When you first enter the restaurant you have to walk up a flight of stairs that lead you to the main dining room. Upon reaching the top you can't help but to be amazed by the gorgeous view of the San Francisco Bay as seen through the huge windows facing the bay. If it's not too busy request a seat by the window - my boyfriend and I got a table right next to one of the windows and the unobstructed view is breathtaking! 

I ordered a glass of much needed Riesling and we started off with the smoked salmon carpaccio. It was served with capers, avocado and burrata cheese drizzled with olive oil and sea salt. (Yummmm!) My boyfriend had a house salad which he enjoyed with the complimentary bread they serve. For the main course I ordered the Surf & Turf Crab with Petit Filet Mignon which was served with steamed veggies and yukon potatoes...everything was delicious and tasted even better with a little clarified butter. My boyfriend ordered the seafood alfredo which was also equally amazing especially when paired with the sourdough bread. 

The portions are quite large so we weren't able to finish our meals, but we were happy with our delicious dinner! All in all, we had a great experience at the Franciscan and look forward to our next visit!
author: Yessy F.

description:
We always eat upstairs - We like to come here when willing to weather through the tourists to do so - The crab is nicely seasoned and generous portion for the price.
We know we are getting fresh food here and it's a fun little place on the water side of Fishermans Warf.
Ariels Allure Martini is very yummy as well - a must try.
Louie Salad is very good here as well.
If you are looking for a casual yet great place to get some seasoned crab and willing to hit this area this is it. :)  Typically we park quickly in a near by lot and just hop on in to avoid too much of the tourist stuff going in in the area :)
author: Kelly M.

description:
I'm not big on seafood and I don't know how so many people like it.  I know... I know... I'm missing out on a lot of good stuff from what a lot of people tell me.  Anyways, if I find myself at seafood place, then I tend to eat non-seafood stuff which defeats the purpose of going to a seafood place.  

The restaurant was big and almost every table had a view of the bay.  The menus were in a form of a cookbook which was different from what I usually see.  I think the menu had pictures of almost every single dish so that's always helpful when deciding what to order.  The service was fast and the waiter was helpful when we asked him about things on the menu.

We ordered the Grilled Onion and Cheese Short Rib Sandwich ($14.95), the Spicy Prawns ($19.95), the Lotsa Crab ($49.95), and two Clam Chowders in the Sourdough Bread Bowl ($9.95 each).  It wasn't long before we got our orders.  The Clam Chowder tasted good to me and that probably got me a little full before my meal came.  I tried some crab but stopped after a few bites. lol  The Grilled Onion and Cheese Short Rib Sandwich was okay and I barely finished it all thanks to the Clam Chowder.

I thought this place was okay but I won't be back for awhile since I don't go to Pier 39 or even SF, in general, very often.
author: Daniel H.

description:
Chowder was cold and the grossest I have ever had. 
Salad was nasty and brown. 
Service was slow and rude. 
Do NOT GO HERE!!
author: Angela E.

description: Great view but that's all this place going for it. Service was semi satisfactory but the food is over priced, bland and small servings
author: L. C.

description: Went here for dinner and had the most memorable experience ever. The style of the restaurant is fantastic. It's like being inside a boat! Delicious food. Would come back again!
author: L M.

description: The atmosphere and setting was nice! The wait was not bad, like 15 minutes. The seats were nice for a couple close to each other, facing the bay. The food was delicious and so were the drinks. I had a great experience here.
author: Jennifer S.

description: Best spot on the pier by far!!! Nice view great Food with the Staff to match a must when you are in the City !!
author: Eric E.

description: Came here for the first time yesterday and I truly enjoyed my experience. The view was a nice addition to the deliciously seasoned shrimp that I ordered. I got the shrimp skillet with of course extra lemons. The drinks taste great and the server was continuously making sure we had everything we needed.
author: Elizabeth A.

description:
I love me some Dungeness Crab!  When in SF in crab season from late November till they run out around march I think... you need to get some of this local awesome eats. 

Now yes, this is tourist central.  But it's also the home of the crab.  The boats you see are real not fake Disneyland replicas.  They are fishing crab and pulling them in right here. Eat local.  Right.  This be as local as you can get!   So why not indulge in history and partake.  

The Franciscan is a classic of architecture on the outside. And the inside is a bit odd with a fancy diner type feeling.  An awesome view of the bay from every seat just adds another reason to eat here.

Now some people may complain about this and that, but why order other dishes in a place known for its fresh crab.  So make it simple.    Get the crab on the skillet with the secret garlic butter sauce.  You have to work for your meal so crack away.  The sauce it the perfect balance of spice, butter and garlic.   You dont need much on your crab meat because you want to taste the nice sweet tender crab.  But take some of that nice fresh sourdough bread and soak up the sauce, scraping the bits of char off the hot skillet with the bread.  Thats the ticket right there.  Ohhhhh yeah baby! 

Now Im sure some of their other dishes are just fine and maybe even really good.  They have one of those menus with photos of all the food for all the foreign tourists, but some of them looked quite good.  But lets circle back to the world of Dungeness.

I've had crab in all the best places and this is right up there with the best, no doubt.  

Also had a crab louie salad for those who dont like to "work" for their meal.  It was a nice presentation and quite good and again, I've had many a louie.  Starter house salad was also great, nice butter lettuces with some thin sliced avocados, heirloom cherry tomatoes, shaved onions with a nice vinegarette.  Dressing was a bit on the heavy side for my liking but not a deal killer.

Our server Bianca was on top of everything with a great smile, and attitude, and there to please.  She brought us extra garlic sauce for dipping cause she saw how much we were moping it up with the bread.  So, spot on top service from her I would applaud.

To be honest ,  I was fearing a tourist trap not so good experience but it turned out I  was in crab heaven ecstasy very quickly with not a regret in sight. 

Also being an older designed place it was not super loud where you have to yell to hear your eating buddies that are two feet away.  I almost forgot what being able to hear in a restaurant was like.  Kudos!  And to top it off,  the parking lot right in front was FREE for three hours with validation at the restaurant.  Free parking in San Francisco!  Holy crab claws!   

Born to crack crab and never look back.
author: Bruce M.

description: The food is adequate at best. And it is expensive. But you are paying for the view and frankly it's worth the price. The theater style tiered banquettes give every diner an eye line to the panoramic window that overlooks the bay. Service is great and the food comes fast. There are other flaws. The bathrooms were a mess... not really acceptable at any price... but especially not in this price range! Location, location location.
author: Robert B.

description:
Excellent view of the bay. Food is above average. The average rating is because I think this restaurant has a "tourist attraction feel".
I remember it being more of an old school Italian sea food restaurant.
Worth the visit.
author: Robert M.

description:
Fantastic views and all tables have a bay view of Alcatraz and binoculars. I have been twice, once I sat at a back table and it was elevated so others didn't block the view, the second I sat by the windows; both offered equally great views so don't fret it.

Food was a little pricey and selection was a little lacking in my opinion, but probably sufficient for a real seafood lover. Personally though, I've had better shrimp for less money, and the server wasn't overly pleasant.

Overall, great place for a decent meal with by far the best view of the Bay and Alcatraz, but if all you are interested in is seafood quality, there are plenty of other options available for you.

Pro: Fantastic Views and Iconic Building
Cons: Limited menu unless an absolute seafood connoisseur, mixed service quality.
author: Christopher L.

description: I love the Franciscan. I made a reservation through opentable 2 hours before for a party of 6 last Saturday night. It was packed when we arrived but we were seated in less than 5 minutes. Friendly service, great view, awesome ambiance and delicious crab. What else could you ask for?
author: Amanda S.

description:
Yes it's touristy yes it's right in the middle of Fisherman's Wharf. But it's tasty comfort food, it's consistent friendly service and it's a great view of the bay. If you like any or all of those things you should be more than happy at the Franciscan.

I usually get the Clam Chowder in a bread bowl, very nom. Or the crab enchiladas, savory and a large enough portion to share or take home in a doggie bag. Their homemade soft ice cream is also pretty tasty. And did I mention they mix nice stiff drinks in the bar? 

This is a fun place to take visitors from out of town but we also often go there just for our own night out. They also treat kids very well and have a nice menu for them. Love this place.
author: Noah K.

description: Great place for a special dinner in San Francisco. Yes, it's a tourist spot. Yes, it's pricey. BUT, unlike most tourist spots, the food was very good. Plus, the view is to die for!! My only complaint is that, for the price of entrees, a side dish should be included. We ordered a salad and split it four ways; it's was quite large and had lots of great greens and veggies, not that blah iceberg. Then we all shared one of the extra large sizzling platters with three kinds of seafood, the seafood and pasta, and the crab enchiladas. Everything was good and the flavors were subtle and unique to each dish. Service was friendly and quick. Fairly noisy and energetic place. Sunset is a perfect time to dine here. Make reservations early and don't be afraid to ask for a window seat when you arrive. It's such a large place, there's always a table opening up.
author: Katniss S.

description:
How can you possibly choose among literally blocks and blocks of crab restaurants?! I'm not even going to pretend like I'm some crab connoisseur, this was the first place I walked into that seemed like it had a decent view of the bay and a clean-cut atmosphere. I love crab, but I cannot handle the stench that seems to permeate some of the more aggressively casual places. This place was very clean and professional, not to mention classy and yet not overly pretentious. 

My table had a direct view of Alcatraz, which felt lucky. They weren't very busy at all for lunch on a holiday weekend, I guess because the competition is pretty fierce. I guess it would categorize as a little "spendy" at about $25 for a generous serving of crab which were apparently market prices at the time. A side of pretty regular broccoli, cauliflower and carrots was a little ridiculously priced at $8, but what are you gonna do about it. It's a lovely place with a great view and white jacket service.
author: Marie M.

description: Great view, great food, great service!  Came after a bay tour around 2:30 which allowed us to get sat immediately at one of the 6 outdoor patio tables.  We were immediately overwhelmed with the book... Err menu but finally settled on the crab fondue, seafood cioppino, and single crab enchilada.  This was plenty off food for 2 and all plates were delish.  I highly recommend if you can eat between lunch and dinner rushes!
author: Brian M.

description: The food was fantastic! Everything we ordered was so good- my personal favorite was the yellowtail carpaccio.  Super fresh seafood and fish.  The only con might be the atmosphere (crying children mostly) but most window side tables have binoculars for sight seeing while you wait for your food.  It was definitely a great restaurant that fills you up even on the light side.  I definitely recommend it.
author: Melissa C.

description: Food was good, prices are so so. Not super impressed but for a nice view and a meal it's worth it
author: O S.

description:
My family went to Franciscan for my graduation celebration lunch last month. We had a fantastic experience. The view is amazing and our waiter was the best waiter I've had in ages. He was so attentive and friendly. He even brought us cake when he found out we were celebrating! He made twin peaks jokes with my brother...it was great! I wish I could remember his name so he could get some recognition! He was blondish and had a beard. 
The food was awesome as well! Highly highly recommend the crab fondue! The crab chowder is also really good but the crab fondue is the bomb. They are very generous with the crab. We ordered just appetizers to share and that worked out really well.
author: Rachael D.

description: Maybe I'm just particular..... But... While we were eating we watched a gentleman who was bussing tables drop a napkin pick it up and wipe the sweat off his forehead then wipe the chairs down with the same napkin. He put this napkin back into his pocket and later wiped the table with it.... The food was good but that grosses me out! Good luck!
author: Emmi K.

description:
Tourist trap.  Same view can be had for free on the pier.
Food is decent, nothing special, way over priced. Better, less costly options are abundant.
author: Kevin M.

description:
Fabulous, classy retro 50s ambiance and spectacular views.

Had the clam chowder (super flour-tasting).  The french bread/butter was good quality  though....
author: Elle S.

description:
We had salmon crostini appetizers and and a very thin salami with a great fresh mozzarella. The crab enchiladas were 
great, and the fish and chips, a batter 
fried basa was hot, hot , hot but delicious. Fast and efficient service.
author: stephanie j.

description:
Food-  amazing :) The crab fondue was a great app. It was pretty rich, but perfect for sharing with a group. Both the Sourdough bread and the seafood tasted very fresh.  Only downfall was the portion of the pasta entrée, it was on the small side. 

Drinks- Recommend the blood orange margarita, cucumber martini, and the espresso martini. All three were refreshing with just the right kick. 

Service was good, friendly and attentive.  However, we wish the waiter gave us more recommendations. Apparently there is a signature seafood platter they are famous for, would have loved to try it.  Other than that, service was good. 

The location gives you a great ocean view/Fisherman's warf lookout... But the inside is kind of tacky. It has a diner vibe" from the red and shiny silver decor... But the price and quality of the food is not at all like a diner. 

Great New Year's Eve dinner here!
author: Dave And JM T.

description:
Pretty good food but it's expensive. The view of the water and Alcatraz is amazing. You're right on the water.

Like the other reviews stated; they need to work on that bread. I normally love "artisan/rustic" type breads, but this was so tough it was almost impossible to tear a piece off, and you'll need a drink to help you chew/swallow it.

The staff were all very nice. If you're a little hard of hearing, you'll need an interpreter for some of them though.

We both ordered the Crab Alfredo meal. It came with soup or salad,  the entree, and ice cream for $29 per person. Kind of small portions but it was filling. We just thought, for the money, it should have been more.

It was good but we would probably go somewhere else next time.
author: Jen N.

description: I saw the good reviews so I thought to try it out! But it was definitely a disappointment. The view was pretty but the food  was terrible. The starter bread was as hard as rock and the butter was frozen. Our skillet was almost $50 with a few crab legs and like 10-15 mini shrimp. Sorry but definitely not recommended :(
author: Michelle Z.

description: Great food.  Excellent view.  The staff hustles.  Prix fix menu was a great way to sample items.   SF staple restaurant.   A little pricey for lunch.
author: Jeff C.

description:
My mother and I were very skeptical about eating herd for our first night in San Francisco and boy were we wrong! 

Walking in you will notice immediately that this restaurant is definitely a tourist trap but it is soon forgotten once you get to your table which will have a spectacular view of the bay and most likely Alcatraz. 

The service was great and our waiter was attentive without being pushy! The menu was very diverse with some of the tastiest calamari I have ever had! For the main corse I had salmon which made me want to cry because it was outstanding! My sister had fish and chips which you have to understand is what she orders at basically every restaurant that has it, and she was speechless because of how good it was. 

The only reason I didn't give the restaurant it's 5th star was because there was food on the floor around and under neath our table when we sat down left from the previous diners.
author: Sam M.

description:
This is a bar review only.

A friend was in town and we needed to kill time, so we thought we'd grab cocktails once she was done with her tourist shopping at Pier 39. We saw Franciscan and decided to try it.

First off, they were more than willing to let us sit at a table and just enjoy cocktails without food--always a plus in a busy area like this. The cocktails were actually quite good, well-sized, and reasonably priced (about $11 each, which really isn't bad when you consider that it's right there in tourist land). Our waitress was really nice, and our water glasses never got lower than half full.

The view of the Bay and Alcatraz is GORGEOUS.

I will definitely bring out of towners here again as a great option for wowing them with the beauty of SF after a day of tolerating Pier 39 (I accept cocktails as payment for my "tour guide" services to friends and family).
author: Vivienne P.

description: Less than impressed. We were a group of 5, got seated quickly which was great but we weren't even acknowledged by our waiter for over 10 minutes. 3 got fish and chips, good fish but the chips weren't fries it was a mix of sweet potato, regular potato and olive. The vegetarian Bolognese was ok, the chicken fettuccine was horrible and we understand it was on the pier which makes it $$$ but $160 for 5 people no appetizers is a bit much especially for the quality of the food and service
author: Bailey T.

description: Great service, nice crusty chewy french bread, pretty good basa, and adequate chioppino. The chocolate mouse cake with frozen custard is yummy and so is the custard on its own. Mixed drinks are nothing to write home about. The view is outstanding. Overall it's a decent place to grab a bite though not as fabulous as it once was. It has a bit of an upscale diner feel and flavor to it now but the prices dont quite match. A bit spendy for the quality but I suppose youre paying for the view. Its one of those places you probably want to experience once if it's your first time in the area.
author: Meika M.

description: The food here was better then I had expected.  There are many restaurants located in this same area, which made my decision hard. I was intrigued by the restaurant view and the crab enchiladas.  Everything on the menu looked and sounded delicious, but I had to go with the enchiladas since I've never had crab ones!  The amount of crab and size of the chunks was amazing! Sooo glad I chose this restaurant! I wish I had more time in San Fran to go back and try more entrees! Also, my waiter Carlos was very friendly and attentive :)
author: Jill M.

description: I have been here 3 times now and only because my family comes in from out of town and like the location and views. Great because it's at Fishermans Wharf, but I for sure will steer them to much better, fresh, quality food restaurant that won't break your wallet! The food here is horrible, greasy and extremely costly only because of the tourist attractions. It. Is. Over rated 200%. I'm a local here in Sam Francisco, take my word, chipotle is waaaaaaay fresher and so much more healthier for you!!! And a fraction of the cost and you'll have fun!!!! Two Thumbs Down!!!! Oh yea I forgot, if your driving, parking is pricey too!!! For nothing.
author: david g.

description: Overpriced food, simple and plain! The crab is so so and if you decide on any pasta dishes you'll need your own salt and pepper to get thru.
author: Anthony W.

description: My sisters and I always come eat here whenever we come visit. So yummy yet so expensive!!.. But def worth it once in a while to splurge. The crab is delicious I they bring it out still hot and sizzling and take it apart in front of you. Not only a dinner but you get a beautiful view! The walls are glass so you can see out the ocean! Seems so elegant and classy! &&The service is great as well of course.
author: H X.

description: I love this restaurant every time I'm in town I come eat here. There service is great and there food is excellent. They also have the best view as well.
author: Karina R.

description:
Sorta pricey, but crab was good and so was the beer-battered fish!  Food and service together were worth the price.  The nice ocean view was a plus; all the tables and booths were set up in a way that anywhere you were seated inside the restaurant, you shoulda been able to enjoy the ocean view.

First thing first, the complimentary sourdough bread and butter i loved and enjoyed a lot.  However, the crab chowder was sorta meh.....oh well.  Then, the boyfriend had one whole crab, and i ordered for myself fish-n-chip with broccolini on the side.  Boyfriend said he wanted veggie so I substituted extra broccolini  for the fries, at no additional cost, and the flash-fried broccolini turned out super yummy!  When we requested melted butter for the crab, our server offered the garlic butter sauce as well!  Great service, i would say :)  The crab was delicious and juicy, and we loved those big claws and meat-filled legs!  The beer-battered fish was crispy on the outside and well-seasoned and flaky inside, which I would highly recommend to all of you crispy-food-lovers!  Last but not least, the fresh made-in-the-house frozen kustard ice cream was really good! creamy and not too sweet!  In brief, we had a very satisfying seafood meal here!

FYI, this place and the nearby Crab House at Pier 39 are owned by the same company.  Based on my comparison of their menus and prices, both menus were pretty similar (almost the same, actually) but the prices at this place were running $3 to $5 cheaper (per each of most of the food items) than the Crab House's price tags!  So, if you order 2 appetizers and 2 entrees, you should be able to save $15-20 here at Franciscan Crab! Nice, isnt it?
author: Ada L.

description: Came here while on vacation hopeing to find good fresh seafood and we did!! The foot is really good and seafood, like crab is very fresh!! One of the most fresh once I had in San Francisco, and We had crabs everyday. The restaurant is a clean, good view of the bay, and servers were very polite and helpful!! Def a place to try and wild strawberry desert was very good too!!
author: Helen Z.

description: Their food is great and you get a great view of the bay. I usually get the crab, mussels and shrimp platter, and it never disappoints. And to top it all off, you can free parking with validation from the parking lot out front.
author: Henry C.

description: Food is good (we ordered crab Alfredo and basa from prix menu and starting with clam chowder), very nice view of the SF bay, but our server (Oliver C.) is very inattentive and provide bad service.  Since we are on our vacation, he is still received 10% gratuity.  He didn't deserve any based on his service.  He eats and drinks in front of customer, texting on his personal phone, didn't even take our order (another waitress has to take our order), disappeared and then came back with the bill, walked pass our table without asking "how are we" or pour wine for us.  This restaurant received 3 stars because of him.  Jeff, the owner, needs to aware about his service to customers.  I would come back if the service is good but I wouldn't since there are so many restaurants offer similar food with better service.
author: n l.

description:
Went here but don't know why.  Guess our group was hungry.  Not that it was bad, really, just the opposite.  What a view!  Floor to ceiling windows over looking the Bay and good food.  But what a tourist trap.  Yes, I know, it was a holiday weekend but sooooo crowded.  And if you wait at the bar, good luck.  This is the smallest bar I've ever seen in a place this size.  Hard to get a drink and no where to stand.  Again, we did have good meals and a nice time when we were finally seated, but I would have rather went to Sausalito for a more comfortable and relaxing meal.  Doubt I'll be back but if you have the time and the patience it is a nice place.  It just wasn't for me. Sorry.

Sláinte
author: Don H.

description: The crabs is definitely not fresh and way over priced for what it is. It's suppose to be sweet with a hint of saltiness from the saltwater instead it's  SUPER salty and dry, very disappointed with this restaurant. It's like going to Maine to get frozen lobster tail... No one does that. The only good part is the crab fondue and octopus (from what I have ate) Came all the way from Philadelphia to try some crabs as people claim it's the best here.But left with disappointment.
author: Liz L.

description: I've been here 5 times in the 6 months I've lived in San Francisco. The food is consistently excellent. I always get the crab. The calamari are always very fresh; in fact, I'm not sure that I knew what calamari are supposed to taste like until I ate them here. Finally, the chocolate sundae is great. If I had to complain about something, I'd complain that they don't serve their sundaes fast enough, and by the time they get to you, the ice cream can be pretty soupy.
author: Keilly W.

description:
OK for tourists.  Expensive.  Food OK. Boudin's resturarant a few feet away is better and cheaper.  We didn't go there because it was crowded--a lesson not to accept second best. 

Beware that they add a charge along with the tax.  When asked they explained it was to pay for the SF health care.  It is bogus as it should not be included and if they are going to add a bogus charge then they should clearly say so, not this HSBC code.
author: Tim L.

description: The views are amazing in this restaurant. I love coming around sunset to have a drink and watch the sunset. You can see Alcatraz, The Golden Gate, Bay Bridge and the communities across the bay. I had the crab chowder and could not eat more than a few bites. It was really bland. I had the sizzling shrimp. They were good. I really liked the bread and butter.
author: Susan P.

description: Ordered the crab fine due,Ciopinno soup, Clam chowder ,Double shrimp and crab. Everything was so good. The shrimp had been marinating a day prior in garlic butter ..really good!!!! Service was on point !
author: Deeba E.

description:
This place absolutely sucked! We had oysters to start off with and they did not even know where they came from and they were the size of a dime. We drove up to Napa and had the greatest oysters for the same price that were very big. Also they gave us one with an almost empty shell. They tasted like fish, and the meals were very small. Nothing was fresh and it looked like it was previously frozen. Terrible tourist area. Restaurant was dead and others complained as well. We have eaten at many places in Fisherman's wharf and it has been delicious, but this place was terrible. Do not go here! It's so expensive and a waste of money. They absolutely suck. 

We have had great meals all week during our stay, but this place sucked.
author: Gabrielle R.

description:
I am a total fan of this restaurant. The look reminds me of my childhood and old school San Francisco.  I call it Rat Pack meets California casual.

Great, fresh seafood, a marvelous menu and stellar service!

And....hangin' on the wharf is always fun---even if you're a local!
author: Myra J.

description:
If you follow me you know I do not give many 5 star ratings. BUT: We come here a lot!! We always are greeted with a smile, always get great service, friendly staff and deliciously creative food :) We take family and friends here and everyone just raves about it.. The view is phenomenal! The fish and shellfish are always fresh. And the desserts are to die for!
Going again soon!
author: R. B.

description:
This is very much a tourist place,great view and atmosphere however the food was sub par. Our table had a shrimp cocktail to start, the shrimp were good but the sauce was definitely not..I ordered a martini that was okay but not for the price. 

My entree was double shrimp and crab. The shrimp was cooked with the shell on which was very annoying to take off as I tried to eat it. Actually the first shrimp I ate I didn't realize there was a shell on it and ended up having to pull shells out of my teeth for the next 5 mins.The crab was pretty good but again for the price I would have rather gone to one of the small street vendors and had crab on the side walk opposed to what I paid for this meal...I wouldn't waste my money again!
author: Chris T.

description:
Overall I can't complain. Even though this is primarily a seafood restaurant, I was still able to get a couple vegetarian options that were very good. 

To start I had the tomato Crostini, the tomatoes were marinated perfectly and the bread was fantastic. For my entrée I opted for the tomato and all of pasta which was the only option on the menu. While it wouldn't normally have been my first choice, the pasta was fresh and everything was seasoned perfectly. 

Great service and an amazing view of the bay, I definitely recommend especially if you're a seafood lover!
author: Toni J.

description:
Pulled pork had very little coleslaw - so little I couldn't see it. When I asked for more I was told it would cost an additional $1. I said I would pay but thought it was wrong. They didn't charge extra in the end but sti extremely poor. My meal was cold first time. 

My wife had clam chowder which I thought was beautiful, mainly because I love potato soup and that's what it tasted like - no fish. Calamari was ok but not good for a fish restaurant on a wharf. 

Service was good and our server seemed embarrassed to ask for the extra $1 for the missing coleslaw.
author: Paul W.

description: Food was of subpar quality for the price paid, but views of the Bay were very nice.  This place will do in a crunch but for great seafood...I'd go some place else.
author: Brandon C.

description: Ok, the fresh whole crab. Get it. It will feed 2 comfortably, if it's an intimate setting or date, this is a wonderful place to introduce your girl/guy to SF and what is preserved here. I am a local 100% and I have only been here twice in my life. And each time is a unique experience to say the least. Set a reservation, it will be packed to the wall with people, especially tourists with having this uniquely exquisite dining experience. Start off with delicious Sourdough and butter, slow down rodeo king, you want to keep room in the tire, this bread is good, and will get you going. Second the bar, ok, it's small, tiny, no room to walk around, and most likely you will be standing with your drink if you are waiting for a table, but once you turn around, BAM the view, Treasure Island, Golden Gate Bridge, The SF Bay calm waters, tour boats, Hornblower, Black and Gold and dining cruise boats at your face in the open Bay gigantic romantic sexy windows. Then by the time you realize your hip is buzzing from the page to sit down, after a very stiff drink with mint(suggestion here people!), you always get a view of the gargantuan bay windows and a sexy exotic view of one of the most romantic cities in the USA. Then comes dinner, Crab, delicious Garlic Sauce, service so good, they crack your crab for you if you wish, they put a bib on you, and bon-a-petit. Ahh fresh crab, ask for lemon if you are not used to fresh crab, or you will pay later(Zinc/Iron is strong padiwan!). Ok lastly, you will leave full, content, and extremely happy. This is unique, cherish your dinner, who knows how long the Franciscan will be here. Your walk in and out, you will see the legends of past who were here, make sure you WALK out to see these treasured gems of legends of music, media, entertainment. Then you have the Pier, Wharf, among countless walking and touring to venture and walk off that full tub of a rollo you called a stomach before dashing into a tantalizing meal...Enjoy a treasure of The Golden Gate!
author: Phil H.

description:
amazing view. 
Amazing crab cakes.
The classic restaurant where everything just works (service, food, drinks, etc)
author: Ale N.

description:
my colleague and i came to franciscan crab restaurant, and overall i thought the experience was pleasant. the decor is very dated, but it is hard to tell if this is a purposely retro theme, or if the interior was never redesigned from its original days. while everything was clean and somewhat bright, it just felt a little tired.

the menu comes with full pictures, which can help along the choosy eater. i decided on the house salad topped with shrimp, and a starter of 2 raw oysters. my colleague decided on the $29 prix fixe which came with a soup (clam chowder), entree (fish and chips), and ice cream.

the fish was very fresh, and that was definitely a positive stand out for me. the salad was also complete with avocado, pumpkin seeds, bibb lettuce, red and yellow cherry tomatoes, and red onion. i liked the garlic vinaigrette since it was light in flavor and weight. 

my manager seemed to like the chowder, but then i noticed he was peeling some of the fried batter off of his fish and chips. he commented that it was a little heavy and on the greasy side, but he still enjoyed the flavor.
author: Jamie H.

description: Stayed on fisherman's wharf and eat at this place with the family. Two kids under 5 and my wife at here at night. View would be better during the day but was a good location. Food was excellent, raw oysters, yellowtail carpaccio , chowder. A little high priced but easy and nice when visiting.
author: Larry O.

description: *I was excited to come again for my birthday dinner. I knew the food was going to be yummy! We were attended quickly and the waitress was very friendly. My fiancé and I had came once before. The second time around, we brought his parents and friends for my birthday dinner. They loved it! I had the combo of crab, shrimp and mussels- sooooooo delicious! We had a nite view of the Alcatraz and watched ships go by. Beautiful! We will definitely come back again. We left with our tummies satisfied and needed to walk it off. Didn't leave a crumb behind. Oh! We tried the Crab fondue and it is fingerlickin' good
author: Karina R.

description: Visiting a family friend, we drove all the way from Arizona with our children. When deciding where to have lunch, we knew that we wanted oysters and clam chowder. Unfortunately, we never made it past the hostess station. We were a party of six and requested a window seat, but there was "already a reservation seated". We suggested sitting on two four tops in another window section but then we'd "be taking up two tables" and apparently they "can't do that" even though the restaurant was fairly empty. Instead of being sat where we didn't want to be, we went to Boudin where they were much more accommodating.
author: E C.

description: Ask for Hodori/Anthony and he'll make it am experience. Facing the waters you have a clear view of Alcatraz. Beautiful interiors. Kid-friendly too.  Our new go-to for the pier. Definitely better than boudin.  Bottom restaurant is a good gran n go too.
author: Susannah K.

description: Came from Seattle and got very disappointed with the service. The food was ok, but the hostess wasn't courteous. First we were told there was no room. we clearly saw many empty tables, then the hostess came back said she can take us in but we need to order quickly. We were reminded several times that we needed to order quickly and felt we were rushed, not impressed!
author: Nima M.

description:
First, the food : It was SOOOO good! I like the crabs, the clam chowder was the best ever. It tasted great, I would come again for the food.
The view was also great, I like the view of the sea! It was right near the pier and restaurant was huge, which we loved.
The only thing that I didn't like was the attitude of the hostess. We were talking and was almost finishing the food, but they just came right in and cleaned our table. Because the crab plate was big, they were busy cleaning. And then they asked us if they could get away all the silver wears, and I couldn't say no so I said sure. I mean, why were they in such a hurry? They could at least wait for us until the time they bring the check. The restaurant was getting less busy, but they were the only busy bees in the restaurant. Other than that, nice restaurant for seafood lovers. I really liked the menu book. It was like a magazine so we could know how all the foods look like when they came out.
author: Anna Y.

description:
The view was terrific!  We sat outside and the view itself would be enough to draw me back.  Even though it didn't take us very long to get seated, the server was kind of slow to respond. Thank goodness she had some other servers to help her.  

I ordered the full crab and I probably should have gotten the 1/2 crab.  It was good but I probably wouldn't order it again because it was so heavy and I'm not sure if I was crazy about the flavor.  I would definitely go back though.  I would try something else on the menu.
author: Jin S.

description:
Not worthy of the hype!!!  Service was a D-, food was an F, drinks-A...hard to screw up a draft beer & champagne so enjoy a local brew & the "Splash" if you like mimosas.

SERVICE---We weren't sure if we wanted a full blown dinner so ordered Calimari & advised our waiter we might be doing dinner, just weren't sure. He never checked back. 

We had to ask twice for water. 

I had to ask for a 2nd drink.  That's easy money people!!!

FOOD & SERVICE--The calimari was very "iffy" on the freshness front with little flavor & swimming in grease. They serve it with cocktail sauce which I don't like so asked for marinara....$1 please. So I asked for yellow mustard & he served me Dijon...really?!?!   

The manager did comp the calimari so grateful for that. However, I bet my husband that he will "pay" later...& dearly I'm quite sure.   Poor thing...he definitely got sick.

The view was great!!  Order smartly & you might get a 3 star experience out of the place. But IMO, too many GREAT food options in SFO to get sucked in to the view being offered.
author: Alyssa S.

description:
No idea or clue about anything but the Fishwich and garlic fries so this review is about those.

Fisherman's Wharf is touristy, but at least they still have local non-chain gems like this spot. One of a kind.

I've eaten Fishwiches here at least 5-7 times and each time it was awesome.  The price is a bit steep, but the fishwich is quite large and comes stuffed with tons of fresh coleslaw.  Everything is fresh fresh fresh and can be eaten by my non-seafood eating friends and family.

Garlic fries are bomb too.

Gotta give 5 stars too since they've hooked us up a few times too.  Hooked us up with a bit of extra fish and some fries on separate occasions too.  Totally just random and due to the friendliness of the staff.

Getting a cup of water is a challenge though.
author: Brian L.

description:
You would be better off buying crab from someone off the street in the tenderloin district. By far one of the worst restaurants I've been too. The waiter was ok, but the food was horrible. Go to mcdonalds. Way overpriced and the crab, which they apparently specialize in does not taste fresh. Last night, and this morning (we ate dinner there last night) both my husband and I have upset stomachs. 

Skip over this place. It's just not worth it on any level.
author: Rachel M.

description:
We came here yesterday for Christmas and was pleasantly surprised by most of our visit.  The restaurant is HUGE and decorated nicely and has the amazing view that nearly everyone mentions in their review.  Everyone who worked at the restaurant, with the exception of the non-verbal woman at the host desk, was pleasant and helpful.

Among the four of us, we had crab cakes, a crab sandwich, pasta with crab and a tureen of shrimp pescatore.  I was the lucky recipient of the pescatore, which was so good!  Really garlicky and spicy tomato sauce, filled with perfectly cooked shrimp.  The pasta with crab featured tons of crab, but was a little too heavy so that was boxed up to take home.  The crab cakes had a lot of bread added, and was served just plain on the plate - no tartar sauce or any other kind of sauce, and no lemon or garnish.in sight.  The crab sandwich was pretty basic, but my stepmother enjoyed it, and that's all that counts.

The really weak part of the meal were the salads.  They were comprised mostly of iceberg lettuce  and the greens weren't dried properly, which means that they were super wet and diluted the dressing.  Not only that, they were plated so messily - really amateurish.  For $7 for the house salad, and $12 for the blue cheese salad, you expect something that looked a little nicer.

Dessert was their frozen kustard, and was absolutely delicious.  Cocktails were big and strong too - yum!

All in all, a great place for Christmas lunch.  I just wish the salads had been better and the hostess nicer.
author: .Hon H.

description: Amazingly good view, all seats are strategically placed on both sides ( Ghirardelli & Alcatraz ) food is just ok maybe because the crab season locally -SF is so, so....,
author: Madray M.

description: I had the best Alfredo pasta in my life and seriously I am picky with food. The crab pasta have no garlic and it looks little but it is actually filling. The other member of the party took the crab chowder. It was excellent too. We came at the right time got best table with Alcatraz view and goggles available to see inside the island. Food was super fast since waiter is directly ordering from a PDA.  Perfect. Will recommend.
author: Laurent G.

description: This is one of favorite restaurant at pier 39. I love the fried calamari here and the clam chowder soup too. And the price is fine too.
author: Aditi A.

description:
Really good and really reasonable.
They have a touch screen soda machine,which I've never seen anywhere else in the Bay which I thought was pretty kool as well.

Got a HUGE piece of fish (and chips) for $8.95

Way better than some of the restaurants in the area and all of the restaurants on Pier 39.
author: Mike M.

description: Clam chowder and fish and chips!!! To die for!!! They also have cioppino bread bowl!!!! This my favorite place!!!
author: Elmer O.

description:
The Franciscan was quite possibly the worst restaurant experience of my life. 

We were recommended to the restaurant by the host at The Crab House on Pier 39 because their wait was about 2 hours for our large group (8 people).  None of us had been to San Francisco before and of course wanted to experience the seafood, especially the famous dungeness crab.  Surprisingly, we were seated right away at The Franciscan but now I know why they had so much availability. 

Now, I can usually deal with sub-par service but when coupled with awful food, it makes the experience ten times worse.  Our server was quite rude.  In the beginning, she seemed like a great server and took our drink/bar orders right away.  But as soon as we asked for water as well as our other drinks, things started going down hill.  She did not re-fill our waters or ask if we needed more drinks once throughout the whole dinner, which later on would have helped to down the disgusting food. 

I had asked her if they had a plate with JUST the crab legs.  She suggested I get the whole crab and that she or the kitchen would cut it up so that it was only legs. so that is what I ordered.  When my food came, the crab was whole.  I waited TEN minutes for our server to even come back to our table after we received our food to ask about it being cut up.  I know it sounds petty but I don't know how to eat whole crab and didn't want a mess.  Typically when you receive your food, a server is to check on your food to make sure everyone got their correct meal and it is tasting right (i know this because I was a country club restaurant manager for several years).  When she finally came back she rolled her eyes and said she completely forgot and will get it taken care of. 

The food.  My crab was BURNT. As if the kitchen had placed it in the broiler for too long to heat it up. Some of the skin was blackened it was so burnt.  The crab meat tasted like it was boiled in plain water with no seasonings.  When I asked the waiter if they had any sauce or seasonings, she said no. What restaurant doesn't have seasonings or sauce?

I can't specifically speak for the rest of my party but the general consensus was their food was sub-par as well. 

At that point, we just wanted to get our check and leave.  When we asked the server for our check, she asked if "we wanted the check split or all in one".  Usually with a big group they wont split it, so we were happily surprised it was offered, so we asked her to split the check. Well our server didn't like that and got a serious attitude as said "Fine, it's going to take awhile then to get your checks, I am super busy".  wow. When she brought our checks we all just gave her our credit cards but she said she couldn't take them right away because "she has a lot of other tables she needs to help first". wow. 

We then tried to get the attention of the manager because things were just out of hand and we thought he should know.  We did not want anything for free or any special treatment but just thought he should be aware the way his restaurant was being operated. He ignored us the first time and when he finally came over to us, he was also rude.  He got very defensive and said that if he had been made aware of this from the beginning of our meal, he could have fixed it. We explained that things just went downhill and that we just wanted to let him know.  He did not want to hear it and was very snotty. 

We all just left and I requested the name and email of their general manager. 

I'm sure not all of the servers are like this but for what it's worth, the food is definitely not worth ANY of your time.
author: Ashley B.

description: Amazing food. Fried calamari was amazing. Got full off of those. I had the basa in the spicy tomato sauce. Not that spicy but was incredible. VERY pricy...so delicious
author: Ryna O.

description: I would give this restaurant 10 stars if I could. My boyfriend brought me for our 6 year anniversary. I was blown away when I got upstairs. Amazing view of the bay and Alcatraz. Our food was so delicious and our waiter was so awesome and helpful. We're from Los Angeles and visit SF a few times a year. I'm so glad we found this spot.
