Although, I didn't like the service we got when we entered from the host. She has a mad face and hardly said a thing! So unprofessional. We come from LA to eat at a not so cheap restaurant, I think she should smile and greet upon entering. Other than that I will definitely come back!!
author: Jess P.

description: The dinner menu is a recipe book that you can purchase.  Trying to watch my budget, I enjoyed the spicy shrimp pasta (see photo) along with a glass of wine.  The serving size was appropriate and I enjoyed the dish, although the spiciness was not there.  For dessert, I shared the giant serving of strawberry frozen custard homemade ice cream (please see this photo).  It was gigantic and soooooooo good.  Needless to say, we ate it all (there were three of us)!  Wow; it is always a great day when dessert makes you happy!
author: Leon W.

description:
In a town noted for seafood, I rate this place a solid "meh".  Nice big place with great views and interesting architecture in the middle of Fisherman's Wharf, a tourist haven, but I think it could do better with its offerings.  The crab fondue was good but the fried calamari was ordinary. There were four of us at our table and we each got a different entree, but all were unremarkable.  Can't even remember what they were, in fact.  Very good service, though.

Update - I really appreciate Jose's response to my initial review.  It was indeed my first visit.  I admire his openness to my critique and invitation to come back and try again.  I will certainly consider it.
author: Eric C.

description:
This place is pretty good!

Parking, we had to look for street parking.

Price: somewhat expensive.

Food: GREAT! but portion per plate, not so great.

Service: exceptional.

Mind you this was valentine's day so it was a bit packed.

Reserve!!! (beautiful view overlooking the bay/alcatraz)
author: Ledam O.

description:
My first exposure to the Louie salad was Trader Joe's.  I love it so.  Well, they have a crab louie salad here, for $20.  I'm thinking.. Whoa, it's gonna be my TJ's salad, but like SUPER good.  Makes sense... I'm paying 5 times more for it.. should have five times more.. or it should be five times BETTER, right?

Oh so wrong!  I was thisss close to returning my food after I saw that not only did they not toss my salad (it is a restaurant afterall, they could at least do that), they put strange things I don't think belongs in a louie salad.. like black olives, onions, tomato.  And sin of all sins, they serve it with..  thousand island dressing!  

But looking at hubby, he was looking worried.  I could actually see him thinking, "uh oh.. she's getting hungry.  The monster's gonna come out.  She's gonna make a scene.  I'm gonna be so embarrassed.  I need to crawl underneath a hole."  So I refrained.  I asked for the menu and I looked at the description to make sure that this is how THEY make a louie salad.  And yeah.. even though they didn't call it thousand island dressing, they instead listed the ingredients that make thousand island dressing.  I sighed, shut up because indeed it was I who are in the wrong.  I should have read the description.  

I hated my salad still.  

Why the three stars despite the horrible food?  Because hubby's fish and chips is pretty good.  The service is good.  Ambience is casual and good.  I like their silverware.. and they gave me a dessert on the house (I think cause they knew their salad sucked and they knew I knew.)

Anyways, would I go here again?  Yes, BUT gawd no on that louie salad.
author: astrid s.

description:
TOURIST TRAP!

That sums up my review. Went there to meet some, well tourists, and didn't want to make a fuss, so I rolled with the plans. $17 for a fish sandwich and fries, that was average at best. Service was just as shoddy as the food.
author: Vivek N.

description:
I'm sitting at around 3.5 stars for this place.... We came here to check out the bread bowl clam chowder (such tourists) and it did the trick. The chowder was really delicious (as were the salty chips we got on the side) and we had a good table with a view of Alcatraz and some military boats. 

It wasn't a wow-factor place, hence the 3*, but we had a good lunch here, debating how we'd easily escape from alcatraz (seriously, did these people not know how to swim?)

Update 22 Oct, after a lovely response from the owner, I think this does deserve an upgrade to 4*, customer service online and offline is so important, and this made a mark on me!
author: Rosie A.

description: The best view of Alcatraz in San Francisco. You can eat a fabulous dinner and have a great drink. Try the blood orange margarita (yum).
author: Liz D.

description:
We had my girlfriends Christmas Party here. Good food, good atmosphere, great views.
I had a $50 bar bill , so I can just imagine how much our food cost. In the heart of Fisherman's Wharf, so that figures into the price also. I've lived in the Bay Area for 40 years , and this is my first visit here, So that tells you something.
author: Jason F.

description:
I came here recently for dinner while on vacation with my family. We chose The Franciscan Crab Restaurant for 2 reasons: I was able to make reservations via my OpenTable app within the hour we wanted to eat and it was close to our hotel!

My sister and cousin says that service was not good, but I didn't notice anything out of the ordinary...our waiter seemed pretty patient while trying to decide what to eat and he took our drink orders fairly quickly.

I had the Cioppino which was soo good! The broth was rich and flavorful with lots and lots of seafood! Everyone else enjoyed their meals - too bad we were too full for dessert!

This is a great restaurant for groups and couples, I'm sure the view gets better as the sun sets! I would definitely recommend this place to anyone in the area!
author: Faye M.

description: Gladly gave my tourist dollars up!  The views were amazing especially during sundown.  We received excellent service from staff and the food was very good.  I definitely recommend trying the skillets!  I normally don't eat Dungeness crab but with the garlic sauce it was tasty!
author: Jon C.

description: This is where kings n queens eat :) Absolutely the best crab I ever eat been going here for 4 years regularly. .. I get the crab fondue nd the crab chowder then the crab feast to follow ..spend about 200 but on the best meal ! I don't eat all day until I'm going there! caus I need to have all the room !!
author: Mechelle A.

description:
This is your typical tourist stop restuarant,  located in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf.  I liked the atmosphere and food.  It was also easy to order what you like because the entire menu has a picture for each food item.  So at least you know what it looks like if you were to order an odd ball entree.  

Fresh seafood served daily.  We had the raw osyters and fried calamari for appetizers. As for the entree, we ordered crabs and a crab sandwich.  I loved the crab sandwich a definite RECOMMENDATION, it was packed with Dungeness crabs, every bite I took was a mouthful of crab so this place does not skimp out on the stuff.  

We didn't get around to desserts but there are plenty of other places to go for desserts around the area.
author: Louie A.

description: The crab and the view are the only thing this place has to offer. It was noisy, over priced and with the exception of the crab, subpar quality. This was quite a disappointment, since my GF and I had such a wonderful experience when we were there just a year ago. The service, the food, and the ambiance all went downhill. What happened???!!! We would love to give them another chance, but we don't have that kinda money to gamble.
author: William B.

description: Hands down the worst dining experience of my life. The booth we sat in, while it did have a nice view, was filthy and had remnants of crab and bread from those who must have previously dined in those seats. Our server, I cannot recall his name (obvious indication of lack of personality and hospitable demeanor), was prompt with greeting but our drinks took roughly ten minutes to arrive back at our table with said drinks. And the drinks! I ordered some kind of bourbon strawberry mint concoction that was terribly watered down (probably from sitting for ten minutes at the service well) and did not taste good. We ordered crabcakes and clam chowder to start. Crabcakes were small and unexceptional. Clam chowder: unexceptional. Now here is where I probably made a terrible mistake: I ordered pasta and a caesar salad as my entree. I know, I know...go to a seafood restaurant and order pasta: rookie mistake. But I was craving. Pasta alfredo was overcooked and so gelatinous it was sticking together in a pasty, gooey pasta blob. I asked for more sauce: arrival took forever and basically tasted like 2% milk with some salt. Caesar salad: SWIMMING in water. I should buy the Franciscan a salad spinner. I didn't eat but a few bites of my meal and the server never inquired how anything tasted. I handed him my plates and he made no comment on the fact that I hadn't eaten anything. (I should have said something I guess. My friend ordered shrimp, mussels and dungeness crab that came out on a hot plate: not hot. Melted butter was starting to solidify. Several of the mussels had not opened up. Also ordered oysters and there were bits of shells. Shrimp: lacked flavor. All her food was cold. Also, as I had a dead cell phone and asked if I could charge it so I could get an Uber and they charge for charging your cell phone! We had dropped almost $300 on a meal and I cannot charge my cell phone for a few minutes? DO NOT EAT HERE. You'd be better off at a Long John Silvers. Seriously.
author: Billie H.

description: Ordered whole crab a bit pricey but great view and delicious! Would recommend it. It was great and filling.
author: Rowena D.

description:
Every time that I go to San Fran, I always try and make it to this restaurant to have their amazing Crab Chowder.  However, after having had the same thing for the past three years in a row, my boyfriend and I were intrigued by the Crab Alfredo.  Both of us loving seafood and Italian, it was a no-brainer.  I was a bit hesitant on the price (because I'm cheap sometimes), but after the first bite--heck, even the first smell, I was in love.  The sauce was so beautiful, and the crab was more than a fair serving!  We were sure that we had eaten the last piece of crab, but no!  There was still so much more at the bottom of the bowl.  It is WELL worth the price (which really isn't too much to be honest).  It is a generous serving size for one person, however, if you do have something to start off with, you will be more than happy to share it with your loved one.

I am more than excited to visit San Francisco again, to have these delicious dishes!
author: Talea G.

description:
After taking a tour of the Golden Gate bridge on the Red & White ferry, which left me cold and needing for some warm food, I stopped by this restaurant right next to the ferry. Having seen the menu beforehand, I knew this place was going to be quite pricey, but I had a little extra change in my pocket, and felt for some quality seafood. 

I was on my own, and got a seat right away--not by the windows, but near them to where I still had a nice view of the bay. But then I had to wait a little over 7 minutes for a waiter to take my order and get me some water. I'm used to being seated AND given water promptly, and when I was there, it was not as busy & crowded as it was when I left. Only upside to that unusual long wait was getting to thoroughly decide on what to eat.

I started off with the crab chowder in the sourdough bread bowl. It definitely made up for that wait ten-fold. It's been ages since I've had such fresh-tasting crab. I had more bread than what I could finish, as I was also given a little loaf of sourdough to my chowder. Some 10 minutes after, my main course of the crab sliders with fries arrived. As expected, the sliders were on the small side, but it was fine since I scarfed down more of the soup than the sliders. Fries were wonderfully crisp and seasoned, and the crab was just as excellent here as it was in the chowder. 

For drinks, I tried out the Sirens of the Sea. Fruit punchy, like I like my cocktails. Don't know if it was the best thing to have directly after a boat ride, since I still was trying to shake off the motion of the boat!

The service from the waiters is the only thing preventing this place from being five-star. Don't know the names of the male servers I had, but there were times when I needed them (such as a refill of my water), and I had to wait a little longer than I think I should have given its upscale atmosphere. I remember saying thanks and bye to my main server, and he just gave me a simple, "yes, thank you--bye" while his eyes were glued to the electronic device all the servers used to take down orders. I would have definitely wanted a more cordial farewell. The place got packed with the dinner crowd when I left, and I knew my server was busy, but it still would have been a nice finishing touch to this overall pleasing experience here. 

Will come back for more of that crab, fresh-baked sourdough bread, and bayside views!
author: Dee L.

description: It's great! The taste is fit for Asian guys! I like it! Crab is amazing, view is nice!
author: Zeyu C.

description:
Great view of bay on 2nd floor. 
Lindsey was a great server
Decent food overall
author: Dr K.

description: Love this place! Yummy food, great service! Sit at the bar with one of our favorite bartenders Vinnie! Make sure to order the crab fondue and whole sizzling crab! Can't beat the view!
author: Tanya D.

description:
We went on Thanksgiving Day. It was very busy but we were sat very quickly (about 20 minute wait) and I know why....the tables are turned over very quickly by the bussers and servers. I've eaten at many restaurants and these guys are fast.

Our server was very nice and respectful. However, after I explained that we wanted the whole crab (shaping the body with my hands to show him what I meant) and an extra 1/2 crab, he suggested for us to get the Too Two Crab because its the same but cheaper. After receiving the crab, we noticed it was not the whole crab and thought they were bringing it out after we were done with the 1st batch.

When we realized that we were wrong, I asked if that is what we ordered and he said yes. I explained "again" that we wanted the entire crab, head and all. But he explained that it was the whole crab but without the head. 

It was a good thing he was nice, just wished we would've been told what a whole crab was. Coming from Hawaii, people here eat every part of the body, head, legs, fat and juice from the inside.
author: C M.

description: The Franciscan has a nice menu with interesting options. The cups of clam and crab chowder were good. The fish [in the fish & chips] was lightly battered and flavored; no sauce needed. The service was very good and we had a view of Alcatraz.
author: Jim T.

description: The view is great!!! Service was mediocre. Came for clam chowder in bread bowl. Was super pricey, no big chunks of clam, and only a couple bites of soup in the bread bowl. Bloody Mary was subpar. Not impressed.
author: Ashley R.

description:
The view is great, got seated as soon as we came into the restaurant, got our drinks really quickly. That's where the "quickly" ended.. We waited and waited for our bread bowls.. And then waited and waited for our actual dinner. So much that our waiter comped us desert.
The food is delicious, clam chowder bread bowls 10 outa 10, the crab 10 outa 10, the garlic noodles 8 outa 10. Highly recommend this place.. The service could've been a little faster but it wasn't obnoxiously slow..
author: Nate E.

description:
Of course this restaurant is going to be very touristy because it is located in Fisherman's Wharf. My family from out of town came to the city and they told me to meet them at this restaurant for dinner. It is a very large sit down restaurant with a nice ambiance.

I am vegan and had a hard time finding something on the menu to order. The customer service was very good so I am not saying that this was an extremely horrible experience. The waitress was nice and found out what items had animal products in them. Unfortunately, I could only order a house salad ($7.95) and a side of french fries ($7.95). Not the best dinner but at least I got to see my family.

I understand that I was at a crab restaurant but having one or two options for those that don't eat seafood would be nice. Please add more vegetarian and/or vegan options to your menu!
author: Anthony H.

description: My experience at the Franciscan was positively amazing. Bianca was so friendly and sweet and the rest of her staff were great as well. You could really see the teamwork through our dining experience. My water glass was never less than half full and whenever you asked for something it came right away. I wasn't  a huge fan of their cocktails however, and should have stuck to my dirty martini. You must try the crab fondue I was in heaven. I then ordered the crab enchiladas and they were divine. It reminded me of my grandmas because they tasted homemade. Thank you for amazing experience.
author: Emily S.

description: Came in after a long day of traveling to be greeted not only by Bianca's smiling face, but her impeccable service. From the get go she was attentive and intuitive to our needs. Any time there was a pause in conversation, Bianca or her team was quick to pick up on it and make sure our needs were met and our experience was excellent. Any time I come back I will be sure to ask for her!
author: Ashley B.

description:
One of our friends took us there, saying it was the best place for Dungeness crab and I have to say he was right !

You might think at first that it is a somewhat touristy place but this place is really worth it. It also offers beautiful views over the sea. 

After a nice margarita, we headed for dinner and tried those huge and delicious crabs ! They will prepare them in front of you and give you the right tools so that it doesn't take you hours to find something to eat. 

After that delicious meal, we still thought we should go for dessert. We were on holidays after all, but when they brought this huge chocolate sundae, we wondered if it wasn't for 4 people instead of 1, even the 2 of us couldn't finish it...
author: Laetitia L.

description: My girl surprised me on my birthday on the 28th and took me here the best view overlooking the bay and the crab was amazing. Our server was really funny and I definitely would come back...romantic ambiance as well
author: Jason M.

description:
I go to San Francisco on business often and this trip we had our International Leaders with us. We wanted to show them the Wharf and if you are trying to impress, skip this place. 

The view and decor was perfect in theming and we loved that. It all went downhill the moment we met our waiter. 

He was rude, rushed, borderline abusive. When asking for our order he yelled at us and was condescending. 

He yelled at busboys and runners across the room in an abusive tone, rolled his eyes and dismissed guests when he was not stressing everyone out and yelling at them. He was equally rude to all his tables and all the employees. 

We were a group of 15 last Saturday night and are a very patient and understanding group. There was no need to rush, no need to be so high strung and certainly no need to belittle the Global VP's and his team when placing their menu orders. 

To top it all off he had the nerve to write on the receipt tipping guidelines. We of course did tip well out of principal however it is tacky. If the establishment puts a printed tipping guideline, that is acceptable. Written in ink pen by the waiter, that is uncomfortable and after the service..appalling. 

The food had mixed reviews from our group. My Toy Box Pasta dish was amazing. 

I can get great food and ambiance many places on the wharf. I will suggest trying those places unless you like stress and anger served with your entree.
author: Christina L.

description: Great experience!  Our server was wonderful, spent a lot of time describing the menu and providing valuable recommendations.  The food and the view were incredible!  Flash-fried crab and incredible fondue!
author: Jeremy M.

description: Have been here a few times.Last night had Caesar Salad super cold almost frozen no green in salad they used bottom stock only ( horrible) had Alfredo ok.Desert was frozen SENT IT BACK  that was it for me. Totally overpriced.Staff over served us they should have joined us for dinner,could not even have a glass a wine with my wife without them interrupting us.NEVER GOING HERE AGAIN
author: ROGER G.

description: This place is fantastic..The only thing better than the food is the view. It's great for sharing. Service is awesome, but it's almost always packed so the staff doesn't have enough time to give everyone their full attention. Their professionalism makes up for their lack of time. Prices are shockingly inexpensive for what they could be.
author: Jesse B.

description:
I live in San Francisco but once in a while, I love to play tourist. And there is no better place to be a tourist than Fisherman's Wharf. Especially in the summer when it is super duper packed. It feels like I'm on vacation LOL

I've always wanted to eat at this restaurant ever since I saw it across from Boudin Bistro when we took some out of town friends there. It looks like a boat! And it is nearly on the edge of the wharf so very close to the water. 

When you walk in you'll see lots of old Hollywood photographs in the walls, and famous people. Not sure they actually ate here though. As you walk up the stairs to the restaurant, you are greeted by a spectacular view of the SF Bay. Alcatraz is the focal point. I would say it was already worth going here just for the view alone. 

We were seated by the huge windows overlooking the bay.. perfect. No wait as this was early lunch. The wait staff are dressed up, and the place has an upscale feel to it. But definitely tourist-y. Yay! Their menu is perfect for tourists.. it has pictures! Usually these are not good signs but a lot of people prob find it helpful to see pictures of their food  (esp foreigners) so I'm not hating . 

We start off with the crab fondue.. with glass of sauvignon blanc (it is a Sunday morning!). The fondue was very good with lots of crab. Their menu is extensive and of course they have crab! I really love crab but just was not in the mood to eat with my hands LOL next time! So I opt out for the next best tourist-y item: clam chowder served in a bread bowl. My partner ordered the Dungeness Crab melt sandwich served with fries. Ok this was prob the best clam chowder I've had in SF so far. The crab melt was very good. But I have to say my favorite thing was the fries! Wow I can eat a whole order of that yum yum yum. Not sure what they put in it but it's pretty close to perfection. 

So we had a pretty awesome experience being tourists in our own lovely city. The service was a little slow and the prices are pretty steep.. but you expect these things when you are a tourist. Overall though, I would take visitors here and may come back when we're in a mood to have that vacation a few blocks from our home.
author: Vol T.

description: Service was good! Food was good, been doing business since 1957 - expected better. The Schmidt sohne Riesling excellent! The bread was great! View sitting bayside was nice! Giving the in house custard a try!
author: Alan H.

description: My wife and I ate here tonight.  The view was nice; big windows overlooking the bay and Alcatraz Island.  The food wasn't great, but was expensive.  Crab cakes were underwhelming and overcooked.  Shrimp Louie Salad; tiny bay shrimp, iceberg lettuce, black olives, a small boiled egg, cherry tomatoes, avocado.  Certainly not worth the price.  Chowder in a bread-bowl; the bread-bowl was not carved out enough, so there was very little chowder.  Too bad... the chowder was decent.
author: Mark R.

description:
After a meeting the group of us, some 25-30 of us decided on this restaurant. 
Excellent view, very cool menu with recipes to help describe the items. Great wine selection. 
Service was great considering to number of people we had. 
I had the crab chowder to start and seafood fettuccine. Both were nice. 
Tried the oysters, shrimp and calamari as well. 
Would go back again.
author: Trevor B.

description: Absolutely wonderful fresh seafood! Awesome views! And fantastic service. Went here after being disappointed at another place and was so glad we made that right turn off Jefferson, this place is it. I'm not super big on seafood but made my friends share with me, after a few arguments, and was very surprised how great everything was. Our waitress Jade was fantastic! There a lot of highly reviewed places across the Wharf,  and as a foodie, I'd say try them all...but try this place first...let it give you the "itis" as it did me and my friends then come back later for round two. It won't disappoint.
author: Shonita W.

description:
I'm a huge fan of seafood and this place definitely lived up to my expectations.

My family and I had the crab feast which consist of roasted whole dungeness crabs in garlic sauce served on a hotskillet. The crab feast was on the pricey side, but WELL WORTH THE MONEY. 
We had fresh raw oysters and the sauce was amazing. The oysters were a bit on the small size though.
The fire roasted mussels were flavorful, but were slightly over cooked for my taste. 

Aside from the food, the view is beautiful.  The interior design of the place is impeccable and the big windows allow you to see the Bay  in its entirety and Alcatraz in the distance.  The service was great, but with the food prices, I didn't expect any less than great service.

Before you do decide to go to this place, make sure you're willing to spend lots of $$$.
author: Sue T.

description:
Art Deco 1950's supper club with a straight on view of Alcatraz with complementary binoculars.  Beautiful view.  Atmosphere is fantastic!

Food was was very good and great portions especially due to this being a pricier place.  Everything was excellent.  I had the crab and shrimp.  Well prepared and very tasty.  Shrimp was just a bit overdone but still good. 

Wheelchair accessible which is always a plus for us!
author: Lisa D.

description: Best view of the bay with amazing Fish & Chips and Crab Fondue.  Acme sourdough is to die for!  Great for tourists and locals alike.
author: Scott S.

description:
Amazing views from the boat restaurant, but the dungeness crab really was not that great. It felt dry and mediocre. I could see why tourists come here, but as a resident of SF I would never choose to dine here. 

My favorite thing we ordered was the mussels. Soaked in butter, it was delicious.
author: Jeanne C.

description: The Franciscan Crab Restaurant is simply amazing! We were so impressed with the incredible quality and quantity of the seafood, the breathtaking views of San Francisco Bay, the fantastic and attentive service and the classy atmosphere, that I know this is the place to go, eat and enjoy on the Wharf. If you love high quality, delicious, and mouth watering food, you will love and appreciate this great restaurant.
author: Marshall M.

description:
Our favorite place to eat on Fisherman's Wharf. The restaurant is clean and fresh, the views are the best, and the food is consistently delicious. 

This is one of our favorite places to visit when my husband & I want a special date and also a grand experience for friends from out of town that want to see SF!
author: Gail H.

description:
My server, Raul C, was excellent. He had great timing throughout and was very nice and personable. He's 5Star for sure!
I was there midday on a weekday so the restaurant was pretty slow. I'm a local SF'er but it's a touristy spot for sure and I had never been.  A nice dining room with a great outlook onto the bay and beyond.
I really enjoyed my cup of CRABchowder and give that a 5 (full of crabmeat, not skimpy at all)...but then I had a crab enchilada and I'd give that a 2 at best. I should have known better to mix my desired flavor of crab in a dish so heavily flavored but Raul did suggest it out of the 3 items I asked him about. The enchilada was doughy. I basically picked through it and ate the crab; luckily i wasn't that hungry. Actually, I give the enchilada a 1 as I found it practically inedible.
The guy next to me ordered the mussels which came on a sizzling skillet (like fajitas do) and they looked (sounded) DELICIOUS. I wished I had ordered them but it's crab season right now so that's what I wanted.
I should have ordered the crab sliders as was my instinct - so my rating is marked down a little because of my entree.
author: A K.

description: The food here is somewhat over-priced but you're paying for the view which, seated along a window upstairs, centers on Alcatraz and the counties north of the Bay.  On a bright, sunny day in late September, the food is more than good enough and the bill was acceptable (though $4.50 each for tea and coffee is rather steep).  A trio of sea-food topped belinnis was the high-spot, though my daughter also liked her green salad and the garlic noodles with shrimp were satisfactory.  Coming from Blue Crab country, I avoided the Dungeness crabs on offer here.  I once thought them wonderful but no longer.
author: Norman G.

description:
Sunday night in the restaurant was busy when we dined at 8pm.  It's a nice, fairly large restaurant with personal service.  We tried the prix fixe menu: the first and last courses were outstanding - first course was the house salad and clam chowder soup, while the last course was frozen vanilla custard.  So good with lots of flavor!  The main course was not as outstanding as the appetizer and dessert, however: we tried the crab enchiladas and the spicy shrimp pasta.  The crab enchiladas lacked flavor (I have a feeling the crab flavor might have neutralized the enchilada flavors), while the shrimp pasta was just pasta with shrimp in it (the spice was felt at the end of tasting.)  

We were lucky enough to have a booth for our party of 2, and we sat facing the Bay and there was a pair of binoculars chained to our booth which provided a closeup and clear view of Alcatraz, as well as other nearby areas.  THAT provides a unique experience.
author: Jessee A.

description:
All I can say is WOW! Don't miss going here.
The views are like being in a postcard.
Add the views with great food and you'll make this place a mainstay when down on the Wharf.
I ordered the grilled crab and shrimp, it was grilled to perfection.
Also had the raw oysters for an appetizer and they brought out real horseradish by request to go with it.
Food, service, wait staff, and the view were all awesome.
I will be back again!
author: Shawn R.

description:
Don't order Cioppino here!

Cioppino is 1 of my favorite dish and I always order it if on the menu.  Well it was pretty bad here...  I mean 1 of the worst I've had.  

Ordered "medium" size and it came out on what looked like strange bowl/urn to hold ashes or hold flowers or something.  Mostly marinara sauce (and lots of it ) and very LITTLE seafood!  All that for $39.95 for essentially large bowl of marinara sauce with few shellfish, mystery fish bites and few crab legs?  Rip-off all right and not to mention not much of taste or flavor.

I give it 2-stars for good service and tall frosty Anchor Steam on tap.  Definitely tourist trap...
author: Duke Vespa P200E D.

description: This is the best restaurant in San Francisco. As Italian i can really say: oh shit! This is truly Italian food! It's really amazing, and it's nice having a trusted restaurant for taking people and feeling you did a good impression. 5+ stars all deserved !!!
author: Francesco F.

description: My wife and I went there for Christmas lunch.  Food was good, table was not great which I understand however the hostess told me it would be 20 mins. and it was more like 45.  I don't mind waiting because of the holiday but be more realistic because now I find your hostesses either  have no idea of the business or they lied to me.  I would like to come back during the week when they open up and get a nice table with a good view.
author: Greg W.

description: I came here with some friends. The view was beautiful, service was horrible. It took 20 minute for our server to come. Our chowder was had frozen seafood in it, and our main course was bland and some where too salty. We asked for a manager after waiting 20 minutes for his arrival we left. Lastly called and spoke with the assistant gm, had horrible customer service became combative. We will never come back to the restaurant again. Too many restaurants in the area with better food and service.
author: Brian H.

description:
We have enjoyed a dinner there, with beautiful views of the San Francisco Bay.
But the service was not at good as we have expected: they forgot to serve us the clams chowder before the first course and we have to wait too much for another drink.
However, the food was delicious, the Dungeness crab was so yummy, with that garlic butter sauce...soooo good!
author: Antonio M.

description: Tourists spot, food was ok or over cooked some of them. Everything is deep fried...why can't they provide some raw seafood? Wondered.
author: Aspen H.

description:
Came here on a Saturday, very busy, rushed & stressful. Our waiter was a little slow in the beginning but made up for it later. The people were nice. I'm from out of town & was looking forward to some good seafood. 

   Unfortunately, it really wasn't that good & I've had better house salads at a nice quaint restaurant. My friends' crab soup wasn't impressive at all & was too small for the price. My other friend got a BBQ sandwich & did not like it (very bland).

   I would NOT recommend this place & would suggest finding a restaurant "off the beaten path". Too much $$ for average food.
author: Rachel E.

description: Great food and service.. The menu is like reading a short story I think it's 36 pages with pictures and descriptions that the food comes out just like it looked in the menu. It's very old fashioned in style but I've ate here over the years and it has been consistently good. Leave room for the ice cream sundae
author: Jud S.

description: Love their roast crab,  soooo good.  This is one of our stops when we are in San Francisco!
author: Methinee A.

description: There is a reason my wife and I always stop in San Francisco when flying west...and that reason is the crab at the Franciscan Crab House This place never ceases to amaze my taste buds! The crab and mussels on the iron skillet is a meal fit for angels...and I am grateful to be able to share it with them on occasion. No doubt I will be back to SFO soon and stuffing myself with the crab.
author: Marc J.

description:
I came here with my family (a group of 10 people) for my birthday dinner! Was craving  1) a beautiful Bay view 2) great seafood. Did I accomplish the two? Well, read on...

Because it was a Saturday night and we had no reservations, the wait time they gave us was 30 minutes. Fortunately, another employee happened to walk by and mentioned that there was outdoor seating on the patio with heaters. In retrospect, this is the best thing that happened to us that night because the view was GORGEOUS. 

Because every thing on the menu is offered in Small, Medium, Large, we decided to order three Large tureens (shrimp pescatore, seafood cioppino, and garlic steamed clams), crab cakes, fresh oysters on ice, a plate of Fish and Chips, and some cocktails to share. Loved the super fresh oysters and crab cakes had the right texture and taste.  

The cioppino, pescatore, and clams were only fair. Lightly spiced tomato base with a nice blend of your expected sea creatures. Had enough seafood for everyone to share and great portion size, but the cioppino and pescatore just tasted TOO similar. I would not order them together again, the pescatore essentially tasted like the cioppino but an only-shrimp version. The garlic broth for the clams was very, very buttery. The tureens were nothing to write home about, but enjoyed them nonetheless.

Sadly, the fish and chips is where they went totally wrong. Firstly, there was NO tarter sauce or vinegar with it. Just ketchup. That just seemed off to me. Also, the fish batter was well-flavored but not crunchy enough and every time anyone cut into the fish to eat it, the batter would come off. That tells me that they did not fry it in hot enough oil. 

I expect every seafood restaurant to have it's fish and chips on point. Sadly, Franciscan did not meet that expectation. They did however serve some pretty solid seafood fare and an uninterrupted ocean view.  Next time. I'll just go to the nearby seafood shacks or smaller cafes, unless I'm really willing to pay a lot for the view.
author: Arushi S.

description:
What a great spot!  Wandered around the Wharf looking for a good lunch destination and found the Franciscan.  First of all, the atmosphere is fantastic: beautiful panoramic view of the Bay and Alcatraz from any table because dining room floor is at different levels sort of like stadium seating do everyone can enjoy the view!  The waiters and waitresses are dressed to impress.  All wore black pants, jacket and black tie-kinda nice to see sometimes, you know?
They are famous for their crabs so if you are a fan, this is the place to go!  I was in the mood for fish so I had a grilled red snapper which was perfectly cooked and thankfully, not over seasoned!
Menu was like a recipe book-colorful pictures of each dish along with the recipe-how great is that!  We had lunch there so while busy, we did not have to wait.  My guess is that reservations are required for dinner.  Mix of casual and formal dress during lunch. Enjoy!!
author: Larry W.

description: Snack here at 2pm. Freshly made fried fishwich, fish & chips, 3 beignets. Clam chowder. All tasted great. No free parking. Quick service in bottom cafe.
author: Clifford W.

description:
Great view and the appetizers were excellent, but do NOT get the crab enchiladas - way way way too much sauce and it completely overpowers the meal.

Verdict: not worth it for the food - the value here is in the view and atmosphere.
author: Max S.

description:
I took another chance at The Franciscan after a bad experience and got a somewhat better one this time around. So I am giving it an extra star.

The downside ... I asked for a table with a view and was given a table next to a window overlooking some benches and trash cans with homeless people milling around them. And bright white flood lights. The same thing happened the last time as well. From now on, I will not ask for a table with a view and will look at the other diners instead.

The service this time was better ... our waitress was overworked but capable, and although she pushed the watered down alchoholic drinks on us frequently, she did a good job bringing everything out in a timely manner despite having a ton of tables to wait.

The crab was good ... although I would prefer more garlic butter for dipping. It is served on a hot stone type of thing and most of the butter sauce seems to have hardened on the top of the stone. The crab was bigger than the last time ... it seems that ordering a single crab will yeild a much bigger crab than if you order the crab for 2 or 3 people, in which case the price is doubled but it seems the portion is only 1 1/2 times bigger.

Fresh dungeoness crab is pretty amazing stuff and I didn't feel let down by the taste/size of this order. Last time, we got the crab for 2 and felt like it could have served 1 person.

The sourdough bread is very good ... but the alchoholic drinks here are useless. I warned my family not to get them but they did anyways and most said they were dissapointed that at $15 each, they didn't feel so much as a buzz after two or three drinks.

The other people I was with had fried seafood and said everything was very fresh and tasted good.

I think the next time I am in San Francisco, I will try the Crab House because their yelp rating is a bit higher ... but The Franciscan is a lot larger and in a less crowded area, so it might be less of a wait to go here. The atmosphere is nice in a modern/sterile type of way and the food was better this time around.

I wasn't blown away by my experience but it wasn't a bad one like the last time. I would recommend this restaurant to friends who were visiting San Francisco.
author: E T.

description: Beautiful view with nice service. Food is decent. Doesn't blow you away but hits the spot for a safe seafood place with nice ambiance. Not bad for cocktails at the bar either.
author: Vanessa R.

description: I feel nothing special with this restaurant! I went their by myself and order set menu, meal is not big!! But for service is very good!
author: Ao S.

description:
The design of the restaurant really attracts me to bring my family for a dinner.. And i heard that it's pretty good.. so why not give it a try.???

First of all... Their bread... it's pretty normal and it's kinda cold... it will be nicer if it's a little warmer... so by going through the menu... My mom and I shared a 3 course menu.. 

It's pretty normal and I think there is nothing special about it.. It might be better to order a bowl of clam chowder on the street cause it's cheaper.. :P

The only thing I can remember it's the rice they served.. I don't know how to describe it but it's like dipping dots... :D but of course it's warm... and you know it's rice...

We shared prosciutto di san daniele.. It's really thin slice ham... Really special... not too salty... perfect... and it's perfect as an appetizer.. 

As for entree... sizzling dungeness crab legs.. It's a little too salty for me... But it's ok... nothing special about it..
author: Shing Yiing O.

description:
I ordered the "regular" seafood cioppino. That's the smallest size, but it's larger than any standard restaurant bowl. It's more like a regular bowl of pho. I can't imagine with "medium" and "large" are. Probably a tureen and a bucket, respectively.

It was spicy and exciting, with two large crab legs, tender fish, shrimp, clams and mussels galore. I was stuffed. Best cioppino I've had in San Francisco, or anywhere, really.

Stare out to sea and cloudgaze through floor-to-20-ft-ceiling windows. Take in a sunset. I think I've found a new favorite.
author: Diane Y.

description:
We have ended up here twice in the last two years. Both times were on a Saturday afternoon. While the streets and businesses all around were crowded, we were quickly seated. 
The main attraction here is the view. Amazing.
The service has been great both times.
The food and drinks are good with many options.

My only suggestion, some of the oysters were too small to be served regardless of variety.
author: Glenn S.

description:
As you move forward through life, you're bound to learn some surprising things.

Like that hangovers give you hot flashes.  I'm not especially proud that my life's journey has led me to that lesson, but here we are.  

I've also learned that you can take any statement that follows "I'm the kind of person who..." and assume the opposite is true.  That one came in particularly handy when I was dating, but it's still useful at times, like when I get a new boss.

The other day, I learnt from PBS that Henry VIII had a velvet toilet seat. 

And -- contrary to beliefs at the very core of my existence -- last year I learned that there is great dining and drinking to be had at Fisherman's Wharf.  At The Franciscan.

The Mr. and I discovered The Franciscan on an odd odyssey.  Before taking an overseas trip last year, we decided to practice being tourists (it's not neurotic, it's called PLANNING), and we scooted down to the wharf for a little sidewalk crab.  But it was windy, and I don't like cocktail sauce in my hair, and I was very, very hungry.  Plus, there were way too many people walking around like they had nowhere to go, which drives me crazy, even though they're on vacation for chrissakes and that's totally my stupid problem.  Still, danger was in the air.  The Mr. had to think fast to protect the visored and fanny-packed.  He steered me into The Franciscan, against every remaining instinct my blood sugar could muster.  

And it was one of the best lunches I've ever had.  Certainly not one of the cheapest, but absolutely wonderful.  We had the whole crab in garlic and of course wine.  The food was amazing, our server was a doll, the view is astonishing, and the decor is so retro glam, I kept waiting for Lana Turner to sit down next to us and bum a smoke.  

So the next time you're looking to break your routine and try something different, head to the wharf and have a few drinks while enjoying our beautiful harbor.  If you get hot flashes the next day, I guarantee it will be worth it.
author: Rosie W.

description:
Good food, amazing view.  The view in this restaurant is spectacular.  I don't think there is a seat in the house where you can't look out over the bay and Alcatraz.  This is what you are paying for.  It is definitely on the pricey end.  The food was definitely delicious but I'm not sure it was $20+ per plate delicious.  I ordered off the Prix Fixe menu, giving me the option of clam chowder or a salad, one of six main courses and dessert.  The total on the meal was $30, essentially equating to free dessert.  

I enjoyed the clam chowder and the crab alfredo.  My friend ordered the chicken alfredo and they brought out the wrong dish.  Once we were able to flag down our server she was apologetic and it wasn't a long wait before the correct dish was brought out.  

We managed to get there before the rush, but I overheard them saying there was a 45 minute wait around 6:30 / 7:00.
author: Jessica J.

description:
It's a great place to sit on the water and have drinks. We loved the view. 

The food, I'm not sure if all oysters in frisco are small, but the ones they served were tiny. 

Only reason we would go back is to drink on the patio.
author: Cody H.

description: I've walked by this place a dozen times in the past but never felt the desire to actually go in.  I guess I figured it was just some tourist trap on the pier, and for all I know it still may be but I will say that this place is really cool.  The decor grabs you when you walk in and then the view just sweeps you off your feet.   Many of the table have binoculars at them so you can enjoy your view of Alcatraz and other sites on the water.  We sat at the bar and had excellent service.  We already had dinner reservations else where so we couldn't order too much food but we had to try something and settled on the octopus condito which was excellent.  Can't wait to return and have another go at this place.
author: Leonard S.

description: Good food and a fantastic view.  While restaurants like this cater to a predominantly tourist crowd, the seafood is great and we had no complaints.  Also, my friend and I arrived here with kiddos, and the staff was gracious and accommodating.  Extra points!
author: Mishka B.

description: Good place. Just stopped in after a long bike ride for a bread bowl of clam chowder. I'm a nut for good clam chowder. Of course the bread was phenomenal,made by the Boudin bakery across the street. The chowder was very good. Plenty of clam and not too much potato. And good and hot. Service was average, and ambiance was very San Francisco wharf, with good views of the bay. Good place for lunch.
author: Jason B.

description:
Got a quick reservation at 6pm on a Saturday night.  Now I know why.

Pros:  lovely views, binoculars available at the tables next to the windows- highly recommend.  That way when they take FOREVER to get your food out you can look at everyone else enjoying themselves on the boats.  Nice waitress.

Cons:  pretty much everything.  Clam chowder tastes like potato soup, crab is weird tasting and dry (baked- ew), calamari is greasy, CRAB chowder is absolutely disgusting (from a can maybe?) sent it back, prix fixe menu is garbage- the rib tasted like it came from a slow cooker (and I would have done it better with onion soup mix and cream of mushroom soup), creamy spinach bland and potatoes...well...gross.  Dinner took about two hours, and with two kids, that just plain sucks. 

Need I say more?  You pay for the ambience.  Horribly overpriced.  Even if the service was perfect, I would not come here again.  You shouldn't either.  Sorry, Franciscan.
author: Allyson K.

description: Hello, sorry for the delayed response. I visited on Saturday the 7th, like I said we were not offered main dishes, only order an appetizer and drinks the card that was used would be under Anita Groeneveld. My mother stated she could check the charge on her card if an amount is needed. We did complain to the manager who seemed the least bit interested, once we paid for our bill we discover we were also charged for a drink that was never ordered. The charge was then voided and recharged the correct amount.
author: Megan R.

description: Nice place right on the water with views of the bay. Expensive drinks ($15/rum & coke, $15/vodka soda). They have a very reasonable prixe fix menu for $39.95 with choice of house salad or soup, entree and dessert. Tons of seafood options for seafood lovers. I don't eat seafood but I had a very tasty petit filet mignon or other option was braised boneless beef which was also very tasty. Service ok. Would've liked to enjoy the restaurant in daytime to really appreciate views.
author: Katherine R.

description: The only thing good thing about this restaurant is the view. The staff was lazy and food terrible. It was dirty and way over priced. Thumbs down !!
author: Scott P.

description:
First off let me say I'm a big fan of the Franciscan, but what's happened to the Crabfest? 

I moved away for a few years and have just moved back. I used to eat at the Franciscan weekly. The crabfest used to be a fully loaded skillet which would challenge the most ardent of crab lovers leaving 3 to 4 people well satisfied. Last weekend I ordered the Crabfest, it had gone up in price a little (used to be $99 now $114) but thats fine, what was disappointing is the serving size. It's dramatically smaller than it used to be, it wasn't just our table I saw others with similar smaller servings. 

Crabfest is no more, its more like Crabscrooge, what happened?
author: Matt F.

description: Although we didn't go to the crab restaurant upstairs, we did grab a bite to eat at the little seafood cafe they had on the 1st floor. They serve up fried seafood and sandwiches such as their famous fishwich. We had the shrimp and chips and the chicken and chips. The chicken was a little dry, but the fries are to die for! We nearly finished them all in both baskets! They're seasoned and very crispy...must be some good fry oil! Would come back the next time I'm in San Francisco...I even wanted to come back later in my trip but there were other places we wanted to check out.
author: Brian P.

description:
I rarely write reviews, however, my experience at the Franciscan crab was so despicable that adding this review was not an option.
I organize corporate events and recently planned a dinner party there for 30pax.
Not only the food was mediocre, the service awful, but they also changed a contract without my consent, charging us more.. Finally, as we tried to solve the issue, three persons got back to me, all telling me different things: you will be refunded, you won't be refunded, this is our mistake, this is your mistake. 
Overall, not only the quality of food and service is bad, but they are also rude and not professional
There are plenty of restaurants in SF where you can find affordable seafood while enjoying a beautiful view and Franciscan crab is most definitely one to avoid at all cost.
I hope my experience there will be helpful and avoid you the misfortune of having dinner there.
author: Chloe J.

description:
The good is delicious. I had an amazing petite filet mignonette that was outstanding. It came with a side of cream spinach that was incredible and the waitress suggested I change my potatoes to a pasta side that has rice, snap peas, and sun dried tomatoes that was definitely the right choice. 

My parents had the crab, shrimp, and mussel combo. They said it was incredible. 

We shared desserts and they were great. The chocolate sundae and Italian cheesecake were outstanding. 

The service here is first class and we truly enjoyed our dinner. The views of the bay are wonderful and give the restaurant a great ambiance. I would suggest anyone's visit to San Francisco and especially to Fishermans Warf should include a meal at this fine establishment.
author: Ryan S.

description:
Expensive and mediocre. I stopped in because we were hungry and didn't know where else to go being so late in the evening. The fishwich place down below was closed for evening so we settled for this restaurant.

I would only find this place worth it during day where you can enjoy the view. In the evening, you don't really see much outside.  

I asked for a recommendation and our server said that the most popular page is their crab menu items. 

I ended up going with the dungeness crab for $50+ which I shared with my nephew. I thought the portion was too much between after a while and got tired of eating it after a while.  

Our server was not attentive and didn't really come by too often to check in. He was not friendly, cold, and didn't bring my bread and olive oil when I ordered it. I had to ask him again to bring it over.  I ordered also a lemonade and mashed potatoes.

At about $110 including tip, this was one pricey meal that in the end, I didn't feel was worth it.

Go for the view if anything and the dungeness crab.
author: Anne Explores LA +.

description: Great service an attentive wait staff and delicious mixed drinks especially the raspberry mint . Delicious food too.
author: M K.

description: Great food! Had calamari as an appetizer and clam chowder with the Bellini trio as my meal. The bellinis were very good, highly recommend them! The only reason I wouldn't give 5 stars is because we had some trouble being in a large group and dividing up the bill. We had to ask for the manager to approve all separate payments, usually they only allow 3 card payments per table.
author: Emilia W.

description:
2 stars for the food and 1 for the view.

I love being able to stare outside the window and see the bay!
That's about where the excitement stops though..
Food was okay, none of the dishes at our table were nearly
as exciting as their counterparts in the printed menu (which is for sale!).
My dish came with deep fried broccoli.. unbreaded,
which made it too dry to be edible.
Definitely a touristy place that's good to try while hungry and you're here,
but I wouldn't make a trip for it.

Service was good and the decor is a bit cheesy-old-Hollywood..
but the VIEW.. the view definitely deserves a star.
It's not romantic, but at least it feels like you're at the pier bird-watching.
author: Jade T.

description:
I really enjoyed my meal at the Franciscan.     We'd been on vacation for a week when we visited so I was not in the mood for a big dinner so I had a cup of the clam chowder and the crab sandwich.     The sandwich was fantastic!   My third crab dish in two days it was hands down the best of the lot.      My husband had the short ribs that were so tender the meat melted in your mouth.    His mashed potatoes were yummy too!

We didn't do dessert but they looked really good and worth a try on the next visit.

My only complaint is that our waiter disappeared for quite a long time at the end of our meal leaving us waiting longer than we would have liked for the check.   I would blame it on our small order causing him not to be attentive to us but he had other tables with much bigger tabs waiting too.   Once he came back, he resumed his prompt service.
author: Ann K.

description: Don't go here.  Franciscan does not honor reservations.  They have walk ins as well as people with reservations line up to check in together.  Reservations are worthless here and the food is ok only.  Over priced
author: Dan C.

description:
The Franciscan is a very busy restaurant in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf, with a great view of the SF Bay.

After a quick wait and enjoying a drink at the bar, we were shown to our table and the server explained the menu.  There are different ways you can order crab legs, shrimp and/or mussels depending on your party size and appetite.  We ordered crab and mussels, along with clam chower to start.  The clam chowder was served in a sourdough bread bowl - soooo fresh and delicious - I could have eaten only that for my entire time in SF!

The crab and mussels were so/so to me.  This was the first time I'd eaten crab and mussels this way.  Personally I prefer mussels served in broth Thai style or with tomatoes and garlic.  The crab also had a weird sauce on it that I could have done without - I'm happy with warm butter!  The food and service was good - these are just my personal preferences, so I know better for next time :)
author: Aymie R.

description: Great crab plate.  I suggest the lemon pepper seasoning. The calamari was average in flavor but had a great crispness to it and did NOT get soggy. The farce that accompanied it was good, a bit of a kick.  Service was fine but not great however, very nice people. I left full!
author: Megan R.

description: We are especially happy with the service as they catered to our 3 year old with her small spills, crumbs, etc... All smiles the whole time. The prices are up there, but when you look at the real estate who can really complain? Surely not us. The seafood was phenomenal and Martin was an even better waiter. His busboy too.
author: Marc R.

description: Some of the best seafood my hubby and I have ever eaten! We split a small cup of the crab chowder, he got the whole roasted crab, and I had the sea bass in Thai curry sauce. We both have gluten intolerances and our waiter, Yuri P., was VERY accommodating! We came on Fourth of July and didn't expect to have an amazing experience since it was so busy, but if it's this good on busy days, I can't wait to come back on a normal day!
author: Lauren C.

description: Well I can see why the locals would haunt this place.  Chowder. B plus.  Crabs A plus.   Service as expected for the view and price of fair.  Good way to see a bit of wharf history by looking at all the old photos.
author: Robert J.

description: Dinner was great , service great , called at 1130am made reservations for 7pm ,got there they didn't have my reservation.  Girl said that morning girl didn't write it down ,had to wait ,
author: Michael M.

description:
Crab was very small. Service from waitress very slow...seated promptly however. Water came 20 minutes in to visit. Order came 25 minutes after waiting 40 minutes to order.
Nice view!
Can't beat that!
Wife's fish was excellent when she finally got it!
Yes there July 2nd in afternoon.
Here one more day.
author: Chip S.

description:
Kind of disappointed. We ordered crabs, Caesar salad and fries for almost $200. There was 6 of us and we finished the whole plate of crabs. 

Has a nice view but not worth the money.
author: C C.

description: This place is beautiful, but if you're going for crab it's not worth it if you're past mid December or so. After that, they start using frozen crab and somehow the Chefs do not know how to properly thaw the crab to prevent the obvious frozen taste. It's a pity...during the start of crab season the Franciscan is awesome. Any other time though, it's not worth the extra few feet to go there instead of the other multitude of mediocre joints in the wharf. *feeling bummed*
author: Food D.

description: Bar Tender so rude 7 people walked from restaurant since he had back to all of us gossiping about employee's when approached with letting him know he said someone else will wait on you instead of thanking me for trying to get his attention. Yet two guys came in and were served with excellence and immediately....  The wine he selected was.old and the oysters if eaten could of been hazardous.  When ask for manager they other fellow mates working  tried to joke amongst each other laughing and staring back at us..I think including  a manager.  After previously spending lots of money with customers in restaurant area two weeks prior, I was appalled by behavior and lack of maturity and  professionalism they also showed major signs of not treating woman alone well... obvious sexual discrimination!
author: Public Review C.

description: Great ambiance, good views , service was ok. Between 2 adults and a 3 year old we spent about $200. The only thing good about what we ordered was our appetizer, calamari. Tried their crab chowder, it tasted like rancid melted margarine.
author: Fameeza K.

description: Crab, shrimp and oysters were very good. Don't bother getting the mussels. Tourist but still good food
author: Lucas L.

description: Seafood has always been a big no-no for me until my friend took me to the Fransiscan Crab. I thank her for making me go there and try their amazing crabs. God, I had never ever thought that I would love seafood like their crab this much!! I literally couldn't stop eating instead of having just one. My friend had the Crab Alfredo and she let me taste it - it was a good as everything else. The overall service was also very impressive as they were open to all types of suggestions. Looking forward to planning another visit to satisfy my new love for crabs.
author: Eduardo M.

description:
Yes, I'm local, and NO I don't care that this is in a touristy part of San Francisco.  Frankly some San Franciscan's and Bay Area folks are neighborhood snobs when in comes to The City, and in most cases I would agree, but I can't find a single thing not to love about The Franciscan Crab Resaurant.  The food is always amazing and fresh.  Hands down the best mussels I've ever had (roasted in their wood buring oven), service is on point...even charming, without being overly intrussive.  The views are out of this world, and almost every table has access to the view.  Parking is validated at the adjacent Fisherman's Wharf lot, which help defray the wicked cost of parking in this "Tourist Trap" area of The City.  

Warm sourdough bread, excellent sea food, million dollar views and great for a family get together or a cozy romantic dinner.
author: Michele M.

description:
Update 11/30/12:  I was contacted by Franciscan management and was told the area had a power outage that day. They sent a gift certificate towards a dinner at their restaurant in the future. Very pleased with that follow up.  

Having said that, I still think they could have posted a sign on a piece of paper and taped it to the front of the restaurant for unsuspecting customers - just something they should consider should another power outage occur in the future.

Have upgraded my original one star to three stars for the restaurant's prompt follow-up.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Closed on a Saturday Night without notice?!? 

We had made reservations online in advance for last night at 7:15 p.m. for a very special evening out. We even received a confirmation email from the restaurant a few days before we arrived. 

When we arrived at the restaurant last night, it was closed and gated. We stood outside and called their phone number and it just rang and rang...

There was no sign outside with an explanation WHY they were closed, nor a message on their answering machine (would that have been so hard to do?).  Lights were on, but nobody home...

At the very least, they could have sent out an email via their reservation system, giving us a heads-up so that we could make alternate plans/reservations...

To make matters worse, we had just met another couple earlier in the day, on vacation from Finland, and raved about the restaurant - we brought them along for dinner. Imagine our disappointment/embarrassment to be greeted by a chained fence. 

Instead, we were forced to go to another restaurant - without reservations on a Saturday night (!) and had to wait over an hour to be seated. 

Very disappointed in their lack of common courtesy to their loyal customers...sent them an email - interested to see what explanation they have for this rude behavior. Will update post if they have the courtesy to reply.
author: Stephanie F.

description: Food was great I ordered the double crab double clam great taste but wasn't meant for two! good thing my girlfriend and I both ordered the same meal but great vibe a 20 min wait to be seated and nice view all around pretty good experience would go again. Found the restaurant right off of yelp made reservations from the app.
author: Marlo M.

description:
I try to go to the bar of this restaurant every time I visit SF.
The view is great, so as food, drinks and service :)
It can get super busy on Saturday nights. So, I would not even attempt to show up there at that time. But, sometime at 4pm is the best. You still get to enjoy the view and the atmosphere.
On top of it, they validate parking for 2 hour!
author: S ..

description: After stopping by at least 5 other restaurants in the area that served a clam chowder bread bowl, my wife and I couldn't find one that didn't serve bacon in their soup. After walking through the piers, we stumbled along this place that had delicious bacon-free clam chowder. The service was excellent, and of course, the chowder was amazing. Definitely worth the trip from Sacramento. I highly recommend.
author: Tamer M.

description: This had to be the worst meal I've ever had.  We payed some serious money for our dinner, which is why I had higher standards for the quality of the food.  I'd also like to say I have NEVER written a negative review before!  My sons meal was actually brought to our table BURNED.  I was looking at him during the .5 seconds that the person (it wasn't our waiter) dropped it off.  We then had to wait 5 minutes for our waiter to come over and help us.  How disappointing.  I have to stop typing it is so frustrating to recount the other issues with the meal and service.
author: Gloria S.

description:
The husband and I had a really relaxed, really nice dinner here.

The view is amazing and it seems like every table in the place has a view.  If you're not right in a window seat they have neat booths that are curved in with a bench seat that faces the water.  So cool!

We had the crab fondue appetizer - it was gooey and cheesy and had enormous chunks of crab.  So good!  It came with too little bread but a server noticed we were about out and brough some more without us having to ask. 

We each had salads - I had the crab Louie and my husband had a crab Ceasar.  Both were fresh tasting and filling.  

Sure this is probably more on the touristy side (and yes, we were tourists) but I did hear at least 3 locals recommend this restaurant. I think if I lived in the area I'd end up there once in awhile.
author: Gina K.

description: The Franciscan was our first restaurant we visited in San Fran , and I must say I was surprisingly underwhelmed, the atmosphere itself is very eclectic and beautiful as well as the view from the large windows that look out over the bay, but the food itself left me wishing we had decided to go somewhere else. The calamari was the best part of our meal but they serve it with cocktail sauce which to me just seems like a lack of effort and originality, also tasted as though it came out of a can. The Louie shrimp salad was the most expensive part of our meal, the shrimp were extremely small and tasteless and it reminded me of a salad you can get at any diner. The foggy wharf crab sliders were good and had a good taste but the breakfast style potato side dish left me a little confused and didn't seem to mesh with the entree well, seemed just like a filler side. All in all it just left us feeling like we weren't paying for quality food, we were just paying for the setting, I would not recommend this restaurant to our friends.
author: Jon F.

description: Very bad service. All of the tables around us received little to no service. Bus team was extremely rude. Food was over priced and poor quality. Felt bad that our large section only had one waiter.
author: R T.

description:
GREAT PLACE TO EAT.

This is one of my favorite places, the service is really good, The view is spectacular and the food is Amazing, "their Appetizers are delicious". I will go back anytime.
author: Sara A.

description: This place is (obviously) known for their crabs. I got the Crab Alfredo, and it was delicious! My only complaint about the dish was that the pasta was still sticking together. I would suggest that you reserve early; this place is so popular, it is hard to get a reservation. It has great views of Alcatraz, and cool pictures everywhere! 5 stars!
author: Delaney G.

description:
I was pleasantly surprised by the Franciscan. I had gone to SF for a day trip and my mom and I hadn't planned anything in advance. We had just looked at WHERE magazine and since it boasted the best crab in town, we decided to ask the concierge at the hotel to make a reservation.

We walked over to pier 43 1/2 and at first didn't really want to walk in because it didn't look the cleanest. Right across from it is Boudin, another seafood restaurant, and it looked really nice. We actually walked over there first to check out the menu, but it didn't have any crab. Sure, it had crab cakes and crab sandwiches, but my mom and I were really hungering for freshly steamed crab legs. So we decided to give the Fransican a chance since we already had a reservation.

Walking up the stairs, the inside was loud and cheerful. We were ushered to our table right away. Everything on the menu looked delicious: we ordered a medium skillet of mussels and shrimp and a pound of crab (about 9 legs). When it arrived, everything looked sooo good.

The crab legs were steamed in their garlic butter sauce, but it wasn't dripping with oil. In fact, it seemed like the restaurant knew just the right amount of sauce to put on to still get that great sea flavor. This was the first time I never dipped the crab in butter, even though we had a cup full of it given.

With the shrimp and mussels came a reduced balsamic sauce on the side; I really urge you to try it. It tastes so good with the mussels.

I really recommend this place! It was FANtastic.
My mom and I ate until we were stuffed; without eating any of the bread, this was the perfect amount of food.

Can't wait to come back!
author: Jasmine L.

description:
Came here on a weekday afternoon with a group while on vacation in San Francisco. Being from a town with lots of tourist we knew that if we are around this location the food might not be great, and certainly not authentic. Either way it was  easy to pick a place near by. 

Entering you get a great view, and the window tables even have binoculars to look outside. A nice and fun touch. The menu is large and the portions even larger. It was easy to split a soup and entree between two people. Service was good as well. As for the food, we were not disappointed, we were not expecting 5 star food but it was still very good. Soup was great, crab dip was great, and the main courses the table had were very good. 

If you want to eat in the touristy part of town I would say this is a good bet to have a good meal without taking the risk of poor touristy food.
author: Paul T.

description: Good seafood, we had a huge party and orders came out correctly and in reasonable time.  Didn't really find much to fault them on.  They validate for the open lot right across the street, sometimes the entrance is blocked, but if you just wait, it'll open up.
author: Raphael L.

description:
Beautiful view, this place has an amazing view where you can sit hours and hours and enjoy yourself.
Food wasn't that great, we ordered fish and chips, crab, mussels and calamari.. fish and chips were the best amongst others.. Mussels had a very bad smell, crab was average and calamari was very oily. As far as the service, clearly they are over staffed.. There were more people running around than customers.. Our server was over the board insincere, it was very annoying.. Overall was an average experience except the view, that was amazing!
author: Seda M.

description:
Extremely pricey, but fairly good. Service is alright due to the servers having a bit of an attitude.  The place probably fits about a hundred people, but due to the immense popularity of the place - it takes FOREVER to get a table.  I would recommend arriving early if you have a group larger than four people.  Definitely recommend to someone visiting the area, or is trying to get a taste of San Francisco. 

Recommendations: Fried Calamari and Clam Chowder in a Bread Bowl
author: Jason C.

description: Beautiful view, but the food is terrible! There were 4 of us and not one of us could eat or enjoy our meal and the bread was rock hard. High price...you're paying for the view. I suggest, if you want to enjoy the view, have a drink in the bar (view included) and go enjoy your meal somewhere else!
author: Pam S.

description:
I apologize for the 4, but I am a bit bias. Crab House is my #1 crab spot! 

My boyfriend first introduced me to this place a year ago for my birthday. The scenery is beautiful and very romantic, the seating is not on top of eachother, which I completely appreciated. The staff has been nothing but friendly and attentive each time we have visited.

Now for the menu, I love pictures. It is nice to see what your food is going to look like prior to ordering and the menu is diverse in selection. Every time we go, we order the crab/shrimp meal, while adding a few appetizers, a lemonade and one of their speciality alcoholic beverages. 

I'm taking my girlfriends here next week for a ladies night out. The scene should be nothing but beautiful and will hopefully be filled with Christmas lights. There is nothing like the Crab House, but this location offers a larger selection for more picky eaters to chose from.
author: Angela M.

description: I appreciate Jose's apology, but you know what, if you are not going to honor reservations, then do not take them on OpenTable.  People such as myself actually make the effort to book a reservation on OpenTable because we are under impression it means something to have a reservation.  If we get the same wait times as walk ups, from my perspective we were mislead.  Just be honest and do not take reservations...make it first cone first served...Honesty is the best policy
author: Richard B.

description: Great food! Great service! Very accommodating, and the menu is genius. Highly recommended! If you do lunch or early dinner, get a table near the window for an amazing view.
author: Derek H.

description: one more star than I wanted to because our server Matthew was great and because they validated our parking so it was free.  Food was horrible!  Cocktail sauce was worst I've ever had, calamari was overcooked, pasta was undercooked, I specifically asked for no dirty sauce on my crab - that was beyond disgusting.  Steaks were cooked well I have to say.  Fish and chips were good,...french fries were good.  But if you can't cook a french fry...you'd ought to stop charging $375 for dinner!!!!  Won't be back.
author: Julie D.

description: Considering the price expected a better variety of dishes with more flavors to offer other than the blant garlicky taste. Tried the seafood combo, fettuccine alfredo with seafood and clam chowder. Way too pricey for the taste it offered.
author: Nazia A.

description:
This review is for the bar only. We came here for a glass of wine before boarding the red and white fleet. The bartender was extremely friendly..offering a few tastes of wines we were interested in. I was impressed that they had a decent wine list..both in variety and prices. 
The menu looked pretty yummy also. I don't think I've ever dined in touristy spots like Fisherman's Wharf..but I'd recommend it for folks visiting the landmark...
author: Mimi T.

description: Bang for your buck. Doesn't look like much due to the '50s decor (a little cheesy) but the food was great. Big portions in a timely manner. We had the crab Cobb salad, crab Alfredo, and a half order of crab. Everything had huge portions of crab meat on it, which is rare. Beautiful view of Alcatraz and the bay.
author: Beth B.

description:
My wife and I have eaten here 3 different times, once with friends.  Definitely our favorite place to eat if we're in the Fisherman's Wharf area, and we drove there once from Union Square because we'd had such a good experience the other two times. 

The menu is different - great photos, even recipes - and broad.  You can get mixed fish as an appetizer; we usually get mussels and one other item.  Always perfectly cooked in a flavorful sauce.  Most recently, I got the surf and turf with a Dungeness crab and petit filet mignon.  The crab was very meaty and perfectly cooked, and the steak was also great.  My wife loves their cioppino and the Asian crab salad.  The homemade custard is delicious.  
It's not cheap, but definitely worth it.  They also have a fixed menu - I think $29 for 3 courses, including the custard for dessert.  
Service has always been good, and the view of the Bay from most of the tables is an extra bonus.
author: Briana P.

description: I visited San Francisco in February while the cruise ship I worked for was being refurbished. The restaurant had a nice atmosphere and great service Prices were steep and the food wasn't all that great. I had dungeness crab/shrimp platter. I also had crab chowder and it was horrible. My order came up to almost $70..which is steep for ONE person. I really can't recommend this restaurant.
author: Celia C.

description:
First came here a couple years ago, absolutely fantastic.  Sadly, went back this past April and it was.... merely mediocre.  The usually fantastic crab fettuccine alfredo was absolutely off.  My spicy crab pasta (red sauce, can't remember the name) was pretty good, but the rest of the meals were off.

Hopefully, it was merely an off night
author: Rita R.

description: good food, good view. nice selection of wines. crab chowder, crab enchiladas are delicious
author: Jessica P.

description: I was extremely disappointed in our waiter's service and the food was so horrible! The shrimp appetizer still had the shell on and it was the worst Salmon I've ever had! My friend got crab enchiladas and the sauce was disscusting! For a 70$ meal we only ate half our meal and didn't take the rest home with us! I will never be back!
author: Tamara V.

description: Pricier than the restaurant below with less tasty food. You pay for the killer view. Ordered the clam chowder in the bread bowl; not the best I've had. Expected better.
author: D D.

description: Ordered clamchowder soup and Italian triple burger. The vegi side was interesting...everything fried (corns, olives, onion, and potato..) A bit too busy.
author: Kristen Y.

description:
Food was good and super expensive. Wines were good and priced about average. They have custom cocktails we didn't try. None of this matters, this is possibly the most beautiful space in the area.
