There is a breathtaking view of the water, the building is well restored and art deco, and the view from and of the building is amazing. I suggest seeing it in the daytime and the nighttime, straddle a sunset for the ideal experience. It gets crowded then!

We went first in the mid afternoon. Walked in and sat by the window with a stunning view, such tall ceilings and open lofty window space.

Caesar salad was top notch, the large one was enough for 4 to share. Chowder was excellent, sourdough bread excellent, crab cocktail perfect in every way. Crab enchiladas were bland until vigorously lemoned, but then the flavor bloomed into something quite good.
author: Scott H.

description: What a great San Franciscan place to go to that's not cheesy and filled with tourist. The view is impeccable!  You overlook the bay thru floor to ceiling windows. And you can sit high on a bar top like table or low and intimate table. All the crostini look delicious but my stomach couldn't handle all of them. Too many to choose from. I ordered the chicken chopped salad. It was good but the chicken was dry! Had to wash it down with 2 Arnold palmers. But if you like a cool place to dine and see the view of San Francisco Bay, you must go here!
author: Gina S.

description: Outstanding food on Pier 39.  Free validated parking for 2 hours while you dine. We are local and do not believe this is a tourist trap.  You can go downstairs for take out or upstairs for full service.  Either place, you get an awesome view.
author: Derek S.

description:
This is definitely one of the more obvious restaurants on the Pier area, so as P and I decided where to eat, this was the first and closest option.  

Window seats were definitely difficult to get, but we were seated on the lounge-y seats that also allowed a view of the bay.

We saw a good number of tables eating whole crabs, but we weren't hungry enough or down enough to use our fingers for the meal.  P ordered a crab sandwich and I ordered a crab salad.

They were both disappointing.  The crab salad had a lot of crab meat (yay) but it was pretty much just crab meat sadly sitting between a hot dog bun.  Nothing else in the sandwich.  My salad was huge.  The portion was definitely more filling (despite being a salad) than the crab sandwich.  However, the dressing did not go well with the salad and the ingredients were not as fresh as I expected.

The view is definitely spectacular.  

I mean, I might have ordered the wrong menu items and did not do this place justice with my experience.
author: Emily W.

description:
Lovely views of the bay and Alcatraz. An iconic dining moment for tourists with great food. The famous sourdough bread bowl with crab chowder was smooth and creamy. Steamed crab and lobster came filled with meat, basa fish in marinara sauce and salmon in lightly pan fried herbs made our table of four very satisfied. The starters go Burrata cheese with paper thin cuts of mortadella ham, Parma ham and other meats was a surprising gift. They. We're in some ways the star of the evening , giving a European and healthy addition to our meal. 
I would certainly return with friends or family
author: Anita R.

description: Being there several times, good scenery of the ocean and great taste of dungeness crab. And the spicy shrimp pasta is awesome
author: Sai M.

description:
Came here for Fleet Week and everything else was jam packed! Walked down the street some more and came across this Gem! They have a regular menu and a "Plixy Fixy" Menu where its pre-fixed and it comes with your appetizer, main entree, and dessert of course. (All for $20)

We ordered the Salumi Platter which is a big cutting board of cured meats. Very delish!! Paired it with their Merlot and it was on Hit!

Our friends ordered the Crab Chowder and they couldn't stop ranting about how great it was. Their spicy pasta (forgot the name) was really spicy as well!

I went with the salmon poached with garlic butter. Came with assortments of potatoes, and asparagus. the salmon was very juicy and tasteful!! and the bf ordered a bowl of garlic clams for 1 person. The bowl was good enough for 2 because they give you a good amount. None of that empty clams!! Everyone was so full by the end of the dinner and we all dug into the cup of vanilla ice cream that came with the plixy flix menu. 

About their menu.. its like a story book! everything had a picture, each entree came with options on how you can have it cooked and everything was explained to the TEE! Window seats had binoculars next to them to see the view of the water. And their bread was good but kinda hard. Overall everyone had a wonderful time
author: Mary T.

description: Absolutely terrible crab chowder soup! Very bland & not worth the $. Even my wine was not very great.... Come on we are in San Fran!!! Wine should be amazing!! Over all I can honestly say I'd NeVeR come back!
author: Casey R.

description: Not particularly great food ... But a great spot to sit and look over Fishermans wharf. We ordered the Belinis, squid & crab sliders - these were good but I would rush back.
author: Josie C.

description: Great food and customer service! Highly recommend trying the clams, fish & chips and clam soup.
author: V T.

description:
So I guess we can start with the elevator ride up to the resturaunt.  Filthy, the walls covered in greasy fingerprints. 
Went up front and found out the wait time was 45 minutes(not so bad, right?) After 45 minutes PLUS another 45 minutes they finally sat us. (Should have left at that point) 
The seating hostess walked us up to a table and told us to stand and wait for the table to be cleaned. We waited for 5 whole minutes practically in the laps of the people eating beside us! So embarrassing...
Next, asked for water and bread right away along with oysters. Never got our water, the Bread was as hard as a rock ( how have they gotten away with this) 
The main dish was old, my mother threw up the rotten lobster enchilada they served her. No utensils were given to eat the crab legs, and we never recieved our desert. This was by far the WORST dining experience my mom, sister and I have ever had. 
We did not ask to speak to a manager because we couldn't wait to get out of there, but at the rate theyre going it wouldn't surprise me if that resturaunt closes down by the next time I visit.
author: Gabrielle A.

description: Went here following a meal at Crab House the day prior. Staff was attentive, food was good, and atmosphere was more upscale than casual. Only difference between this place and Crab House is the price and needing to ask for refills on drinks and dipping sauce for the seafood, but not a bad experience. We went for a mid week late lunch and it was not busy, but got busier as we were leaving.
author: Sarah W.

description: I know this is a tourist area so I expect high prices, but I hope for at least mid-range food here. This was not even that. All the grill plates are over-flowing to excess with butter and oil. Nothing else was worth a glance either. I'd say skip it.
author: Angela K.

description: They need to learn how to cook a steak. Had to send it back only for a second one wrong. Eat half of it. The food runner can't bring you any thing like hot butter for the crab or dipping sauce for the kids, you have to wait, and wait, and wait. Cold food is always good, right? The waiter didn't check on us until it was too late and the food was cold. The food runner that was kind enough to give us water used his filthy hands on the water glass rims. My 8 year daughter mentioned this and knows better. She refused to drink. Try paying for the check, had to wait for the manger to breeze by. Explained the issues, he had zero concern. I've been here several time, but his was the worst. The whole staff need retraining.
author: Patrick L.

description: Went here for lunch with my wife, I can honestly say that it was the worst dining experience we've had.  How can anyone mess up fish & chips?  The clam chowder was absolutely awful.  The worst part was seeing a rat run through the dining room as we were dining.  Check please!!!
author: Alex N.

description: Hello and thank you for writing me back! It's a shame that your restaurant lacks so poorly. We had an out of towner that should've been impressed. We paid cash but were not the type to try to get your hard working employees in trouble. The view was incredible but the experience sucked. Įm sure you'll have tons of yuppies give you good reviews. What a shame. I hate giving poor reviews.
author: Ieva J.

description:
I brought my family here for dinner on Father's Day. There was a bit of a wait even though I had a reservation. I'm going to guess that they get pretty busy on weekends so making a reservation would be a good idea if you plan on dining here. The most impressive part of the restaurant is the view. I requested a table overlooking the water and the view was beautiful. I got a great view of Alcatraz by the window. The service is also spectacular. Our server was very attentive and gave recommendations on the menu. 

As for the food itself, well...it could've been better. My pasta dish was too salty but lacking in flavor. I also tried the clam chowder in a bread bowl and the chowder had a gritty texture to it and it wasn't very creamy. I also tried the crab and it was okay. My dad, on the other hand, loved the crab. The day after dining here, he was still raving about the crab, so that made me happy because he's a picky eater and it's hard to find foods that he enjoys. 

The food is overpriced considering the quality. You're really paying for the location and the experience of dining by the water.
author: Nancy C.

description:
This place is fantastic.  It's pretty touristy (with pictures of hollywood stars, etc), but what is to be expected of one of the most popular restaurants in San Francisco's Fisherman's Wharf?  It was a great dining experience overall - the food was delicious!  The clam chowder and the crab is excellent.  
I'm definitely planning on visiting again.
author: Pegah Y.

description:
Fantastic view, great food, nice bar, excellent staff, worth the wait!  There is not a bad seat in the house.  This is the place to make a memory!
Stumbled into the Franciscan right at sunset and will never forget that view, go hungry.
author: Robert C.

description: My favorite place in San Francisco. The servers are great and the crab cakes are the best thing ever! My bf and I come all the time and will continue.
author: Monica A.

description: Ordered the "lotsa Crab" for two & house salad w/ my half bottle of prosecco & my hubsters ipa & we are satistifed! Just right w/ the bread & extra garlic dipping sauce
author: Liza Q.

description: Had the crab Alfredo. Was pleased that there was actually a good amount of crab, but the alfredo sauce was plain and the Alfredo dish was actually dry. Should've tried the crab legs like I had originally planned.
author: Kristina S.

description:
Did this place go under new management? Or perhaps new wait staff and cook staff? My family has been to this place for a long time to eat, every time we are in SF. However, this time that we went was just different. What happened???? Let me define our experience in the following points:

1. We never received the water we asked for. I ordered an iced tea, and everyone else in our party of 4 ordered a water. The water never came, and we didn't want to inconvenience our waiter since he was very rude and argued with me when I asked about the crab, which brings me to my next point:

2. In the past, every time we order the half crab, or lotsa crab, or even the whole one, it comes steamed in their secret garlic sauce, which is absolutely delicious. This time, the crab was fried or whatever, and it was sizzling on a skillet. I asked the waiter why the crab wasn't steamed as usual, and he proceeded to tell me that I should have told him that unless I wanted it steamed then it won't come out that way. Fine. Maybe things have changed, that's OK, I can eat fried crab. But this crab was just horrible. Way too salty, and just did not have a fresh taste. 

3. Our appetizer, the crab fondue. I'm pretty sure they did not use crab in there. It tasted more like someone threw in fish with some cheese, baked it, and called it a crab fondue. For almost 20 bucks, I expect more than soggy "fondue" with burnt crostini thrown on the side. 

4. HOW DO YOU MESS UP FISH AND CHIPS? That was another sadly messed up dish. It was one of my favorites until this time that we went. The breaded portion was just so soggy and the inside tasted as if it were frozen and then microwaved. 

5. Our waiter. Looks like a french guy with grey hair (possibly his name was alexander?). Why would you raise your voice and argue about a dish with me? I politely asked you a question. In addition, my party of FOUR shared two crabs. And you only bring by one crab cracker? Why???? Between the four of us, it's hard to get to the two whole crabs that we ordered with only one cracker. Finally, he walked by our table a good two times per minute. And if you see that we have no water, then that's just a shame. 

Perhaps this is unnecessary, but I have unfortunately crossed off this restaurant as a go-to place on my SF travel list. Shame.
author: Becky K.

description:
Sorry this is long...

Our first visit here was great! no complaints and that's the only reason that i'm giving them a two instead of a one. 

I liked it so much the first time that after spending the whole day in the city for my birthday my boyfriend decided to take me there before we headed home. We arrived and were seated next to a window probably within ten minutes of getting there so I was super jazzed. Our waitress, a woman with blonde hair and braces, came over to take our order, and that was literally the only time she came to our table until she brought us our check. I am a bread addict so when 15 minutes passed and we didn't have any I was a little disappointed but it was kinda busy so I decided to not ask for any. A couple minutes after the busser brought my boyfriend his soup he drank the last of his water and empty his glass remained for the entire rest of the meal... we shared the rest of my water over what seemed like an eternity. (I would've politely asked for more but our waitress didn't even acknowledge us since we ordered.) Our busser brought us food and it was delicious! Best Shrimp Alfredo I've ever had! We continued to try to get our waitresses attention to refill our water glasses but she was preoccupied with other tables. We sat after we finished and talked for quite some time and when I looked at my watch I realized we had been there twenty minutes since we finished eating we started looking around for our waitress 10 more minutes passed 15, 20, we waited until it had been a full hour after we had finished our food for her to finally acknowledge us and bring us our check. If it hadn't of been my birthday my boyfriend would have made a fuss in the restaurant but he didn't want to ruin the night. I don't know if it was because we look younger or got water instead of wine that night but I know that she visited the surrounding tables multiple times during our service and completely ignored us when we made eye contact or tried to get her attention. I know plenty of people who work in the restaurant business and that's why we always tip 25-30% and this is the only time we have ever left someone less.
author: Emily E.

description: Loads of tourists, so what? The view is absolutely great, it feels like being on a boat. Nice deco, decent cocktails too. We always opt for the fixed price menu (29,95 for starter, main, dessert) - their clam chowder is always hot and tasty, their crab legs nicely seasoned. Love their ice cream too - they always offer a free ice cream to our 5-year old.
author: Karlijn V.

description: Excellent meal--the Dungeness crab sliders are delicious! The side dish of roasted potatoes and corn is just as tasty! Great for kids.
author: Jacki P.

description:
I'm posting this on behalf on my aunt who dined here this past weekend. She was vacationing here in SF and has severe celiac disease. She went back to Houston and is still suffering from her unfortunate experience at Franciscan. Here's her story:

My daughter n I stopped in the Franciscan Crab Restaurant in San Francisco for a snack after lunch and wanted a Ice-cream Sundaes.I'm a Celiac & allergic to gluten. I talked to the waiter & asked questions about gluten in the strawberry banana Sundae, he checked & said the ice cream is GLUTEN FREE in that specific Sundae and it was GF. I said I was allergic & thanked him. He seemed a bit upset that we only order 1 sundae, it was huge. We were eating it & in my 2nd bite there was a piece of chocolate cookie(gluten)! It was hidden in d middle of the ice cream! I about fainted & was so shocked & upset because I ate a piece thinking it was walnuts. I put it on a plate & asked waiter why I had this Cookie in my ice cream. He looked dumbfounded & said he told the staff I was ALLERGIC . He said he was sorry & won't charge me! Duh!!  I had just gotten well enough to go on vacation & get off steroids after 5 years... Now I was poisoned by some inconsiderate waiter/chef. It had to be purposely put in my dish because I asked if there were cookies in it & he assured me it was Gluten Free. I was in such shock & I couldn't think to ask for a manager. I would not even rate this a 1 star, he was so inconsiderate of me & I'm guessing because I didn't order a $$$$ meal was his only reason to act this way. We were pleasant n enjoy our day & the beauty of the bay. I'm still sick 3 days later, my body reacted 20 minutes later & I could hardly walk.. Ended up laying on the grass near the street & getting a taxi back to the hotel. This ruined our last few days of our vacation... I had a difficult flight home . I was so bloated and looked like my 5 month pregnant daughter. And then there's the pain & now I'm back on the steroids . Not happy at all. Disgusted with this place. Not once , when we moved to be closer to the restroom, did anyone check on me! My daughter ate the Sunday & said not 1 strawberry or not 1 slice of banana in the strawberry banana Sundae.  Don't recommend this place at all! #FranciscanCrabRestaurant, San Francisco, CA.
author: Jenna G.

description:
Solid seafood.
Great view and cool restaurant decor.
Good service.

Great view of the San Francisco bay from fisherman's wharf. The seafood was solid, meaning good but not anything spectacular.
author: Sisi R.

description: Great food. Great atmosphere. Clam chowder was excellent. They were able to seat us right away in a busy Saturday afternoon. Awesome view of San Francisco Bay.
author: Scott W.

description: Fisherman's Wharf can be a rip off but this place was good. Not cheap by any means but at least the food was good. The view is great and amazingly we got a seat right away on New Year's Day despite the crowds outside.
author: Marc M.

description:
We decided to play tourists on Saturday and walked the beach and the piers. Then, we always wanted to try the Franciscan and headed there around 2.30 pm. We were right away seated at a great booth with a fabulous views of Alcatraz, the Jeremiah and more.
Had the cocktail with the cucumber cocktail which was great. We also had a Ferrari Carano Chardonnay and I must say that I am amazed by the prices on they wine list. $49 
As for the food we had the crab fondue, mmmm, the tartines, the clams, the yellow tail Carpaccio was the only deception as floating in the sauce so loosing its taste.
It was my first time in 18 years and certainly Ill go back with family when they are travelling...
author: Christophe K.

description: Excellent service, and a great dish! I ordered fish and chips, my husband ordered lobster alfredo. The food was very flavorful and the staff was more then accommodating!  You can dine at a window seat overlooking the warf. I will definately be coming back next trip!
author: amy s.

description: Second time I've been here in two months.  It will be my last.  There is a reason the place is empty.  Over priced, just plain old bad food.  At least they didn't screw up the draft beer.
author: Ed B.

description: We got the double crab and mussels, the crab enchilada, and the crab chowder. The dungeonous crab was delicious! The crab chowder was more like a crab soup, not creamy (Not what we expected to say the least). We loved the views and the decor of the restaurant! It was definitely a cool place to experience. :)
author: C D.

description: Very disappointed in the service, our waitress was borderline scowling at us. The food was good, and the prices are totally worth it for the view!
author: Amanda A.

description:
I wouldn't go back. The food was o.k. but the service was absolutely terribly. Definitely not worth the price. Believe me. I'm from Maine. We know our seafood. Our waiter was sarcastic, and confusing. I tried to ask for a recommendation and had a question on portion size and in the end received a bowl of soup the size of my pinky finger.

AND they left the feet on the shrimp! The feet! Who does that!? 

Overall it felt like any other tourist trap just trying to get your money.

Go to any italian place in Telegraph Hill and you'll find better seafood.
author: Andrew G.

description: Wasn't too impressed.  I had to ask 3 people for water.  The waiter didn't even ask if my daughter (who is 3) if she wanted anything to drink.  Food was good had the crab chowder and crab cakes.  Oysters were fresh.  View is gorgeous.
author: Eilleen Z.

description: I became an instant fan of this place. We were seated by the window with a very nice view. Our server was very polite and fast considering it was a busy weekend. We ordered a lot of different seafoods that i cannot remember in particular. All i know is  i love this place over all.
author: Sheila D.

description: Put our name in for a table outside, told us it would be 15 minutes for a table, buzzed our indicator and told us that they had split up our table and given it up to parties that had arrived later.
author: Robert T.

description: Much more of a tourist spot than we expected given the prices are a little higher than your typical visitor hang-out in the Wharf.  The food was good - I had the wild salmon - in a tasty chiopino sauce and wine list was reasonable.  Downside is that it was too impersonal; way too many tables with comings and goings and our waiter seemed disinterested.   Reminds me of a seafood version of the Daily Grill in LA.
author: J.K. S.

description: Well, to start off.....I will say the service was friendly. We didn't have a reservation the evening we decided to give them a try. Thankfully, we were able to be seated outside a table on the terrace. We enjoyed the view of the Wharf district. As we were handed the menu, I felt the menu to be quite dense, a bit busy on the variations of courses to choose from. The atmosphere was loud and unfortunately, were seated next to a table of people that were just obnoxiously rude. I realize this was not Five-Star restaurant as some may have posted. I will not repay a visit.
author: Marie H.

description: I sucked it up and went to the Wharf to meet my aunt and uncle visiting from SoCal. This place has a REALLY nice view of the bay upstairs, especially of Alcatraz, and you hella pay for it. I ordered the house salad, because I'm lame. It would have been okay except for the fact that it was drenched in vinaigrette. Drenched. Luckily, the waitstaff kept the bread coming. Speaking of the waitstaff, they looked really preoccupied even though the dining room was basically empty while we were there, but whatever, I'm not chatty. My aunt got a bread bowl with crab chowder, which was pretty good, but pricey. I would probably not come here unless I entertained visitors who are dead-set on spending time near the Wharf.
author: Lauren F.

description: Thank you for the terrific service!  The hostess was hospitable and seated us right away.  I came here on a whim last weekend, had a craving for steamed crab late afternoon.  The clam chowder, steamed crab for 2 and several cups of generous amounts of coffee were satisfying we were full!  Will come back for more when I have another craving for crab.  Our waiter, was very very attentive and we also had a wonderful view of the bay, and of Alcatraz Island.  Keep up the great work and see you soon!  Will recommend this place to friends.
author: Stephanie I.

description:
Ask to sit in Ben's section! He's great! Each recommendation for my family came out great for each of us!

The food was fantastic, and the view of the bay and Alcatraz was first rate!

Five stars!
author: Jay H.

description:
Good overall, but the food was not "OMG this is what San Francisco stands for". 

The atmosphere is nice, being that it's right near the bay and the window view is beautiful. I also love their menus. They were so beautiful in book form. Very nice touch.

The food: I had the crab chowder and just some garlic crab (something along those lines?). The chowder I would give 2 stars. It tasted very fishy which was weird. I didn't expect it to be so fishy, I mean it's crab. It was also a bit bland. I didn't really enjoy it. The crab is pretty good. It broke apart easily and it was so meaty. However, the garlic sauce it was in was not very flavorful. It just felt like something was missing. 

Would I recommend this place? Mmm yes? Only if you want a nice sit down restaurant for seafood. Would I come back? I guess so, I would like to explore their menu a bit more. However it seems a bit expensive compared to other seafood restaurants.
author: Karen N.

description: this place sucks. complete tourist trap. food is average- robbing customers with pricing. With how much you're paying for a meal you should be going to Gary Dankos.
author: Brock L.

description: Service and view are outstanding. Food.....not so much. Clam chowder and crab were very fishy. Caesar salad had very strong anchovy taste. Filet was very thin and over cooked.
author: Kim B.

description:
I have ate at the Crab Franciscan a few times now. The food there is overwhelmingly delicious, the views are spectacular and prices are fairly descent for the location and food, great deal. The reason this place got 3 which I really would rather have given 3.5 is because of the service, upper management this older lady was a sweetheart and totally tried to make best of the situation but what she didn't notice is everything else that her co-workers were doing in the background. 

My last visit I made reservation 3wks in advanced  right when we got there 10min early to make sure we had a great table, the lady was like shit we gave there table away. They then tired to shove us in some random small booth to accommodate 6 of us, after making reservation in advance, but the manger was super polite and took care of us getting us a much better table. 

The Franciscan is def a tourist spot being located in the pier 39 area but its supposed to be the best of the best right there. The staff was rudest I have ever encountered. Shoving passed us saying "move out the way" being extremely rude and saying "move it". Then they tried to rush us out the door the moment we sat down. We ordered apps first they brought our entrees first then our soup and salads sorry never heard of that one before. The waiter would not even wait till we finished our order before he moved to the next person. Being busy is a good thing but being rude about being overwhelmed is not the customers fault. 

This is not the first time this occurrence has happen either.
author: Dara S.

description: Atmosphere was great. Service was great. Food was great. They don't have anything other than seafood and they don't have kids meals but the crab is some of the best I've had. If you want a cool location with a good view where you can load up on crabs, shrimp, etc. this is the place.
author: Jamie W.

description:
Another lovely treat at the Franciscan Crab Restaurant tonight.

Just a bit disappointed because I let Mathew C talk me into something I knew I didn't want.  We always get the iron skillet roasted mussels as a starter.  Then I order a whole roasted crab for myself.  I let Mathew talk me into a double mussels double crab skillet and the crab just wasn't the same as the whole roasted crab.  (Sorry)

They poured wine over the mussels which got onto the crab as well.  And there wasn't the garlic all over the crab....and I LOVE the body of the crab and got mostly legs.

Don't get me wrong, it was delicious but it just wasn't the same.  

I know better next time.  Mathew said he was trying to save me money.  I appreciate that but to me....it's worth the few extra bucks to get the garlicky roasted crab !!
author: Betty S.

description: The restaurant is beautiful but I was not 100% satisfied with the food. The bill was high, I don't mind spending money on food as long as it's good.  Sorry, maybe it's just me hope everyone else enjoys it though.
author: Christina B.

description: Seafood is okay. Had the prefix menu, clam chowder was creamy, just no filling, no clam in soup. The crab was okay. Hubby had the boneless rib, too salty. Good to experience, but not something great
author: Doris U.

description:
I saw someone else's review that mentioned the window where you can order a few food items, mainly fish sandwiches and garlic fries.

It came up as this restaurant but clearly we didn't go into this restaurant so I cannot comment on that. However, for the street like vendor (probably same company), the fish sandwich was much better than I expected.

Fries were also really good, not too much garlic like some places but not too little where it makes you wonder what was the point.

They have a small seating area off to the side but it seems like it's permanently reserved for birds, the gull type unfortunately, due to lack of clearing up, they are swarming the place like huge flies that if hit you would hurt!
author: Nick L.

description:
There's really nothing bad I can say about this place. Their food is delicious, like their black linguini with clams, crab chowder, crab Alfredo pasta, and of course their signature dish, those butter garlic crabs served on a sizzling skillet! And while you savory your yummy dishes, you can bask in the scenery of the San Francisco bay, and enjoy the classy ambiance inside the restaurant. 

So even though this place is located in the heart of what's probably the 
most touristy spot in SF, don't be fooled! This restaurant is not tainted whatsoever. The next time you come to Pier 39, consider eating here at the Franciscan!
author: Roxie T.

description:
Food rating:  4 stars
Service rating: 2 stars

I've probably eaten in this restaurant about a dozen times.   The food is good.  They've got, logically enough, plenty of fish dishes.  I've had the fish of the day, some salmon pasta, I can't recall, but I certainly remember that there was not a single meal that I didn't enjoy.   That's not really what brings me back, but the food's good.

Having raised that point, what tends to bring me back is my family.  I've always come here when either my mother or my father was visiting.  It's convenient, and tourists always end up somewhere in or near Fisherman's wharf...  go figure!

Now the service, though, sucks.   My theory is that they serve mostly tourists and figure they don't give a shit about building a rep.  Tourists will take abuses that locals most certainly would not.  Therefore, waiters here push as much as they can.   If occasionally they get caught, "fuck 'em... cheap fuck can go back to Arkansas," is probably what's going through their minds.

So we had dinner here once, my mother and I, and we'd both ordered appetizers, both ordered entrees, and I think we'd split a bottle of Chardonnay.   We're probably talking $100 to $150 (Yes, as others here have pointed out... seriously overpriced!)   So the waitress brings us the bill and, sure enough, the little bitch had already rung up 20% tip and added it to the total.   My mother, who was treating (thanks mom!) asked what that was all about:

Mom:  "Excuse me, but why is the tip already included?"
Dumbass waitress:  "Well, ma'am, that's just how we do things here."
Mom:  "What do you mean?  Service is not compulsory unless it's a party of six or more, right?"
Dumbass waitress: "Errrr, well, we just add the tip to the bill as a convenience."
Mom:  "Convenience for whom?  You're going to take this off right now and bring me a bill where I can fill in the amount of the tip."
Dumbass waitress:  "Yes, ma'am."

You can bet your ass that dumbass bitch didn't get her fucking tip.  

So if you come here and that little dumbass bitch tries to rip you off or give you attitude, give it right back at her and ask to speak to her manager.  I assure you that'll shut her right up.
author: David O.

description:
We enjoyed our lunch here. The view always makes a big difference.

View: 5 stars
quality of food: 3.5 stars
quantity of food: 2 stars ( portions are small but we don't care much about potions this for those who do)
Price: reasonable ( this is because of the location, view and type of food - you can't expect to have this and pay fast food price)
Service: 3 stars ( place was busy, there was some attempt at service but still difficult to get)
Parking: 4 stars - no valet but free parking offered free for 2 hrs
author: Anthony G.

description: The calamari was good but the portion was huge on the share platter! Skillet shrimp comes with the shell on and it's so hot it burns your fingers to peel them. They should be peeled for you. The crab enchiladas were ok, and not very warm at all. Overall for the pricing we expected better. The view is great but food was simply Ok. Service is prompt, but I really think it's about a 2.5 to 2.75 stars but not a full 3
author: Sherman C.

description: Food was okay thought it would be something more..  I was gonna give it a threw star but the guy giving out the food was an a hole.. I ask him if that was our food n he said no n he called out the number and guess what it was ours... ask him for lemon wedges and he gave me a dirty look. If u don't want to work today call off don't bring it to work..
author: Joe T.

description:
On vacation with my husband - we were looking for a place to have a nice dinner with a nice view.  Mission accomplished.

The exterior is flashy- I was almost scared, but once we got inside my fears dissapated.  Our large booth facing the window was just what we needed to sit close and enjoy the view.  We got the cheesey fondue-like appetizer and a bottle of wine to start the evening.  The sourdough bread in San Francisco is amazing - and this was no disappointment.  The waitstaff was extremely friendly and helpful as we were picking through the menu.  I settled on salmon and my husband got the cioppino... He was ecstatic when it arrived.  I was pretty happy myself- the flavor of my fish was spot-on and it was cooked just the way I wanted it.
I know it's touristy- and maybe even a bit over-priced - but San Francisco is a touristy place - and this was exactly what we were looking for. 

Oh - and the silverware had fins on it... which I thought was cute/funny.  So I might have "borrowed" some.  Ssshhh! :)
author: Valerie G.

description: Was a great place to eat! Make reservation online! Saved us totally. Food was awesome! Chairs were a little uncomfortable but we managed ... Service was quick and attentive!
author: Alana F.

description: The view is tremendous, service was very good.  Menu seems pricey.. I believe they sell you on the view.  Food was good nothing outstanding.
author: Mike C.

description: Nice views of the bay.  The food is good but over priced.  I guess that's San Francisco in general.  I wouldn't go back only because it seems a little out dated and there are so many places to eat seafood at in the Fisherman's Wharf, I know there's something better.
author: Amanda C.

description: Our meal tonight was excellent. Service was outstanding. The crab legs and crab fettuccine were amazing. The homemade vanilla ice cream was the perfect way to round off a great meal.
author: Kathie K.

description:
This place has awesome views of the ocean! They have windows from floor to ceiling which makes it very easy to see the great views.  

I loved the crab chowder! It was so fresh and not too creamy.  Kudos for all the crab meat that was in my little cup.  We started off with crab cakes which were yummy and calamari that arrived in a huge plate! Also, very good.  The crab was good, but I felt like it was a bit dry and needed more sauce.  Maybe after eating at Boiling Crab, no other place has yet to live up to the whole sha-bang! We also got halibut, but it was on the salty side so it was difficult to finish the whole dish.  

We had the chocolate mousse for dessert, which was ehhh.  Maybe skip dessert next time!
author: Cindy T.

description:
Great, great views, fair to good service. Busy, energy but terrible menu and very high prices. Food was not close to the quality I expected.
Bistro Boudin (upstairs version is better IMHO)
author: Chris O.

description: Restaurant has dirty floor with dirty restrooms and slow service. Price seems to be a little expensive.
author: Vilashiny S.

description:
Tourist review. 

Yeah it's a tourist spot, so? I just flew in from Chicago with my laptop bag and carry on in tow, tired and waiting on broil to scoop me up. Walked the Wharf a few times looking for the right place to eat, the Franciscan scared me off originally because of its high prices. In the end, this is where I enjoyed a freakin good meal. There are a lot of steps going up when you are lugging luggage and not sure what was going on with the elevator. The hostess wasn't nice or anything, hardly an entrance greet and sent me to a table in the back since I was solo. It was pretty early when I got there and after watching me come up those steps I'm surprised she took me on an escapade rather than seating me at any one of the many tables open and nearby. Although she wasn't happy with my request I asked for a table overlooking the water. Once seated everything got better. The fruity mixed cocktail was strong enough to send me into a nice haze. I've never had clam chowder so good and with real seafood in it. What the fuck have I been eating in Chicago! Fake chowder I suppose. Then the crab came doused in a garlic sauce which was heavenly. My problem was not knowing how much strength to use when breaking the shell and a bit of self consciousness, not wanting to soil myself too much in the process. An older couple seated nearby saw me struggling and the lady said simply.. "first time?" "It's a messy job but just go for it, you'll love it. You can always get more napkins" She's right! Fuck it, so I get dirty in a white linen cloth place, I'm just some silly tourist. Yes it was pricey, but the food was excellent. At the time I was there I was able to get in on the Prix fixe menu and dessert came at the end. A bit of their own home made frozen vanilla custard was the perfect end.
author: Jacob J.

description: I love this place service was the best well go back the waitress was awsome my brother forgot his I phone and she bought it down I they're crab was the bomb
author: Willie Z.

description:
We took the trolley down to Fisherman's Wharf to have dinner at the Franciscan - I've never been here before - but one of our colleagues at the show we were attending wanted to check it out.

Other reviewers talk about the views, but it was dark out and I did not really get a look at what the night views might be. I did notice when we entered that there was a fairly large crab sitting near the hostess stand - baked out of bread! Looked really cool - I've posted a photo of it to this review...

There were 10 people in our party - we had a reservation and were seated promptly. I was a little unsure what to order as the menu is strangely organized and I was not sure just what the hell I was going to actually receive when I ordered something.

We ended up ordering a large mussels, shrimp, and crab appetizer - served on a massive cast iron skillet. The mussels and shrimp were pretty good - the crabs were so-so. I also ordered the Alaskan Pale Ale - which was tasty. Someone asked what made it Alaskan - I replied that Chinook Salmon had swam and pissed in this beer!

We then ordered dinner - I ordered the salmon with an olive oil dressing - had a bit of garlic and chopped olives in it - very tasty! I would like to come back here again and try some more seafood dishes. Everyone seemed to enjoy the food!
author: Neal E.

description:
Don't get me wrong, yelpers: this place has delicious food, that gets even better paired with the view. 

BUT  there's a huge thing that prevents me from giving this place higher than 3 stars...

Part of the dining experience is the service, and I felt that the server we had was really cold and only cared if we were going to order more off the menu. He stared at his inventory gadget more than he looked at our faces! We had to flag down our server multiple times to ask for things like utensils and napkins, because he would clear it away way too quickly, before the rest of our food even arrived. This might have been excusable if the restaurant was packed and busy, but it wasn't. 

This place seems to be a bit over-hyped. Sure the food is delicious, and the view is amazing, but I'd hate spending so much money only to be treated like this.
author: Tiffany S.

description: Wow!!! Horrible service! I get it, busy day, crowded, maybe even short staff; but that still doesn't give you an excuse to be rude to customers. First, the line was out the door, so I approach the young girl holding the door, no smile, no how can I help you, just a sour look on her face. I ask if they take reservations and she says no. I Mention I have 10 in my party and still the answer is no with no suggestions. A male with his hair pinned back approaches and says it may be an hour or two as to discourage me. I say ok please put my name down. Surprise! 20 minutes later my name is called and we have a table. Our server wasn't much better but did showcase a smile (hence a star). For what they charge and fact it is an iconic restaurant one should expect above average service not just blah. Too bad for them. People have choices and if tonight is the norm for customer service watch out Franciscan!
author: Frank G.

description: The sofa is not comfortable but they are friendly. The soup is very nice but crab is too salt. We didn't even finish one crab.
author: Giulia Z.

description:
On a recent trip to the Bay Area (long time East Coaster) I happened to find my way to FCR. We needed a last minute reservation for a party of 10 with 5 adults and 5 kids and FCR seemed to fit the bill perfectly.  As background, I've been to to all the great seafood joints from Maine to Maryland and FCR would definitely rate in my Top 5 Seafood places of all time.

On your way to actually eating food you will experience some very scarey things that will question this 5 star review.

1.  The crowds of Fisherman's Wharf tourists
2.  The cruise ship like architecture
3.  The amazing oceanfront view - which usually is a bad food omen.
4.  The huge menu with PICTURES of the items.

We sampled about 20 different items from the menu and everything was excellent.  Double roasted crab and shrimp, yellowtail carpacio, crab fondue and steamed clams were very memorable.  Great place for adults and kids to dine.
author: J D.

description:
Let's set the scene:

Thursday afternoon and I've got a hunger for soft shell crab, but whatever can I do to feed the need for delights of the sea...

In walks the Franciscan to save the day, but my Fiance is not a fan of the sea dwelling delicacy, so thank god the drink menu saved me from a life of crab-less days. 

Order soft-shell crab to split with a friend and I plus some small plates for the table to be shared , add in a few too many Kettle one tonics, and I was on the path to a wonderful afternoon.

Go, eat and be merry.
author: John S.

description: I would only come here again to have the pitch black view deep into the abyss of Alcatraz. The overweight tourists slobbering their over cooked over garliced crab is also just a delight.
author: Sushi H.

description:
Met expectations. I came for the whole crab, and it was marginally better than another place I recently dined at around the corner. Great view. Clearly a tourist place, but if you want crab this is a good place to go. 
There was a misunderstanding with the bill, but the manager was able to resolve it to my satisfaction.
I recommend the Cloudy Bay Sauvingon Blanc with the crab. Pricey but worth it.
author: Chris S.

description: I was there new years eve with my wife and friends. Food was okay, did not like the pasta. The service was very good.
author: Max K.

description:
Fun place to go on Fisherman's Wharf that doesn't feel in-your-face touristy like so many places down there do. 

The atmosphere is bright and airy with killer views and a retro-cool vibe with vintage black and white celebrity photos on the walls. 

We sat at the bar and had a drink and the crab fondue, which was delicious. The bartender was friendly and fun to talk to.

The menu was a bit pricey, but my experience was so good that I will definitely return.
author: Amy C.

description:
Favorite date night place on the pier.  The view of the Bay is gorgeous and I'm crazy for the mussels! 

The wait is pretty long for a walk-in, service varies depending on the night, but I've never had a bad experience!
author: A T.

description: Amazing views; not in season crazy good crabs but still sourced from Washington state; friendly and attentive service and decent prices. I'll be back!
author: Tommy A.

description: Look, the crab is bloody delicious. I don't know what other people are complaining about but you get in, you get a seat and the foods delicious and right on the bay. If you want some kind of secret towny experience this isn't it. If you want good crab without a fuss its here. Also my gf said to mention the dessert is delicious too.
author: Omar B.

description: I went as a solo diner in search of Dungeness crab for lunch. After researching and talking to concierges I decided on the Franciscan. It was a beautiful day and the views of Alcatraz were spectacular. The restaurant itself feels like you've stepped back in time - really nice atmosphere. I didn't know if I could tackle a whole crab on my own and I had decided on a half crab. My waiter recommended to get their fixed price menu since I was already ordering clam chowder. So I got a cup of clam chowder (with a side of sourdough bread to make up for the lack of a bread bowl), Dungeness crab legs in their garlic sauce and a vanilla custard for $30. The food was delicious, the service wonderful and the atmosphere really pleasant. Definitely worth visiting. A nice retreat from the otherwise very touristy and kitsch wharf area.
author: Nikki B.

description: Great view of the Bay at this restaurant.  We had drinks and Dungeness crab which was delicious.  We'll make it back there when we visit the area again.
author: Jay N.

description: Excellent Dungeness crab cakes!  Lots of crab meat without overwhelming spices. We also had the crab fondue. Really cheesy and filled with crab meat. We stopped in for a small lunch. Most every seat is designed to look out on the Bay with a great view of Alcatraz. This is a must-do if you like crab. Quiet dining off the crazy streets around the Piers. Really enjoyed this place. Would go again. Headed to Napa now.
author: Cerise S.

description: I am very dispointed with the dinner.Actually our friend recommend it to us,but the crab was a little badly smelled,with loose meat,looked like old one.Also price is not cheep,nearly 60 dollars each for three of us,including one kid, only double crab and double mussel,salmon as well as two soup.I will not recommend this to my friends.
author: Jian S.

description:
3.5 stars from me. The food is very good, the view is very good, the service was good. I think we were steered towards ordering more crab than we needed. 

That said, it was delicious and a lot of fun. 

You won't be disappointed but nor will you be blown away. 

We loved the yellowtail appetizer and the crab crostini.

We didn't love that our table was a bit loud and drafty, being right by the stairs. Also it was slightly overpriced, but that's what you expect in the tourist zone.
author: Tony B.

description: Food was very fresh and well cooked. Portions were big enough. Calamari was O.K. and the Crab was delicious, however as a Mediterranean, I prefer the shrimps to be fully cleaned before being cooked, here you need to do it yourselves. Overall it has a great atmosphere, view and interior design. If you are gonna attend with your partner make a reservation for the upper stage seating areas.
author: Alihan D.

description: Packed on a Friday night, slipped the  matradee a 20 and he got a great table for my kids and I at the window overlooking the bay. We ate fresh crab legs served in a large heated pot at the table. Nothing better than crab legs that stay hot all thru the meal.   A great place for a tired traveler and her hungry kids. Also a very safe location. GO THERE!
author: Joan S.

description:
First and foremost, I would like to mention that our waiter looked like Manny Pacquiao's long lost twin brother! He seemed a little uptight but the fact that he looked like the Champ made him absolutely awesome!

On the pricey side, but what do you expect? It's next to the water and located in the heart of a tourist area. I came here twice and both times on a weeknight. No problems finding parking (By the way, don't forget to validate before you exit the restaurant!), Not busy at all. I made reservations prior to our arrival. The host sat us within minutes. Upon making reservations, you can request to sit at a booth, but for a more romantic feel, request to sit next to the window. Don't fret if you walk in and get the impression that this is a fancy restaurant. You can wear casual, business, or even dressy attire. Either way, you will not feel out of place. 

The bread was okay, I've had better. 
For an appetizer, I ordered the calamari ($9.00 for the small, feeds 1-2 people)  I've had better. But the combo shrimp, mussels, and crab definitely made up for it  ($35.00 for the large, enough to feed 1-3 people, 4 if all of you have small tummies.) We also ordered the Crab Melt with fries ($15), which was to die for. 

We left completely stuffed and the bill didn't burn my wallet. I plan on coming back again to try the antipasto bar and the cocktails. I have my eye on the Merman Island Iced Tea!
author: Crystal T.

description:
Pro: Delicious food, fantastic seaview, excellent service

Con: pretty pricey, limited choices on the manual~
author: Dennis L.

description: Go elsewhere don't waist your time and money. Non friendly services. We were not done eating when the waiter retrieved the plates and cleaned the table. The food was ok but there are better places down the pier. What made it worst my husband got food poisoning.
author: Adriana L.

description:
Went here for the view mostly. We both ordered cocktails, I ordered a bloody mary and my friend ordered a apple tini, both were good. We also ordered the crab fondue, out of curiosity mostly. It was more of a crab dip than a crab fondue, still tasty just not as original as we were hoping. I ordered the chowder for lunch and she ordered a sandwich, all in all we were happy.

The plating seemed a little over done here. Also the waiter was a bit spacey. But I would bring someone back here for the view and location.
author: Laura P.

description: We came here a year ago and enjoyed it so when we returned this year to San Fran we got off the plane and came right here. We like the patio bay view and watching the street performers below. We got a bowl of clam chowder and a few drinks to start our vacation off. Always great and friendly staff. Check the menu carefully though cause it can get pricey real fast. That would be my only complaint. But they do have good options for the more frugal tourist.
author: DJ V.

description:
-Dungeness fondue is quite tasty
-Clam chowder doesn't have a lot of clams 
-Crab sliders are great in concept but ruined by some kind of oily gobbly gook
-Incredible views
-Menu is like a color magazine with pictures of the food
-I'd go back in a heartbeat despite prices being $$$$..but then again, look where you are
author: David G.

description: Had an absolutely amazing dinner here. I was a little worried in the beginning of dinner that our service wasn't going to be good but I was pleasantly surprised. Our server was very kind and attentive. Our table ordered shrimp and crab that come on a skillet (there were at least 25 shrimp and many crab legs), shrimp fettucine alfredo, crab chowder, house salad, mashed potatoes, and steamed vegetables. It was all amazing! We also shared the chocolate frozen custard sundae which was out of this world!!
author: Julianne P.

description: Came on a Sunday around 2. Didn't have to wait and got a great table by the window with a beautiful view. Every table had a pair of binoculars which I thought was pretty awesome. Our server didn't really have a personality and couldn't recommend anything and it was so hot in there i was sweating.We ordered a cucumber lime martini which was very good, the clam chowder was grainy with over cooked potatoes, shrimp cocktail tasted old and hard, seafood cioppino was really good, and so were the crab and mussel platter.
author: Diana L.

description: Overprized so you pay for the view (awesome though). The menu was very well explained with beautiful pics of all the dishes, almost like a fashion catalogue. However the crab (frozen previously by the way) was just OK and a little pricy. The vibe of the restaurant was good. I am not sure I will go back. Felt a little like a tourist trap but as a San Franciscan just passing by that area I wanted to try it.
author: David D.

description:
We first stopped in on an afternoon that we were exploring Fisherman's Wharf. We decided to grab some cold beers, share some appetizers (calamari & crab fondue) and enjoy the view of the bay and Alcatraz.

The service was flawless and menu was so tempting that we made a reservation and returned for dinner a few nights later. Two great experiences in one week!

The atmosphere is a step back in time. The seafood was fresh and fantastic. Try one of their skillets, we had double crab and double shrimp. Had to have the calamari again and really enjoyed the crab chowder.

Yes, this is a tourist spot and that's a good thing! Every member of the staff we met was a great ambassador for the city of San Francisco.
author: John B.

description:
The Franciscan says the steamed crab is their specialty so I had to try it.  I was with some clients so I didn't get the whole steamed dungeness crab which I will go back and try, I didn't eat to get that messy at the time.  I did try the mussel and crab skillet.  This was very good.  The mussels were great but some a little overcooked.  The crab was juicy and done in their garlic sauce.

The restaurant is clean with a great view of the bay and Alcatraz.   We were sitting during sunset near the window.  I'll be coming back to try the whole dungeness crab next time.
author: Alan V.

description:
We will never, ever, get tired of this place.
The best Fisherman's wharf has to offer, one of the greatest spot in the city.
The crab is the best ever.
The service wonderful.
The view......outstanding.
Only the best is what you will get there.
author: Isabelle V.

description: Had an amazing time. Went there for our anniversary and had the best service and food. We sat at the bar and Raul made us feel welcome. Best service we have had in ages.
author: AugustanScott R.

description: Fresh, quick service!  Decently priced!  The fish sandwich was delicious and so were the french fries!  The fish comes with their coleslaw on top, which was different, but delicious.  I would definitely come back!
author: Liss B.

description: I love the crab/cheese appy- TDF. The view! The decor! It's terrific.
author: Dani S.

description: For two of us I spent $250 for soup, three sides, three large entrees, two drinks and one dessert. The service was great, clam chowder was awesome, rest was just ok. For the price I expected more. The owners of this restaurant also apparently own the Dead Fish and a few other locations. I was not impressed at the Dead Fish either.  Save money and go to one of the many other locations along the wharf.
author: Tito G.

description: I came here with my girlfriend for a vacation night dinner. We ordered oysters for an appetizer and pasta with fish dinners. The oysters were $2.50 each (reasonable i thought) but were the size of dimes. They smelled terrible and clearly were frozen. They tasted even worse. They give you bread when you sit down. It was rock hard with land o'lakes butter on the side... terrible. The couple next to us got their food and it looked disgusting and frozen as well. They were CLEARLY not happy. Fortunatly for us we werent that far into the meal and i paid for our 2 drinks and we left. We each ate one oyster and left the rest. The waitress was kind and truthfully not surprised at all.  Pick another place..... we should have known when there was 7 people in the restaurant on a saturday night.
author: John D.

description:
The place had an amazing view of the ocean along with the decor in the restaurant. The menu had a little bit of everything but it didn't have anything I really wanted to eat. I was quite surprise that there was no lobster dish on the menu.

I had a crab cake and calamari for appetizers. It was ok but I had better. I also had the sea salted french fries which my little boy loves. For dinner we had a boneless short rib dinner which I thought was kind of dry and not enough flavor.

Overall, great view but the food could be better.
author: Diana P.

description:
First impression with the hostess was bad! She asked me if I have a reservation and I asked if we needed one and she said"I was JUST asking" then walked away.

Sat by the window with the view of Alcatraz! Gorgeous at night.

The server was great my wine glass was very empty.

We ordered the crab fondue and 1/2 order of crab.

Everything was great.

Total was about $78 

Id come back and refer friends.
author: farah b.

description:
My hubby & I hosted our Rehearsal Luncheon at Franciscan Crab Restaurant.  Several family members and friends were from out of town and we wanted to give them a true San Francisco treat.  What better place than the beautiful views of the Bay in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf?

I contacted Franciscan via email and their General Manager, Craig, responded within a few hours.  He provided me with several menu options and event spaces.  The great thing I loved about Franciscan was their All-Inclusive per person rates. Each menu includes 3-courses, all non-alcoholic beverages, tax, and gratuity.

We reserved the Bayview Room and offered our guests the Cable Car menu which was $40 per person.  The kids were offered a separate menu at only $5.95 each.  The Cable Car menu included a salad and choice of Dungeness Crab Legs, Salmon, or Slow Roasted Short Rib. Guests also enjoyed a really creamy & delicious ice cream for dessert.  

My hubby and I both ordered the Dungeness Crab Legs.  Typically, I am a carnivore but considering the venue we had to try their specialty.  Though at first, I was a bit jealous of the surrounding plates of Short Rib at our table.  My cousin gave me a big piece to try and it was so tender, juicy, and seasoned well.  I started doubting my crab selection until I tried it.  I definitely went with the right choice!  Their secret garlic sauce is amazing!  The crab was succulent and easy to eat.  Our guests loved their entrees and the Bay views were breathtaking.  We were extremely pleased with the food, service, & ambiance.  

I took off 1 star because upon arrival I handed my credit card to the hostess and told her not to accept payment from anyone else.  She happily agreed and took my card.  When the bill arrived, I asked to sign it and noticed my in-laws were paying the check.  It was a very nice gesture but I wish the hostess would have at least given me a heads up.

ADDED PERK: Validated Parking - 2 hours free during lunch and 3 hours free during dinner.
author: Nikki C.

description:
The location is great because of the view complemented with the tiered seating upstairs. Real nice for a family dinner. Good service, quick table clean. 

PS Mmmm, Cioppino.
author: Emmeline A.

description: Always very good and nice atmosphere... Beautiful views. Not the best deal in the area but always a solid place.
author: Lyndsey C.

description: We came here to celebrate my sister's commencement from UC Berkeley. I requested a window with a view and they seated my family and I off in the corner with no view. When we got seated we ordered waters. Well, that took about 10-15 minutes just to come out. Then we waited another 10-15 minutes to place out appetizer order. I ordered the four meat sampler they brought out a board with meats just spaced out on it. Definitely not worth $38.95, then they forgot to bring out the bread so we had to remind our server that the appetizer came with bread. We also ordered a calamari order to share. That was probably the best part of the meal. Another 15 to 20 minutes passed and we finally placed our order for our main course. We ordered 3 clam chowders, 1 crab chowder, 2 double crab double shrimp, 1 chicken Caesar salad, and 1 kids fish and chips. The chowders all came out 25 mins later and the crab about 15 mins after the chowders. We had to keep asking the server where the salad and fish and chips were. Keep in mind the fish and chips was a kids meal... In my opinion everything should have come out together. Or the kids meal first. Well, the salad came out another 15 mins after the crab came out. And the fish and chips was the last to come out another 15 mins after the salad. That was just unacceptable.  The fact that the answer to why the fish and chips wasn't out yet was because the "kitchen was backed up" doesn't excuse it, the fact was that they lost the order... Or messed it up and sent it out with some other group. Just ridiculous. Wouldn't recommend this place! Gabrielle was the server that day
author: Maria S.

description: Get a window seat because it even comes with a pair of binoculars that my kids loved using to see Alcatraz where we had been earlier in the day. The menu is actually a book with gorgeous pictures and recipes. Took one of these home to try and make the sizzling garlic crab. It's got a retro 1950s vibe throughout including wait staff in dinner jackets. Amazing calamari and oysters. My son loved his smoked salmon Caesar salad while my younger one loved the fish part of his kid's fish and chips but was disappointed that the chips were actually overseas ones salty potato chunks with olives. My filet was cooked perfectly and came with amazing mashed potatoes. The kids had a huge chocolate sundae between them while I enjoyed a Chocolate Fog drink. Service was efficient and friendly. Great place to watch the sunset and the tide go out.
author: Nina F.

description: I went to this place for a nice intimate dinner for two, the service was fast and staff was very friendly. It's an upscale place with a family vibe to it. The food is great and not too expensive. I will definitely return when I'm in the bay!
author: Leslie A.

description: My husband and I went on the 4th of July for dinner and to watch the fireworks. The view is great. However, the food is lacking in flavor. I had the whole garlic grab and the clam chowder. The crab had no flavor. It just tasted like plain boiled crab. It needed salt and I tasted no garlic. They should boil their crab in a Old Bay crab boil seasoning packet or at least ad salt to the water. It's bad when Red Lobster has better crab than a water front restaurant in the city lol! My husbands home cooked crab tastes better than this place. I was also disappointed that they didn't offer an option to have the crab cracked, as other restaurants do. We had to put in major work for bland crab. The clam chowder was by far the worst I've ever had. It tasted like mushy potato soup with a unpleasant flavor. It's hard to get bad clam chowder anywhere in the City but they accomplished it. It amazes me to see so many tourist going there but they don't know any better. The service is good but they need flavor! I expected better for the price. My recommendation would be to go to the bar for a drink and take in the view. There are many other better restraints in the area. Try Alioto's.
author: Sarah L.

description: Great prices, good food, a nice view and decent service. Put all that together and you've got yourself your "go-to" place for future visits to the pier 39.
author: Isaias L.

description: Decided to try somewhere different when we were in SF. The place and view is really nice, everyone should experience it once. The food was average though. Had the clam chowder and it was nothing special. The husband had the crab chowder, now that was tasty! We shared the seafood mix platter and a ceasar salad that was all right. My son did enjoy the binoculars they have at each table. Basically you are paying for the view. You could get better food at the little outdoor stands. I doubt if ill go back as there are so many better places to eat.
author: Tami T.

description:
Had the Cioppino at $20 for a good sized bowl.  Had two large crab claws, fish, mussels, and calamari in a great broth.  Very good version for the price.  Everything was tender and cooked perfectly.

Wife had the fish and chips at around $25 which I thought was ridiculous considering its just fish and chips.  It was great for what it was, but no fish and chips is worth that price!
author: John B.

description:
How have I not written a review for this place?  I've been coming to this restaurant for YEARS! Well, nearly 7 to be exact.  

I lived near the wharf for nearly four years and have tried every restaurant around the area.  That said, I keep going back to the Franciscan.  The food is delicious - especially the double crab/double shrimp skillet.  It's enough for two people to enjoy.  All I can say, is don't miss out on this gem.
author: Noneya B.

description: The service was wonderful.  The environment is wonderful.  The food was horrible. I have leftovers that cost nearly $60 per plate, and I tossed them in the garbage.  The roasted crab was beautiful.  And stringy, salty, oily, fishy tasting, and dry.  Our table nibbled from a few legs, and then ate more bread.  The mussels and shrimp were fine, but unremarkable.  Next time, we go for sightseeing and come back home for dinner.
author: frank k.

description: We ate here after a day of sightseeing in San Francisco. We found the service great, the food good and reasonably priced, the views awesome. Also, my mother left her cell phone there when we were done, and the staff used the phone to text me to let me know that they'd hold on to it til she returned. :)
author: K L.

description: Franciscan Crab Restaurant is a romantic place to dine in.  My husband and I celebrated our 10th year wedding anniversary, despite the soaked weather, the experienced was pleasant and impressive!  Franciscan is pricey, but worth every penny!  I requested to share half of my lobster chowder and we were given 2 cups that were nearly full.  Our server, Rhys was very courteous and made it extra special for both of us.  Thank you!
author: Deborah E.

description: Had the fixed price menu for $29: great clam chowder and garlic dungeonness crab, with a great view on the port. Service was excellent, the sourdough bread was unexpected, and so good!
author: Sebastien I.

description:
I took a group of bikers (motorcycle) here for dinner in Dec. I had planned an overnight event in SF to play like a tourist. As many who have lived here all their lives had never spent the night in the city and played tourist. So I booked us hotel rooms and planned activities.

I picked the Franciscan as I like that it had a long term history, was good sized to hold a group, has wonderful views and of course because my favorite food is Succulent Crab.

Now you all know if your gonna eat at a nice Seafood restaurant in the city the prices are going to be a bit higher so no need for me to even go there. 

What's more important is the service, the food flavor and quality.

First let me say when I contact an establishment about  about group reservations it's when I get my first impression if I want to eat, stay or go to that particular place. I am very much about Fantastic Welcoming customer service. So when I contacted their General Manager via email he replied and was very welcoming to having our group come for dinner, so I decided to keep our reservation. I also said I could not give an exact count as our RSVP's flexuate but he said do not worry about that we will accommodate any size group you bring. So all correspondence up to our arriving was answered and I was always assisted, that's good service.

Upon our groups arriving we sat at the bar it's not too big but the bartenders were very helpful in assisting us with our drink orders. I was not sure what I wanted and so the bartender asked if I like Martini's and of course I do. He suggested a Cucumber Martini and I said go for it. He made me one and it was so fresh like I had just had a fresh one from the garden infused with Vodka. Yummo!

We were then seated, I only had wished it were still light out so we could enjoy the wonderful bay view but that's for my next visit at lunch time.

The wait staff were quick and efficient, not overly talkative but that's okay we do enough talking ourselves. All of our food was flavorful and plated lovely. 

I do have to say thou I love Crab, I think I said that above,catch my drift! haha Drift and Crab in the sentence. But I really like it steamed with melted butter. So I ordered from the Pre-fixe menu what I thought read, and I never looked at the menu again to see if it said it or not. But steamed Crab and when it came it was roasted Crab, now I'm not saying it was bad it just was not what I had in mind and when I have something in mind to eat that is what  Iwant. So roasted was a bit drier then steamed so to me not as succulent. But of course I picked the shells clean, you thought I wouldn't??? The pre-fixe menu is nice you get a few entree selections, soup or salad and dessert.

We had a wonderful dinner and I would go back for sure. I want to go for lunch and just take my time dining and enjoying the views.
Stop in the Franciscan if you are in the city and say hi to the General Manager if he is there Craig, he actually seated us that night. And get J.C. to make you a Cucumber Martini.
author: Tina L.

description: The service was amazing - friendly - & fast! The food was great & the atmosphere was fun!
author: Bonnie H.

description: Nice place located at harbor 39 we stopped in to grave a beer the food looked good, but we had to keep on moving. Next time there we will try to eat.
author: Danny H.

description: Full crab was magical. Food came very fast but waiter service was very slow. (Didn't check tables often)
author: Carlo A.

description: Love this place! Great service and food and I found there prices to be reasonable even for a tourist spot.  I've been here at least 5 separate occasions and the service and food is great each time.
author: Austin S.

description:
I wish I had come here on a day that San Francisco isn't raining or cloudy because the view of the Piers and Alcatraz would have been outstanding. But I still thoroughly enjoyed my experience here even though some menu items were a bit pricey.

My boyfriend and I came here with two international students after a long day of touring around San Francisco's landmark locations. It's somewhat initially deceiving walking by this retro-glitzy-looking restaurant; my first thoughts were that this restaurant would be decked out and upscale. To my surprise, it looked like a fancier version of Mel's Drive-In: decorations such as old-fashioned photos and paintings, tiled counters along the walls, black cloths as our napkins, and menu items such as fish & chips, clam chowder, etc. Don't let these retrograde items fool you! The menu items sound mediocre, but WOW they did not taste like that.

The four of us ordered these items:
- chicken and chips 
- prix fixe 1: cup of clam chowder, salmon in a spicy tomato cioppino sauce, and house-made kustard ice cream (vanilla)
- prix fixe 2: cup of clam chowder, crab alfredo (with linguini pasta), and house-made kustard ice cream (vanilla)
- wild strawberry Italian cheesecake
- chocolate fog (basically a chocolate rum-like concoction with Godiva shot and a hint of mocha flavor)
(Items we didn't order but were customarily included were water and sourdough bread & butter.)
We were all very pleased with each of the items we ordered--everything tasted above average. But I'd definitely highlight a few items in particular.

HIGHLIGHTS: chicken & chips
Having had a crab/shrimp cocktail snack from Fisherman's Wharf earlier, I was in the mood for something not as seafood-y. I thought the chicken and chips would be a simple strips and fries dish, but WOW was I so wrong! It was a single long strip of deep-fried chicken but didn't taste like the typical heavily-battered dry chicken. It was juicy, tender, and SO delicious! I'm not sure how I can even describe how pleasantly surprised I was to taste chicken like this! The chips were also delicious--it tastes like those flash-fried, addictive fries that you'd eat on cruises (as my boyfriend put it). 

HIGHLIGHTS: crab alfredo
I had enough crab for the day from snacking at the Wharf, but this dish made me happy to have more, especially because of the linguini pasta. I don't believe I've ever had linguini pasta with texture to this perfection before! I love cheese from alfredo sauce to death, so looking back now, I wish I had ordered this (with chicken or shrimp) instead of my chicken and chips. I sometimes can't justify to myself to order an alfredo pasta dish in a restaurant because it's simple enough to make at home, but Oh My Gosh, I want this dish again!

Other features of this place that will make me want to come back again: 
PARKING: 
This place will validate your parking ticket if you're parked in the lot right outside it (2 hours off if you parked there before 6 pm, and 3 hours off if you parked there after 6 pm). This parking lot has several employees that give out/collect parking tickets at the entrance/exit, help guide traffic flow, and direct you to open spots, so it was extremely easy to park (minus the usual Fisherman's Wharf tourists that crowd the streets and walk through the lot occasionally). 
SERVICE:
The restaurant's host/hostess and waiters/waitresses are very attentive, polite, and easy to talk to. None of us ever had to ask for drink refills, extra utensils and plates for sharing, or wonder about when we'd be receiving food. They "properly" served us by serving us our food on our right sides and picking up our finished plates on our left sides--classy classy!
OCEAN VIEW: 
This restaurant sits right next to the docks, so you can get a front seat view of the bay and Alcatraz from your table. This place even chained binoculars to the window-edge counters so you can get a close up of Alcatraz and the bridges! 

The best way I can describe Franciscan is casual-looking menu and restaurant with not-so-casual food quality and service. If it weren't for the fact that parking around the Embarcadero is so expensive and Fisherman's Wharf is extremely out of the way to get to, I would definitely come back to this restaurant again (and even refrain from snacking on seafood around the Piers and Wharf so I can make room for food from here)!
author: Stephanie C.

description: Beautiful views of the bay- Alcatraz and boats are right there out the window. The clam chowder was not the best- the crab fettuccine is very salty, but pretty good! The service was a bit on the slow side- it's a nice touristy location on the water, but there are a few I would recommend just around the corner over this place.
author: Steph P.

description: A little better than Meh, but not much.  I'd go 2.5 stars.  The view is pretty awesome - enjoyed that.  Drinks were ok.  Food was so-so.  I got a salad, which wasn't fantastic (didn't even finish it).  Iron skillet shrimp were sent back - they tasted fishy.  Smoked salmon crotini were good.  Best dish was the crab fondue, which was super yummy.  Needed more crostini to go with it, and they gladly brought more.  Service was ok.
author: Linnea E.

description:
Every year at the start of crab season we head to sf for a crab Louie
We usually go to another place on Fishermans Wharf but decided to try somewhere new. Don't bother with this place if your'e looking for a good Crab Louie. The expensive salad was VERY small & had about 3 bites of crab on it. The clam chowder was marginal. Good service, great view but can't recommend the food.
author: Dale C.

description: I was in San Fransisco for a few days and decided to go to the World Famous Fisherman's Wharf while in town. Let me first say that San Fransisco is an amazing city and I would love to go back. We were hungry from walking around so we stop at the Franciscan Crab, and from the pictures of all the famous people on the wall that have ate here I could tell it was going to be expensive LOL. The view from your table is of the bay which was amazing. We ordered the "1 pound" crab, 1 appetizer  and just Burger with fries NO ALCOHOL and the bill came to $ 94. I almost jumped in the bay when I saw that, but I guess you are paying for the view because the crab was not all that (I'm from Maryland I know about steamed crabs). But all in all I had a great time at Fisherman's Wharf it is a must see if your in town.
author: Chris H.

description:
I definitely think the view is worth it, if nothing else. The classy-retro theme is well executed throughout, and there are tons of little vintage details. It's further down from the whole Pier 39 fiasco, and overall I'm sure it does get its fair share of tourists, but it felt less 'in your face', to me.

Their chowder is decent and generous in portion. Drinks are good - I enjoyed a "Splash" champagne cocktail; perfectly light and refreshing. I really loved the lightly fried broccolini with sea salt.

Service was sub-par. Our server was very cold, and I felt rushed despite the restaurant being not crowded what-so-ever (I am one who likes dinner a la the senior special, before 5PM). He took my delicious broccolini away before I was done grazing. I would give it another chance, though.
author: Nicole E.

description: I booked a table for a party of 14.  First, the tables were not setup and they made us wait till they set it up although i made a reservation.  Second, I specifically requested for a good view and they set us up in the corner with no view.  Third, we had to call the waiter 3 times to take our drinks order.  Fourth, those that ordered pasta got wrong orders and the food tasted...blah.  Everyone seemed to be raving about this place but i found it less than mediocre.
author: Indira V.

description:
