What a fantastic place!!! They were the only restaurant able to accommodate our party of 6 even when we did not have reservations. When we had to change our seats for a bigger group, they gave us free desserts..... Everything was great. If you're ever in the Bay area, this is a must! 

Our table ordered the cioppino, double shrimp & crab (served on a hot skillet), crab chowder, oysters, short ribs & whole crab..... There was nothing left but shells & silverware ;) my kind of dinner!
author: Lucky Y.

description: Food was amazing! The view was exquisite! First time in San Francisco and I am so glad I came to this restaurant to eat. I felt it was a little pricey but the view more than made up for it. Our server could have been a little friendlier but all in all was a great experience.
author: Gregory O.

description: Got charged 100 dollars more then what we should have! I looked at the bill and noticed the waiter added four different items that we did not order!!!! When we pointed it out to him he was unapologetic and said "wow that is far off" not to mention he was very dismissive and unfriendly to me and my boyfriend the whole time. The only reason I gave it two stars is the food was very good. I get the bill being off by ten dollars but 100 makes me wonder. Plus no explanation of how that happened. Will not come back.  Heads up people make sure You go over your bill so you are not wrongfully charged!!!
author: Shereen R.

description:
Ended up here last friday night for a bday celebrations. 
+free and easy parking with validation
+accomadated big group but the table was not enough room for food
+waiter nice, seperate billing, took pics
+food was good, had better, but it was good
   *got the crab/shrimp/muscle combo - alot of food
   *calamari appetizer aight, broccoli was real goood
+view of the bay, had outdoor seating, be nice if it was during a warm day/night

Would come here again with a group of friends or family, 3.5-4*
author: T T.

description: This is so good that I have to come here every year for my Birthday. My husband and I share the crab feast. Says it feed 4 but my husband and I share it and I still want more. Its that good. My daughter hates crab so she orders the chicken fettuccine. I tried a bite that is some damn good alfredo sauce. The wait staff is always nice.
author: April B.

description: i had crab fondue which was okay. i had crab sliders no taste i had crab enchain i had an whole crab i had soup and salad
author: Tiffany K.

description: I have had a lot of calamari in my day, and this is the best I have ever had. We shared the single serving and it was plenty for 2 people.
author: Keeley A.

description: Not impressed. From the rude hostess to the bland food, the overall experience was not worth the price..at all. Our waitress was nice but that didn't change anything about the experience. Overall, wouldn't suggest this place, there are plenty of places around that will have great seafood and employees with a  nice smile on their face.
author: Mimi K.

description: This place I literally traveled and took a day off of work for. It's my favorite place on the wharf. The food is always on point and I love it. But today I was SO disappointed I might not be back. The food was AMAZING, but the service was worse than terrible. The lady in the beginning was sweet, but the guy "shadowing" her was a complete sarcastic rude asshole. I didn't catch his name but he was shaved headed with a little facial hair I think I don't remember. He took over after the food was served, and made weird remarks while we were eating. Then stood over us and said "I guess I should like take these.." Still stood there and then took the plates. It was so awkward. And then he put the check down aggressively and walk away. Then we wanted to split the check (I put the cash and my sister put in her card) and he walked up and said "ok.. This looks like it's ganna be complicated" and rolled his eyes and we explained to him the cash then the rest on the card and apologized. He said "sure." And looked irritated then walked away. As a server myself I KNOW that's not hard to do AT ALL. And his attitude was so uncalled for. Customer service was nonexistent. But the worst part was after we signed and left our FIFTEEN PERCENT TIP besides the shitty service, because I, as a server know the struggle of tips felt bad. Then he grabs the check OPENS IT RIGHT NEXT TO THE TABLE IN FRONT OF US. And makes a face and says "wow...." And stormed away shaking his head. HOW RUDE CAN YOU BE? NEVER should a server act that way. If I could of snatched the check back and took my money I would of . I was so angry and appalled by his behavior I don't think I'll be coming back for quite sometime. Which sucks because it's my favorite place. I just don't understand why your in that business if you obviously hate it. Hopefully he gets his shit together or I don't see him having a job for long.
author: Matthew P.

description:
Great service, good food, and a wonderful atmosphere. It's in a tourist area of SF, but didn't feel much like it during my visit. It's 50's diner decor may throw you off a little as it did to some people who were walking by wondering what this place was, but I would definitely recommend giving it a try.

This place has a great view of the bay and is perfect for a nice dinner overlooking the sunset. By the way, If you do happen to park in the lot nearby, they will validate two hours of parking.
author: Kelvin M.

description:
My go-to seafood semi-touristy restaurant when I have friends or visitors in town.  Great retro upscale ambiance, awesome floor to ceiling windows with a great view, and the seafood has been above-average as well.

I love the Cioppino, and the 4 fish - 4 ways is excellent as well. I've never had the crab (not a good choice if you are going out afterwards - dangerous to clothes!), but have had the mussels and shrimp on the hot iron, and they were good.  You can't beat sharing that type of plate with some friends, though - you usually remember how much fun you had more than whether the food was 4 star or 5 star.

Bonus points for printing the recipes on the menu and the tables for 2 down past the bar.  They sit you both sit on a loveseat, so you get to sit together and look out the at the bay.
author: Andrew S.

description: Food was great, waiter was very nice. The place is cool. The food is a little on the expensive side and it was a little cold in the restaurant. I would definately come back.
author: Ryan S.

description: I hosted a special dinner for family members who had never visited San Francisco. They were so excited to eat on the waterfront. We chose Franciscan's on a recommendation from the St. Francis concierge. From the moment we stepped into the restaurant our experience was horrendous. First, the hostesses attitude was indifferent and she seemed like she would rather be any place but there. We were seated by an elderly woman by the window, however, next to our table was all the kitchen equipment that was encroaching on our dinning space. I felt like I was in the middle of your kitchen. We requested to be moved and were sat at another location in the restaurant that had the exact same issue. We had been touring all day and were excited to sit down for an amazing meal. In addition to drinks, we ordered the calamari and crab feast for 4. As we began to eat the smell of rancid oil was overwhelming. It tasted like burnt rubber and oil that has been used for everything you've cooked for the last week. It was hard to get the taste of brunt, old oil out of our mouths. So we sent it back and hoped our crab dish would be better. But, that was not the case. The crab feast came out with the SAME overpowering rancid smell that the calamari had also. This was so disgusting we had to leave. Not to mention, we were starving. San Fransisco is known for it's bread and this bread was stale, hard, cold and then we noticed all their bread was sitting by the window just waiting to be served to guests. It felt like we were In a factory with pre prepared frozen food. Disgusting, if you're looking for even mediocre food avoid this place at all cost. If you wanna eat by the wharf you're better off getting a fishing pole and catching it yourself, it will definitely be fresher. The one positive note was the bus boy who was extremely apologetic and empathic with the situation. He was the only positive part of our experience. It is one hour of my life I can never get back.
author: Caitlin H.

description:
Beautiful view! Couldn't ask for a better one. But, sadly, it does not make up for the terrible service. The place is super, super loud. We could barely hear our server.  We were rushed out of there so fast that I felt like we were still swallowing! For the price, you don't expect it to be fast food. 

The crab was great, the shrimp was ok. 

Atmosphere and service were similar to a Burger King.
author: Shannon B.

description: I've eaten there 3 times before leaving this review and I must say that though the food is tasty... The service I have received on all 3 visits left much to be desired and necessary! 1st visit- after waiting over 30-40 mins for our initial beverage like you know ummmmm.... Water and then another 20 mins for my Pino, I should have taken the hint but I didn't, I ordered and ate and enjoyed the food but NOT the service (well lack of)! 2nd visit - almost exact service as the first visit except we had a window seat to distract us from being ignored by wait staff. Apparently we were supposed to get binoculars to view the view but lo and behold the wait staff failed to offer any exceptional service! 3rd and final visit was last night. The waitress paid us little attention, accidentally squirted crab juices in my eye while attempting to break it into pieces using a butter knife! Each time I visit the bill is no less than $200 for 3 diners. Franciscan's will not see that from me again! Thank you for what I can do at home!
author: That L.

description: Food was just okay but honestly portions weren't too big for the high price you pay more. It seems like you pay for money for the experience of eating at Pier 39 and being able to view the ocean as you eat. Place was really nice with a full bar. My drink was really strong and had tequila, made me drunk really fast. Seafood was pricy. They made us wait even though we made it to our reservation on time, wthHowever we at least did get a seat byt the window to view the bay which was nice. To sum it up, this restaurant is really a tourist trap and ppl are attracted to the scenery and high end look. Food was just okay but not worth the price, u can get the same stuff at a cheaper restaurant
author: Stephen C.

description: I ordered a cup of clam chowder with the spicy shrimp pasta. The clam chowder was the worst I have ever had at a restaurant, and there was so much sand in my clams that I couldn't even finish eating it. My spicy shrimp pasta was not spicy, in fact it was sweet from the caramelized onions. It was ok, but would have been much better with some spicyness. Our waitress wasn't the greatest, never asked us how our food was or even refilled my water.
author: C C.

description:
I haven't been here in years but to me it is a touch of "old San Francisco". Despte the heavy tourist population, I, child of a SF native, found it delightful. Our seafood was fresh, prepared nicely, service was attentive. This is how SF has been for years and years as the Whart has always been a tourist attraction and also a place that locals actually DO visit as the fish markets are real. 
I loved how coffee comes in a separate pot for each person....why don't all restaurants do that? Yes, the prices are steep, no doubt about that. But, I think they do a great job. Keep it up, Franciscan.
author: Sandy T.

description:
I came here with my brother who was visiting me from So Cal. We got here and there was zero wait, we were whisked off to our table immediately which is always a plus.

Food and service? AWESOME.

We shared the crab fondue. So cheesy and they dont skimp on the crab meat. We each got the prix fixe menu for $25 a piece. The house salad was so fresh and the garlic vinaigrette was to die for. 

My brother order the spicy shrimp pasta and I got the sizzling crab. His pasta was perfectly cooked, seasoned just right and delish. My crab portion wasnt very big but it was just enough with the bread, appetizer, salad ect I wouldnt have had room for more! The garlic sauce on the crab was amazing and it was so sweet and fresh I was sad when my crab cracking was over!

Dessert was their house made ice cream which reminded me of what my Uncle made for us kids with the rock salt and churner thingy. 

Our server Burak was incredible. He was warm, attentive, smiling, helpful, friendy and personable. He attended to the little things which are really important. When I went to tear open my after dinner hand towel packet to get the last of the crab mess off my hands he even took my towel packet and opened it up for me so I could grab the little towel out!

When our amazing dinner experience came to an end I had to ask for the manager on duty (Drew) so I could compliment him and his staff about how happy we were with everything. 

I have to say to the Yelpers complaining that its expensive.....hello its a crab restaurant at Fishermans Wharf!!!! And its not THAT expensive when you figure in the ambiance, view, food and service. We left after spending just under a bill completely full and very satisfied. 

Will definitely be back again and will be asking for Burak!
author: Erika G.

description: Just incredible,. The views of the Wharf and Alcatraz are stunning! So is the Dungeoness Crab legs!! The place to go in San Francisco!!!!
author: J. R.

description:
A friend was visiting from out of town and wanted seafood and we stumbled upon the Franciscan crab restaurant. As a resident of SF I had my reservations.... It's in tourist town. The part if the city marked as " here be monsters" to locals. 

I was pleasantly surprised. We had a great time. Food was excellent, great views, good service and not overly inflated prices.
author: Phill R.

description:
Spontaneously ended up having dinner here with my parents and my grandmother on a day trip to SF one day. I had been craving seafood for awhile and we thought being at Fisherman's Wharf would be a good opportunity to satiate that craving. Unfortunately, we were not able to get a window seat, but we got one of the booths right next one that was cleared not too long after our food came out, so it was nice to be able to look out into the bay while eating our dinners. The 50's-diner decor of the restaurant was nice. The booths and the little trinkets around the store were cute touches.

The food itself was quite delicious. We got the Surf and Turf with boneless short rib, seafood black linguine, and chicken alfredo. The short rib was very soft and flavorful, the seafood in the pasta was very fresh (although a bit messy to eat), and the chicken alfredo was very good as well.

However, I must -1 a star because of the service. Service was noticeably slow and when I was eating my crab, I couldn't help but feel a bit judged by our server. I mean, yes, eating crab is not pretty business, but it is probably not an okay-thing for the customer to feel uncomfortable eating in front of the server.

I might be coming here again some time in the future, but probably not any time soon.
author: Lynn K.

description: We absolutely had no complaints with our lunch.  We were proudly greeted, host was very courteous and we were seated quickly.  Server brought out our water and bread instantaneously.  Service was excellent from start to finish.  Son had the fish and chips, probably the best I've ever had.  Daughter had the clam chowder in the bread bowl.  Certainly good, cut not the best we've ever had.  The best part of the meal... Hands down, the double mussels and double crab; steamed to perfection.  The view if the bay and Alcatraz also added to the atmosphere.
author: R L.

description: I love the vibe there, view is nice, you can also enjoy cameras there, crabs are well cooked, however the price is expensive
author: Yasaman A.

description: Great location, friendly people.  I only had the clam chowder in a sour dough bowl, it was really good.
author: Jason W.

description:
I'd say this place is 3.5 stars. 

What's good: the drinks (I had the tattle tail), the crab (I didn't think the garlic sauce was that special), the view (absolutely spectacular), the ice cream, and the price of the fixed menu. 

What's not good: the service (we had three people working our table and none of them really cared or got things done quickly), the clam chowder (more like potato soup), and the house salad (why not offer the Caesar on the fixed menu?)
author: Francesca V.

description:
Four stars is probably just a bit much for this place, but it is surely better than three.  We had dinner during a weekday with some out of town relatives.  For tourists and locals alike, the view from most of the seats here are killer.  We had a great view of the bay.  Five stars for the view!  One negative was they seated the seven of us in a spot that normally seats six, even though we were early and the place was wide open.  That did take away from the experience just a bit.  

The food is pretty good.  Most of us had some sort of seafood, and I give it pretty high marks.  Not the best I ever had, but pretty darn good.  The plates did seem a bit skimpy on the side dishes, but I don't think anyone walked away hungry.  Took a little longer than I thought necessary to get bread and water, but no big deal.  The children's menu is pretty sparse, but both of our kids found something they liked.

Service was the one sorta weak spot.  The staff was very nice, but it often took some doing to get their attention.  I just did not feel like we were really being taken care of despite the fact they were not very busy.  Don't get me wrong, the service is not terrible, but for the prices they charge I would like have a little more attention shown to me.  Perhaps this is due to the fact it is located down in Fisherman's Wharf and they serve lots of out of tourists, but still.   Also be aware that even with a group of seven (two of those were kids), our gratuity was included in the bill.  Seven people seem like a pretty small group to hit us with that, but what do I know?

Overall I enjoyed the place and would recommend it to anyone looking for somewhere to sit and appreciate the view while having a nice dinner.  The food is good and you won't get a much better view of the bay.  The prices are a bit high, but probably normal for that area.  If you drive, make sure you check to see if the restaurant will validate your parking.  The parking garages charge a bloody fortune down there!  I think the lot right in front of Franciscan's will validate, but you should check first. 

Oh, and since your in the area, go and work off your dinner by playing some old coin operated games at the Musee Mecanique.  It is just a few doors down and well worth the visit.
author: Scott S.

description: We ate here yesterday... Food was wonderful, waiter was cool.. Prob not the best but cool.. Until he approached us and demanded for more tip!! WTF!!!?? Seriously!!??? What waiter demands MORE tip from their customers!!!?? We already left him $5.. That's all we had in cash.. He stopped us while we were leaving.. told us we needed to tip him more!! Wow!! Wtf!!??! His name is CARL!!!! Bald-ish older white man!!  Anyway, my daughter (an 11 year old) took out her cash and gave him another $5.. This waiter is an asshole!!!! ONLY 1 star because of the asshole waiter!!!! He really needs to be fired!!!!! Ruined our day!!!
author: P. S.

description: The location and food was Excellent.  Typical tourist pier 39 spot. The issue that both my date and I had was the service. Unfortunately I heard great things about the service from yelp and zagat alike. When we arrived, it took our waiter over 15mins to initially take our drink orders. The servers name is Micheal. He is a cue ball bald head looking guy. He had absolutely no presence.  I saw the expo way more then him. The expo was the one who served our food. The waiter didn't come once to refill my water (which was empty for most of my meal) or even ask how our meal was  Even The manager came to ask how we were. I never saw the server after the initial interaction. It wasnt just us either. Our whole section was neglected by any service. (Water refills, condiments, getting a check) nobody in our area was pleased. I didn't see him the whole meal. He truly didn't care. If you go to this restaurant,  don't be served by the bald guy.
author: Joe J.

description:
Went there for mother's day 2011. I'm sorry to report that both my dad and I thought the clam chowder, which was recommended here by some on yelp, was disappointing. It tasted more like potato soup with chunks of clam in it. I asked the waiter if this was traditional NE clam chowder thinking maybe this was some special take on the tried and true favorite...no it was just regular clam chowder he said. He asked if we wanted something else, so at least the service was good, thus at least the two stars. For the disappointing food, price, and incovenient location though I would hesitate to give this place a second try. 

Good service and great view (when the weather cooperates).
author: Jose U.

description: Best crab house I have ever been too. Expensive but well worth it. I had Crab enchiladas with lots of crab inside. My wife had the combo shrimp,crab and mussels. Great portions. Service was excellent as they were well staffed for the fourth. Will visit again next time we r in sf. Happy 4 th
author: Neal S.

description: Stay away. Been coming here for 50 years. No more. I had sea food cioppino and the wife had steamed clams. Both. We're horrible. No flavor, bland and watered down. First time I ever sent a meal back. The manager was understanding, but stood by his chef,saying the cioppino was there most recommended meal. Folks, go somewhere else and have a great dinner,just not here.
author: Peter M.

description:
hey, look, if you're serious about seafood, you're not at fisherman's wharf.  you're at ppq, thanh long, r&g, koi palace, or boiling crab.  

but if you find yourself entertaining out of town guests (read: in-laws) and doing the whole touristy thing, this place fits the bill with panache.

once you ascend the stairs, you get fabulous views from the window-side tables - along with binoculars for voyeur peeks of alcatraz.  even when you're seated away from the windows, you can take advantage of banquettes facing the views.  from the jacketed waiters to the black and white photos of vintage movie stars, the whole place is decked out in this swanky, retro diner meets art deco vibe.

you are paying for all this, of course.  it's an accessible, all-american menu with fisherman's wharf prices.  we went for the 3-course prix fixe.  the chowder was passable (a request to get it reheated went smoothly).  the basa fish fillet in tomato sauce got raves.  the crab enchiladas were really tasty and featured some decent hunks of crab - my fave.  the pasta bowls, like my crab fettucine alfredo, were really stick-to-your-ribs satisfying with decently executed (but not homemade, of course) pasta.

i was a bit miffed that the dessert was an already melting scoop of soft serve in a loutish cup.  it really shouldn't be too much to ask for a nice dessert dish and a bit of mint.  and finally, $8 for an ordinary dish of fries?

sigh...i'm glad that i don't have to play tourist too often!
author: Sandy C.

description: I took some customers here, they loved the place and the food. The service was not the greatest but perhaps he was tired that night.
author: Miguel L.

description: The food is no better than a chain restaurant, but the prices are that of a fancy five star restaurant.  It's understandable for the seafood, but $10 for less than 12 ounces of crab soup is wrong.  We came on a super busy day and the service was very rushed and stressful.  The people were nice though.
author: Abigail S.

description:
The service and atmosphere was amazing.  We had a reservation, but would probably been able to get a table even without one.  We had a great table on the water and even had binoculars to look out over the water.  The kids loved that feature!

The food was good.  Not great, but good.  I felt that the combo platter we had was over seasoned with the butter/garlic sauce.  It was difficult to enjoy the flavor of the fish with the massive amount of flavored butter on top.  I ended up not dipping my crab in the sauce because I wanted to enjoy the flavor of the crab itself.  Everything was cooked well, the server was great, and we didn't wait long for food.  We'd go back for the atmosphere and service and order a different dish next time!
author: Annette J.

description: We had the shrimp Alfredo and it was very very good!!! It ia not cheap bit it os worthed.
author: Diego ..

description: Would give them more stars if possible. The staff was wonderful! We were sat right away at a lovely table right on the window. We didn't read the menu and messed up our order the waiter took it back re made it and didn't make us feel bad at all. His busser / assistant was great too. He stayed on top of grabbing dirty plates as we finish picked up our one your olds constant messes and rather than be upset about it he took time to talk and play with our little one. My husband asked me to marry him here four years ago and every year we come back and the.service continues to exceed expectation. It isn't cheap but it is well worth the cost for the quality of food,  service and views.
author: Natalie E.

description: They have an excellent verity of sea food.  I recommend the oysters! Came here after a baseball game and it was crowded but we got seated right away.  The waiters were friendly and they filled our water up very fast.  Mix cocktails are great as well!
author: D R.

description: Food was delish. We ordered the crab fondue, and the combo platter to share. Wish we had ordered more crab. It was seasoned and cooked perfectly. Our waiter took orders and checked in. He wasn't super friendly, but he got the job done. We enjoyed the view. Almost every seat has a great view of the bay. Had the cucumber martini-defiantly a good pick.
author: Mallory R.

description: My husband and I were in town on business and wanted to try a good seafood restaurant. Thanks to Yelp we found the Franciscan and were very satisfied. Great food, great Fisherman's Warf atmosphere and reasonably priced. We had a great time. Thanks Yelp!
author: Cynthia W.

description: After reading the reviews and seeing that the manager took time to write back some of the customers who had a disappointing experience, my boyfriend and I decided to give the restaurant a try. Where do I begin...after our waiter, who was clearly overwhelmed with more than his share of tables, passed by us twice before saying he'd be back to assist us, then grabbing bread and butter that had been sitting at the station behind us (station: where all the extra utensils, napkins and condiments are stored)  gross you can't keep bread and butter in the kitchen where it belongs?? I understand time management and expediting but really?!?!? One thing We were extremely excited about being in San Francisco was the clam chowder.  The "clam chowder" I'd prefer to call it potato soup, was so disappointing I would have rather had calm chowder from Campbell's soup. I ordered the crab enchiladas, since they are a crab restaurant, and my boyfriend ordered the triple meat sliders. The crab in the enchiladas was so salty I wasn't sure they had salt left in the restaurant. And then the sliders, poorly made and constructed.  You can't use tiny sourdough cracker to hold together a hamburger patty, falls apart immediately. The end our waiter didn't even notice that I didn't eat my food and there was still half the food left on my boyfriends plate. Brought us the check for $79 and walked away. We don't mind paying money for a good meal but this was ridiculous and we left hungry!!!!  Do not eat here unless you want to throw your money away as well!!
author: Kim P.

description:
You have to come here at least once for the ambiance and the sea view, which is phenomenal. Food was good, I loved my clam chowder soup, crab enchilada was tasty, but crab legs could be fresher given they are so close to the water. Service was good, quick and professional. It's a fine dining location, so try to look nicer going there, even though they are quite lenient towards your appearance. 
It was pretty cool to have binoculars near the seats.
author: Alina B.

description:
The Franciscan Crab features floor to ceiling windows which offer an excellent view of the bay and Alcatraz.  I liked the attentive service, crisply dressed waitstaff, unique flatware and retro ambiance.  Binoculars are provided.

The cuisine was tasty, and a good value, but not necessarily amazing.
author: Chris H.

description: Amazing. Amazing service. Great views. Best restaraunt on the water. Food was delicious.
author: Lissa Z.

description: Delicious fresh crab and grilled mussels.  Upon walking in it looks like a classic diner....amazing waterfront views and attentive staff.  A must for fresh seafood lovers.
author: S G.

description:
My family and I chose to dine at The Franciscan after discussing the various options Fisherman's Wharf provides.  The setting of the restaurant was wonderful, but the service was not as great. We had to request waters after sitting without attention for over 10 minutes after being seated. We had 4 different service providers assist us in taking orders, busing food, and delivering the check. The dirty dishes were loudly collected at a dish bin down the isle from our table...
For the item prices and restaurant history I expected much better service, consideration, and attention.
author: Courtney J.

description: Best Seafood Cioppino I have ever had. Will never forget it.  It was so good! I came at the right time it wasn't very busy. Service was friendly and good. Got out of the brisk San Fran weather and really enjoyed my meal.
author: Chris W.

description: If you go to San Francisco and are looking for a good crab feast, look no further than the Franciscan.  The extensive menu has something for everyone and the views of the Golden Gate Bridge and Alcatraz are the best views along the waterfront.  The service is great and the booths are supper relaxing, all facing the large windows along the bay.
author: Peter D.

description:
For a place in the Wharf, this is one of the nicer ones. 

Location is superb. Views from most tables are really good. Decor is nicely upscale. 

We had lunch and dinner here on two different days. At lunch the service was okay but great. However our waiter at dinner was excellent, really beyond expectations. 

The food was good. Crab is nice quality and everybody was happy with the meals. The prices are also not outlandishly expensive considering where you are.
author: Tam P.

description: Absolutely delicious. My wife and I were last here 6 years ago when visiting San  Francisco. We returned only last week on vacation again and it was even better than I remember. If you love crab this place is a must!
author: Shannon H.

description:
Planned a girls night out and decided to have dinner here before our gift exchange. 

First thoughts as i walked in.. "ooh this is fancy! I like!" While we waited for our table, hostess offered us to sit at the bar. Declined to overpriced drinks and sat pretty quickly. We were sat in a fairly large table with a pretty good view i liked the binoculars they provided and the cute fish spoon and forks the lighting was perfect also. Although, the food was... lousy. I ordered the pre fix meal with clam chowder, crab alfredo, and fresh made ice cream.
Clam Chowder - Tasted alright but then again tasted as if i was from a can. 
Crab Alfredo- There was a fair amount of crab but the dish was VERY HEAVY the dish had NO FLAVOR i must have drenched salt and pepper in that religiously per bite. & it just wasted good. 
"Make it themselves icecream"- Too sweet tastes like over sweetened vanilla. 

My friend got the crab enchiladas and it tasted like straight up cheese. They added too much cheese into it that it overpowered the crab and wasn't good. 

What was the worst part of the food there is that my girlfriends and i were like "Can't finish our meal lets take it togo and eat it when were drunk later...EVERYTHING TASTES GOOD WHEN YOUR DRUNK RIGHT?" Wrong. Tasted worse than before. 
 
Try someplace besides this your better off at Joes Crab Shack or Bubba Gump.
author: Rosenel A.

description:
Hooo-boy! You so have to get the clam chowder in the bread bowl! That was definitely one of the best I've had!! LOVED IT! So yummy!!

My friend & I shared 1 Dungeness crab after the filling soups we got. The crab was good. Had to ask for the melted butter though since the wait staff did not bring it with the main dish. 

The view was great. Wait staff was a bit on the slow side, but once we had their attention, they were responsive. Perhaps it was just a busy night. 
Definitely not an inexpensive place to eat. but food was quite good. 

One of the down sides was that the restaurant can get quite noisy at times depending on where you sit. We heard a lot of banging and clanking of dishes which was distracting at times since we thought something was going to fall down on our table. There was some giant glass sculptures above where we sat and behind that was a wait staff station where it appeared that some bussing was occuring.
author: Tara R.

description: Our service was blazing fast and attentive. Food was good: tried the crab chowder and iron skillet shrimp and crab dish. Food had good flavor and the iron skillet was a nice touch. Good place for a nice dinner if you're visiting Fisherman's Wharf.
author: Jason R.

description: Delicious cioppino!! Amazing views and perfect for a windy San Franciscan evening. Clear view of Alcatraz and located conveniently in Fisherman's Wharf. The garlic clams were perfect.
author: Ally M.

description: Crab ravioli is AWESOME. .. and we're from Louisiana.  Thai sea bass was excellent as well. Ariel treated us like family. .. great service.  Calamari was without but the views made up for that.
author: Em S.

description:
If you're visiting San Francisco from out of town and looking for somewhere to get your Fisherman's Wharf crab fix on, this is a great place to make that happen.  

The crab was delicious and the service was excellent.  The wine menu was decent.  We went on a Sunday night and it was extremely busy, and we ended up waiting even with a reservation, so it's probably a good idea to make one.
author: E. C.

description: The location and service of the restaurant is its selling point. You're not paying for the food, in fact, I found that I've had a lot better food at other places for cheaper. You're definitely paying for the ambiance. My family and I ordered the crab, clam chowder, fish and chips, and calamari. Most of the food was decent but the crab was horrible. The crab I had, had an aftertaste of some kind of peroxide or ammonia. It was horrible. I expected a lot more in quality for the amount of money I paid for it. All in all, I don't think we'll be returning to this place unless its for a get together where the intent is to hang out, not eat quality food.
author: Alfred K.

description: We got a great table next to the window, so we were able to watch the boats pull into the docks. The server served our needs. He took our order and refilled our beverages when needed. What you need to know is that this place is overpriced. My wife had the crab cake appetizer and a cup of clam chowder and I had the Shrimp & Crab skillet. Water to drink, and the bill was $90. The food came out quickly and I like the fact that the waiter uses a handheld device to put your order in, so it goes right into the kitchen. The crab cake lacked flavor and the shrimp & crab legs were drowning in garlic, lemon butter. It was a bit too much, especially for the shrimp, which were sitting in it. The crab legs were protected by their shells, so they weren't as overpowering. They even give you more of the butter to dip the crab legs in. I was expecting it to be regular butter. Nope, more garlic lemon butter. Must be a San Francisco thing.
author: Bill G.

description: In a city of stellar seafood it's hard to be average, and the Franciscan was very good though not excellent. The cioppino came with two enormous crab legs, and I was a fan of the crab but the broth was too garlicky to be well balanced (and I'm a fan of garlic). Sourdough bread was soft and crusty though not warm. A fabulous view to Alcatraz when it's not too foggy, but the tableside binoculars weren't working.
author: Becky R.

description: Prices too high.  Restrooms, dirty gas station quality, broken and not supplied.  Bread cold and hard.  Very noisy.  Hard to have a conversation and enjoy the company.
author: Mark S.

description: Questionable customer service.  When asked very early on to split the bill between two couples response was "What we can do is let you folks figure that out."  Thanks! That was not at all helpful. I should mention that there were only four other customers here & many employees walking about bored. So, customer service is a hassle apparently & it's over priced...but it is tourist city so...probably to be expected.
author: Sam M.

description:
There are some old school couples booths here that would make you feel like Sammy Davis Jr. and Frank Sinatra were going to seated right next to you.  I was with some business colleagues so we had a more conventional booth for the three of us.   

Basically we did our best to put the dungeness crab on the endangered species list to no avail.  Even with three company credit cards at the ready we were simply outmatched.  

Don't steal the silverware!
author: Jon G.

description:
DROOOOLS!!!!

I went here with my friend's family for Thanksgiving and got to try everything CRAB related. 

Crab Chowder $10 per CUP. I know, its pricey but totally worth trying it. You actually see AND taste "real" crab. Its so soft that it breaks in my mouth without having to put any effort into it. 

Crab Enchilada $28 for two. That day, i was craving some mexican food/flavors... and then i saw this in the menu:) It was baked, cheesy, creamy, saucy.. and the crab just added so much quality into it. The Enchilada wrap was very moist and didn't break into pieces. Kind of...chewy in a sense? but in a good way.

Crab LEGS! We ordered the large order for people to share. I normally dont like crab legs because they're usually bland, dry, and require alot of "butter/garlic" dipping. But this was something NEW. The garlic/lemon flavoring had soaked into the meat through the shell and it was absolutely AMAZING!!!! It was saucy and delicious. 

If i go back, i'd most likely just order the crab legs/whole crab because it was just THAT good:)!
author: Hanna K.

description:
Ok so its in the heart of Touristville But you have terrific views and I loved how bright and open the dinning area was. 
As an Englishman that misses his fish and chips I have to rate it. Fries are ok but the fish is the closest I have had to the British stuff since I left there in 96. Strangely enough its catfish but it feels and tastes like buttery cod. Really light batter which is a welcome change from the inch thick usual.
Ice cream harkens back to the Mr Whippy soft serve that icecream van would bring when I was a kid. Just add a cadburys flake and youve got a 99. (got to be a Brit to get that reference)
author: Adam O.

description: One generous word. Fine. Very much a "out of the can" flavor. It's possible we didn't get the right thing. My wife and I ordered off the prefix menu, I had spicey shrimp and pancietta pasta. She had the crab legs . We ordered the oysters as an appetizer. They were good but on the expensive side. . It came with soup or salad. We got one of each. My clam chowder was just bad. Tasted more like store bought potato leak than clam chowder. Very runny and no clam. My wifes salad tasted ok but was soggy. The service was very slow. Her crab was pretty good. My pasta was.... Filling, but tasted out of the can. Kind of like spicey spaghetti-o's. It is pricey. Two beers and two glasses of wine and it was $125 before tip. I wouldn't go back. I wouldn't recommend it. Def a tourist trap type place.
author: Michael W.

description:
It's purely about their SECRET GARLIC SAUCE. Ask for extra when ordering the:

Crab Feast (Secret Garlic Sauce)
Crab Chowder Soup
Crab Fondue with swiss
Fruit/PinaColada Smoothie
House-made Frozen Kustard Ice Cream
author: Monalisa M.

description:
This restaurant is mediocre. I was not impressed with any aspect, even my view of the Bay was blocked by fog. The waiter gave us poor service, I had to ask the Bus Boy to refill my water glass as the waiter would only come to our table twice the entire night. He took our order, and gave us our check. (Hope you enjoyed that tip :).) 

There are restaurants in walking distance of this abomination that I know for a fact will give you better service, food and value. I would avoid the Franciscan.
author: Rick P.

description: We didn't come here for a meal, just some beers and apps. We ordered the fried calamari and the crab fondue. The calamari was cooked perfect and the crab fondue was OFF THE HOOK. U have to let the fondue sit for a little while so it will thicken up...... The place was very clean and the service at the bar was great. The decor was nice, great view of the Bay. It is a little pricey, but well worth it. If at the wharf, give this place a try.......
author: Michael C.

description: Great bay view and cosy indoor environment. Cold oysters are unexpectedly nice and smooth. 应该是这附近有最佳室内环境的餐馆了。
author: Kai W.

description: I am actually pleasantly surprised. Service and food were really good. We waited almost 30' (even with a reservation) but it was worth it. We ordered crab cakes and the halibut with lemon caper sauce. The kids ordered the past. The deserts (chocolate mousse cake and ricotta cake) were outstanding. I recommend you bring your own wine (corkage $10). Great atmosphere and the service was top (server Don). Will come back.
author: Pablo U.

description: Very impressed with the food and service..we walked in at 2 min to closing and we received the best attention ever..the crab enchiladas are the bomb!!..
author: Kelly N.

description:
Why didn't I Yelp it first?!  Sheesh!  My friends came up from L.A. over the weekend and we walked around the wharf area a bit before deciding on The Franciscan for a late lunch, early dinner for some probably.  I loved the old-tyme photos that lined the walls as we climed the stairs to the restaurant but that's where the love ended.  Everything else was mediocre at best and the restaurant is too high priced for mediocre.

First off, we waited at the table for about 10 minutes before the server even came to get our drink order.  No, it wasn't busy.  When he got there, we just gave him our drink, alcohol, appetizer and entree order all at once.  It took several minutes after that for the bread to even be delivered to the table.

We started with the calamari appetizer.  It was pretty bland but offered dipping sauces to distract from the blandness of the actual dish.  Then, there were 4 of us.  We ordered Crab legs, Lasagna, Prime Rib French Dip and Fish'n'Chips.  The best was the Lasagna (I'd have not put bell peppers in it though) and then the Prime Rib sandwich was good (not great).  The crab legs tasted really fishy to me and the fish'n'chips like no other I've had, unfortunately not in a good way.  They were dry so we ask for malt vinegar, only to be brought soy sauce in a little cup instead.  I secretly hoped that wasn't a 'joke' since my friend who ask for it was Asian.

If it weren't so high-priced it would get a 3 but I expect better service and food quality as the price goes up.  Also, it seemed funny that at a seafood/crab restaurant, the 2 items that were somewhat okay were... not seafood.
author: Susan D.

description: Memorably delicious bass! Great view the patio wasn't open but the bartender let us slip thru, great view!
author: Jill F.

description: Been going Here for 5 years ... great service every time ryss and bianca treat me and my girl like royalty.. we get the crab feast.. The crab fondue and the crab choker EXTRA CRAB PLEASE ... FOOD IS ALWAYS LN POINT !!!!
author: Jamael W.

description:
It really is just okay.  The location is great and the decor is interesting, but the food I had wasn't anything special.

I got the prix fixe meal with clam chowder, fish and chips, and "kustard" ice cream.  While the service was generally prompt, I was initially struck by how the guy bringing bread and water to my party's table managed to do so without even looking in our direction.  (When we got the bread, I'd kind of already wished that I'd gone to Boudin across the parking lot, probably because the bread was room temperature and not terribly soft.  To the Franciscan's credit, the butter was soft.)

The chowder came out quickly along with my dad's salad.  The chowder was different from the kinds I've had before - the potato and clam seemed more finely chopped, and it was a little more seasoned than usual.  I liked it, even though there were more hard bits in it than I'm accustomed to.  The fish and chips were pretty solidly underwhelming.  The fish was misleadingly crispy on the outside, as it was too wet on the inside.  The fries were either lukewarm or a little cold, and I think they only got the warmness from the big hunk of fish on top of them.  Finally, the "kustard" just seemed like ice cream in a glass cup to me, but I'm not an ice cream connoisseur.  It was okay - though the portions seemed kind of generous, you really do pay for them, so it's not a great value.

As an aside, my dad seemed to think that the bartender went above and beyond the call of duty by putting a lot of liquor in both of his $9 drinks.  On a totally unrelated note, he was thoroughly satisfied with his meal, which included the crab enchilada.
author: Ian M.

description: Yes this place was pret..ty AmaZing. I had the Shrimp Alfredo pasta Bowl & it was delicious, had to eat every last bite! Staff was super friendly and nice. Establishment was clean and the views from the window were brilliant. They even have binoculars on the ledge by the table:), perfect idea. Def walked off that pasta on the pier afterward:), was worth it though.
author: Celeste K.

description:
Awesome, awesome place.

The only clean looking place on Fisherman's wharf. I understand all the other places have been ther 100 years but it's called a mop. They're all filthy except for here.

This place is on it's own, across from Boudin Bakery. You can see Alcatraz from the windows. really nice view but with 2 other guys at the table, I had to hold my sentimentality.

Crab cakes = Best ever

Calamari = Not just the best ever bt one of the best dishes I have ever eaten. They have somehow made them so soft and crispy, it was like eating chips. UN------INGBELIEAVABLE!!!!!!!!!

Clam chowder = Awesome. Very creamy. like a nice Greek soup.

Ceasar crab salad = Okay. I DESPISE whole leaves of romaine lettuce that I have to cut myself. At $15, it should be cut and fed to me.

Grilled octopus = Not only terrible but no taste at all. It sys a ton that we finished the 3 bean salad that accompanied it but not the octopus.

Steamed mussels = He said they were great

Oysters = They raved

Frozen custard = AWESOME!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Overall, I can't wait to go back. I'm not a fresh crab kinda guy but they had these huge plates with mountains of them on some tables. Looked cool.
author: Gee T.

description:
I had very low expectations when my friend announced that we were going to a business dinner at the Franciscan Crab Restaurant.  I rarely go to the wharf and it is generally a place I associate with tourists and mediocre food/stores. 

We started off with a antipasti platter and the house salad.  Both were good.  Then came a crab feast.  On the menu it came warm and in a garlic sauce, but we asked for it cold with a side of sauce, mayo and drawn butter.  It is a hard meal to beat. 

Service was friendly and attentive.

I think it was a very expensive meal (added to the tab were the many bottles of wine that the 4 of us downed), but as I didn't pay I am not sure.

Next time I won't be so skeptical when my friend wants to eat at the wharf.
author: Katharine A.

description:
July 4th Visit:

Waited over an hour before we finally get to sit down. It's July 4th, afterall. Friends (3) ordered the Crab Feast to share. I had the Spicy Prawn Pasta. Two of them had Clam Chowder. One had a Rib Burger. 

Friends said their foods were delicious. Unfortunately for me, I think my pasta was just alright. The sauce was really goo-ee with the noodle kind of undercooked. The shrimp was not really fresh. I could say an average Pastini would have better pasta. 

Our waiter was friendly but he wasn't all that great. I'd say he's a step up compared to servers who take your order, bring out your food, then take your money. On our way out, he mumbled something to my boyfriend. Apparently, he asked if we were dissatisfy with the services. My boyfriend said everything was fine. The waiter looked at the receipts and said, "it's just that these are kind of...nevermind." What was he expecting? We tipped him nearly 15% which I think is fairly reasonable. Plus, gratuity shouldn't be expected. It was pretty generous considering the service he actually provided us. It was very awkward and unprofessional when he brought it up. Just made us wish we didn't tip him anything. 

The hosts were slow and aloof. The Helpers (the guys in the black top) were pissy-looking. We know you guys had a busy day/night, but that doesn't mean we deserve to be treated like dirt. 

Great view. The firework boat was right in front of us. 


A While Ago Visit:

Came here for lunch with friends. Seated outside. The view was nice. The breeze was nice. The birdy-poop-stained surrounding was not nice. Having birds flying close around you was not nice. I was so paranoid that I'd end up with bird poop in my food. :(

Food was okay. Service was slow.
author: Jennifer L.

description: I have been coming here regularly when visiting San Francisco.Place has reAlly gone down hill.Food is totally half assed.We spent over  hundred dollars on lunch for two.I felt like I should have payed less for the quality of the food.I had the crab fondue for an appetizer.It was mediocre at best.I guess the Mexicans working in the back can't make fondue.I did order a Mexican dish though.I thought this may be good .I had the crab enchiladas.the lettuce was put inside the enchilada and heated in it!!!!!!Yikes!lettuce should never be heated in an enchilada.I could get a better enchilada for much less.My husband had pasta that was so bad that I would've sent it back.Spicy shrimp pasta .Not good at all!!!This place is a tourist trap.It used to be good.must have changed owners.The only thing good was the clam chowder.We won't be coming back.
author: Jennifer s.

description: Ask for Laura!!! -- It's old school but it's awesome... A must do when in SF
author: Grace g.

description:
AUUUGHH!! We wanted the Crab House at Pier 39, and told the cabbie this and the cabbie brought us HERE after getting lost and circling the block and making us carsick and almost hitting a pedestrian and we get out and I didn't recognize anything  but I saw  CRAB and we figured it was the glorious one I had read about on Yelp.......

Well, thankfully, the view and the crab was very good. I figured this was the more highly reviewed one, so we order the whole crab and the mussels, which were very fresh and tasty, and of course the view made them more tasty.
author: A.J. S.

description:
So after a long and most hectic week, I found myself on a Friday night, trying to decide where to dine out.  I was a little tired and didn't want to deal with the see and be seen of the latest 'in' place nor did I want to go someplace too simple.  I did know that I wanted to dine out and that I also wanted to go somewhere different.  Well, after much consideration and changing my mind several times along the way, we ended up here.

Years ago, I had a girlfriend from Wisconsin who liked this place so I recall coming here quite a few times back then.  Hadn't been back to eat in ages, but always remembered that as far as the wharf goes, it was one of the better places to dine, other than Scomas.

Upon walking in, I was surprised to see that the light stained blonde wood was now gone and that it had been replaced with a lot of white paint and some dashing red lighting.  A little over the top, but all in all, I thought it worked and I actually liked it a lot better than the old decor before the remodel.

Food-wise, I knew it wouldn't be hitting any new culinary landmarks, but figured it would be a comfortable and relaxing place to eat after a long and tiring day.  I ordered us a bottle of Ferrari Carano Chardonnay and also an appetizer of fried calamari.  It was odd to see that bottle of Ferrari Carano since it brought back memories of my evil ex-fiancee and how we used to order that all the time.  At $49/bottle, it was an inexpensive, yet satisfying choice which I felt was priced fairly, especially for a touristy place.  Only double retail or so I thought at the time.

The fried calamari was good.  Wasn't mindblowing like what I've had in Monterey or at high end restaurants, but all in all, it was tender and cooked nicely.  As for our entrees, she wasn't too hungry and ordered the Fish and Chips while I had the Olive Oil Oven Poached Salmon with asparagus, olives, rosemary, and garlic.  I've never been a fan of olives, but everything else was better than I expected.

Disclaimer: To be honest, I didn't have the highest expectations coming in and it was actually a lot better than I had expected.  I especially liked the baby heirloom potatoes with accompanied the salmon.  It's certainly not a fancy place, not by a long shot, so I wouldn't dare compare it to the higher end places in the city, but for what it is, especially as a tourist place, I didn't think it was bad at all.  The salmon was cooked perfectly too.

The Fish and Chips looked good and I liked how it came on a long plate.  As with the calamari, I enjoyed the unusual presentation and felt that they were really trying to do just a little more to stand out.  She felt that the fries were salty, but I'm a saltaholic, so to me, they weren't salty at all.  As always, YMMV (your mileage may vary).

Wasn't sure if our server was new, but she and the rest of the staff that we came in contact with that night was really good, especially considering that we were at the wharf.  Most definitely didn't get the "I'll treat you badly since you're a tourist and I'll never see you again anyway" type of service that one sometimes gets in the area.  I liked the 'cookbook' style menu too.  Beautiful pictures of everything and with recipes as well.  The only negative about it is that because there are so many pages, it was hard to cut to the chase on what to order.  Perhaps an accompanying quick reference sheet might have been helpful although it worked out just fine as it was for me.

I had been rushing to get there since I knew they closed at 10PM, but was surprised when I saw people get seated well after that as we were finishing up our meal so perhaps they can be a good choice for late dining on weekends.

The dessert offerings looked tempting, but I decided to make it an evening of nostalgia and decided to take us to Ghirardelli for an ice cream sundae afterwards instead.  

All in all, it was a good dining experience.  Better than I had expected and I thought really good compared to some of the other choices in the area.  For a tourist restaurant at the wharf, I'd say it's definitely a four.  Yet, with that said and done, when I compare it to other similarly priced restaurants in the city, I just can't do it (give four, that is).  Three and a half is pretty much what it is in my book, but since Yelp doesn't allow half stars, I'll have to give it a three which based on my experience that evening doesn't feel right either.  Regardless, I wouldn't hesitate to dine here again or bring out of towners here, especially if they are looking to dine in a nice relaxed environment at the wharf in pleasant surroundings.
author: Roy N.

description: I like the bar salad, we ordered half grilled crab an it's yummy! The waitress took away our receipt with tips and showed an unsatisfied face right before we left !
author: Linda L.

description: This crab place is amazing. From appetizer to dessert your stomach will be happy. They have a wide range of crab dishes and meat dishes too. Their dishes are very large and I recommend you share a entree with someone. Their custard ice cream is awesome!  The service was excellent and I definitely recommend this place to my family and friends.
author: CJ C.

description:
This place is amazing! It has beautiful views, wonderfully presented dishes, and delicious crab. We had crab and shrimp on a sizzling plate, fried fish sticks for the boy, and crab enchiladas. Everything was great but the crab enchiladas. Now, I am an enchilada fan, don't get me wrong... but not the ones at this place, sorry.They were gorgeously served, but failed miserably in taste. If you ever made a crab burrito with italian style sauce, this would be your meal. Very strange. The crab and shrimp plate we ordered was absolutely delicious. No complaints there. 

The views were by far the best part... even for my little munchkin who spend the hour or so here trying to get a glimpse of Captain Hook in one of the boats (dont ask, he is obsessed with pirates). 

As long as you stay away from the italian crab burrito (or enchiladas as they call them) you will have a great time here! Beautiful place. Gorgeous view. Wonderful staff.
author: Tracy N.

description: Outstanding service and the crab sautéed in their "secret" garlic butter sauce was amazing to say the least.  For a high end restaurant the prices were exceptionally reasonable for the portions served. The only negative was their limit on fish dishes ... but it is, after all a "Crab Restaurant"
author: Mark M.

description: I think the high ratings came from tourists. We found that the crab was quite oily. Rather than simply boiling it, they boil it / cover will oil / then bake it. The results are less than stellar.
author: Doug G.

description:
I love this restaurant with all my heart! I know that it reeks of touristy schlock but I don't care! There is nothing more quintessentially San Franciscan than The Franciscan Restaurant! When you take your out-of-town guests on the Powell Street Cable Car and end up along Fisherman's Wharf, it would be an absolute crime against nature NOT to haul your pals over to this wonderful, storied and exciting dining adventure along Pier 43. 

The half-century old building-comfortably retro-chic in an old San Francisco kind of way screams of delectable cuisine and unrivaled majestic views of San Francisco Bay. These sights and flavors combine into a magnificent marriage of fantastic dining pleasures. The tourist component is just more icing on the cake. Even just walking along past The Franciscan is a delight-out front is the fresh crab and sourdough bread for sale.

Inside I have never once had a bad meal. The Foggy Wharf Crab Salad is perfection! The Seafood Cioppino takes you straight back to Italy!  My favorite fish-Halibut-is oven-poached in a drizzle of olive oil and served with a soy-ginger glaze! OMG-so good! The Black Linguine Pasta with clams is to die for!  Add the most beautiful dining vantage points to the mix and you have a for sure fine time here.

Yes, parking is a problem, but I have always come down to Fisherman's Wharf on the Cable Car or Muni Bus. I revel in the unfettered tourism aspect and never look back. This is what San Francisco is all about!
author: Gail P.

description: Good food. Wonderful service. Even better, views out to sea strait overlooking Alcatraz. They provide the binoculars as well. A blast from the '50s. Grace Kelly was sitting across from us. An escape from vulgar tourist rough trade on the Wharf.-- HOTSPUR for The PJ.
author: Philadelphia Junto A.

description: Beautiful view, and the food is pretty good, a little pricey though, but that's expected in this location
author: Hector R.

description:
First night, new city, what do you do for dinner? You walk around near where you are staying and find something that looks ok.

So there we are walking around fisherman's wharf, crab joint here, seafood joint there, plus a bakery (boudin's). 

We chose this place 'cos it seemed to be set away from the more central tourist area, and hoped we wouldn't get 'ripped off'. 

We definately did not get ripped off.

The service was fast and attentive. The food was good: lots of it and tasty.

Mrs Crash and I shared a 1/2 serve crab with 'special' sauce for appetizer. The crab was nice, quite mild taste tho, especially compared to our more familiar muddys. The sauce was a little weird to our taste tho' quite creamy and garlicky, but not really so nice.

We had a pasta dish each for main, and they were very tasty, seemingly fresh pasta, but both quite creamy/buttery sauces.

Sides of house salad and asparagus were great, very fresh and appropriately simply prepared.

Overall for our first USA dinning experience we were impressed.
author: Captain C.

description:
Crab Restaurant is what it is, more like an overpriced Olive Garden.. 

Went there for my best friend's birthday in a group of 5. 

Wait time on friday night we went was 30 minutes, but actually 40-45 mins because the host told us that the guests that were seated on our table had the check but kept on chatting. The waiting area was right next to where the busboys cut the bread. One busboy was really friendly and offered a plate of bread and butter to snack on. I also observed another guy who was pretty clumsy and dropped the butter plate off its mantel, but he cleaned well, and disposed the contaminated butter away, so kudos.

Its a gorgeous place, I cannot lie, but lacks romance in service and in the food. ESPECIALLY the food. It might have been what we ordered itself, recommend ordering the seafood dinners instead of pastas and sandwiches. 

Ordered the calamari platter, which was really good. There was alot to go around the five of us, and had a buttery, flaky taste. 
Most of my friends ordered shrimp alfredos, chicken fettuccine; I had a crab sandwich. Two of my friends were planning to share a crab sandwich as well, but was easily dissatisfied when it came out.. the sandwich looked so much smaller than what was shown in the menubook. My friend also pointed out that "I had more fries than her"....I felt whatever about it, and souped up my sandwich with a squeeze of lemon and some ketchup.
The chicken fettuccine was a little dry, and was sitting in oil, according to my friend.

It took a while for our waiter to come by with our check although we notified him that we were in a hurry. My waiter looked like a hipster Mario, not Luigi. I liked his hair though. 

It was my first time here. Next time, I know now to order fresh seafood such as the crab or shrimp, or just get some clam chowda.
author: IC C.

description: Can't beat the location & service, and all of the buzz from tourists in the house.  Went all out yesterday & ordered half crab w my friend ordering the salmon.  I wouldn't give the food an A plus but definitely a solid B.  the homemade ice cream for dessert was excellent, and again, you can't beat the view & solid service.  Thank you. I'll be back.
author: Leslie R.

description: This place is awesome! It's right off Pier 39. We went there because it's just convenient and righttt there..but not a bad choice. Food is pretty pricey but everything was good! we had the crab & spinach fondue (which they were NOT greedy with the crab at all), fried calamari, & the dungeous crab & shrimp platter. The platter was sooo good! Food came on a sizzing plate and was pretty fancy! We ate as we overlooked the pier Haha.  Food was quick and service was great...he came out every so often to ask if we were okay! Def recommend if you want a fancy place to eat crab!
author: Samantha B.

description: This place is busy, but what can you expect? It is in a beautiful location right on the bay! I want to get straight to the point about this place. I had the steak medallions and my fiance had the crab (obviously). We were both extremely satisfied with the meal and the experience (fireworks went off while we were eating supper). How amazing!  Four stars for a great experience!
author: Kristen R.

description:
The bulk of my points is for the ambiance and great view of the the Bay. The food was okay but in another location it would not be worth the price. I had a 3 course dinner for about $45. I started with Clam Chowder; it rich and creamy and had good flavor. My main course was  Pan Seared Sea Bass served with petite potatoes and asparagus. The flavors were there but I found it to be a bit overcooked. I loved the Siren By the Sea (malibu, capt. morgan's & meyers rums, orange & pineapple juice)

It's touristy but overall but if you know what you're getting into it can be a good experience
author: Savannah M.

description: Great piece of real estate. Fantastic view. That's where it ends. Really, really bad service, poor to mediocre food with high prices. Keep walking is my advice.
author: Jim S.

description: We ordered the whole dungeness crab for two, did not like it. Perhaps it's just that I am not a fan of this dish, but it was terrible.  The building is cool and the view is maybe the best on the whole wharf, but the food was extremely disappointing.  I felt it was extremely overpriced for what we were served.  It was easily the worst dinner we had during our visit.
author: Justin G.

description:
The restaurant is nice, and the views are gorgeous. The food however; was just okay. The crab chowder was salty (although, there was a very good amount of crab in it), the smoked salmon/crab/avocado crostini was bland. The actual crab itself was good. Do yourself a favor and just go for the crab! For the prices, you may expect to be more wow-ed as far as taste goes. But, you're paying for the service, the presentation, the views of course.

If you really want good fisherman's wharf food, I would head towards the stands and eat amongst the seagulls. If a nice restaurant experience is what you're after, then give this place a shot.
author: Sabrina T.

description: Decided to eat here while on vacation in the bay area.  The menu is a little pricey but from the looks of the place one could probably deduce that before going in.  My wife and I ordered a full crab and was not disappointed.  The crab was brought out on a huge platter and was cooked in some sort of garlic sauce that was basically coating the entire thing.  After a messy 30 minutes or so, we concluded our fight to get every ounce of meat out of the guy as possible.  I was definitely impressed with the food and our waiter (who I compared to a French Vin Diesel).  It was really one of the highlights of the trip.
author: Donald Y.

description: Slow service gets 3 stars because I'm feeling generous. But shrimp cocktail that has not been properly deveined, that's a health hazard. Go for cocktails and the view. Skip the food unless you like being served feces.
author: Kat S.

description: When was the last time you spent $100 and you were treated miserably? It happened to me tonight at Franciscan Crab Restaurant. Upon settling the bill, my card got declined and this is where the true character of the place and people running it came to life. Upon explaining I need to get back to my hotel (5min away) and get another card,  the manager, Jose, started to act like he was possessed by the devil: "we need to collect the money"; " you came to our restaurant, we did not invite you here!!!" and so on. I showed them my hotel card - "this does not mean anything to me = we need to collect the payment". I finally left them my ID and got back to the hotel, got another card and returned to  settle the bill. Jose nver apologized for his rude behaviour and he also made a demonstration of pride by making me wait for a few more minutes while he was pretending to vacuum the floor. My take-out of the night: nice views, average food, service so and so, terrible manager - he does not know anything about hospitality and humanity - he should be doing something else. I spent $100 to be humiliated - thank you Franciscan Crab Restaurant!!
author: Gabriel P.

description:
Great service, delicious dining and world class beauty on the bay ! 
Have hosted  two large parties at the Franciscan
with EASE, counting on their great reputation and yes they came through with smiles and a good time was had by all!!

A wonderful place to celebrate!!!
This company has been hosting for years and MAKES it EASY,  one  package includes tax, gratuities... Voila , a party you can count on !
The Italiano way ....molto viva bella.

Such relief for me, already had my years of  owning/operating  a resort and hosting major conferences/ retreats!!
author: MaryAnn W.

description:
I have been here three times mainly for the view.  The Pier 39 Crab House gives you more food and better.  I have given it a two star because we first ordered claim chowder and there were very little clams, mainly potatoes.   We ordered Lots of Crab and the portion was so much less then the one at Pier 39.   We also ordered crab cakes, two small cakes two bites each cake $16, what a rip off.   In addition the crab was hot outside and inside cold.   I asked him if it was fresh and he said yes but I really wonder..  They just poured sauce over the crab instead of having it cooked with it.
Overall just will not go back.    This was Valentines day also and my wife said never again..
author: Craig C.

description:
If you can fight your way through the hoards of tourists around Fisherman's Warf, than the Franciscan is a great place to eat. We ordered the fried calamari (must have at any seafood place) for an appetizer and clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl (must have at any San Francisco restaurant). Both were delicious and full of flavor!

3/5 stars just because of the location. It's a non-touristy restaurant in a huge touristy area.

Tip: ask to get seated at the window! It's a beautiful view of the bay!
author: Kevin R.

description:
The view is gorgeous, the restaurant is light and airy, all the staff were unbelievably professional and attentive,  but unfortunately the food was just OK. 

The crab chowders that my friends ordered looked amazing in the menu, but came out lukewarm and runny, not very chowder-like. Neither of them finished. We ordered a combo roasted seafood platter of shrimp, mussels, and crab for the table. The crab legs were surprisingly meaty, but the shrimp was bland and the mussels were dry. Disappointing because there was an abundance of mussels compared to shrimp and crab. Luckily, 2 out of 4 of us ordered from the prix fixe menu, which was reasonably priced and pretty tasty! 

The prix fixe menu is only $20, and you get a choice of salad or soup, about 5 or 6 different entree options, and ice cream for dessert. Pretty good seafood deal! We ordered the crab enchiladas (which looked and tasted as yummy as it did in the menu) and the spicy prawns pasta (just a little kick of spiciness and a lot of prawns). Neither one of us were disappointed, and there ended up being enough to share with everyone (the enchiladas were huge)!

A cool thing about the restaurant is that there are binoculars next to each window-side table, and Alcatraz is in unobstructed view.

Also, don't forget to get your parking ticket validated if you parked at the lot next to the restaurant!
author: Julia K.

description:
Visited this place on a Sunday during lunch.  We were seated right away and didn't have to wait.  We were seated right next to window which had a great view of Alcatraz, bay, etc.  They even have binoculars for you to use, although, I was weary to use as it is full of germs!!! :)

The staff was very attentive.  We ordered crab cakes, 2 bowls of clam chowder, house salad, clam linguine & alfredo fettucine.  Everything was delicious.  Take note the bill came out to $90+.  Pretty expensive for lunch. Would I come back again, absolutely!
author: Monica V.

description:
Not only was there not a bad view in the entire restaurant, the food and the service provided by our server Laura was superb.

Unlike other Fisherman's Wharf restaurants this is not a tourist trap. And as a local who avoids the area, I would go here again. There are also plenty of choices for non seafood eaters like my friend who had the short ribs. As for me, I was thrilled with the sizzling platter of mussels and shrimp.
author: Katy C.

description: We just went here for the first time and it was really delicious. The only criticism I have is that we didn't get much crab in our Double Shrimp, Double Crab order.. or it may have been it was so delicious I just wanted more!
author: Linda B.

description:
A group of relatives and myself were visiting the Bay area, and one of them had heard good news about this place.  Looking at the menu, it was going to be a pricey affair, but how many times were we going to San Francisco as tourists?  So, we caught them as they just opened and were nice enough to seat us even though we didn't have a reservation (there were 10 of us, too).

The menu is mostly crab and fish related, understandably, but most of us didn't really like seafood to be honest.  Luckily, they had other options on the menu for us. The chicken alfredo I got was alright but very bland without any of the creamy goodness that you are supposed to get with alfredo sauce.  A cousin of mine ordered a whole crab, and he loved it.  This was no cheap crab place where you get the drawn butter on the side either, but rather the butter is cooked on the same skillet they bring it to you on.  They bring you sliced sourdough bread a couple of times as you wish, and the waiters are great about water refills.

The desserts are great looking, but only a handful of us had it.  They have a deal where you pay $25 for a soup choice, a medium-sized entree, and a cup of their custard ice cream, which was a deal a few of them went in on.  The ice cream is really good from what I heard.  They have a separate bar seating area which has around 6 cocktails, 5 draft beers, and 4 specialty foreign bottled beers, and good sized wine list (pause for the $10 corking service for wine........ok).  Overall, I could've found something that tasted better, but it was a nice restaurant with a nice view.
author: Nathan S.

description:
Let me start by saying I'm giving a 2 because myself and my friend both got food posioning.

We began with a bottle of Cloudy Bay, Sauvignon Blanco 2009 (excellent choice). The waiter wasn't good at pouring wine, it splashed everywhere. We had to refill my own glasses. The calamari was so greasy, I could barely eat it. When mentioned it to the waiter he mumbled something then walked away. The octopus was decent, great beans with cilantro. Can't remember the name of my entree but I had Halibut. The brocolini was AAAAAmazing!

Had a spider on our table, waiter wiped off the bug guts.
Bus boy came by, broke a plate with our wine bottle.

(Second time visiting, not impressed) I won't be going back, unless I'm just ordering a cocktail.
author: Jenna P.

description: This is the ideal tourist spot for a solid meal. A lot of the food on Pier 39 is quick prep food that is over priced. This place has fresh seafood that is prepared well. Lots of butter so be ready. I would definitely come here again!
author: Shawn T.

description:
I really wish I read the reviews before I trekked over. Labor day weekend... I should've known that the entire world would be at the pier/wharf area. Because our fav wharf spot had a 45 minute wait... and we couldn't wait... we decided to roam looking for a spot to go to. 

We walked over to Franciscan and stood at the front trying to decide if we should go in. A lady walked out and we asked what she thought and she said the food was fantastic. It was late.. and we decided, what the hell. Let's try it.

Upon walking in, we were immediately seated down. The view is great especially with the sun setting. We went for the $30 pre fixe menu... of clam chowder, petite filet minion and frozen custard. We were given bread and a tiny cube of butter. I anticipated some warm soft bread... oh no! It was rock hard. I felt like a dog gnawing on a rawhide. It hurt so bad. I had to wait for my clam chowder soup to come out. However, I felt the soup tasted more of a potato soup??! It was super starchy and had a dallop of clams. The meal came out and I felt it was suuuuper salty. I couldn't even finish my meal, we had to take it to go. I'll give it up to the frozen custard though. It was a hefty size... a little too much... but if you were to order it for $6 off the menu, you receive a decent amount.

I wouldn't return.... the customer service was blah. I didn't feel they attended to our needs much and were slow. And the food wasn't anything memorable. However, the view is great.. AND you get 3 hours free parking if you dine here. Wish I knew that before we paid else where!
author: Deanna G.

description: Great view, phenomenal food, excellent service. Loved the double shrimp double crab entree for two! Recommend the Siren of the Sea cocktail. Would definitely come back. Highly recommend
author: Jane L.

description: If you're looking for chain restaurant service at five star pricing, this is the place for you.  If you just finished up the all american guided family tour of San Francisco and want to take the kids out for their first crab dinner and you're excited to take a selfie with the crab, this is the place for you.  If you want anything close to a fine dining experience, this is not the place.  I found this place on OpenTable and planned a romantic evening for two. I made a reservation online and asked for a table for two by a window at 7PM.  When we got there, they didn't set aside a reserved table, so there is no point in reserving a table. The ambience is akin to a 1950s diner replica.  The salads were served in a five star fashion - on a plate with a monstrous rim which would look wonderful with a carefully crafted salad of fresh greens.  But when piled with ice berg lettuce for all but one salad type, it's just not good.  And that other salad?  That's just a giant plate of arugula and a few spots of blue cheese and avocado hiding in there somewhere.  Crab should be prepared without excess oils to savor the flavor of the crab.  I like to "LIGHTLY" dip the crab into a succulent butter with garlic and lemon.  But here, the crab is saturated in butter or oil, or perhaps it's both.  Prepare to be messy and greasy.
author: Keith B.

description: The food was excellent with fresh unique ingredients.  We tried the Prix Fixe dinner for $29.95 that offered at least 5 choices of entrees.  The view and ambiance was also excellent.
