The only negative was our waitress who was inattentive and borderline rude.  We asked for lemon for our water three times.  We also had to wait for our check and for her to return to our table to take the payment.  The unfortunate part was the fact that our neighboring table was receiving superb service from a male waiter.
author: Donna D.

description: Great view.  Food ?   The crab cake ap was not inspiring and a little oily   Ok but overrated it is
author: Nick D.

description:
WONDERFUL! 

Excellent services, out-of-this-word seafood, and a great view/atmosphere. We will definitely be going here again. Everything we were looking for in a San Fran seafood experience.
author: Lia K.

description: We came here with my girlfriend in the middle of the week, we order delicious carpaccio, crab fondue, a great bottle of wine, crab chowder soup and a crab trait for two. The food was amazing and the service is super fast. This place definitely is worthy of your attention and money. Come here and enjoy a great food and beautiful view!
author: Vic H.

description: First off, the service was horrible.  The restaurant was not busy when they seated us and it took them about 5-10 minutes to take our drink order.  It then took them about another 5-10 minutes to come back with our drinks and take our food order.  The food was not fresh, it was not worth half of what we paid.  They never came back to ask if I wanted a refill on my drink or my water.  Worse restaurant we have been to in a long time.  I would not recommend it and I would never go back there again.
author: Antonia D.

description: Food and service was great! Our server was very nice. We had a great view outside on the bay. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars was because the women's bathroom was dirty.
author: Rachel R.

description:
My sister, her husband and I made a reservation for last Saturday night  and arrived early (5:15 reservation and 4:50 or so arrival).  We were seated right away and got a window table as requested.  Binoculars were a great addition to our table!   Great start, but didn't continue. Service to get our drink order was slow and we felt ignored.  Service the rest of the time followed the same course.  It wasn't awful, but we felt that given the hype, location, prices etc. it should have been spot on.

Our gripe here is that we think the Franciscan seems to portray itself as a fine dining restaurant but lacks in the execution to do so in our observation.  Butter knives should be on the table.  If a salad is ordered in addition to an entree, a salad fork should be supplied.  The servers who bring the drinks and food should KNOW who gets what drink and what food.  It is SO, SO, SO ridiculous in a nicer restaurant that the server should stand at the table and ask who has what.  Get it together ahead of time, come up to us and put the food and drinks down just as we have ordered them and don't disrupt our time out together.  This should not be an issue as so many other restaurants deliever food and drinks to a table without interuption.

We felt that our waitor should have checked on us a few minutes after we recieved our entrees.  He was no where to be found.  We grabbed a server and asked him to bring me tartar sauce as requested when I ordered.  A few minutes later our server passed by, NOT to check on us, but we caught him to get the tartar which the server didn't bring.  5 minutes is enough time for your shrimp to cool off before you eat them.

Come for the view which is incredible.  Ambience is incredible too.  Food is good, not great,  but worthy.  The Franciscan just has to take it up to the next level. 






















All in all we feel that we would come back to the Franciscan for the views which are incredible, but only if they take it back to what it used to be when our grandfather took us here many years ago and it was magical.  The customer felt special and the experience was incredible.  Service was amazing.  Please get it together again.
author: Janie H.

description:
Really surprised with the very nice service. View was fantastic of the Bay and Alcatraz. Food was good too with some unique dishes like the black linguine made from octopus dye to all the traditional menu items that one would expect from Fisherman's Wharf. As a native of SF, returning for a visit, I would continue to take out of town guests here to 
meet their expectations of a San Francisco dining and ambiance experience. Pricey but worth it.
author: Rachael G.

description: Best crab...great ambiance & view of the bay. Will definitely go back. Menu was very nice & had a lot of wonderful options. From the appetizers to dinner & drinks, well worth the money spent. We ate like kings
author: Kimie T.

description: I made a reservation, arrived on time, watched as people without a reservation were seated before me. When seated, I was placed at a table in the bar not in the restaurant all because I'm a single diner. They could not find my reservation even though I spelled my name three times on the phone. I waited for another twenty minutes for service and the left after I had only been served water by the bus boy. Very poor especially since the restaurant was at most half full.
author: Fr Kevin K.

description:
Five stars for their wine list... JUST the wine list. Holy hell! A bottle of Veuve Clicquot for $59... Cakebread Chard for $59 as well. Are you freaking kidding me? 

We didn't eat here- so I can't rate the food. But for the love of god- a bottle of Ferrari Carano is only $49!!!! 

This was a great spot to escape Fisherman's Wharf and get our drink on. Sit on the balcony during a gorgeous day and imbibe! 

Seriously, the wine list is so rockin' I took a picture of it... check it out.
author: Jory S.

description:
5 stars for our first visit. We got the filet mignon...medium rare... and the seafood combo with mussels, shrimp, and crab i believe. That filet mignon literally melted in my mouth....it was soooooo good and so flavorful! i loved the sauce that came with the seafood.....everything was to die for lol.

3 stars for the second visit. We knew we didnt want to mess with a good thing, so we simply replicated our previous order and added in The crab chowder. The chowder was amazing, but the second time around, the combo was just ok and the steak was suprisingly tough and flavorless! That was an unpleaseant surprise for sure! $40 for a crappy steak did not leave me a very happy camper!

So that averages out to 4 stars! Lol
author: MissusBugatti J.

description:
I love my out-of-town friends and family so much that I will sacrifice hanging out around Fisherman's Wharf just to be with them. As we were walking west along the wharf (jeez, that's a lot of W's), one of the small children decided she didn't feel like walking any further and since we were all looking to eat, we just happened to be right at FCR's doorstep. "How about here?" I suggested.

The sourdough bread is decent, the clam chowder above average (I warned my company of the perils of consuming crappy Boudin chowder, too), the dungeness crab sammie was decent, as was the crab enchiladas. The fries were nice and crispy, the calamari was whatevers, but the broccolini was probably the best thing I ate there.

Superb service, AND they have one of those cool Dyson hand dryers in the restroom. 3.5 stars, really--I didn't want to give the impression it was a 4.
author: Maximillian M.

description: We visited San Francisco in Aug 2012 and sat on the patio enjoying the view of Alcatraz and the Fisherman's Wharf area.  They have little heaters above the tables for those days when there is a chill in the air from the fog.  We immensely enjoyed the crab fondue and the bread as well as some fruity and quite tasty mixed beverages, I could definitely go for some more of that right now!  I will surely go there again on future visits!  Can't wait to go back!!
author: LaWanda W.

description: This place is horrible! Was given 20 minutes for wait time but waited 40 minutes instead. Finally sat down and was at the table for 10 minutes with nobody even greeting us. We looked at a server and they gave us the "one minute" finger. Needless to say we walked out and went to a different restaurant!
author: Bethany G.

description: Too commercialized and over priced. Snooty manager. Nice looking restaurant tho.be back maybe.
author: Jorydude r.

description:
San Francisco was the most Northern point on a 3 week road trip that I recently went on with my boyfriend.  We stopped in various places in the Southwest and West coast states and each location we made sure to do something extremely touristy or eat something that we would never have a chance to do back in Austin, Texas.

We picked the Franciscan to do both and we ate as much as we could as well as had amazing views and decor to complete the experience.  The Franciscan is something straight out of either a mobster flick or a late 80's date movie.  The service was upscale and the food was gourmet as well as different than any other seafood restaurant I've experience on the east coast or the rare gems in Austin.

We stared off with smoked salmon carpaccio that was served with capers, avocado and burrata drizzled with extra virgin olive oil and sea salt.  Followed by each enjoying a house salad which was a large bed of romaine wedge and fantastic pumpkin seeds for an added crunch just to name a simple ingredient in the salad.  For the main course we enjoyed 3 pounds of whole roasted dungeness crab that is first sauteed in chopped garlic, butter, olive oil and anchovies then sprinkled with sea salt and black pepper.  We paired our seafood dinner with a nice California prosecco that was really light for what we were eating.
author: Allie S K.

description:
Received a very genuine letter from manager Brandy to appreciate the comments. She also advised us to bring out the food problems (i.e., too salty) on the spot so they can correct it.

I guess we should have done that but usually we just feel most of the restaurants will not do much even if we do so. It appears that this place really do care about customers. Since Brandy's letter is so nice, we will certainly give the place another try if we happen to be in the neighborhood in the future.
author: Chun L.

description: I had a great night here dining with a co-worker.  The views are amazing, especially if you dine around sunset on a clear night (which we did).  We both ordered from the $29.95 Prix Fixe menu and both enjoyed the clam chowder.  I had the crab legs, a decently sized portion for the price.  The waitress was excellent.  My only complaint was that when the food arrived at our table it wasn't hot, but kind of lukewarm, but everything was tasty.  If you're at the Wharf it's not a bad choice for a tourist-trap restaurant.
author: Kevin T.

description:
Came here for our last night in San Francisco.  I ordered the double mussels and double crab.  Both were good but I wasn't such a big fan of the garlic sauce smothered all over the crab.  Still, I finished all the crab.  Mom got the clam chowder in a bread bowl.  I was originally going to order that but when I read the description, it said it contained thyme and I really hate thyme in my clam chowder.  Mom seemed to like the chowder so I tasted it and what do ya know! no thyme.  Instead it tasted as if it contained bacon and maybe cheese?  Good, but definitely not authentic New England clam chowder.  Anyway, our Irish waiter was very nice and attentive and even though we were there past closing, we weren't rushed and neither were the people at the other tables.  
Each table looking over the water gets its own pair of binoculars which is a nice touch.  If you eat here during the day, you will have a nice view of Alcatraz. 
Each table also gets bread to munch on while waiting for your meal, but it was cold and not very appealing.  
We ended up spending about $80 just for the two of us.  
Meal was ok but not too sure if I'd ever go back.
author: Anastasia E.

description: Menu food photos were very misleading as portions were small. We ordered the half crab, full order shrimp, crab chowder etc. Unfortunately, food was not photo worthy to post......
author: Brad D.

description: For such a busy place, in such a touristy area, we didnt expect such wonderful service, food, and ambiance. It was all that. The food was delicious, the view was just what we wanted, and the staff was the best part, The hostess, the waiter, and the servers gave us the best dining experience we've ever had. Worth the luxury prices.
author: Scott L.

description: Great service and crab was very good - though out of season so from portland - but nothing they can do about that.  Great atmosphere and very cool place to eat facing Alcatraz!
author: Kevin W.

description:
You get what you pay for! Excellent view, polite and attentive service, yummy food. The calamari was a bit greasy, as was the brocco-whatever side, but the mashed potatoes were excellent. I loved the crab sandwich. The crabmeat and avocado combo is oh oh oh soooo smooth. 
Is it a little touristy? Yes.. But there's nothing near pier 39 that's not touristy, so just remember where you are, and adjust your expectations accordingly, people! Take your visitor friends here, they will be satisfied.
author: Es L.

description: Excellent service and spectacular view of Alcatraz!  Great place to bring guests and entertain.
author: Virginia C.

description:
My boyfriend and I were planning on heading to Sausalito, but we arrived to the SF Pier too late and the next ferry out wouldn't give us enough time to get ready for dinner.  We decided to eat at the pier and take the bay cruise instead.  The day turned out perfectly!  

The place looked pretty dumpy from the outside, but hey, if the food is good, I could care less!  But once you go up the stairs and walk in, the restaurant is actually really nice inside.  They have a great bar area with plenty of stools.  The restaurant is large and full with plenty of booths, tables, and these half booths where both people can face the water.  What a great idea!   All of those were taken so we were seated in a booth with a great view of the water.  

Every single appetizer, entrée, and dessert has a picture that accompanies the description.  Awesome!  I love that.  Everything looked delicious.  We decided on the following:

Crab Chowder- very good

Crab Louie- AMAZING.  I got this as a 'starter' but it could really be your meal.  A hearty portion of crab is served on top of greens.  It comes with asparagus, olives, eggs, and other goodness.  Everything is topped with a thousand island type of dressing.  My description isn't very good, but trust me, you have to try this.  

Sea bass in a mild thai curry broth- This was excellent.  The curry broth sounds a little weird, but it fantastic with the fish

Salmon oven poached in olive oil- My salmon was so juicy and tender.  YUM!  The olive oil was great, but I wish I tried something different like the spicy tomato conserva.  All of the fish dishes come with roasted heirloom potatoes, squash, and olives.  Since mine was in olive oil, it didn't keep my potatoes very moist like my boyfriend's dish.

Overall, I would give Franciscan 3.75 stars.
author: Vivian W.

description:
Good food, good view, friendly staff. Price was reasonable. If you don't want to spend too much money and still want crab, tray the Crab Enchilada. That thing was massive and FILLED with crab meat. very good price too. 

Only thing that was a turn off was the copious amount of bird crap outside the window and all over the building. But it's situated by the ocean, it was expected. 

Cheers, 
-Herbal Tea
author: H T.

description: If you've ever had the crab chowder at Legal Sea Foods, you will STRONGLY DISLIKE the yucky stuff they call "crab chowder" here.  It was so bland and horrible that I sent it back. They brought me their clam chowder, and that soup was even worse....just a bowl of thick, floury clam water.  My husband had the seafood enchilada.  It was so full of onions, he didn't like it.  The view is beautiful, the service very good....but the food is not!
author: suzy e.

description: Come here for the view  (binoculars chained to the window-facing tables), excellent service and old-style ambiance.  It has a 1940s Italian feel to it.  We came about 4pm on a Tuesday so not at all crowded. The food itself was so-so. My fish was overcooked and the sauce was bland.  I think the crab is the thing to get, and would come back again for crab, view, and a cocktail.  The server gave me a map and SF guide when he saw me reading my poor quality rental car map. They were very nice to my children and made me feel quite welcome.  A nice spot even for locals wanting to show a nice view of Fisheman's Wharf to out of town guests.  More of a bar and crab type place but worth a visit.
author: Kara T.

description:
GREAT view!

I love their menu, there are so much to chose from. Most of it has pictures, which was super helpful.

I had the Seafood Cioppino as a starter, it was huge. Didn't even finish half of it, but it tasted just as good the day after. It was a bit too hot for me to fully enjoy it, but the taste was amazing.

Their filet mignon was actually disappointing, which I didn't expect from this place. The surface was burnt and it was far from medium - which was what I asked for.

My hubby had clam chowder, it was just okay. His crab sandwich was good though, although it was smaller than what the picture showed.

An okay place, nothing to rave about. The location and decor is perfect, but I must admit I expected more from this place.
author: Haley S.

description: I have been here twice and it is a great place! Good food, good service, and a really nice atmosphere! The servers are all very nice, and the view is fantastic! The food is worth the value, and it is also a great place to go just for drinks, or coffee and dessert!
author: Julee E.

description:
The fresh seafood is wonderful! i would recommend to everyone!
This, with the amazing view (large windows, open deck, old hollywood style ambiance) is a must-do, at least once during your stay in SF.  The service was great, as well - very friendly staff!
I wasn't a fan of the crab enchiladas.  I chose this entree since there were a lot of great reviews of this dish on yelp, but I would prefer the fresh, seafood taste over a sauteed, saucey prepared meal.  i thought some of the components of the sauce overpowered the taste of the seafood.
other than this minor detail, my family and i had a wonderful dining experience!

oh yea, for a party of 7 (sharing one big appetizer of fresh seafood, each person ordering an entree, and 3 bottles of wine), i spend $350+ dollars. 
very expensive for me, but it was father's day and my mom's bday...
author: The Fuzzies S.

description: Dropped in for a drink. Nice retro architecture, neat photos on the walls, and cool views. It's a pretty face. Unfortunately that's about it. The customer service was indifferent, almost chilly. We felt invisible. Uninteresting and tremendously overpriced drinks. Leaving aside the looks, which merit a star, our brief visit was a vaguely insulting waste of time and money. Won't return. Added a second star for the kind customer-focused reply to complaint here on yelp.
author: tegen d.

description: Absolutely wonderful! View was spectacular.   Atmosphere was old Hollywood.  Salad one of the best I ever had. Excellent service. Go!!!!
author: Angela C.

description:
Great service.  They have a computer that takes your order.  In three minutes you have your drink.  Then the food comes just as fast.  Why every restaurant does not have the handheld computer amazes me.  

Great view and fresh crab.  Their drinks use fresh juice.
author: Doug K.

description: I don't mind paying some more for decent food and ambience, but this place is what my dad would have called a "clip joint". Sky high prices on mediocre food and portions way too small.   Trading on the location of Fishermans Wharf to inflate prices while providing very little for the customers dollar. It would never survive in a normal marketplace where customers expect value for the money. Watch out for the $12.50 bloody marys just for starters!
author: Mary C.

description:
We happened to be in SF for a day and asked our concierge where a good seafood place would be. He named a couple places, but the two named were Italian based while Fisherman's was more American-esqe seafood.

Driving for more than ten hours from LA to San Francisco and getting lost is not fun, and when you're hungry, that annoyed and aggravated feeling is so not good. 

We got a seat overlooking the bay and Alcatraz, which I thought was really nice, and was promptly greeted by the servers assistant then following the server. We ordered the combo crab/mussel, combo crab/mussel/shrimp, crab enchilada, and the 3 pound crab.

OMG so good. That garlic sauce of theirs, now I know why it is notorious! It's so delicious I kept sucking all my fingers until the very end with how good that sauce was. The crab, the star, was so tender, succulent, and sweet; it was a drug, I couldn't stop eating it! The mussels were tender; the sauce for dipping however was too salty and looked like someone put too much cilantro. The crab enchilada, Mexican with an elevated taste of dungeness crab, perfecto!

Next time I come back, first thing on the itinerary is Fisherman's Wharf!
author: Min K.

description: The Franciscan isn't all that great. I have gotten the whole crab sauteed in garlic, which was fine, but not good enough. I have also tried the spicy shrimp pasta, which to me was really gross. It was too sweet!! (the name should be changed). I stopped going after the third time.
author: Debbie J.

description:
If you want some crab, this place ain't drab!
A 'Crab Sandwich' did I grab, 
and honestly, it was FAB!

I had a family friend in for the day, and I was really excited to have a catch-up-lunch. I scoured Yelp for something exciting, but wasn't able to put my finger on anything specifically. After meeting up outside the Gap in Fisherman's Wharf, this place stood out as the closest and classiest looking joint.

Walking in, it's like a step back into the old San Francisco Hollywood Glam. The place is clean and well decorated. It has a really cool 'vintage' vibe.  The views are amazing, of Alcatraz and the bay. Lucky for me, they seated us in a great spot to take in the whole scenery. Our server and the support service was very friendly and attentive. In fact, my friend commented on how nice it was to have "real" service vs. that lazy, borderline-rude hipster shit you get elsewhere. 

I didn't try my friend's meal, but my crab melt was delicious! It also came with some amazing fries! About the menu: it's HUGE. And the images don't do the dishes justice at all! The portions are much larger than pictured, making the price point just right for this sort of experience.
author: Andrew C.

description:
I recently went for the first time and really enjoyed myself. Hard to believe I've lived here my entire life without a visit. I guess I've got "Fisherman's Wharf is for tourists" stuck in my head. Too bad because I've missed a gem for so long. 

We were celebrating a birthday, the staff were helpful, even when we brought our own cake in for the birthday girl they put it in the kitchen, carried it out with candles (which I'd forgotten), and then took it back to cut and bring the slices back to us. Wonderful service.  

The food was delicious! I enjoyed their expanded pre fixe dinner for a reasonable price with the perfect amount of savory food. Everyone at our table really enjoyed their dinner and the oysters. 

It's nice to know that even in the heart of a touristy area the Franciscan is still serving wonderfully San Francisco food for locals and visitors alike! Also as a local with 3 free hours of validate parking, it's like getting a golden ticket. 

I won't hesitate to go back or suggest it to another local or an out of town visitor. Oh and the view is to die for, sunsets are special so take your sweetie. :)
author: Jackie W.

description:
I wasnt impressed. But then again, I dont think I like these kind of places very much. 

The crab was fine, but not meaty enough. I think Rusty Pelican in Newport Beach has spoiled me with the HUGE crab legs they serve. 

Service was very slow and our other dishes were standard quality. 

There wasnt anything memorable for me about this place.

2.5 stars is my rating.
author: Robert H.

description: Breathtaking view and delicious food! What else to add? Perfect restaurant!
author: Lora D.

description: First they lost our reservations, so we had to stand awkwardly for a 1/2 hour in a crowded area. Crab Fondue was good and my wife loved her Siren of the Sea drink. My Crab Chowder was lukewarm and not very good. I got the Crab Alfredo which was nothing special and I was going to take more than half of it with me, but the busboys evidently threw out my entree instead of getting it to go like we asked. The waitress apologized but refused to rectify it, instead brought my a dessert that I had already told her I din't want. So it was $20 for mediocre Alfredo that the then threw half of away and told me better luck next time. My wife got the Crab Enchiladas which she did like. It has a nice atmosphere and great views.
author: Matthew K.

description:
Omgosh! This place was sooo good. The first time we went here was a couple years back, we ordered the caesar salad, some mash potatoes, and fries just for little side dishes to share. So yummy! The salad was on a wedge that they grilled for a couple seconds which I loved! The fries were nice and crispy and warm with just a little sea salt delish! The mash potatoes were nice and creamy and had little bits of garlic throughout!

For the main course we ordered the crab platter which was 100 bucks but it was soooo much crab and was covered in a scrumptous garlic. . . .I don't even know! Just soooo good, we used the bread to sop up all of the left over sauce from the crab. Ohhh I'm drooling just thinking about it! There was plenty of crab to go around for the three of us, we almost couldn't finish all of it there was so much. We came here a second time bringing my uncle and his two kids so that there was five of us and got the same exact side dishes and crab platter and there was still soo much crab to go around. You could tell the dungenous crab was nice and fresh too.

The service was good for how busy the night was. I mean it was packed! And it was only a wednesday night! Our waitress was friendly and our food and drinks all came out in an appropriate time. I definitely think that anyone who had a bad experience here should try it again because just like you, restaurants have off days.
author: Becca G.

description:
The ambiance is very deceptive here.  Let's do this in order...

1.) The atmosphere: Can either be dressed up or dressed down...very commercial and somewhat plastic.  The plates were shaped strangely and took up most of the table space.  They were long and rectangular...and the silverware was very tacky!  

2.) The menu: One word explains the menu...excessive!  They should spend less money on pretty, overwhelming menus and more on fresh seafood!  There were about 30 pages to the menu.  It was like reading a novel.  The first page gives the items on the menu, but all of the following pages were pictures..."Where's the crab?  Oh, it's on page 26!"...ridiculous!

3.) The service: Pretty decent...they kept the bread coming...mostly cuz my dad kept eating all of it!

4.) Finally...the food:  Old frozen crab!  Fresh crab is tender and comes right out of the shell in one piece when you crack the shell.  Frozen crab falls apart and shreds...this crab did the latter!  The shrimp was okay, but only because it was soaked in melted butter and garlic.  The veggies that came with my entree were oversalted and mushy...The crab chowder is starchy and doesn't have much crab in it at all!  

People would think that they would get fresh seafood at a restaurant that is located right on the water, but sadly, that is not the case with the Franciscan.  If you want fresh seafood, you may have to travel to Joe's Crab Shack in Sacramento...or just make it yourself.  Don't waste your money or your time...you may leave full, but mostly angry that you spent $100+ for old frozen crab!
author: Rebecca M.

description: Me and my partner went there today. The service was awful and so was the food. It came late btw and there was no taste in it at  all. I ordered the halibut and it was a 35 dollar dish. Not worth it. There was no flavor and the portion was small. For 35 dollars I expect a little more. Like presentable and tasty food. Our server was late in giving our drinks and didn't give water at all let alone ask for it. Won't go again. This place is a minus for me.
author: Ronald S.

description:
Soooooo yummy!!  My husband and I took our families here before our wedding for a casual "rehearsal" dinner, since we all love seafood, and this location happened to be convenient to where were were prior to dinner.  

Atmosphere: casual, clean
View: of the water
Food: OMG!!

We ordered family style:

salami platter
calamari
steamer clams
crab feast
steak
house salad
bleu cheese salad
crab enchiladas
shrimp cocktail

Stand out dishes: We all LOVED the calamari and steamer clams, which were tender, and tasty.  the crab feast was incredibly well seasoned and yummy, though some thought it was a little salty.  the house salad was really yummy, with extremely sweet grape tomatoes.

My husband and I were skeptical, since this is a very touristy restaurant, but the food was outstanding and the service was excellent (and they didn't even know we were a wedding party). We are locals and will be back to try the mussels.

Overall, wonderful experience.  and who else can say they got to wear crab bibs at their rehearsal dinner?
author: Grace L.

description:
It's true I had to be tour guide. As I explained to my boyfriend comes with living in the bay area. I digress.

We chose this place because it was a great view. The food was great. I had the crab fondue which was pretty good, I didn't like the bread choice that the meal came with. Easily fixed with the bread basket. My out of town friends had the crab, the flavor in the meat was quite deleticable. The boyfriend had shrimp and it was very good. I will say if your on a diet avoid this drawn butter covered place!
author: Desiree Y.

description:
In February of 2009, I took my friend to her first San Franciscan restaurant. We could not have been more happier.  Augustine was our waiter. He was fabulous.  He made us feel welcomed, explained what we wanted to know about the wonderful foods, and was not pushy!!
The view is breathtaking. I'm from this area and my friend couldn't get over the wonderful people and buildings. 
You won't go wrong going to The Franciscan Crab Restaurant!!!
author: S.A. D.

description:
Dined here during Labor Day weekend 2011.
A 1940s style restaurant, with old world sensibilities.
Ate crab enchiladas and seafood (sizzling) platter.
The food was OK.; but, nothing special.
author: Gail F.

description: The restaurant is awesome. The decoration in side looks so pretty. At night you can see the fireworks. The bad thing is the waiting line, but it worths the wait.
author: Al G.

description:
If you are from San Francisco and have never been to Franciscan in Fisherman's Wharf, you are missing the boat.   The perfect evening includes such surprisingly great food,  a vibrant,fun environment (bright),, great service, a view to die for and may I say this again?   absolutely wonderful service.    Follow it up with a bag of taffy and candy cigarettes from the candy store,  an Irish coffee at Buena Vista and a drive down Lombard.    

This is a must for your friends from out of town.        .
author: kimberlyn u.

description:
The single point is for the ambiance and the view.  
Beautiful spot. lovely view - great decor and photos. 

The food though... and for the price, yuck.  It was terribly overpriced and incredibly disappointing.  Neither of us finished our meals - not because of the size of the portions, but because the just weren't particularly palatable. 

The pasta was a horrible, sticky consistency and the chowders were cool by the time they reached us.  I will say that the calimari wasn't bad - it wasn't anything to write home about, but it was the highlight of this meal. 

The service - horrific.   Our server was the worst ever.  We were obviously a distraction to his many conversations. We sat there for a ridiculously long time and though he kept glancing at us, he never would break away - eventually he did finally come back over to take our order, but he never checked back with us, he brought us someone else's drinks and then took them away, and we had to grab someone else to give our own drink order (incidently - terrible martinis), and a different person brought every course.  He wandered by on occasion, but he ignored us. By the time he showed back up with the check he had his, "time to tip me well" smile on... Yeah, right...  I know the job of a server isn't an easy one, especially on a busy night, but it shows if your heart isn't in it - this guy obviously wanted to be elsewhere.

I'd read that Sunset Magazine had recommended this restaurant, which is what guided us to this place and all of the star photographs as you walked up the stairs promised a fun time.  What we got was an evening of disappointment knowing that we could have chosen much better all around restaurant for our money. 
We don't mind paying good money for a good meal with good service, but this was easily our worst dining experience in S.F., and at the same time, our most expensive.
author: Katy W.

description: The food was ok, not worth the price. It has a great view. The shrimp and chips is baby salad shrimp that you have to get a spoon and eat because they are so small.
author: Patrick C.

description:
More like a 3.5. I take visitors to this restaurant so that they can get some of the "tourist" dining in Fisherman's Wharf without having to wade through the crowds over at Pier 39. 

The view and decor are appealing and the service is very good. I'd recommend coming for lunch to fully enjoy the view. One of the nights that I visited a fight broke out at the bar, so that kind of ruined the aforementioned ambiance... although it was hilarious. 

The crab fondue is a must have here. Make sure to save some of that free bread because you only get four crisps for about a cup of fondue. Large chunks of crab meat along with tender swiss chard.

The roasted crab is good, but I wouldn't say it's the best in the city or Fisherman's Wharf. 

The Seafood Cioppino was the my favorite dish. It's deceptively large, as  a "small" is not the same as a "cup" of soup. The tureens have a piece of bread and a few claws sticking out, so you would think that it isn't much food, but is more than enough for dinner on its' own. 

Overall, if you have guests in town or are in fact a visitor yourself, this is a nice place to come with free parking in the area.
author: Mike C.

description:
I came in with high hopes and a empty stomach and walked out completely and utterly UNIMPRESSED. This place is known for the view and i would hope the Seafood, but nothing was spectacular nor was there anything memorable about my experience. If it wasnt for my reciept or pictures, i may have erased my food journey almost as a lark. 

Crab Cakes -- NOW...i love crab cakes, but these were bland and hardly enjoyable. Served with a pickeled cucumber  side that tasted like a korean side dish.
Crab Fondue -- Where was the crab? Straight up cheese and spinach with very little crab served with 4 small pieces of baked bread. 
Seafood capaccio -- The best part of the meal because it was the only one that had flavor. The soup that bathed the little seafood confections was tasty.  For $20 it better.

2 Glasses of wine- Rhiesling and Sauvingnon Blanc pairs well with seafood. 
 
 Bill exceeded $80 for two
author: Kelly S.

description:
My parents took my sisters and me to the Wharf a number of times every year.  I was born here before 1950, so obviously the area was very different.  I have been to the Franciscan Crab Restaurant at least 7 times in the past two years.  Friends come from Oregon, and Florida; family members from NYC, and I bring them to this restaurant for lunch or dinner. The Franciscan is truly beautiful and has wonderful views of the bay.  The decor is ecclectic and colorful.  The ambiance is both friendly and sophisticated.  The service staff is amazing.  (Of course this may be affected by the attitudes of the guests. Certainly, this is reasonable.)
I LOVE the food!  The roasted mussels and crab are delicious.  Until I tried the cioppino here, I didn't enjoy it at any restaurant.  It was super flavorful and authentic.  The fish entrees may be a little pricey, but the preparations are fantastic, and if you know what fish to choose, you cannot go wrong.
I worked in a seafood restaurant in the 70's, and I am very particular because of the education I received while working there.  That, and the way my family used to purchase, cook, and eat seafood during the 50's and 60's lends even more specific preferences to my choices today.
Give it a shot.  If you are looking to have a good meal in a festive setting, the Franciscan is the place.  Next time, I'm trying the salumi platters!
author: janice s.

description: I wanted to eat fresh crab in San Francisco and my dad told me about this place. Not only was the crab amazing and exactly what I wanted, but the bread was delicious! We had a view of Alcatraz. The ambience is fun for families and for a date night. The wait staff was very friendly and helpful as well. I will definitely come back whenever I visit San Francisco again!
author: Lily P.

description: Food was AMAZING! We had the petite filet mignon with crab legs, came out perfectly. Service was top notch. My husband and I were out late and decided on this restaurant since it was still open. We were very happy to have picked this restaurant, surprised it didn't have more stars on yelp! Only draw back is that it is pricey, but you get what you pay for! If you are looking for a quality meal, romantic setting, and great service, this is the place.
author: Kelly G.

description: This place was ok. Food was good- but not great. Prices were reasonable for San Fran. Wait staff was attentive and friendly. Beautiful view of Alcatraz.
author: Charlene R.

description: I'm going to admit that I was not expecting much from this restaurant and was pleansantly surprised.  Due to it's location on Fisherman's Wharf, I expected it to be a tourist trap with weak food.  I'm glad I was wrong!  The fish I ordered (halibut + olive oil oven poached) off their menu where you pick the fish, and how it's cooked - was TO DIE FOR.  The fish was so well done.  Loved it.  The fondue appetizer was quite nice as well.  I would definitely recommend this place and will be going back!
author: Bettina S.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here because I was craving crab. We made reservations and only waited for about 10 minutes at the bar with a great glass of wine and a delicious long island. 
Between the two of us we ordered calamari, 6 oysters, a second glass of wine, and one whole crab to share and it was plenty and very inexpensive. It was delicious, we got a  beautiful sight of the water, and very enjoyable. I would def come back here.
author: Valerie G.

description:
The food and atmosphere were great. The sever was a little slow but we survived. We sat outside at sunset which was nice. Great location. 

The spicy prawn pasta was off the hook. The crab enchiladas were terrible. DO NOT GET THEM
author: Tony K.

description:
WOW is all I have to say.

This is how food should be prepared EVERYWHERE!!!!!!

The menu is "cookbook" style, so not only do you know how they prepare it but you can take notes and make it at home.

The have an array of appetizers, drinks, salads, main courses, and desserts.

I came with my bf (ex-now) and we enjoyed a wonderful meal and fantastic view of the ocean. It's in the heart of the Fishermans Wharf.

We both felt extremely satifisfied with the outcome of the experience but it was verrrrry pricey. The bill was about $125 for both of us and we didn't order a lot of food. Mostly shared a few items.

The only reason for 4 star and not 5...our server seemed annoyed the entire time. It was late...but we areeee still patrons. I think he was ready to go party or something....just seemed anxious.

I have been craving it since the day I tasted the deliciousness of every bite I took. 

If you don't like seafood....don't bother. It's so TABU to me when people who don't like seafood go eat Chicken or a Steak at a Seafood Restaurant.

I will return very shortly! Mmmmmmmmmm sounds so great right now!
author: Maronita I.

description: Sat at the bar around noon on a Tuesday.  Had the combo platter (crab, shrimp, mussels) for $40....it was huge, delicious, and worth every dime.  Had a mermrita (it was okay....too juicy and not enough tequila).  The recent remodel (not sure when), but since we were here years back is really nice.
author: Tammy D.

description: Took my Girlfriend here for Valentines day. Service was GREAT! Food was really good! Really great place for a romantic dinner or just a friends outing. Food is a little pricey, but well worth it. This place is highly recommended.
author: Paul M.

description: Good food and great service.  Crab was prepared well and tasted amazing.
author: Mehran R.

description: Stopped in for crab being in Dungeness crab capital. Didn't feel anything special but wasn't disappointed.
author: Scott S.

description:
To be exact, A 3.75

Located in San Francisco's Fisherman's Wharf, with free parking once ticket is validated.

Ambiance and decor is nice, classy and retro with a nice view.

Food was presented nicely and the dinnerware was new and fancy. Overall flavor of the food was pretty good. The price of the food wasn't bad, but could pricey seem compared a lot of newer seafood restaurants that serve in more of an abundance.

Service was great and they were attentive and polite, just like you would expect at  a restaurant perceived at a higher caliber than most.

For a good restaurant experience overall, the Franciscan is perfect.
author: Donovan D.

description:
... if only the food was as good as the service.
Friday dinner at 7pm, lots of tables available.
Clam chowder is better at Boudines across the street.
Cousin's wife had very oily salad.
Fish and Chips; breading overcooked... fish undercooked!
Sent two orders back. My cousin reordered the F&C, I ordered the Crab Chowder.
Crab Chowder tasted like salty potato soup but was grey/green in color. Second order of F&C was less cooked on the outside and marginally cooked on the inside.
$20 for F&C in a sit down that is $8 down on the street at the "old Sally's" with a new name. Same owner!
I used to recommend this restaurant to tourists, but, not any more.
Great View... bad food.
author: Christine E.

description: I was here a very long time ago with a group of friends for a birthday celebration. I can definitely remember the food being delicious! Being a dummy, I should have ordered one of their specialties, but I didn't since I'm not a big shellfish person (besides shrimp/prawns), so I didn't order crab. I opted for something I thought sounded good. It was a memorable experience only having been there once. The place is really nice... fancy dining.
author: M J.

description: Go to the bar at the back and ask for Sam. Try the Guava Juice w/Champagne. Its amazing! Views are obviously breathtaking.
author: Cessie C.

description:
I went to the Franciscan this past week with my wife and her friend so that we could try their famous Dungeoness crab. We started off with cups of the crab chowder that was creamy but lacked any substantial pieces of crab but was tasty. We also shared a large order of fried calamari which were fried perfectly and were a healthy portion. Now lets move onto the main idea - 2 big crabs seasoned withwhat seemed to be garlic and olive oil and some other spices. The crab was good but the crab for three with the soup and calamari didn't fill us up. The meal ran about $140 and was good but not incredible.   

Pros - Fresh tasty crab and Fisherman's Wharf location
Cons - Chain like atmosphere but that's what you get in that part of town
author: Chris M.

description: It's kind of an old school restaurant.  When I ate here, the floor was not swept up. But maybe they were busy or they didn't want to disturb us.  Anyway, CRAB dish was great.  That's what we came here for and we got what we wanted.  Everything else that we ordered were just ok...  I'd return for more crabs for sure.  Next time I'd take my whole family and only order the crab feast.
author: Aban E.

description: With flawless food presentation, an ideal location right over the water, and ceiling high windows to enjoy the unobstructed view, The Franciscan, unfortunately still ranks lower than most of the other seafood restaurants in the area...and amongst its sister restaurants: The Crab House and The Stinking Rose. The test subject in this controlled research is the "combo" of mussels, shrimp, and crab. It was dry. It was bland. Again, the presentation of each dish is beautiful, but nothing was spectacular, flavor wise. All beauty with no substance. I see no reason to return to this establishment since there are so many better options at Fisherman's Wharf to choose from. They do pour strong drinks though...if you're into that.
author: Helen L.

description: The food's not great. And it's ridiculously expensive. But the view makes up for everything.
author: Patrick S.

description:
Wondered in here while visiting San Francisco last weekend.  Food was great - service was wonderful.   We both got the set menu.  The crab legs were yummy.  Makes me wonder why I spend all that time picking MD blue crabs.     The view was wonderful. 

If we'd realized the patio was heated, we would have requested to sit outside.
author: Ingrid G.

description:
Most of the time I like to stop by at Franciscan for a beer and fresh oysters; last week I took my new friend who has never been to the fisherman wharf to see what it's all about.  We were lucky to get a sunny table with a view of Alcatraz. I was under the impression that Franciscan is one big cruise ship  - it was that close to the water. I told myself that even if the food is bad here - nothing can beat the view. They even have binoculars at the table so you can zoom in to Alcatraz, sea lions and Golden Gate or Bay Bridge.
     Surprise,surprise! Food was delicious! Every single dish we had from refreshing Foggy Wharf Crab salad to spicy Shrimp Pescatore... My friend was raving about their marinara sauce, which she said should be called "heaven". Olive oil poached salmon with rosemary baby potatoes and asparagus sauté was phenomenal too!   
     Oh and I forgot to mention their signature drink - Upscale Blueberry Margarita. Prefect balance of flavors - not too sweet, not too sour, but kicks right in!  Our waitress, who recommended us a drink, was friendly , energetic, but not annoying. She knew exactly what to say and when. 
      I came here mostly for the view, but now I will be back for the food and will bring more friends. Fisherman's wharf is extremely underrated destination for San Francisco locals. Everyone is under impression that the food is terrible and overpriced.  Every other review screams "tourist trap", I say give it a try. I've been living at the wharf for the last 3 years and never had a truly terrible dining experience here. Franciscan on the hand rises above traditional "chowder in a breadbowl".  I can't wait for the next time to try their famous garlic roasted crab.
author: Vasil A.

description:
We dropped by just for dessert. Reminded me of the stuff you get on a cruise. Lite and airy cheesecake fluffed up for your viewing pleasure!
Bleh.
author: Vince R.

description: THIS WAS FABULOUS.  Read Yelp and Michaell Bauer like crazy looking for cracked crab.  I've lived in the area my entire life and never found a restaurant/food at The Wharf to be anything but disappointing.  10yrs ago I even worked there 2 months out of the year for a spell and never found a thing - ate out every week. Had the crab, the crab enchilada crab cakes etc, Bloody Mary , strawberry lemonade. WONDERFUL! The view and table were amazing - I didn't even know there were tables like this; booths, perched high so you can have a postcard view - brilliant. Waiter (Vicente at 1pmish ¼) could not have been better. The service was flawless.  Best birthday EVER!
author: Erin D.

description: This place was terrible! I was the third generation to dine at this this establishment and the last. The only draw of this place is the view, there are plenty of other great wharf restaurants with a view so no point in bothering with this place. The crab came very over cooked and shriveled in bits and pieces not half as crab as was described and pictured in their menu. Yes there menu is garnished with cheese snap shots. We were not the only table to send food back 2 other tables in our section also sent theirs back. The wait staff has no care for customer service or food quality they just took it back no offer of compensation or recooking. In the future i will opt for Alioto's and Scomas.
author: Jennifer M.

description: The service and view were great. The food was mediocre and plating was sloppy.  Prices are way to high for the quality of the food. It's a touristy place but I probably would not go back. There are so many great restaurants in this town it's not worth paying $$$$ for $$ food.
author: Geoff S.

description: My first night in San Francisco, my wife and I decided to eat here.  We had a 7 o'clock reservation and showed up at 6:55 and we were told 10 more minutes.  No biggie, that's actually kinda punctual in my book.  We both opted for the prix fixe menu for 29.95 and the Mermarita.  We had to ask for both bread and water.  Still not so much of a big deal but it would've been nice to have our server check in on us once in a while so we could actually ask for these things.  We both had the clam chowder. My wife liked it as it was a little spicier than normal clam chowder, not that it was really spicy at all.  I did notice that the actual soupy part was also more grainy than say clam chowder that you would find at the little stalls around Fisherman's Wharf.  My wife got the Basa and I got the crab legs.  The basa was really good, and I did like the cioppino.  The crab legs on the other hand weren't bad, they just weren't spectacular.  I figured "Crab Restaurant" can't go wrong with the crab! It was just okay.  The ice cream was just like regular vanilla ice cream.  It was a little creamier than like Dreyer's but nothing to write home about.  Not a bad restaurant, but a little over priced for what you get.
author: Exequiel R.

description:
When your out of town guests say they want to go to Fisherman's Wharf for seafood - this is the place to take them.

It's upstairs, with big windows and tiered seating, so there's a great view from every table. Lots of great retro-kitch nautical and San Francisco memorabila. 

The portions are generous, and although they're not breaking any new culinary territory, the food and service are very good.

I especially like their house-made soft-serve custard. Yum!
author: Betsey S.

description: Decent steak for a seafood place, great atmosphere and view of the bay, good service.  Best homemade vanilla ice cream I have had in a long time!
author: Daniel M.

description:
This is the only restaurant in the whole Fisher Wharf that worth to go! And let's me tell you why.
Firstly, you get a magnificent view of Alcatraz Island and the beautiful ocean while you're dining here. If you're a traveler, this place is where you can take tons of pictures. If you're a local, why on earth could you miss this place for brunch on a beautiful sunny day.
Secondly, the food is good. Whether it's lobster chowder, fondue or clam+crab combination, it's all delicious. Compare to the chowder you can get at the stand outside, this chowder is a different level. And don't forget to treat yourself with a big chalice of cold beer or slender glass of champagne. After all, you are already there, in this beautiful restaurant so why not giving yourself the whole experience, right?
Thirdly, even though this is subjective but I will say it anyway, the service is acceptable. When they're busy, you have to get a knife or a bowl by yourself. However, because this is not an upscale restaurant, so I don't let their service clouds my judgement. 2 out of 3 is fairly enough for this restaurant to get a recommendation from me.
author: Tai V.

description:
Pricey!
We had a very nice dinner even though it was a little pricey.  We went on a Saturday nite for a bday celebration.  Had a reservation but the Hostess failed to mentioned to our server it was a bday celebration even though I did noted on the reservation.  However  we did received a complimentary dessert after I mentioned to our server we were there for a bday dinner.   Our service was great,  food was good, it is a pricey restaurant.
author: Kat T.

description: The restaurant is beautiful and the view is awesome. Service was good. But, for the price you pay, the food just fails to wow me. This was the second time having lunch here. We fully enjoyed ourselves, but to pay $130 for lunch for two, I expect to have a foodgasm. The $130 was not just for the food. That number includes sales tax, Government mandate surcharge (5%) and tip (20%).
author: Yelper X.

description:
We ate lunch with out of town relatives this week.  The view was nice, but that or an equally good, view is available at many places at the wharf, so I would not return to this restaurant.

The menu is pricey and deceptive; here is what happened.  I ordered a salad and asked that crab be added to it.  The menu listed the crab at $8.  I was charged $8.95.  Another option listed was for chicken, listed at $5, but when I asked the server how much that was (after my lunch, and when I was disputing the bill), she said the chicken was $5.95.

After much discussion, the extra $.95 was removed from the bill, but I'll never eat there again.  Who needs that sort of aggravation, especially when there is an abundance of good seafood restaurants all within walking distance?
author: Susan H.

description:
Hubby and I went to Franciscan on a Saturday night with another couple. We waited about 30 minutes (vs hour and half at crab restaurant down the street). The wait would have been more tolerable, except there is no designated "waiting" area in the restaurant. We waited near the bar, but because there are only about 15 seats, we were standing behind the people sitting, blocking the walkway for restaurant staff. 

The FOOD was delicious. I am new to San Francisco, so I don't have much to compare, but I had clam chowder and my bf had some spicy shrimp tomato soup, and we were scraping our bowls. We also had the crab fondue appetizer, which was to die for. Our server was very busy, and not around a lot, but we had all we needed. He did make suggestions on serving size (the smallest soup is HUGE), saving us money in the end.

Overall, we will be back next time we feel like dropping $100 on a seafood dinner.
author: Michelle L.

description: Was walking around fishermans wharf with my brother. Decided to stop in for a beer at the bar, ended up having a whole crab. Food was amazing and you can't beat the view on the water
author: Zach A.

description:
Great view of the san fran bay and alcatraz.  Perfect place for dinner if you're a tourist like me.

Huge menu with pictures, a little tacky but skip right to the dungeness crab with the garlic butter sauce and you'll be all set.

The decor is old school, pretty interesting.
author: Michael V.

description: First off if your allergic to shell fish this is not the place to go:( `My friends had really good meals though.  Crab enchiladas  and fish and chips.  Enjoyed sitting next to the window and seeing Alcatraz.  They even have binoculars there, so you can get a closer look.  The hostes and our waiter NEVER smiled...maybe it's against policy:))  This may be the only restaurant that won't give you separate bills, which is against policy. I can't imagine why they have this policy especially with so many people that have a business per diem.  It is expensive for what you get, but, your paying for the atmosphere.
author: Patty L.

description: We had my sissy's bachelorette party dinner here. The view was spectacular in every direction and had a clear view of alcatraz. It was so close to the bay that it seemed  like the restaurant was floating on the water. However, I think the windows were a lil dirty. The decor looked so much fancier on the website but in person it's a lil rundown. The service was alright. We were told the possibility of splitting checks at least two per table as long as we talked to the waiter but when we did he would not work with us. This would have been so easy especially because we paid for most of our drinks at the bar. We did get our food and the food was delicious but our drinks were neglected. I saw many of the girls and guys in our group gettin up to get their drinks from the bar including myself. If it wasn't for the food and the view I would of given it 3 stars.
author: Maribel M.

description:
First night in San Fran we got stuck out in the rain with our two little kids.  Checked the reviews on Yelp and this place looked pretty legit and said it was kid friendly  so we decided to give it a try.  Overall the food was pretty good.  My wife got the crab chowder and I got the crab with special "garlic sauce".   However, the service though is where things fell apart.  Our waiter audibly signed when he saw we had two small children and we ordered waters instead of drinks.  He were basically ignored us the whole night after that.  I usually expect pretty good service when spending $30-40 per person at a restaurant and unfortunately the Franciscan Crab did not deliver.

It was night when we went there but I imagine the views are pretty good during the day.
author: Matt C.

description: Nice place to enjoy seafood with a group of friends. Prices are fair, but drinks a little expensive, like in the most restaurants in the area. Overall experience is positive
author: Alex L.

description:
The cioppino at this place is amazing! It's the only thing I can recommend because it's the only item on the menu I've ever had, aside from their free bread and their strawberry shortcake sundae which are also the bomb. 

I've had cioppino at about a half dozen other places, but the Franciscan has the best, hands down. The seafood is fresh and plentiful, but the sweet, slightly spicey tomatoe-based broth is what makes it a winner. If you don't mind navigating the hoards of tourists, do give this place a try... 

And if you really want to backhand your taste buds, add some parmesan cheese and tobasco sauce... 

P.S. the service is fast and friendly, and the views are excellent.
author: Pablo D.

description: I am going to give five stars for the good food and great bar service.  Bartender Roaul made several different mixed drinks upon request that were all superb!  Mojitos, Guava and champagne and several others.  Fabulous views.  Nice setting.  They cook their crab legs with oil and/or butter and some seasoning.  I prefer plain boiled.  I am sure it was described in the menu, and I did not read it.  Still, the crab meat was really, really excellent.  Crab fondue:  Wonderful.  Crab enchilada:  Great.  Oh, and my husband ordered the fish-and-chips:  Fantastic.  Really great ones are so hard to find.  Excellent!  They have only one table-for-six near the window, so that was a drag for my husband's birthday, but they put two tables together and were so nice and accommodating.  They do have an elevator for those who can't do stairs.  For a busy Sunday, they were really nice, and I would go back for the plain-boiled crab and fish and chips and crab fondue.  Oh, yeah, one guy in our party ordered medium rare steak, and it was really almost well done but very tender.  He would not send it back, though.  Over:   Wonderful.
author: April G.

description:
The ambiance of this is a modern 50's style look. The environment is very pleasant and comfortable. We were seated in a corner facing the lake, which was beautiful. The outside patio was refreshing and the view was nice. 

Unfortunately, when it comes to the food I can't give this restaurant a positive review. For our appetizer we had the crab cakes, which were good, but I've definitely have had better crab cake before. As for my main course I ordered the crab enchilada which came with a complimentary frozen custard ice cream. The crab enchilada was mediocre at best. 

Moreover, our waiter was not helpful nor attentive. He had a lack of urgency and didn't seem to care about giving good service. The service was so bad that I had to ask one of the bus boy's walking by to ask the waiter to come over to the table. We waited for about twenty minutes to just get a refill on our drinks! We sat there waiting for our complimentary dessert which took a lot longer than it should have. Furthermore, I had to walk up to management and tell her that we've been done with our meal for about an half an hour and still haven't received our check. The manager gave me a unsympathetic quick apology and assured me that she will have him bring over the check. Finally after waiting and waiting we received our check without any apology or explanation. 

I would recommend only coming in here to check out maybe the ambiance, but other than that I would say there are many other options available around Fisherman's Wharf that are extremely better than this place.
author: Thania M.

description:
First of all, their food isn't as small as it looks on the menu. (They also sell their menu as a souvenir if you want to keep it, go figure?) I was expecting tiny portions or everything but it came out alright. My friends and I each ordered our own dishes but shared most of them. We got the calamari, mussels, surf and turf, and a sandwich.

I was expecting horrible food for such a touristy spot, but I would come back again.
author: Lily Z.

description:
Well I'd like to give it a 3 1/2 stars but there wasn't the option. I would say that my experience at the restaurant was good but I must say I tasted better particularly on the crabs.

We ordered crab chowder which was nice. The iron roasted mussels was also good but quite a few mussels were over roasted in my opinion as they were very tiny inside their big shells. The sauces that came with the mussels went very well. We had 1 dozen fresh oysters which I felt were really good; relatively big and really fresh. They were gone in minutes.

Our entree was of coz the crab. Ordered lotsa crab which was enough for 2 persons in their signature garlic sauce. The crab was a little bland although you start tasting more as you eat more of the crabs. But I still couldn't really taste that signature sauce. I don't usually dip my food in the butter sauce but I did this time. The butter sauce was mixed with garlic and it did go well. The butter also helped to give the additional flavor which made me wonder if that was the signature sauce.

Anyhow, the crab was really fresh with lots of meat despite being a little bland and the service we got was also good although we didn't get a refill on our coke. Maybe they don't do refills.
author: Cutiephinphin L.

description:
Came here tonight with a friend of mine who loves certain items on the menu (mostly crab!).  Although the food was good (except for the "billy club bread" served with my cioppino, which could have chipped a tooth when bitten into), the service was entirely too slow and completely uneventful.

Since I'm in the service industry, it's hard for me to ignore when the only person to come by the table during our first ten minutes sitting is the busser/food-runner, who had merely dropped off some water and some bread.

Our server, who showed up at about minute 15 or 20, took our orders in a quick manner.  The downside to this was that, given it was my first time here and their menu is about 45 pages too long and extremely confusing to navigate, only provided suggestions in a speaking manner akin to a live auctioneer, and the volume of his voice made it even more difficult to actually take him seriously.  By this time, the bread that the busser/food-runner had given us was already cold and virtually inedible.  Unfortunately, nobody bothered to offer us anything hotter or fresher at any point and time during the meal.

Our server seemed to be simply going through the motions with us and, after watching him interact with some of his other tables, this feeling was confirmed.  One example would be that he only checked on the quality of our meals after 15 minutes with our entrees had passed... most places would notice you have your meals and check back within one or two bites to  make sure things were good.

Being a believer in karma, I did actually tip despite the uncertainty of who the tip was actually going to (the busser/food-runner did more work for us and the surrounding tables than our server did... I never saw him carry anything out of the kitchen except for one cup of soup, and only saw him pre-bus tables two or three times.  Hell, I overheard our server, who was doing very little at the time, ask this person to vacuum the surrounding area... as if he wasn't already doing plenty to assist this server in doing his job!).  Quite honestly, I hope that this place pools their tips and splits them between all of the tipped employees... I'll be sorely disappointed to discover that our server received 100% of our tips tonight, because he certainly did not deserve the tip that he received from us.

Needless to say, if I do actually return, I'll sit at the bar - at least the bartenders appeared both competent and interested enough in their jobs to pay attention to their guests.

Quick addition:  Our check was opened at 6:45pm.  Our credit card was run at 8:19pm.  Given that we had water, a lemonade, a cup of soup and a salad, and two entrees, it really shouldn't have kept us in the building for any longer than 55 minutes.  It's a shame that the service bit a big one, because the food was, generally speaking, pretty okay.
author: Jay B.

description:
Dennis E.
My family and I with out knowing any thing about this restaurant.  While the food was alright the pricing must have been for the atmosphere not the food.  

We had salads of one kid or another while all were large portions nothing worth in quality what we paid for.  

The waiter while good the service attendant while serving drinks spelt my wife's drink and then sat it down with drink all over the table and glass never offered to replace the drink then drop napkins off  for me to wipe the table clean all without even an apology.  All this with the manager watching without even a comment. 

Paying over one hundred sixty dollars for 2 drinks and salads along with this kind of service we will not return.
author: Dennis E.

description: The baked crab came out looking delicious and it was tasty. However the sauce lacked a bit of flavor. I prefer going to The Crab House on Pier 39 because of that reason. Overall the ambiance is nice and the restaurant is spacious with an outlook to the sea. Staff was super friendly too. Only 3 stars because of the sauce.
author: Hayden P.

description:
First off, I'd like to mention that I'm allergic to seafood (I get skin rashes) and I don't really like seafood anyway.

But since my sister absolutely loves crab, I tolerated going here and actually ordered the crab with the "special garlic sauce" on the prix fixe menu for $19.95 (good deal, by the way). The place was packed so I figured, hey, if these people chose to go here, then maybe the crab is worth it. Hmmm. I've tasted some crab before and I'd say the Franciscan's crab is around a 3 on a 5-point scale. I've had better.

On the other hand, I love how they had a view of the bay, overlooking Alcatraz and Angel Island. They have a full bar but I didn't get the chance to get any alcohol since I'm the designated driver, as always! Haha. Speaking of parking, this restaurant validates your parking spot for 2 hours.

I should also say that the seating on the higher level (where they have the booths) is very awkwardly placed. We were sitting at the tables near the ledge and a family of four came to sit on the booth opposite to where we were sitting. It felt weird because they were facing us while we ate. I know some people, like my sister, don't like it when they have spectators watching them eat. I personally have no problem with it but in our seating arrangement, it was pretty inevitable that the family was watching us. I mean come on, we were right there in their peripheral vision.

But anyway, all in all, 3 stars out of 5. Thank goodness for the prix fixe menu. If they didn't have that, I would've not eaten here. But kudos for the views and kustard ice kream!
author: Michelle B.

description: My first shot at crab. Amazing. Fantastic service, great views. Nice way to watch time disappear.
author: Melissa L.

description: I was told about this place from the Information Center when we exited BART.  It was a great restaurant with spectacular views.  The food was somewhat expensive but tasty.  The steamed crab was excellent and you are able to order 1/2 a crab which we did.It was a wonderful experience and the wait staff was great.
author: C G.

description: We were in town for some business and found this restaurant to be one of our favorites. The food was delicious and eye appealing. I had the fish and chips....which normally I would never order. The fish was fresh, pure white in color and with a nice light batter. My hubby had the spicy seafood with noodles...also excellent. The bread and butter was to die for! Our service was excellent. Wonderful décor, unexpected in a seafood restaurant on the wharf. Great view of the sea with Alcatraz in the picture. A must for us to return too.
author: Karen G.

description: The food was pretty good but the service was not. We asked our waitress what her favorite item was on the menu and she named a few things then during the middle of the meal we asked her something and she says "oh I don't eat seafood actually" glad we didn't take her suggestions on the food since she actually doesn't know what it tastes like. View was nice. That's about it.
author: Danielle H.

description: Service was excellent! Not too much attention but always there to make sure our glasses were full and our needs were cared for. The food? Excellent as well! Fisherman's Coffee was a great ending to an awesome meal!
author: Barry P.

description: Finally gave the Franciscan a try (after 20 years in and out of SF!). This restaurant is right smack dab on the pier, and it seems to be designed like a cruise ship. We had an early dinner at around 6, and the place wasn't too packed--very pleasant. We were seated in the middle (not bottom) floor overlooking the bay; there was also heated outdoor seating. It was my little brother's birthday celebration so our group consisted of 4 adults and 3 kids under 9. Our waiter came and took our orders, as I ordered the salmon (medium) cooked with the olive oil selection. Our food came quickly, only after about 10 minutes ordering. Our calamari appetizer was so-so, but it came quickly and satisfied our grumbling stomachs. For dessert, we ordered the house "kustard" which, when arrived was huge! Like a goblet of cream...MMMMM. Also, the MacGyver in me realized that I could place the rest of this "kustard" in my little brother's childrens cup. Which I did. On the way home, I had my custom "kustard" shake! MMMMMM! Definitely WILL return! Fast service, and really, REALLY pretty and informative menu! Which means pictures for EVERYTHING!
author: Kristine A.

description:
I know, I know - The Franciscan is a total tourist trap but I really wanted crab. I've been a few times before and the food has always been consistently good not to mention the cocktails. Sometimes being a designer gets in the way and I'm swayed by the look and feel of a place. Who doesn't like the retro feel this place offers? I swear it sucked me in or maybe I was trying to flee from the starving artist outside!

I had to have crab so I ordered a whole Dungeness Crab and my friend had one of the fixed meals. Overall, I thought the crab was melt in your mouth goodness. However, I did not like the secret garlic sauce. Maybe it's because mine wasn't really sauce...it was overly cooked garlic sans butter. I had to ask for a side of butter. If I'm going to consume a whole crab, I'm going to smoother the hell out of it in butter too! :)

It's a little over priced here but come on, if Crab is what you want this is the place. Plus, people watching is at it's best both in and out of the restaurant. You've got a ton of tourist inside awaiting there fish feast and outside you've got a starving artist trying to guilt the tourist into supporting his meth habit. Sorry, but the artist outside the restaurant was clearly on something as he screamed at people walking away.
author: Leanne S.

description:
My mom was visiting for the weekend so she took us out to this place for dinner.  We had been here before, and had a good experience.  The place has beautiful views and a good ambiance as it is not super loud and there are full wall length windows giving beautiful views of the bay.  Unfortunately, it was foggy when we went so we didnt get the optimal view.

We ordered fried calamari to start and then i had crab chowder in a bread bowl.  My mom had some kind of seafood with black linguine.  Everything was decent, though a little salty.  Service was great and there was no wait, but the food was only ok.
author: Lisa C.

description:
Over priced, horrible service, fair food.

Four of us went to this restaurant for dinner. We got Crab Fondue as an appetizer and prefix dinner menu along with some drinks. First of all, it took more than 40 minutes to get our appetizer. Then one of our drinks never came until we asked for it an hour into the meal. The appetizer was very good though.
The first course, salad/soup, came so late that we actually had to ask to see what is going on in the kitchen. The salad/soup finally came, and the waiter did not take away our plates for appetizer. Our table was unnecessarily overflowing with used plates.
Then the main course came. To my surprise, the waiter tried to place the main course in front of me without taking away the plates from appetizer and salad. Does he not see all these plates on our table and there is no place to put the main course? We ordered prefix course dinner. Isn't it normal to remove the previous plates before putting a new meal on the table? We told the waiter that he should remove the used plates first before serving us more plates. 
To top it off, one of the main courses was crab. We were never given crab crackers.  Were we at a crab restaurant? How can they serve crab without crab cracker tools? By this point, we knew that the service was ridiculous. We finally got the crab cracker after reminding the waiter that we need cracker tools. We were sharing the crab plate, so we expected to get 4 sets, but we were given only one set. We didn't even bother to ask for more because we were getting pretty tired at the service at this point. 
The dessert was a plain soft serve ice cream served in a glass cup. Very disappointing. 

Food was fair - I wouldn't say it was worth the money though. But the service was probably the worst I have ever seen in SF. Considering that it's a pretty pricey restaurant ($45/person), I expected the service to be better. I don't expect the waiters to check up on the table frequently and be all friendly, even though that is what I would normally get from a restaurant in this price range. But at least, I expected that they would pay enough attention to serve the meals properly and provide appropriate utensils/tools. No gesture of apology was expressed by anyone.
I would never go back here again.
author: Jane M.

description: left $500, the place didn't worth that money: clam chowder in bread bowl was not good because bread was cold; frustrated with the service (we expected something similar or even better like in "the crab house" on the 39 pier). do not recommend the place.
author: Artem A.

description: My wife and I had out wedding reception at this place on a Monday and the treated us like royalty here. The quality of the food is top notch to match with a professional and courteous wait staff. Over looking the bay in a pristine environment is what this place is all about. You will spend some good money but you will leave here feeling like a million bucks.
author: Fernando R.

description: This place is very nice, the service is great and fast. Nice place to enjoy good food and have a nice conversation with people.
author: A C.

description: The five stars is for Felipe. He made our San Fran vacation amazing by offering us tips on where to go (and more importantly, where NOT to go). He made us feel like welcomed locals, and not annoying tourists. I am usually into smoked salmon, but he recommended the smoked trout pancakes. Why not? I'm on vacation. Holy cow! I now appreciate smoked trout more than salmon! It is less fishy and does not have an over-smoked taste. He makes hand crafted cocktails with heart and is very friendly to his co-workers and guests. Felipe was a highlight of our trip! We went back a few days later specifically looking to see if he was working! What a fabulous employee to have; I hope you appreciate him as much as his guests do!
author: Stacy F.

description:
I knew better.. I really did.. but I was swayed by this cute little himbo I met earlier in the day. We wanted seafood, and he picked the place...

As we climbed the ominous staircase into the fishy deathtrap hell-fire pit above... wait... can a pit be elevated?? I don't know.. I don't care... each step I took closer to the mollusk abyss.. My stomach was twisting and turning.. trying to break free from my loins and run away as fast as it could.. but alas.. my flesh acted as a prison barricading my poor stomach in organic bondage gear, as if it was a guest star at the Folsom Street Fair!

We ate a torturous plate of crustaceans and mollusks- each one with an odd texture and flavor.

That night the ocean creatures awoke from the dead and crawled up my esophagus in teary-eyed fury, making their way into the toilet and with a flush their journey home to the sea began.

Serious though, a tourist trap (it's on the Wharf... duh)! Interior is severely dated. Food was over cooked and disgusting. The server asked me how I liked everything, and I mentioned that the food was overcooked. He said he knew, and that it was caused by the griddles they serve them on. WFT!? You just knowingly served me burned food?

I really did get sick from the food. The last night of my brief and much needed holiday was spent puking up Franciscan cuisine.

In conclusion, that's the last time I listen to a himbo.
author: Moonshine B.
