He thanked me and gave me his card and said I could email him for anything...I have to take back what I said in the first review...this is not the touristy spot I thought it was...you can find them here and there...but I guess you gotta let them in...JK...
By the way...Drew is the man that ensures you enjoy your dining experience!!!
Thanks Drew
author: Melanie G.

description: So I went on a date tonight and he suggested this restaurant.  I was not too excited when he mentioned it because I thought "tourist trap" It's on the pier close to pier 39.  I was pleasantly surprised. We ordered cosmopolitans and Sam the bartender made an awesome cosmo. I told her it was the second time in 5 years of living here I thoroughly enjoyed my cosmo (I'm sometime of a drink snob). We ordered a humongous platter of cracked crabs, salad and started with calamari.  Calamari was a little greesy, but tasty.  The crabs were kick ass.  I loved, loved, loved it.  Definitely a messy first date food, but what the heck.  I am that kind of girl.  I would totally recommend this restaurant.  Good food an amazing views of the bay
author: jennifer b.

description: I am local and this place has always been just right. Service is great. Make sure you bring a full wallet, gets pretty pricey pretty fast
author: Jasmine L.

description: We traveled to San Francisco to celebrate our 25th anniversary. We booked this restaurant based on some reviews we read.  The view is fabulous, they even provide you with binoculars. The service is good, but the food was disappointing. Not even close to what you would expect for the price. We ordered the "lotsa crab" which came out to us on a sizzling hot pan. The crab appears to be cooked in a butter sauce, which seemed like it should be great, but was not. The sauce has a very stinky and overly fishy taste. I asked for just some plain garlic butter and they brought me the same very stinky fishy smelling butter. My husband and I both had the same reaction. Pew. The crab itself, once I washed all the sauce off with lemon juice, was very Good!  Our food was not an anomaly. This is just the way they make their food, according to the waiter. In addition to the funky stinky crab sauce, was a very poor quality salad. I was amazed that they could dare charge $14 for an iceberg lettuce salad with poor quality blue cheese and bacon. The beer was good! We just wanted to have a fun dinner so we did not complain.
author: Lori P.

description:
Seafood pasta was very good. Crab was good too but hard work (as always). I did however find them to be especially meaty. :-)

Great view and easy to find (Sticks out like a sore thumb).
author: eewei c.

description: Reservations easy. Food awesome. Service with a smile and enthusiasm. Looking forward to our return visit!
author: Roger D.

description:
We had to ask about our appetizer twice before it arrived. My chowder arrived without a spoon (there are no spoons on the tables, it should have been pretty obvious I needed one). The crab arrived without a plate for my mom to eat it on. My dad's regular fork was replaced by the waiter with a small fork even though he wasn't eating crab.  The waiter's name was "Joseph" on Monday June 5th, 2006. 

The place was cold and breezy. The view of Alcatraz at sunset was excellent. We asked the busboy to turn on the gas fireplace. 5 minutes later the waiter turned it off. We had to ask him to turn it back on twice.

the clam chowder was "ok", though it wasn't hot enough. We had to ask to get bread on the table. It was warm (not hot) on the inside and cold on the outside. The butter was hard and cold.

My crabcake was "ok". For $15, it should have been terrific.

Dungeness crab was very good, though very expensive.

The seafood risotto was "pretty good". For $30 it should have been awesome.

The waiter pushed aside my mom when she asked how we were supposed to eat the crab that he plopped on a raised centerpiece. He pushed her aside and pulled the shell off himself.

Service 0 stars
Food 2 stars
decor 3 stars
Price $$$$
Not recommended
author: Lee S.

description:
Our trio wandered into The Franciscan  for a first taste of dungeness crabs.  It was between here and the Fisherman's Grotto but the yelp reviews on the latter were less-than-pleased.  

The 50's-esque diner decor on the outside was somewhat gaudy, but we enjoyed the cozy red booths with dark wood trim.  Floor-to-ceiling windows offered a great view of the area. Though it was dark, it was still nice to be near the windows.

A soon as we sat down, a crusty loaf of bread and a block of butter arrived.  I was disappointed that the bread wasn't warm but it was handy later on with the soup. We ordered a bottle of the Napa Valley Sauvignon Blanc ($29), which paired well with the Crab Chowder.  As a native Marylander, I'm used to a crab soup but not chowder.  Creamy in texture, it also had large chunks of sweet crab meat. However, there was something still lacking -- blandness? in complexity? -- and I'm not sure it warrants the $10 price tag. I sopped up the rest of the soup with the extra bread we had leftover and was sated.

Now for the main course - we are 3 small ladies, so we went with Lotsa Crab (3+ lbs for $50) and the Flash Fried Broccolini ($8) and Zucchini Fritti ($8) as sides.  We were in for a lot of FRIED things!  

When the crab came out, it was steaming hot and (I think) soaked in butter. Again, mild disappointment as I would prefer to dip the crabmeat in butter myself, but it was still very tasty.  Broccolini had just the right amount of crunch and salt, as did the Zucchini Fritti.  Still - everything we ordered was fried and/or had a lot of butter so not the healthiest ideas.

Overall, ended up being pricey but fun.  The service was prompt and there when needed.  Our waiter, in particular, just happened to be around at just the right moments. Never seeming to push or be too aloof.  I had a great time and would return to the Franciscan, but I'd better save up $$ in the meantime!!
author: Carina d.

description: Wow great restaurant! Came here for a New Year's lunch! Was seated at the best seat, with a great view of the water and Alcatraz! I got the price fixe menu, so clam chowder (which was so so IMO but I'm a harsh critic with clam chowder), spicy shrimp fettucine, and the vanilla ice cream for dessert. The spicy shrimp fettucine, which was hardly spicy, was very good. The pasta was cooked just right, the pancetta bacon added a great smoky flavor, and the shrimp and sauce was just...yum! The ice cream, which was served half melted, sadly, was still delicious, very french vanilla-y, it says on the menu they make it fresh, which tasted like so. BF got the lobster chowder, which was delicious! He also got the combo crab legs, shrimp, and mussels, in a garlic butter sauce, which we were just scraping off the bottom of the grill pan. Overall the ambiance of the place is great, customer service was great, waiter was on it with the drink refills and asking us if how we were doing. I would come here again.
author: Angeline E.

description: Beautiful view with above average food.  Service was great.
author: Parro K.

description: Pretty managable price but the food is average. The clam chawder is aweaome but very little (even the one in bread). The salad and fish'n'chips is very average
author: Saad A.

description: Average food good view.  We had the crab and shrimp bake with garlic butter. The shrimp were better than the crab. Smoke salmon crustini and blue cheese salad were average. I think this place was better back in "the day" and is mostly for tourists.
author: Alison S.

description: It was a great dinner. We were seated quickly without a reservation.  We choose the price fix menu. My wife and I both had the salad, she had the salmon, I had the crab Alfredo. Both meals were excellent.  Service was outstanding. Would definetly go back next time in SF.
author: Brian L.

description: The unique building provides beautiful views of the bay and city. There is some construction going on at the pier, marring the view at the moment, but so what--you came for the food, right? Expertly prepared whole dungeness crab, or maybe just a sandwich made from its luscious, sweet meat. Perfect crab enchiladas or alfredo.
author: Charles J.

description:
This is my favorite Restaurant. I have been here more times than I can count. 

Good: 
-Great view of the ocean and Alcatraz. One of the best. 
-Free parking in their lot for 3 hours 
-Good Service/Never a wait 
-Yummy (expensive) crab, their sauce is to die for, I dip my bread in it 
-Yummy pasta, I get the crab Alfredo dish, or the one with tomatoes 
-Also like the crab or clam chowder 
-DESSERT!!! The chocolate sundae (Valherone??) AMAZING! has hot fudge and cookie bites in it. 
-Pictures of old movie stars in decor

Not Awesome: 
-Portions are smaller recently (but still good). They changed their plates, now they look cool, hold less food. Sign of the times? 
-The crab is amazing, but expensive. You can get a small amount for $20 but you will be so happy with it you want more. 

Overall. Still my fave place.
author: Wendy K.

description:
A big mahalo to Drew & Hank for the awesome service and food!!!! We love you and willl be back soon!!!
Leilani, Wayne & Michele;-)
author: Leilani N.

description: For the price I don't think it is worth the visit. There are obviously beautiful views but the food is not as great as you would expect. Servers, hosts and bar staff were all top notch which made for a great night out!
author: Darcy M.

description: One of the best cab places I've popped into. It's enjoyable and the cab is excellent. The staff were all friendly and the atmosphere was better than I expected walking in. Watch out for the price tag though.
author: Tree C.

description: I made a reservation on 1-7-2012 using "Open Table", and they had a window seat waiting for us at the time requested. We were entertaining out-of-town guests. The view was amazing, the restaurant has a really nice nautical/Art Deco atmosphere, with tall windows offering amazing panoramic views. The wait staff was courteous and friendly, the food was excellent, and reasonably priced. We'll definitely come back the next time we are up in San Francisco! Keep up the good work, Andrea! I think the new waitress you hired will do just fine! :-) Sincerely, Laurel and friends
author: Laurel L.

description: Hmm.. I struggled with a two or three star for this one. First of all the location is awesome. Virtually every seat in the house has a great view. The service could use improvement. Waited aprx. 15 minutes before the server came to get our drink order, I'm not sure if it is because they hand you an giant menu with pictures and it takes time to go through it?? No idea about food allergies actually we took a big risk with our daughter dining there so they could only give us french fries and avocado..No fish made with anything else but butter?? We got the crab which was actually good. Would I return?? Probably not.. but it is worth visiting at least once.
author: Deepa S.

description: I love this place. The crab is flavorful. Buttery, with the right amount of garlic. You get alot of crab for two with the "lotsa crab" for fifty bucks, like three pounds. The calamari is crispy, and the oysters taste fresh. The service is okay for the most part. Last time I went was really busy, and the crab wasn't steamy like it usually is but it was still warm and yummy. I love the strawberry banana sundae. The vanilla ice cream is addicting. The view is nice. Parking could be better. Definitely a family place. I'd recommend this place if you're a tourist or if you just like crab. :o)
author: Miss H.

description: Worth visiting for the views and old fashioned decor! Food is fine but not notable.
author: Kaitlin B.

description:
We must have caught this at the perfect time. No line, no wait, sunset view.

Obviously it's a tourist trap, but its well done, doesn't seem too touristy. The seafood was delicious, the prices were reasonable.

I would not have eaten here if there had been a long line, I know that would have killed the mood. But if the stars are aligned - I recommend the Mussels, Shrimp and Crab meal, shared amongst a few good friends or family members.
author: Daniel C.

description: Just finished a big crab dinner. YUM!!! My favorite place to eat at Fisherman's Wharf.
author: Don L.

description: Beautiful Views. Delicious Crab. Great Service. What more can you want out of a restaurant? Seriously I would eat here once a week if I lived in San Fran. Hands Down the best restaurant on the Wharf. You can't go wrong here.
author: J W.

description: I highly recommend this place. It's a nice place to come and have some good food, they also have pretty good drinks. My husband and I always take family and friends that come from out of state to eat here and we make them all lovers of this amazing place. There is a waiter who was sooo nice and friendly, he is a Turkish guy and was always attentive to us and friendly..made the experience that much better. We go here about once a month or every other month because it is so good! Hope you will give it a try
author: Emilie G.

description: The restraunt has a very nice atmosphere , but I wasn't impressed at all. Most likely wont go back. For the money there are definately better choices on Fisherman's Wharf.
author: Nathan M.

description: Stopped in here after picking my inlaws up from the airport.  Must say I was very satisfied with the food.  It was sort of hectic (it was about 8pm), and there were waiters and waitresses moving quickly around in very narrow spaces, but that aside, we we're seated quickly.  Wish we could say we got to experience the incredible views, but it was completely dark outside.  We did, however, get to see the lights of boats and ships floating by.  I ordered the olive oil oven poached basa which was to die for!  The sides were even amazing.  Entree was served with acini di pepe pasta with sun dried tomatoes & snap peas which the pasta I just could not get enough of!  My mother-in-law ordered the cioppino which she loved and my 5 year old even ate the mussels from her bowl.  Their clam chowder was okay to alright....not superb.  I can't recall what my husband or father-in-law ate, but I know they loved it.  Will definitely be coming back for more!
author: Palei T.

description: I am definitely a fan of the Franciscan.  Not once during all the time I lived in SF did I ever darken the doorstep of a restaurant on the Pier or near the wharf.  I remained firmly planted in SOMA and the Mission.  However, The Franciscan has very fresh seafood, with a wide variety to choose from.  The photos on the menu belie the tourist clientele, however, it was fun to look at and even more fun to choose food from.  I ate ahi tuna tartare with a miso dressing and I also ordered the cherry tomatoes with onions and sardine to share.  Both were mouth-wateringly nommy.
author: Lizzie S.

description: Went here on a nice day and the view was awesome! Any seat has a view of the bay ! I had the House Chicken Salad and it was fresh, i liked it. Oysters on the half shell were pretty good too. Clam Chowder was ok i guess. Anyhow, we will probably return for the good service and view and try some different things from the menu.
author: mike a.

description:
The food here is above average, but I've been to places where the prices weren't as high with the same food quality.

The ambiance is definitely a factor, plus the location. The view is stunning... It's of the bay and I'd take any special someone here on a serious date, like an anniversary or something. I ate the crab chowder here and it was REALLY good -- they did not go cheap on the crab meat. The crab they cook here also is very delicious. With the melted lemon butter... it's to die for.

Be warned, the food here is extremely over priced, but it is also somewhat exceptional. Oh man, I can't decide, So I'll give it 3 stars.
author: Gabe R.

description: We decided to eat here after we finished our tour of Alcatraz.  We were seated right away to a table right on the windows with a great view of the bay.  I was just in the mood for a nice hot bowl of clam chowder-and my husband got the crab chowder-both in bread bowls. The food was good-but I think you could have the same experience at one of the outdoor stands as it was very expensive.  Good view, ok food, ok service.
author: Sharon N.

description: Excellent crab... One of the best crab experiences I have ever had! The servers were excellent and made good recommendations to amateur crab eaters.
author: Kelly S.

description: I've lived in SF area my whole life and this is the first time I've been to the Franciscan.  I have to say - I was very impressed.  We were there for lunch to celebrate my Dad's Birthday.  I loved the light in the room - the white walls, big windows...and the view of the bay - gorgeous.  I also liked the old-time feel of the decor - yet it didn't feel "old".  The food...we ordered the short ribs which came with spinach and mashed potatoes - the ribs were so tender and flavorful as we're the other items.  My Dad ordered the Sea Bass with cous cous....it was delicious, delicate and the flavors came together very nicely.  My daughter ordered the fish and chips off the kids menu and I figured it would be your standard fare - something generic and average but no!  The fish looked flaky, delicious and the fries were SO good.  The coffee was fabulous and the strawberry sundae...."pause"...well...my husband said, "there is something wrong with that....it's just TOO good....how can it be that good?"  Need I say more?  The only not so great thing I have to say is that I was disappointed with the chicken Alfredo : (. It wasn't bad at all...it just lacked a little flavor.  I think next time I would ask if they have fresh grated Parmesan...and some fresh ground pepper...I think that's all it needed.  Our server Paloma was sweet and engaging.  Overall a perfect birthday outing in a beautiful city and great food.
author: Rachael C.

description: Just had another great night there. Man, the food is delish, the service is so efficient it brings a tear to my eye, and the parking is easy. Nirvana, I have found you at the Franciscan.
author: Karen Z.

description:
Typical Franciscan scenario.  The folks were in town and wanted to head down to the wharf for lunch.  My review is pretty in-line with some others I've seen so I'll be brief.

The service was very good.  Our server was friendly and his approaches were well timed.  No issues and a generous tip was left despite the fact that this place is definitely overpriced.

The food was a mix.  The clam chowder tasted funny.  My father and I both felt something was off.  The calamari was awful.  It  was soggy and unappealing.  However the crab sandwich with garlic fries that both my father and I had was excellent.  The fries were perfect and rival the Gordon Biersch version served at PacBell_SBC_AT&T_*insert next name here* park.  The sandwich was served on a soft, freshly baked roll.  The avocado was just right and the crab was fresh and delicious.  Perfection.

The view is great and the atmosphere is fine.  The remodel doesn't bother me at all.  However, the bathroom was atrocious.

Borderline 3 stars...would have been 4 if the soup or calamari had been better.
author: Ross A.

description:
It's just OK. I give it an extra star because, yes, you can sit in a comfy booth with a full-on view of Alcatraz and the bay. But then again, we live in the Bay Area and we have fantastic views everywhere. My crab chowder was good and my bibb lettuce house salad was decent. There was nothing on the menu my daughter wanted so she ended up with french fries. We ordered two cokes and got diet coke. It took us at least 20 minutes to catch our waiter's eye to get him to change them. He was more interested in playing with his palm pilot ordering thingy and with talking to the waitresses than in actually waiting on us.

I am being gracious by giving them 3 stars.
author: Erin O.

description:
My boyfriend and I tried Franciscan for the first time and I am a fan.  There are so many seafood restaurants at Fisherman Wharf but Franciscan is one of the better ones.  My boyfriend has the aged steak, which has got to me one of the best steak I ever tried ($50) and I had the seafood linguini ($25), so the price is reasonable. Both dishes were delicious, the steak is cooked and seasoned perfectly with the right amount of fat, the steak literally melt in your mouth.  The pasta was equally delicious, the sauce is savory, reminded me of a seafood cioppino cooked with shrimp, clam mussel and even crab claw. The portion is pretty big and the service is good. I do recommend this place if you are in the fisherman's wharf area.

Update: They no longer serve the Aged steak (my fav)...this is why I removed a star
author: Eva E.

description: I wanted to take my friend visiting from New York to a nice dinner at Fisherman's Wharf.  Franciscan exceeded our expectations.   We got a wonderful table facing the windows and the expansive view of the bay and alcatraz and got seated right away, it was a Tuesday night.  Our special cocktails were strong and delicious-Ariels Allure.  The service was great and prompt. We had Clam Chowder, Oysters, Crab Cakes (the best there was hardly any breading and all fresh crab), the shrimp & crab grill, and the Kustard ice cream with strawberries and banannas. We had a food orgasm.  Everything was extremely well made and delicious.
author: Esther L.

description:
The food was better than we expected.

The service on the other hand was terrible. Our waiter, who also the shift supervisor, paid no attention to us, never checked in to ask about refills or how our meal was turning out and then to make matters worse he lost one of our credit cards. We literally had to beg him to look for it, and even then it took him an extra 10-15 minutes of haphazard searching to finally retrace his footsteps and find it.
author: zahra b.

description:
Yeah, let's eat crab! Of course coming here means two consequences:

1) Your stomach full of great seafood.
2) Your pocket empty of a couple or three of those $20 bills that are itching you. 

Be intelligent and save some money from the wine to ask for some good sized desserts.
author: Javi V.

description: I WILL NEVER COME BACK HERE. I went with my sister and my mom for a fun lunch on the wharf about two months ago or so. The only redeeming quality of the restaurant is the view. The two young women who were hostessing were as cold as ice; it was a long wait so we tried to be polite and chat with them to no avail.  The server was just as rude, barely even acknowledging us. He ignored our attempts to get his attention, didn't check on us to see how we were doing and was very cold with us. After the bill came (which we had to flag him down for and was ridiculously expensive for okay food) we paid and then went to look for the manager, not to be rude but to let him know of the overall service. We politely went up to him and let him know, "hey, just so you know everyone has treated us really coldly and if we hadn't been here before we wouldn't come back." and he literally responded, "Well there isn't a lot I can do about that. It's very busy." I couldn't believe it, not even an attempt at an apology or an explanation. I have been a manager in the food service industry for three years and even I know not to treat someone like that.
author: Kelly N.

description: On a warm, sunny Sunday afternoon, we felt like playing tourist and were glad we did.  We tried the crab chowder and the clam chowder, mixed in a couple of cocktails, had a couple of salads, and just enjoyed the spectacular bay-front view for about an hour and a half.  The service was great, prices reasonable, food good.
author: mark c.

description:
I accept the fact that the food will pricey since it is on the Wharf and does have a great view. In this case, 1+1=30. 

However, the food is sub par, the service is slow, and the atmosphere is loud.

I would even take my San Fran visitors here...sorry.
author: Aubrey W.

description:
I really didn't like this place and I'm probably never going here again. Usually when I eat at the wharf, I like to get crab... because crab is delicious. 

Anyway, being that I had crab twice in the last month and a half, I thought it was time to try something a little different.  I haven't had fish & chips in really long time, so I thought the Franciscan, a semi-nice seafood place, would have really good fish & chips... especially since a medium order of fish & chips was $16. 

Apparently not! The fish were TINY TINY TINY pieces... probably the size of a very large chicken nugget (maybe like 2-3" in diameter).  You only get THREE of these tiny pieces in a medium sized order.  Also, the breading tasted like KFC fried chicken, which is something I normally DON'T look for in fish & chips. The fries were okay, they were called "garlic fries" but didn't really have much garlic, so they didn't really have a garlic taste.  I was VERY disappointed.

As for the view... well, it was pouring rain outside. So I couldn't really see much, but I'm sure it could be a very nice.
author: Christy H.

description:
Went with Girlfriend. Lots on the menu. We sat at a booth, which was romantic and comfortable. Had a cheap bottle of champange and ltos to eat. 
A bit pricy, toursit trap? Maybe. But good service, good food.
author: Adam B.

description:
I'm not a fan of the cold sour dough bread. It's served cold and left out on a little cart that also stores napkins and utensils. The menu is overpriced but I decided on the Prix menu where it's 29 for main meal and dessert. It's nothing fancy. The salad is skimpy. The amount of salad dressing that they put on it was minimal.The fish and chips "Basa" fish is actually a cheap fish that is imported from Korea. There's nothing "exotic" about this fish selection. The fish was undercooked and soft. I'm used to fish and chips with crispy batters. I've had fish and chips in Sydney, AU as well as in other parts of the bay area.  It tasted like it had been microwaved. I'm not saying it was, but I can get better fish from Long John Silver's. The custard that they serve makes you think it's a fancy dessert. It's only a cup of vanilla ice cream. There's nothing special about it at all. 
   My fiance wanted a box to take some of his food home that wasn't finished. We asked for one and instead the plates were just taken away! The only nice thing about this restaurant is it's location to the water. Other than that, disappointing.
author: Katie A.

description: I was worried when we first walked into this place b/c it looks like a big cheesy diner.  The meals were actually really good and my wife cleaned her place which is rare.  We got the Halibut and Sea Bass.
author: Sean C.

description:
So the day before Thanksgiving, I'd mentioned to hubby that if we're going out for Thanksgiving dinner (we already had the brunch part of it at Kincaid's.) that we try something different.  Hubby couldn't decide and just picked a random place where there's cheaper turkey and found Franciscan.  His thought was that he got turkey and I got seafood.  (He HATES seafood, BTW.)  

Now some of the reviews here were QUITE negative and some were very positive, so I said to myself that I should at least TRY it just to see what's going on and to say that I've been here.

Hubby ordered the au-jus steak sandwich instead of the turkey, since he was all fulled from brunch earlier today.  (The other reason is that the only thing he could eat off that Thanksgiving menu was the turkey with stuffing.  He can't touch the dairy in the clam chowder or the mashed potatoes or gravy... plus he hates seafood!!!  He does not like pumpkin pie either... though he could have offered the dessert to me instead!!!  *evil grin*

Ummmm... he didn't look too happy with the au jus sandwich  And just to prove his point, he did NOT offer his fries to me to share, which usually means that it's REALLY bad fries!!!

I ordered the crab/salmon crostini instead of the crab cocktail... I recommend staying with the crab cocktail.  The stuff came with this cheese and olive oil dip which looked disgusting.  I took a small taste of it and immediately went YEEEECH and asked our waitress to bring cocktail sauce for me.

I also got the cast iron mussels.  Now... there's one problem... I ordered the garlic shrimp AND mussels, medium size.  Turns out I'm gladI didn't get the shrimp b/c the mussels were gonna be filling.  But again, the dipping sauce of lemon butter is NOT a good choice.  WAAAAY too heavy!!!  I would recommend getting a few wedges of lemon instead.  

The worst part is that when I left, my stomack was NOT happy at all and I was terrified that I ended up with food poisoning..  I am RELIEVED though that was the case -- just a bad case of indigestion.  But for a couple of hours, it was QUITE scary for me....

Their saving grace was the waitress was nice and service was pretty reasonable.  But I don't think I'll be back for this one, especially given my indigestion episode.  I'll stick Hog Island for oysters and mussels and I have PJ's for the rest (except for garlic crab vermichelli, which would be Thanh Long on 46th and Judah.)

And yes, next time we pick a seafood place, *I* will pick the place!!!!  (NEVER EVER let a non-seafood spouse pick a seafood restaurant!  And if we want cheap Thanksgiving turkey dinners, we'll go to Baker's Square.)
author: Joanna R.

description: A great seafood spot on the wharf with amazing seafood and great ocean views.  You pretty much can't go wrong with what you pick to eat, everything I have ever had on the menu is delicious.  The service is very friendly and the restaurant has a great atmosphere with a bunch of cool old-school pictures.  This is one of the few really nice restaurants on the wharf where I have seen families take their kids and have no problem- the place isn't overly crowded and I think they have a kids menu as well.  Either way the franciscan is a great place for lunch or dinner by the Pier 39/Fisherman's Wharf area.
author: Sean B.

description:
Here's an explanation of my rating system, since Vlad K. tells me that he thinks three stars is bad, Bad, BAD!

* = Terrible
** = Sub-par
*** = Just good
**** = Great
***** = Almost incomparably fantastic

Go for the Cioppino.  Stay for the Lemon Torte and Custard Ice Cream.

The cioppino was delicious, if a little salty.

The lemon sauce drizzled around the torte was perfectly puckery sour, and the custard ice cream was so smooth that I could not remember putting anything of a similar texture into my mouth ever before.

Everything else (yellowtail carpaccio, clam chowder, crab chowder, roasted crab, butter lemon caper sea bass) were just ok in my book.

This is a good place to take an out-of-towner.  The kitsch, the star photos, the view, the seafood... it'll all go over well with someone who hasn't been spoiled by all the *really* good food there is to be had in a place like San Francisco (or New York, even.)
author: Caryn K.

description:
In my book, it's STILL the best place to take a visiting friend from out of town. Such a fun view! 

I'd pay $100 to eat crappy crab with that view... I don't care.
author: Erin H.

description:
Came here for lunch once and dinner two times. Food is descent. Great view of the ocean if you get to sit by a booth that will allow you to see the sepctactular view. Expensive. Romantic dining. Family frendly. Open for major holidays. 

Try it if you're around the area and if expense isn't a matter.
author: Chunky P.

description:
Head to one of the Seafood Grottos or old school Crab spots before going here. 

Crab is baked in (drenched in, actually) heavy garlic butter sauce, messy to eat and impossible to digest. 

Waiter repeatedly  explained the crab legs as being "ripped apart from the body" - not the most appetizing before eating.

Steamed clams arrived in a vat of butter sauce....eww.
author: Rebecca H.

description:
This was one of my best experiences in San Francisco by far.  Though the fare was pretty pricey, it was well worth the money and I will definitely be back when I'm back in San Fran.  Fortunately and unfortunately the menu is a cookbook..we had to go through it at least five times to make up our minds, but all of the dishes looked so wonderful it was hard to make a decision.  The staff was friendly and patient as we went through the menu (remember 5 times) and were able to make some really great recommendations on food and wine

The mussels, crab, and shrimp iron skillet hit the spot.  I'd been wanting good seafood for awhile and being from Baltimore it's a little tough to find food that really meets the mark.  This definitely surpassed it.

The seabass was moist and tasty as well and how can you not enjoy your meal as you watch sea lions play though the window?  We were so delightfully full that we left our leftovers (damn, damn, damn!!!) Again well worth the money spent...this will be a place to remember.
author: Aisha B.

description: So so so yummy! Everything we ate was fantastic. The staff was all wonderful and friendly. View was fantastic. Ate here twice during our visit!
author: Daphne D.

description: One of the nicest restaurants on the warf strip. You have a great view of the busy San Francisco bay with all the cargo ships passing through. The food was also amazing and the best oysters I have ever had. We sat at the elegant bar which is made up of a really nice white (granite?) and seats at least 18. Definitely coming back.
author: P K.

description: The best & most original seafood I've ever had. Seriously.  Although, I'm from the East Coast and haven't spent much time in Maine.
author: Scooby C.

description:
I treated my friend to seafood dinner,   we had crab, shrimp, salad, crab chowder and cocktails. Dinner was OK. but more than enough for two...We requested a to go box from our waitor, 111 Burak, B. he gave us a box but when we asked for a bag, he said there were none, I asked for a piece of foil, he said there was none..I told him I did not believe him he shrugged his shoulders and walked away..My friend turned and asked the hostess for a bag she replied sure and gave us the bag....When we told the waitor there were bags available, he had a terrible attitude and flaked us off. We were not 
sure if his actions were because we are Black, or if he is just a miserable liar .On a
 $ 118.00 tab we have him a undeserving $19 tip....Needless to say we will not be dining here again anytime soon. Seems weird a restaurant that has had famous entertainers in the past and has good to take out does not have bags or foil.
author: Nita M.

description: We love bobo's, and we're so pleasantly surprised by the Franciscan.  Mermaid Mary was perfectly spiced.  Crab Louis salad is a visual feast as well as a feast. The crab mussels and shrimp sizzeling skillet was over the top. Our meal exceeded expectations. Side note the view was outstanding.
author: Pam M.

description:
I came here for dinner with 6 members of my family.

The food is about 3-4 stars... highly recommend any dish with their green fettuccine (delicious). The atmosphere is upscale casual.  Once you look beyond the adjacent parking lot (bleh) the ocean view is good.

The service left a lot to be desired.  We had to wait 20 mins for water/bread.  We had to ask our waiter to refill our waters. You would think at $20-$30 an entree your server would add that extra touch of class to remember who ordered what.  The food runners came out handing the wrong dishes to each person, which is something I would expect at Denny's, not at an mid-range to expensive restaurant. 

The 18% mandatory tip for parties of 5 or more further reinforced the laughable service, since our waiter could basically get away with bad service as he was guaranteed a great tip.  Seems a little communistic to me.

Anyway, go for the food, not for the service.
author: Ian F.

description:
Was in town on business, craved seafood and a friend suggested this spot.  First, I love going to the Wharf -- I have a non-local pass ;)  to do the cheesy touristy things.  If you just want seafood, you can get it from the vendors on the street for much cheaper.  But you come into a restaurant like this to be served and to enjoy the atmosphere which I did. 

I like the menu showing pictures of all their dishes as well as instructions on how to prepare at home.  Started with the crab chowder soup and had the sea bass prepared with the canellini beans. It was exactly as the waiter described as well as what I was expecting.  It was more than I could finish so portion size was good. Service was prompt and with their little electronic gizmo for taking orders the food came out fast. 

I sat at a table along the window facing Alcatraz and used the provided binoculars to gaze out into the Bay and along the piers. Yes the spotted parking lot was a bit of an eye sore but what can you do -- it's the Wharf!

Agree with other reviewers that this is on the pricey side but if you're looking for a comfy spot looking out to the Bay, the Franciscan is a nice option. Might also work as a nice date spot if you secure one of their booths situated on the upper deck.
author: M G.

description:
I am totally a sucker for 50's interior decor, large plate-glass windows that look out onto maritime situations, and huge booths to have private conversation over a bottle of wine.  The Franciscan provides all of this. 

They also provide enormous tables of big parties that sit right on top of the big private booths, especially when there is nobody else in the restaurant. 


I liked my food, my dining companion didn't, but I enjoyed myself enough and got tipsy enough to go spend a bunch of money to go look at the submarine next door because we'd been staring at it through the windows.  And I LOVED the submarine.

edited to add: My girlfriend actually liked her food a lot, she just thought the ciappino wasn't as good as she had remembered "from back when."  So, I am adding another star, as I was confused.
author: Ivy S.

description: I thought this place was going to be a total tourist trap which it was a little bit but the food was good and the drinks were good. The only problem was the service was a little slow.
author: Mike K.

description: The location is 5 stars, no better view than waterside at the Wharf. I had the beef rib and Dungeness Crab while my counterparts dove into the breadbowl crab and clam chowders, petit filet, and salads. The food was very good, portions OK, service above average, however, this restaurant lacked the "WOW" factor for me. I found it to be a good seafood restaurant and was frankly disappointed that it did not meet the hype. The beef rib was sub par, however, the Dungeness was spectacular as it normally is. Overall, no one that I dined with that evening was talking about our meal once we left the restaurant. Good place but nothing special.
author: Douglas H.

description:
We had a last minute - "same day" need for a reservation for 35 people in San Fran for a group of visiting Canadian customers. 
I made a dozen calls- with no luck on someone to take our large in last minute.
Not only did the Franciscan Crab Restaurant take our reservation- our group was extremely happy with location and the dinner. THANKYOU  Franciscan Crab team for coming to our rescue! We will be back!
author: K T.

description: Ok this place was AWESOME!! My husband and I spent a weekend in the City for our Anniversary and we ate dinner here and seriously loved it. The crab with the butter garlic sauce was perfection and I cannot say enough about their CHOCOLATE MOUSSE!!!
author: Nichole N.

description: Wonderful, had the fish and chips. They were everything good fish should be. Fresh and fried to a light, crunchy, flavorful strip that works well with the chips.
author: Allen L.

description: Food was great, nice atmosphere, and free 3-hour validated parking! Would have left a 5th star, but there was a table of 7 people next to us (table seats 4-5 people max) and they were very intoxicated. Most bars would have kicked these people out, but the management didn't seem to    care about that. I'm not one to usually complain about that, but they were overly obnoxious. Other than that, good experience with the service.
author: Richard M.

description: The place is off the hook Kool, and I'm a SF Native. I'd eat crappy food to bask in the architectural glory of this place! Fortunately the food however was great! I'll tell U there is no better piece of SF history, interesting Deco, good seafood, and view of the bay. I've wasted alot of money and time in supposedly great frou frou, cutting edge San Francisco restuarants. I"ll keep exploring the San Francisco I love, but the Franciscan is one of a kind! David
author: David O.

description:
Went here with my girlfriend because we had a free crab certificate ($35 or so).  Had a nice butter lettuce salad.  The shrimp coctail was not that memorable, but still good.  The crab is great!  Secret garlic sauce is really good.  The creamed swiss chard was ok at best.  The chocolate sundae was also good at best.  Great place if you are tourist!  
Come if you like crab.
author: Mike A.

description:
I went here over the weekend with an out of town guest.  We ordered lots of different foods, including the misto platter.  Everything was tasty and delicious.  Cocktails were medium strong for the price.  

My un-foodie brother ordered a french dip, and it was the only disappointing item on we had.  It was really really fatty.  I guess no one should order beef at a crab restaurant  

The service was less than I expected.  My server struggled with this little handheld computer contraption used to send the order to the kitchen.  She ordered large dishes for us, even though we asked for small ones (e.g. I wanted a cup of soup, not a bowl).  Service was slow.  We waited too long with empty cups, etc.
author: Quetta L.

description:
Work party
Free = Good... no great
Ordered crab = yummy
Great view = impress dates
Fork = spoon
Service = Friendly and good
Validated = parking

Come here again = If free, too many great restaurants that do a better job in the city.
author: Po L.

description: We went there on new year day for dinner. Overall food is not bad, but service is slow, very very very slow. It took a while for the server to show up take drink orders. I asked for a cup of hot water and I didn't have it, until I asked twice and finished the bread for a long time. It took us more than an hour to get our food. We even told the server to cancel one of the entrees order (if they haven't started) because I was stuffed after being too hungry and eating too much bread. But of course server had told us they had started cooking. Still had to wait for a while before the food actually arrived.
author: Ada K.

description: The food and service is great. This was only our second time here, but it was wonderful. We had 1/2 crab, sizzling shrimp dish, crab cakes and crab fondu. We did not go home hungry. Fisherman's wharf is a tourist trap, but this restaurant is not.
author: Dante's I.

description: Delicious, great view,wonderful service.  I had the crab Alfredo which had more crab then I first thought and oh so good! My husband had the whole crab and he ate it all. We fully enjoyed our meal.
author: Jennifer D.

description: We went there and it wasn't good. There was a party and it was wayyyy too noisy. We wrote the owner a letter, and he asked us to come back. Our second visit was like I remembered. Sooo good.  I feel like  going there tonight
author: dave d.

description: I came here three times with my boyfriend. It has a beautiful view and plenty of seating. I prefer the booth facing the water and the wharf. I ordered half a dozen of raw oysters which was delicious. I always ordered the sizzling Combo Mussels, Shrimp and Crab on iron skillet-roasted. Their crab is very soft and dipping with garlic oil is very tasty. It is great for group dinner and couples.
author: Lily T.

description: The crab chowder was delicious! We craved it the entire time we were visiting the Bay... The service was fast and very friendly. The portion size could've been bigger for the price, but it was truly delicious. Great environment. Beautiful views.
author: Paul B.

description: My friends had a mini reception here after their civil wedding ceremony so it was a fixed menu.  The restaurant is in a nice location along the pier with great views of the bay.  Right across is a parking lot or you could opt for street parking--if you have the patience, or get lucky.  The food we had was pretty good, I liked their caesar salad and the salmon was tasty as well.  The servers were friendly which is always a plus.  The restaurant was pretty crowded (for a Friday--shocker, haha!) I guess it wouldn't hurt to have a reservation.  I think it's a cute 1st date type restaurant for all you fellas (or ladies) out their trying to impress your date.  Then you can head back to Pier 39 for those yummy sugary doughnut holes!
author: Tess E.

description: Came to San Fran from Newport Beach $ really wanted a great seafood dinner and clam chowder!  After reading great reviews of this place I was looking forward to a great meal. However, the clam chowder was the texture of potato soup and had way too much bacon flavor and hardly any clams!  Very disappointed!  Then I ordered the salmon& crab crustini. The salmon tasted like it came from a package! The rest of our items were just ok. The four of us spent $200 and were still not satisfied so we headed to ghirardelli for dessert. The service was great but boy were we disappointed.
author: Lea T.

description: Great food and service. The group of 8 I was traveling with tried many restaurants in San Francisco. Franciscan Crab Restaurant was the only one we went to a second time in 7 days. Accepts on line reservation. Took our party on time on both Friday and Sunday evenings. The food was great. I especially liked the Crab Enchilada. Beautiful view of San Francisco Bay and Alcatraz. I scored it a 4 out of  5 only because of the sound level which was noisy. If you are in San Francisco you have to give Franciscan Crab Restaurant a try.
author: Tim M.

description:
Great view, good atmosphere, a bit pricey. 

The crab fondue was great say my traveling companions.

The reason I dinged this place was because the Stella Artois tasted like ass in a glass and my prime rib sandwich was a prime rib brick.

I had a better dining experience at a truck stop restaurant.
author: Chi T.

description: They were not very accomodating as far as our selected table.  It seemed to be a real problem for them.  The restaurant was empty - only three tables full - but they were totally put out.  Lunch was good, service was very good and the bloody mary's were excellent.  $200 for lunch (pary of 5) created a little sticker shock, but Grandma is only in town occasionally and she remembers this place fondly from the 60's.  I highly reccomend the crab fondu and the crab melt sanwich looked great.  I personally had a half dungeness crab which was excellent - served with garlic butter poured over the crab and onto the skillet.  I could have used a little ramikin of that sauce for dipping, but it was still great.  Atmosphere and view top it all off!
author: Michael F.

description: I've been here twice and both times the servers were friendly and attentive. The first time I was here, one of my clumsy friends spilled water, and the server was there so fast that he practically caught the glass as it fell over! The food is tasty, definitely of good quality. While the prices are a bit much, the ambiance of this place makes up for it. The drinks on the cocktail menu are good enough, and not overly expensive. Where this place lacks is at the bar. The selection of liquors, wines and beers is just a travesty. Such a nice place, with absolutely NOTHING unique or dynamic about the bar. The house cocktails would be much better if they had a better selection. I had to name off several bourbons and single malts after scanning the wine list, before I finally settled on one of their house recipes, which as I said, was good, but it was made with Jim Beam, and I did not go to the Fisherman's Wharf to drink Jim Beam. It is also a bit touristy, but I'm a sucker for that kind of thing, and the view is spectacular.
author: Joshua D.

description: We had the whole dungeneous crab and enjoyed the atmosphere and view. Nothing mind blowing but a decent meal with a great view, it is what it is, a tourist trap and that usually means great location and decent food with a price. I really enjoyed the view, it was A-OK!
author: Paul A.

description: Not a 5-star restaurant per se, but Great service and surprisingly good pricing so I'll give them 5 stars. Shrimp and other skillets are a great bargain, especially for Fishermans wharf. Wine is a bargain too. Tremendous view of the bay.
author: Jay G.

description:
My family has always thoroughly enjoyed an outing at the Franciscan, but we just had the most AMAZING experience, and they've earned our business for life.

I had planned on hosting my sister's engagement party somewhere in San Francisco, and we are all big fans of Fisherman's Wharf, so I decided to look around that neighborhood.  While the Franciscan is one of my favorites, I figured they would be too expensive, so they were actually one of the last places I looked.

Their banquet menu was entirely reasonable, and they had much appreciated touches like complimentary non-alcoholic beverages and ice-cream for desert.

I contacted the GM, Craig Woods, and I was pleasantly surprised by his quick and detailed responses. His abundant friendliness and his clear competence were big bonuses.

As excited as I was that everything was running so smoothly beforehand, I was still blown away by how amazing they made the evening.

The stand-bys were all there - ambiance, amazing view, delicious food, etc. They let us decorate however we liked, and gave us as much space as we needed. They even kept a booth open near our tables to create a "wine station". Our waiter Alex was extremely attentive and intuitive. The courses came and went with flourish, and several staff members, including Craig himself, always seemed to be on standby to make sure we were well taken care of. We were never pressured to leave or "keep it down" (although we were on our BEST behavior :)  )

Finally, when the bill came it seemed obscenely low for all our consumption and service. I have no doubt that Craig wanted to make sure that the evening was perfect for us. Mission accomplished.

They have gained our business and gratitude for life!
author: Jessica J.

description: I am really surprised how many positive yelps this place gets.   I Was  fooled too I Don't know if they pad these yelps but everything  I am going to write is true. A matter of fact this is my first yelp ever.  The service terrible, a few people mentioned this so I was kind of prepared for this but the food was disgusting. The clam chowder was forgotten and brought out after are entrees. Then I wish I hadn't asked for them at all. It tasted like raw flour. Our entrees were equally gross. It all came out very quickly, too quickly everything was cold. My husband shrimp pasta cold and bland. My sons Italian burgers were cold and greasy.  My daughters crab was ok but the portion was measly and I expected a better quality for what they charge for it. They actually took the clam chowders off the bill but I wish I would never stepped into this place. My daughter was celebrating her 16 th birthday and  we all thought this placed sucked. Go to pier market on pier 39 that place is great.
author: Lorena G.

description: Today three of us had lunch about 1 PM.  The service was excellent but the food was below par for a SF restaurant charging these prices (no lemons were served without asking and no sauce for the crab cakes).  The food was OK, mind you, but more along a chain restaurant style.  Of course the view is terrific on this beautiful SF day.
author: Robert A.

description:
Visit Date: 2/5/2011

While I am not a foodie or anyone professional in the food service industry, I enjoy great eats and will call out a bad meal when I see it. Much to my pleasure, the Franciscan delivered on every level. From the time we arrived (with a reservation), till the check was paid, the food and experience was outstanding. We enjoyed our fillet cooked to order and seafood linguine spicy and hot. Just as importantly, the staff was first rate and when the assistant manager discovered it was a special occasion for us, it got even better. As I'm not a fan of SF as a casual evening, but when I can get eat a meal like that it makes the trip a little better. 

Notes:
1. Be flexible in your drink orders, the bar is not extensive (lots of wine options).
2. Its not cheap, but it prices accordingly for the ambiance and quality of food.
3. Make a reservation, or plan to eat before 5 or after 8 on weekends.
4. There will always be an issue, its all about how its handled. That separates the Franciscan apart from other (newer) offerings, a true classic.

We will go there again in the next month or two and If there is any issues I'll report and revise.
author: Travis M.

description: First tourist day in San Francisco and I wanted to celebrate my recent relocation with on the water seafood feast. Saw the Franciscan, had an old 50's Rat Pack vibe from what I could see on the outside so was expecting to be run down but went upstairs and it wasn't at first I thought I was underdressed but they don't seem to have much of a weeknight dress code so they sat me in a half booth with Alcatraz right in front and the Golden Gate off to my left. Dinner started with 6 decent raw oysters, a good salad and a so so cocktail (now know I'm not a fan of blood orange drinks). I thought with views like this, in one of the most expensive cities in the world how much seafood would a 39.95 mussels, crab and shrimp skillet be? I was wrong, it easily would feed two. Loaded with seasoning, salt, garlic and butter it was a Cardiologist's nightmare but oh so good! I sat at that table for two hours and finished it all while I watched the sun set over the bay. I never felt rushed, service was discreet but attentive. If you want a place to wow someone this is it. With the fixed menu starting at 24.95 it is an event place for those of us without tech or banking money, but I will be back, and it will be as much for the food as the sunset.
author: Daniel P.

description: We had the same experience as others have posted here.  They do not honor reservations so if you plan on going on a busy night, go somewhere else. We made a reservation a month earlier so my family and I would have somewhere nice to eat on Christmas Day.  We get there, it is packed, we push our way thru the crowd to the hostess and say we have a reservation and we'd like to check in.  She says check in is at the back of the line (at least 25 people deep) and doesn't even take our name down. Rude, rude, rude. So here we are, standing out by the street on Christmas Day, in the cold, waiting in a huge line.  No organization at all, people walking in off the street, half the people saying they have a reservation and being told to go back to the end of the line and wait to check in. Great way to spend your Christmas evening right? And now you have no choice but to wait because it's Christmas Day and everything else is booked or closed! I have read the managers response on here about how he's sorry if we "misunderstood" how the reservation system works.  I know how a reservation works and this is NOT it.  The service was terrible. Not a smile from the anyone...from the hostess, to the waitress, to the manager, they were are harried and stressed. We were served crab (which was surprisingly tasteless) with nothing to eat it with and had to wait, and wait, until finally my husband flagged someone down to bring us the claw crackers, bibs,, etc.  The food itself was unremarkable and our two desserts were literally slid into he middle of the table by a passing waiter and left there.  We spent $250 on Christmas Day to be treated and fed poorly.  We would never go back.
author: C J.

description: My wife and I ate there on Saturday to celebrate our Aniversary. She wanted crab and crab we got! In addition we received excellent service from Nick and the buser Ozreal, the manager Drew stopped by and poured wine and gave us two flutes as a take home gift. The crab was delicious and we ordered the " lots of crab ".  The only negitive was initially I felt a little rushed when the salad we orderd was delivered about 30 seconds after we ordered it, before the wine even was served. Then things were a bit more relaxed thereafter. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a good place to eat by the wharf! We will go there again.
author: Russell D.

description:
People are understandably wary of restaurants at Fisherman's Wharf but this one is a winner. The views are outstanding and the decor makes you feel like you're in a high-style 50s restaurant in Hollywood! It's really something else.

And, the food's great too. So many restaurants with views like that don't seem to think they have to bother with the food (I'm thinking about Sinbad's, among others.)

We had lunch, great salads and a crab/chard fondue. Wonderfully prepared and presented. A nice, albeit pricey, wine selection too.

For the Wharf, it's fairly reasonable. The wine jacked up the bill but the entrees were fairly priced and well worth it.

We'll be back, and back and back.
author: James G.

description:
Oops, previsou review was incomplete:

Had not been to The Franciscan (Wharf) in years so when my wife wanted to give it a try I thought "Tourist trap, but okay."  I made a reservation for two and was rushed nicely to a table overlooking the Bay.  Cutting to the chase: The service was exellent including the host who tried very hard to make it a good experience.  Wine list was very good.  We both had seafood, and was excellent. The Bill?  Again nicely surprised.  The management at this restaurant undserstands that if people are to come back you have to make it an experience to remember - Bravo! Great for locals, too.
author: Lawrence W.

description: My husband loves their seafood soup and crab legs.  As for me, I don't care much for this place.  I think it's the view your paying for.  Their fish in the Fish & Chips platter had that sea type taste which turned me off.
author: Ethel-Lynn Q.

description: Luckily, someone else paid for my food. I can make a much better and larger Crab Louie at home for the same price, or less. The dressing was bland and there was not $22.00 worth of crab in the salad. This place has indifferent service and overpriced food, but the nice view distracts you a bit from being ripped off. In this price range, Scomas is better. Basically, the Wharf's seafood restaurants are tourist traps. They are never my first choice in San Francisco eateries.
author: Pam J.

description: Filet mignon n short rib entrees are very good.  Yummy desserts too!
author: ReviewNu T.

description: I came here with a party of 10 on a Friday night and was not disappointed.    My girlfriend and I shared two servings of mussels ($16.95) and an half order of crab ($19.95). Both of the dishes were served on a sizzling cast iron plate that kept the food nice and hot. The California mussels were fresh and full of flavor. The crab was a bit on the skimpy side for it look like it was barley tipped the scale at 1 lb, but the flavor wasn't bad at all. The bread could have been better for it was cold and hard. Overall the experience was good and i think the price is just right for what you got.
author: LiveToEat F.

description: Very nice view of the bay.  My fiance took me here for my birthday.  My favorite was the clams in garlic wine sauce and the cioppino was pretty tasty.
author: Candace L.

description: We had our Anniversary dinner here last week. We were seated at a window table and had an amazing view of Alcatraz, the Bay and a beautiful sunset. Our waitress, Mari, was fabulous. She checked on us regularly and accommodated all of our requests. I can't give this restaurant higher than a 3 however, because I ordered the crab enchiladas and they were dreadful. They were made with flour tortillas and were like raw dough inside. I cut the enchilada open to eat the fillings, and there was hardly any crab but rather an abundance of lettuce and onions. It was so unappetizing that I needed to order a replacement entree of crab fettucini alfredo. This was delicious and I highly recommend this entree.
author: CS F.

description:
When I was a kid this place was just a greasy spoon and a sort of tourist trap eyesore at the head of Fisherman's Wharf. I believe it was even painted that awful Nassau green or whatever that popular blue green color was back then when even cars were painted that shade along with two-tone cream.  It used to just scream "Tourists Only, Locals Beware!" 
Well. 
So when we came up with a group of 12  to tour the nearby USS Pampanito WWII submarine and the USS Jeremiah O'Brien"Brien a WWII Liberty Ship that are moored practically next door to this restaurant, someone suggested we go in to the Franciscan or lunch. It was with great foot dragging that my husband and I accepted but  we were outnumbered and had been suggesting going to another place a block away which we knew was good.
So, in we went and spent a long time perusing the cute cookbook menus. While they are obviously an adorable gimmick, it takes too long to read them and figure out where the prices are and then have to try and chose.
Not to worry. We both settled on the crab enchiladas. They were delicious in a strange sort of way since the sauce they came in was a marinara sauce and not a red or green chile sauce. Good, but more like fusion food than anything faintly Mexican, if Mexican was what they were attempting,
Our service could not have been more expert.  Eva W. was our wait person  and she treated us as she had just graduated with her master's degree from the table waiter school of restaurant training, Excellent and adept attention to each member of our party and everything was carried out with finesse and graciousness.   She acted interested in us and making sure our every need was cared for and all but opened the door for us as we left. 
Another thing we liked was that we had asked for separate checks and this was attentively seen to without complaint plus the management added an 18% tip-- as we were a group. I'd have sooner the management had gone ahead and just made it an even 20% because this gal made it worth while. 
Everyone was thrilled with the food and its unusual presentation, the only thing that was out of place were the glass rectangular plates on the tables, they were used to put our bread and butter on, the SF sourdough was very fine, by the way, but the plates should have been removed when the entrees arrived if only to save table space. Also each table had a large white bowl with wire contraption on top placed in the center and waiting as if all diners expected to be served a  cioppino  but all I could see was that these strange bowl contraptions took up unnecessary table space and were in the way. 
All in all  I would say that if we find ourselves at Fisherman's Wharf again any time soon we will go back to the Franciscan.
author: Elizabeth B.

description: It is an absolute must to make a reservation. We waited 45min, even though the hostess said it would be at least 2 hrs. Family friends seem to be really keen on having dinner at this resto. The ambiance is nice, the decor makes you feel like you're in a boat. We ordered seafood everything from the skillet menu; crabs, mussels, clams, shrimp. They were all very good. The shrimp pescatore was definitely my favorite. The service is great, overall its definitely an overpriced tourist restaurant, but we were not disappointed with the food. So if you have visitors in town and they want to check out Pier 39 and you don't mind spending a little extra, this resto is definitely worth checking out.
author: Ennie L.

description: Just okay for me. The service is GREAT. The food was good but the portions were WEAK. You do get a GREAT VIEW of the Bay. Very SEXY.
author: Three XL T.

description:
To me the Franciscan just screams "come in!" It has a great view. That was the the first thing that drew me to it. Actually it was the only thing that drew me to it since i know nothing about it. The interior is very nice. From the floors to the ceiling there was something that caught your eye.
I ordered the Seafood Black Linguine. Great tasing dish full of seafood. it has mussels, crab legs, clams, and shrimp in a nice marinara sauce. It was $25...if it wasn't for all the seafood covering teh pasta i'd say it wasn't worth it but there was definately plenty. Be careful with this meal though. It has broken clam shells hiding in side.
My grandma ordered a blues cheese salad and crab cakes. I wouldnt' really call the salad a a salad. it was more like several whole romaine leaves stacked on each other with dressing drizzled over them. i didn't care fro that. i expected much more. So i i advise not to order the Pt. Reyes Blue Cheese Salad. The crab cakes look good. She said ther were good but i don't know. 
To top it off we had the Wild Strawberry Italian Cheesecake. Now that.....that was some damm good cheesecake. I know in my review i said i didn't like light cheesecakes but i liked this one. It was so strawberry-ey!! I was like heavy heavy whip cream light. It came with some delicious vanilla ice cream too. I enjoyed every bite of that!!!

It is a tourist trap but the was my whole reason to go (and to have good food). To have my family see, eat, and enjoy San Francisco all at once.
author: RAy J.

description: I went with a group of 7 close friends. They seated us promptly, the service was great, and the food was surprising for a tourist trap. The roasted crab came hot and plenty. The steamed clams were pretty yummy but not life changing. All in all, it was enjoyable. Pretty much over priced, but what else can you expect when you walked into a tourist trap? I don't think i'd go back again, but I definitely had a great time while I was there. Then again, I could be in a landfill and have a great time with the right people.
author: Kevin L.

description: Had a fabulous time - We waited for about 20 minutes for a table ( no reservation) but had some fun cocktails and the bartenders were outstanding.. then, our waiter Tom (Irish) was friendly, helpful, funny, and even guided us to a few different menu items we weren't thinking of getting.  LOTSA crab, LOTSA wine and a great time.
author: Kasi S.

description: Overpriced, terrible food and service.  Great view
author: Cami W.

description: Relatives from out of town were over so had to do the tourist thing at fishermans wharf. I knew all the restuarants here are overpriced and the food is generally Terrible.  But our tourist relatives insisted because of the 'incredible views' to try this place.   Well of course the place sucked.  Yes, as predicted, overpriced awful food.  And to top it off, had to sit through bad service as well. At least made it under $100 barely for this crap. You can get much better food for $70 less if you know where to look.
author: Neil K.

description:
Tad pricey yet nice view :)

Roasted whole crab - YUMO; 
Crab & Shrimp Louie salad - fresh & crisp w/too much dressing. Next time need to order that on the side.
Steamed clams - pretty tasty but too bad the clams were so tiny
Crab cakes - need more taste and I had better

Iced Tea- pretty cool, they actually leave you a pitcher

Parking - you can bring your bill to their sister company "Crab House" for them to validate your parking.
author: Katy N.

description: Service, vista and crab was very nice, but it's a bit pricey.  The menu was unique by having both pictures and recipes for everything.  Good mix of locals and tourists...definitely get a reservation.
author: Patrick P.

description: I really enjoyed dinner here this weekend. Started out with some clam chowder then me and my husband shared some crab and let me say it was deeeelicious! Usually I'm not huge on crab but I can honestly say that I truly enjoyed it here. I also ordered a cocktail..it was called the "tattle tail" and that was nice and sweet. We will probably eventually visit here again.
author: Stephanie R.

description:
This week (6/27) was my third visit to Franciscan. A great time, again! We got the same server we had two years ago (we remembered him, he didn't remember us), and this guy is really a good waiter. I wish I had taken the time to get his name so I could call him out here.

Here's a tip ... some of the window tables have binoculars. Request this when you make your reservation.
author: David J.

description: I used to work here...the food is overpriced, but the views are amazing and most of  the servers are great....
author: Maren C.

description: arrived and told 20 minute wait, requested a window seat as there are panoramic views of the bay..was told addl 20 minute wait for window seating.. actually we waited in total maybe 15min. window seat,binoculars are table side for you to look out into the water, our window was in great view of alcatraz. looking around many people had the skillet platters.. i ordered the crab/shrimp skillet, yumm! it came with an amazing garlic sauce.also ordered clamchowder bread bowl,which taste the same anywhere on the piers.. overall service was good, could have been better for me,waiter mayb just had an 'assertive' personality, wasnt too friendly but i cant call him rude. i do recommend for those seafood lovers,. great view, resturant is upstairs old fashion/modern updated features,style is a bit confusing but overall clean looking,it is noisy so this isnt a place for low key romantic dates/evening.
author: Stacee G.

description: Wow... I liked this place! All the cool pictures when you walk in.. the way the seating is set up.. the view! I loved my clam chowder and crab.. the service was OK.. but i dunno.. i liked this place
author: lizette c.

description: My boyfriend and i went here for our 4yr anniversaty. The food was incredible! the Food was Great, that we left our plates clean! we started with a salad it was like a  Apple Gorgonzola Salad. Only with spinich instead of lettuce. It wasnt as great as it sounded. so i dont recommand it. we had calamari, and pasta which were the highlight on dinner! =) Oh did i menstion its located by the bay! we sat next to a window, where you were able to  see the golden gate and alcatraz!
author: Silvia C.

description: The view of alcatraz and the bay is great but the food is not.  Had the whole dungeness crab and it was oily and lacked any flavor.  I think the reason they deep fry the crab is to hide the freshness of it (lack of).  Also had some squid on bread that didn't make sense and wasn't good.  If you want fresher dungeness crab I would go to one of the crab stalls along the street instead.
author: Luke T.

description: Had the lotsa crab, crab chowder, and clam chowder. Everything was made to perfection and the service was top notch. The manager was the highlight of the meal. Very personable and accommodating. He went out of his was to make sure we had a memorable experience. This is a definite recommend!
author: Doug B.

description:
Overall, I was pretty disappointed with this place.  I was excited sitting at the bar waiting to be seated because the place looks realllly nice.  The view is awesome and it's really cutely decorated/set up.  Then I took a look at the menu, which was literally a little cook book with instructions on how to make the food and pictures for everythingg! I love seeing what i'm going to eat before hand. And I figured looking at the prices and the menu and the overall decor/location, that the food should match.
Unfortunately, the fish wasn't that fresh, the clam chowder was really peppery and in my opinion had too many little things added to it like celery and potatoes.  The calamari was pretty good, nothing exceptional. But OH MY GOD, the squash/potatoes served with the fish in the soy ginger glaze were SO delishhh. Mmm. I stole them off of my friend's uncle's plate while he went to the bathroom. Heh. A friend said that she came the other night and the fish was like butter and super fresh, so maybe they were just having an off night. But i wasn't impressed for what we had to pay and definitely expected more from the look of the place. Oh wellll, it was still a good night on the Wharf.
author: Kim S.

description: This place was great! Best restaurant on the Wharf during our stay. Most impressive thing about this place aside from the awesome view was the price of the winelist.  It's so cheap!  We had a bottle of Veuve yellow label for $59. Their Opus was under $200 and their Caymus was only $79. All the wines were barely marked up from retail. Love it!  Hawaii is definitely not like that.  Anyway, the food was good but not great, but service was on-point which made up for it.  My gf had the crab enchilada prix fixe which was great. All three courses were tasty especially their homemade crem brûlée ice cream.  I started with their clam chowder which was the best I had in sf, granted I only had Swan Oyster depot's and Boudin's.  For my entree I had had the 1/2 dungeness crab and shortrib combo (I actually ordered the whole crab but was thankful the server punched the 1/2 crab in). The crab didn't taste that great but the shortribs were good. Overall an enjoyable last dinner in sf!  We' ll be back.
author: David M.

description: Went there with some friends last week and were seated immediately. Nice view of the bay, if you can pretend the parking lot scattered with seagull poop is snow or something. I ordered the half portion of crab and the asparagus, both were very tasty but I did not leave full.  The service was fine, nothing to write home about.
author: Tania J.

description: I've lived in SF for five years and I think this is THE BEST RESTAURANT IN SAN FRANCISCO and it's my absolute favorite.  It was also my Dad's favorite restaurant, so when he passed away last year we had his memorial lunch here (40 of us) and the staff treated us like royalty. I've been here many times and the food is incredible, the service is impeccable, the view is spectacular, and it's always consistent.  What more could you ask for?
author: Susan C.

description: I went here while I was at the Apple WWDC.  The view is beautiful.  I suggest getting a booth that faces the bay.  The food was great.  I had the crab, and it was very yummy.  I can't get fresh crab in Indiana, so this made me ever so happy.
author: MJ W.

description: I think people are being a little hard on this place. Look, it's Fisherman's Wharf. The only reason you're coming here (hopefully) is to have lunch with someone from out of town and stare at Alcatraz. Maybe smell some seals. Well, you could do a lot worse than the Franciscan. It has an elevated, beautiful sweeping view of the bay through enormous windows. The Dungeness crab was prepared simply and delicious. While some entrees were a bit bland, I followed our server's advice and had a fantastic salmon fillet cooked in a mildly spicy tomato-olive-squash sauce. Service is a little clumsy but they try. It's unquestionably overpriced, but again, it's the Wharf, what did you expect. At least you can park for free in the pier warehouse. A good choice among limited options.
author: Tom L.

description:
worst restaurant ever!!!!!!!!! 
first they should hire who could serve the food...
really disappointed..
first they give us very corner which doesn't have view
if they do this when they are really busy I would understand, but 1/3 of tables were empty. this already make us unhappy. I complain so they change the seat!  3 times!! can you believe it?? all of the table were empty. they keep give us wrong one. 
well after that i come here to enjoy it not complaining so we were enjoy the view(which i have to get it by myself) we order food and ordered mineral water, this end up another complain..we never get mineral water..(asked about 3 times??) we gave it up. after ordered food i opened napkin found little piece of food kind things (could not figure out what is it) were attached inside of napkin..it was well dried and smashed. we should just come out at this point,  but we already ordered and food might be different.  salad was good,  clam chowder .... really don't want to say it.... we try it. and that was it..(worst clam chowder ever) oyster was tasteless  not really worth 2.25 per piece. i really love oyster so i know what is good and bad...**** is the word just come out my mouth. it would be different on time to time...i might visit here wrong time of year..but just had great oyster on other restaurant...they just don't know how to pick the great ingredient.-- this case they should not charge us 2.25 per one.... really over priced..... i got really disappointed but still we pay what we ordered and gave tip for all this not so great servise..we've mention mineral water..they did not say anything...shouldn't they apologize that we did not get it??gosh!! i really recommend not to go there... really over prices not worth it and really bad service. For the great view... there are other restaurant with this view... just don't go there!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Nikki Y.

description:
Two stars (solely for the Franciscan's atmosphere) including architecture, location, view, etc.
Service was fine.
Menu book is very aesthetically-pleasing with full recipe text and photos.

However, everyone in our party felt that the food was a major disappointment for our "San Francisco experience" (this being the Franciscan after all).  We were initially excited to find a place with crab chowder, but the restaurant really screwed with a good thing.  We were expecting a simple substitution of crab instead of clam, but instead we received a tasteless fishy mashed potato-like mush.  In addition the bread did not taste like sourdough at all and it seemed like it was day-old or stale.    

The shrimp entree was excessively oily with a rubbery texture and completely in-shell (legs and full-shell attached).  In summary we would not visit this establishment again due to the disappointing quality of the food.
author: Dirk D.

description: Great view of the ocean. The food was great also.. LOVED their Crab/shrimps platter. We're definitely going back there for more. The staff was very nice and courteous!
author: alex g.

description:
10-30-2011
     Highly recommended
     As a lifelong resident of Los Angeles, I was first introduced to Crab Louie  at The Franciscan in late 1959 or so (I just learned it celebrated its 50th anniversary in 2007).  Crab Louie & SF sourdough bread at The Franciscan became one of my favorite San Francisco mid-day meal traditions, repeated at least a dozen times since then.  This was my 1st return in about 15 years.
     It's changed: greatly expanded in size, still great Bay views, has lost some of its intimacy and the bread is fresh, crispy & excellent French baguette but no longer sourdough.   Originally a family owned business, it's now clearly part of a larger multi-restaurant corporate entity.  The Franciscan's menu has expanded greatly from the simpler, but excellent basic seafood menu of the past.
