But remember, basic in San Francisco represents a fresh & delightful variety for any seafood lover. 
     The Crab Louie came in a different presentation of the same variety of ingredients (plenty of fresh Dungeness crabmeat, Romaine lettuce, tomatoes, avocado, sliced egg, other garnishes and a superb Louie dressing).  In 15 years, the price has gone from 14.95 to 19.95.  
     My wife ordered the black linguini & clams in garlic, olive oil and seasoning, and comments,  "It was excellent." 
     The house [Franciscan] chardonnay was above average and worthy of a 2nd glass.
     Our server was cheerful, patient & reasonably attentive. 
     Enjoy!
author: Allan A.

description:
Restaurant has good view of the bay during daytime, and lights of Embarcadero and PIER 39 at night, as the restaurant is surrounded by glass.

What's tasty:
Seafood Cioppino
Seafood linguine
Crabcakes
Seafood platter

Service is pretty responsive.
author: Royce S.

description: WOW OMG I HAVE BEEN TO A LOT OF RESTAURANT IN MY DAY'S MORE THAN HALF IN SF,BY FAR THIS IS THE BEST ONE,THEY PUT THEM ALL TO SHAME,THE Clam Chowder bread bowl OMG,THE BEST I HAVE EVER HAD,MY WIFE HAD THE Crab Louie Salads,ONCE AGain WOW HAD THE Fish and Chips WOW,AND WE HAD THE Fried Calamari AGain WOW THE BEST,AND LAST Zucchini Fritti,THE SERVES WAS THE BEST TOP OF THE LINE,WE TOOK FOOD HOME ALOT OF FOOD THAT JUST DONT HAPPEN IN TODAYS Restaurant's,the wife and i will be going back for more.thank you guys,you all ROCK
author: Michael S.

description: The food is very good, and priced high. But I am goddamn TIRED of the bathrooms consistently being a disaster. It's suppose to be a restaurant, not a dive bar. When your entrees are priced in the 20-40 range, you gotta be more on top of the bathrooms than that. Absolutely disgusting
author: David W.

description: Fantastic view! They did a great job remodeling the place. Great crab. Good service. Good choice for a romantic night out.
author: JA R.

description:
I am going to say we actually had a good time... a very good time. I am always leery of restaurants shouting to the tourist an experience they won't regret, along with a bill they won't forget. This place though left me quite satisfied, happy actually. The view is quite amazing, with a well laid out tiered interior, so everyone gets a good view of the "Rock". We started the evening off with one half a Dungeness crab for an appetizer - it was out to us immediately, almost scary, "did it even get cooked." they must have had them ready to go. And it did taste fresh still. It was very nice! When eating on the wharf, it's all about the fresh fish. You can get pasta or salads anywhere. I choose the Sea Bass, it was cooked sotto' Olio. Not sure what that actually means, but oh boy... it's surprising. A rosemary leaf laid across a healthy steak cut, still in its fry pan with squash, potatoes and the real olives, that have that tangy zest. The meal was enjoyed thoroughly with the accompaniment of a bottle of the house chardonnay.

This place is quite spendy. A lot has to do with location. After all is said and done, you probably won't get out for fewer than 50 per person.

Try it at least, and for heavens sake, order fresh fish.

p.s. Along with all the other reviews, I give their service a star as well. just one-
author: Joe W.

description: The view from the restaurant of the Bay and Alcatraz was great but I felt cheated with the dungeness crab. I had expected a large crab because it was to be shared among two people but what we got was a plate of legs. We got short-changed the body of the crab where the best meat is found. When I asked about it, I was told we did get the whole crab but that wasn't true. The waiter offered us free ice cream instead.  My son ordered the Alfredo and it was tasteless.  They are also a bit pricey.  If you want a whole crab, go to Cioppino's instead.
author: Katherine N.

description: No no no. How do you mess up fish n chips? My friends got nicer fish meals, and I stuck with fish n chips because I'm not a big sea food eater. We all basically hated our meals...There was 6 of us I think...They seated us against the window, which is nice I guess, if there wasn't a view of some old parking area painted white, with a black area with white bird poop all over it...Atleast they painted the one part white so you can see the poop...Even though that's cheesy looking. I'd never go here again..And their clam chowder was horrible! I feel really bad rating this so low...But honestly, it's how I feel.
author: Katy B.

description:
my mom and brother came to visit and i called to make a reservation.  maren was VERY helpful with on the phone.

when we arrived, though.  she was not the hostess on duty and we stood around too long waiting for a table, considering that it wasn't *that* busy.  

the food was ok, but expensive.  my mom really enjoyed the view.
author: Claudia B.

description: My grandma, mom and I stopped here on their visit to the city. They loved the view and all of our food was pretty good. Everyone walked away full and happy. I don't know that I would really make my way down to Fisherman's Wharf to go here again unless I was giving a tour to visiting friends, but if I am down there I'm sure I'll stop in.
author: Stephanie W.

description: Hmm, don't know why the reviews are low here. I think this is a good place for crab. Their crab is delicious along with their Louis Salad. Best I've ever had. Highly recommended for crab. Beautiful location too!
author: John Z.

description: In general we had a great dinner.  We had a great table with a fantastic view and the waiter (Larry) was five stars.  He did a great job and was very attentive without being intrusive.  The oysters on the half shell were very small.  The Crab Fondue was very good and I would get it again.  I had the roasted crab and was disappointed because it wasn't filling, just very average in taste.  We had the chocolate truffle cake for desert and it was very good.  The view and experience really made it worth going once.
author: Joseph P.

description: yum yum yum! i'm not too much of a seafood fan but it was delish! the food is presented very nicely
author: B H.

description:
Pluses: the appetizers we had were good. Fried calamari and crab cakes, and both were surprisingly enjoyable. The cocktail sauce for the calamari was a real treat - sharp and spicy, not what I expect to get in most places, especially in the touristy parts of town. Also, the bread was fantastic.

Bad: service - we had to ask someone to send over our waitress - even to order drinks. Maybe she was new, who knows.

The crab chowder was *terrible*. Way too potato-y - it was like eating mashed potatoes with bits of crab in. The bread bowl had no flavor, and was cut deceptively shallowly - I know - bad food and such small portions, but it felt deceptive to me.

If you want a place for drinks and snacks, you won't do badly here.

If you want a nice sit down meal, avoid.
author: colin l.

description: SERIOUSLY!!! Don't waster your time or MONEY here. the sizzling skillet of crab, shrimp, and mussels was DROWNING in some nasty oil. The "flash fried" brocclini was soaked as well. This is definitely a restaurant for the tourist from Nebraska that's never left town, but for those with even the slightest understand of "good" food that doesn't come processed from Sysco Restaurant Supply STAY AWAY. Your better off at your local curry house of Thai restaurant the schelping to this whole.
author: Marsha F.

description: Cathy's right.  This place has a GREAT view.  Depends on where you're located in the restaurant, you will be either presented with a view of the bay, the hills of San Francisco, or both!  It's pretty amazing especially on a sunny day.  The food is also excellent.  We had calamari, clam chowder, salad, and pasta.  All very tasty after a chili day in the bay.
author: K C.

description:
I should have alarms going off in my head when my visiting friends said to me "Let's go down to Fisherman's Wharf and eat some crabs". It was Sunday morning, and it took us a while to get ready, but we were off, and you could literally see how excited my friends were by them jumping up and down in the car. It was Mother's day, crazy time to find parking, so we ended up paying $20 to park at a lot with long lines going in and also coming out. 
Ok, so we finally arrived at the wharf, what a mob scene; there were people everywhere, tourists and locals all walking around looking for over-priced food in dirty locations. We were walking around, and you can literally see the thought bubble above my friends' heads "CRAB!" 
Away from the mob scene, we found this restaurant, it was located in front of the water, and the location immediately caught our attention. "Great location", I thought, "must be expensive", so I studied the menu carefully outside, when I turned around, all my friends were already inside getting us a table. I thought to myself, what kind of restaurant would have seats for lunch on Mother's Day? Well, apparently this place is more than 80% empty, this should be another warning sign. The menu came, and my friends suddenly became quiet, they are not used to this kind of prices from their neck of the woods, but hey, I just followed them in here. We ordered: medium mussels on skillet, Crab cakes, and "Lotsa crab" to share. The mussels were pretty good, fresh and hot, you can't really screw up mussels, as long as they are fresh. The crab cake sucked! It was two tiny pieces of deep fried dough, yeah, I can see the crab inside, but com'on, these things were like a bite each! 
Now, for the main entree, crab. The crab was smothered in garlic and oil to make it flavorful. What I couldn't understand is why don't they just crack the shells a little so the garlic flavor can get to the meat? Instead, they overpower the dish with so much oil, trying to compensate for the bland crab meat? The crab dish was $50 and wasn't even that good. I didn't want to say this in front of my friends, but at least they got their crab craving out of the way. The bill was around $100 with tips and taxes, and we were still hungry. We kept on getting more bread at the end  because our stomach was still empty. I guess I should thank my lucky star because I didn't get sick after the meal, because that was probably the only good thing going for this restaurant, and the great location (this is why they got the two stars). 
The worst part, they wouldn't validate our parking at the end.
author: Toshinobu K.

description: The menu makes everything look REALLY good but the food that comes out does not live up to the yummy pictures in the professionally photographed menu booklet.  We ordered the tureen of clams and fish entrees.  The clams were the size of dimes and most of the shells were empty.  The fish was dry and tasteless.  It was so bad that we couldn't even finish our meals and left with each of our fish half eaten. The bill came out to be around $80-90 for two people. This place is a major tourist trap.
author: Becka T.

description:
Yes, it is a tourist trap, however, the food is great, the interior is large and nicely decorated and it looks over the water. I went on a busy Saturday evening, and the service was great.

We had the shrimp skillet and I had the prime rib (always my fav) and I can't remember what my sister had, but I remembered she liked it! 

We finished with a sundae dessert which was HUGE and yummy... the two of us could not finish it.

Overall good place and the parking in front makes it convenient even though it is on the pier.
author: Diana O.

description: Beautiful view of Alcatraz and nice waiter. Because this place is located in Fisherman's Wharf, the prices are ridiculously inflated in order to rob tourists. Crab cakes were quite good. Useless rectangular dishes piled up on our table causing mild perturbation. I got the Sea Bass w/ asparagus, olives & potatoes. The fish was indeed delicious, but the whole concoction was nothing to go bananas about. My girlfriend's broccoli appeared to be deep fried, which we thought was kind of strange. We ordered the strawberry cheesecake for dessert, but I'm not sure what it actually was.  It was kind of creamy, like a whipped custard or something. We didn't finish it.
author: Andy E.

description: Let me start with it was busy.  That is the only slack I will give.  They do have a good blood orange margarita...that is when you can get it.  My waitress would put in our order and we wouldn't see it come through for 20 to 25 minutes.  Got to the point where she had to start bringing the drinks out herself because the runners weren't getting it done.  Food was sub par.  Got the grilled shrimp and mussels for the appetizer.  The shrimp was crazy salty and I felt they were trying to cover the fishyness with to much butter.  Now on to fish and chips.  We were visiting from Dallas TX and I have had better Fried fish at a red lobster.  The breading tasted like something I would eat at a carnival.  It tasted like it had been dipped in funnel cake batter.  In the end we did get to see some good street performers and a homless dude picking a sourdough bowl out of the trash, eat, sniff his armpits and play with his dogs.  Aaah San Francisco classy, clean, and inviting.
author: Jason O.

description: I brought her here for her birthday + two of our closer friends.  Yelpers recommend certain appetizers, so we all shared the crab fondue to start which was too cheezy.  The calamari wins again!  After warming up our taste buds, we moved on to entrees.  Halibut and Salmon were ordered by our fishy friends, while I got the crab enchilladas and the birthday girl got her mother of all -- filet mignon with crab.  Ow ow!  I expected something more of the crab enchilladas as it was too lumpy, if you can call it that.  Personally, the crab enchilladas at Don Ramon's are better to best.  Like the romantic couple that we are, we fed each other parts of our meal.  Her filet mignon was pretty good, but again, I expected something else of the crab.  The Franciscan Crab Restaurant is a member of a chain of other restaurants which include the Stinking Rose, Calzone's, and BoBo's among others in the Bay Area.  BoBo's does their crab differently, and by differently I mean heavy on the French influence (Butter!)  I believe that if we were served with the same butter experience here as BoBo's, then we'd come back sooner granted we don't have a heart attack first.  All in a call, our ressies here proved a great birthday treat for the little lady.  I recommend calling in for a seat early and absolutely near a window view during the day!
author: Michael B.

description:
Cheapest Claim Chowder bread bowl you can find at a sit down restaurant in Fisherman's Wharf.  

But it tasted like cafeteria soup and the calamari was pretty bad as well.

I'll stick to the stands on the street.
author: Richard C.

description: So we ate at the Franciscan on a Sunday evening. We made reservations and were seated immediately. I want to start with the good parts. The service and atmosphere were wonderful. The view was amazing. The waiter (Rhys) was great and attentive. Cocktails were done well. The appetizers were good. The prosciutto was awesome, the crab chowder pretty good, not amazing. Now for the bad. We ordered the "Lotsa Crab" and shared. The crab came hot and covered in this muddy substance. It was not a delicious seasoning although I think that is what it was supposed to be. The actual crab meat was cooked ok, but this muddy stuff really detracted from what is a delicious meat. My husband also bit into something that was so foul he almost threw up at the table. He is a little shy so he didn't want me to talk to the wait staff but I think the restaurant should know. I suspect that a crab burst in the water because he described a bile taste. Had the crab been done well this would have been a 5 star review
author: Amanda B.

description: Amazing seafood! I took my parents here when they were visiting the city, because I wanted to give them a real taste of San Francisco. The location is awesome, and the food is great. It isn't even that expensive. Their oysters, and cioppino are to die for...
author: Jaqueline M.

description: If you are looking for a restaurant on the water with a huge menu and decent service then you might be happy with the Franciscan. I found my fish dish to be mediocre at best. The type of fish served was immaterial as the didn't seem to offer a simple (flavorful) grilled fish but instead hid the fish under sauces and veggies (and even seaweed--which would have been tasty had the extreme saltiness been balanced).  In what became a three day eating tour of SF, I much preferred FISH in Sausalito (limited service) and Tadich Grille.
author: josh k.

description: I went here with my boyfriend on our first night in San Francisco. We had the chicken asparagus and shared a Clam Chowder bread bowel. I thought the food was excellent! The view was great! OUr server was nice enough to give me the menu cookbook  because I loved our meal so much! I highly recomommend this place!
author: Mandy M.

description: This is so far the best Crab place in San Francisco. I've been here about 10 times over the past 2 years just for the crabs. Their plating used to be better till they got the new see through rectangular plates. Their menu is a booklet which is quite unique ( i like!) . I get 3 hrs parking validation in the parking lot right across from the restaurant. The other dishes on the menu have their good and bad days but the crab has been consistent till date!
author: Living At E.

description: It's ok.  The menu book is a little overwhelming.  It's quite thick and it takes a while to actually go through the menu to find something to eat if you have no idea what you want to eat.  The service is alright, but we weren't attended to immediately.  There were empty tables around us, but I guess the table in the corner that did have people were seen twice before we were asked for our drinks.  That's just the second visit.  Maybe be better for you, but thats what we got.
author: Stace V.

description: very nice place, I just had a problem have someone to serve me and my family. The waiter that was assigned us did'nt want us so they got us a young lady. I was going to tip her as much as 25-30% just to show him he lost out but, when I got my bill for my wife, I and 2 children they  had already included 15% on my bill so. that's what I paid. I give the place a 0. I can't hide the fact I'm Mexican.
author: Miguel M.

description: We went there to experience the view by the bay and were fairly disappointed by everything but the food.  When seated, it took a looooong time for the waiter to come get drink orders.  We had been drinking nothing but alcohol for two days straight, so we each ordered a water.  Bad mistake.  Waiter immediately wrote us off as cheapskates and proceeded to act like a stuck up ass hat for the rest of dinner.  We ended up splitting the large cesar salad and the Lots of Crab.  The salad was...ok...the crab was good, liked the roasted part, but was covered, I mean COVERED, in their garlic sauce.  It was messy and I was really tired of it by the end of crab fest.  The busboy that kept handing us wet naps was the savior of the experience, so we tipped him on the side.  Oh, and the windows were dirty, so the whole bay view was a little crusty looking.  Won't be going back, and don't recommend that anyone else go there either.  Waste of money!
author: Lauren H.

description: I've been to this restaurant over the many years. It has been recently remodeled and updated and I think they're trying hard and doing a pretty good job. Excellent place to take visitors.  Best location on Fisherman's wharf and every table has a view.  I would recommend ordering fresh San Francisco seafood:  fresh Hog Island oysters and the Dungessness Crab.  Oysters were fresh and excellent, and at $2 each I think reasonably priced.  The Roast Crab Feast at $100 is said to be for 4 persons, but I think it was enough for 6 people. Overall, good experience, your visiting guests will appreciate and remember.  One request to the restaurant: In the old days when a ship would sail into the Bay, the Matre'd would announce the name of and ship over the intercom --- please bring back that wonderful tradition.
author: Ken V.

description: Sometimes when you have folks from out of town they want to go to fisherman's wharf and do the whole touristy SF thing. This is a good place to take them because the view is great and the food is good. It's classic old style SF. Additional benefit is you can make reservations on Open Table, unlike Scoma's (which is a very good restaurant, but is first come first serve).
author: Steve P.

description: Went here because we just got done from doing the Alcatraz tour and we were hungry!!!! Im not a big fan of seafood but I'll take clam chowder anyday. Ordered the cesar salad and thought i would step out of the box and ordered the crab fondue. OMG was that good! It came with baked bread and just oozing with butter, pieces of crab and everything good!  I was in heaven.
author: Catherine G.

description: As much as I would have loved to buy a crab from one of those street stands as I'm sure they are delicious, I just didn't know how I was going to pull it off with no table, no chair,  no silverware and no sink to wash my hands.  So we decided to eat at the Franciscan.  I opted for a half order of crab since I was still quite full from the clam chowder in a bread bowl from those stands.  The menu stated 1+ pounds.  When my crab came out 7 minutes after we ordered, it was a mere two small legs slapped onto an iron skillet.  It was clear that the skillet just came out of the oven, but the crab was luke warm, like they had nuked in the microwave for a minute.  The secret garlic sauce isn't great at all and actually tastes kinda curry-esque.  I was actually okay with my meal until we were leaving and the table next to us ordered the same thing and their crab legs were presented in a S pattern and was swimming in half a cm of butter.  WTF?  I was pissed, it looked nothing like mine.  Had we still been eating, I would have certainly complained, but it was too late.  Take your hard earned $ elsewhere.  There are lots of other restaurants at the wharf that'll be worth your time.
author: Casey F.

description: Our waiter was really friendly and on top of things which was nice for such a fancy restaurant. We had the 2 pounds of Dungeness carb and they were so good. The garlic sauce they cook them in is just amazing. So flavorful and fresh.
author: Tina L.

description: The Chowder was very good.  After that everything else was downhill.  The mashed potatoes were very salty.  Sent them back and the 2nd batch was just as salty.  Service was so so.  Overall food not very good.  Great location but a little disapointing to look out of dirty windows. Would not recomend this place.
author: Stan S.

description: Kind of disappointed in this place.  Like other reviewers before me the menu makes everything look mouth watering, but the food does not live up to the menu.  With the exception of the crab chowder which was so tasty (making my mouth water as I type) .  For my entree I had the Olive oil oven poached sea bass, asparagus, butternut squash, olives, rosemary & garlic... the problem with this was that it did not have that much flavor.  I also don't think it was cooked properly.   The service was not that attentive... we must have sat there 10 minutes before anyone came to our table, when one server finally did show up he never came back again.  His intention was to give our table away to another server... but didn't seem to inform the new server or us.  He realized his mistake when he saw how irritated we looked sitting at our table with no service.  For the amount of money you spend here I definitely expect more which i did not receive.
author: Halley S.

description: I don't understand why this place has an overall rating of 3?! I loved the retro decor it felt very cozy. Great view of the bay. The service was excellant. My girlfriend and I couldn't get over how stellar the service was. Our waiter and the rest of the service staff were very attentive and quick. We ordered oysters and they were so good and fresh. We had a cup of the chowder and it was so delicious and fresh. The Losta Crab took the prize. I loved the sauce and the price was reasonable. I will definitely go back again.
author: Angelica and Doris O.

description: Great view and very good food.  The descriptions in the menu book leave nothing to chance so you always know exactly what you're getting.  Not just for tourists.
author: Pat P.

description: I am a fan!! Good crab and great service. I could not have asked for a better waiter We will return frequently and soon.
author: N. C.

description: no bueno. supposedly their fresh steamed crustaceans still in shell are top notch - this is supposed to be on zagat's survey, but the rest of the menu consists of mildly edible crab cakes and some other boring appetizer items that are poorly executed. thank god they serve delicious girly cocktails. the service is pretty good, although the waiters can be pushy. the food is just really unfortunate. i will likely never go back.
author: Y K.

description: what an amazing view!  we were given the window seat, so we got to enjoy the view of the ocean during dinner, which was phenomenal. the food was pretty good too, but nothing special, and portions were rather small. i don't know if i'm impressed enough to come back again.
author: Jen K.

description: when my friend came here in the last time, she wanted to try this place. because it had a nice view of bay, it was located in pier 39. guess what? the foods were OK , but we had to pay too much.
author: Jane K.

description: Excellent tourist spot. The food was tasty. I ordered the fettuccine alfredo with crab. However, I was disappointed in the small portion size. However, the service was excellent. The server was very attentive and knowledgeable about the plethora of menu choices. If going in the evening, I recommend making a reservation (if accepted), I waited approximately 40 minutes before being seated. Don't feel bad for me, most of that time was spent at the bar.....(wink)
author: Miss Cherry x.

description: The only good thing about this place was the view.  We ordered the skillet crab and shrimp.  The shrimp were tiny and undercooked.  We didn't even eat them.  Crab was decent, covered w/ butter so super greasy.  Also got the zucchini friti, which didn't come out until I asked about it after we'd almost finished our crab.  When it finally did arrive, was so oily and gross we sent it back.  Don't waste your time here.
author: D T.

description: I recently held a graduation party for 17 here. It went very well. I worked with Sid to make the reservations & he was very good about taking care of  us. The staff was friendly and attentive. I agree its a bit of a touristy spot but our guests were ALL from out of town & this place was a HIT with all of them.  Great view of the bay & its great that they validate for 3 hours of FREE PARKING.  Friendly bartender - nice mojitos.   We had our infant daughter with us & we had no problems - we were allowed to stow our stroller out of the way.  We had a selected menu with a choice of braised beef, crab legs or salmon - I thought the braised beef was excellent.  My husband (the graduate) enjoyed the salmon & I saw folks digging into their crab heartily. Even the ice cream dessert drew raves. I would return & recommend them. If you want fine dining OF COURSE you would stay away from the Wharf. This place is for tourists & out of towner's but what is wrong with that?
author: Sandra P.

description: Ew. My fingers smell fishy. And not for a good reason.
author: brad m.

description: so i just got back from Franciscan tonight and for my first time there i absolutly loved it... what i was really impressed with is the presentation of  everything from the silverware having fins on the ends to the cute little cup you get when you order crab. ( includes bib, wet towel, crushers and a little fork)  i order wine ( 9 $) we started with the crab chowder and the medium clams... yummm!!! for dinner i had the filet with the crab and my friend had the whole garlic crab.... the filet was goood but just something didnt see right.. the color looked like tuna but the crab OMG!!!! was so freaking goood!!! the service was excellent  and i will def. be back
author: Shauna P.

description: My two friends and I ate here for Thanksgiving today.  Even though the restaurant offered the traditional Thanksgiving fixings, we were in the mood for something different and so ordered from the daily menu.  I had the Pomegranate Champagne Mimosa.  It was very refreshing although a lot more tart than I expected.  One friend ordered the Redheaded Smoothie which was absolutely delicious.  The crab & chard fondue was great, although I would not call it a "fondue," which implies something cheesy and saucy.  This was more like a dip.  My friends liked it too.  The soy ginger tilapia was perfectly cooked and flavorful.  One friend got the Thai coconut curry sea bass, also delicious.  To top everything off, they shared the chocolate mousse made with Valrhona chocolate that was to die for!  I had the lemon tart.  Both desserts came with their homemade frozen custard.  The service was perfect from start to finish.  The restaurant was not busy so we were able to linger over our meal.  Our waiter was friendly, courteous, and efficient.  BTW, we are Bay Area locals and would recommend this restaurant to anyone for a special meal.  The bill came to about $50 per person which I thought was reasonable for all the food you can get, including cocktails and dessert.  Plus, you can't beat the view!  We had a window seat and could see Alcatraz.
author: Patty A.

description: I have never read a review of this place, and just stopped by to get something to eat because of its close proximity to the Red and White Fleet dock, (just outside).  I ordered my girlfriend a Ketel Lemon Drop to drink, because we are on a quest to find the very best one.  The lemondrop was quite tasty and definitely unique in flavor compared to those we have had throughout the peninsula.  My gf was not very hungry and decided to order the childrens chicken tenders meal.  The tenders were about as tough as they come, dressed more like some overcooked dry  lousiana catfish than the warm tender fowl that was expected.  That`s why you don`t go into a restaurant with ANY expectations.  I ordered a bread bowl of crab chowder which was rather uninspiring.  It was a solid in it`s effort, but I found some that was better just by walking down the street.  The restaurant had good wait staff and it had a nice view of the bay.  It looked much better in the dark after a couple of drinks.  I would not recommend going there for lunch, and I might not want to go back at all. I would drop by for a drink anytime.
author: Vile M.

description: Excellent crab.  Service not bad, however not polished either.  Overall, I was pleased.
author: T B.

description: We are veteran visitors to San Francisco....going back 20 years. We live in the Miami/Fort Lauderdale area of Florida. We are very leery about eating in restaurants in tourist areas. We were staying in a San Francisco Warf area and wanted Dungeness Crab for dinner.  We searched Goggle for Seafood restaurants in San Francisco and the Franciscan Crab Restaurant was one of the choices.  They advertised " Lotsa Crab - 3# - two or more share for $ 49.95. We walked to the restaurant at 6pm. The menu posted outside stated the same price.  We walked up the stairs to the second level and the hostess greeted us and promptly seated us at a table with a great view of the bay.  The descriptive menu was presented with the choices for the evening.  We ordered a bottle House Chardonnay, House Salad, Lotsa Crab, and  Rosemary-Roasted Baby Heirloom Potatoes.  The  Food and Service exceeded expectations.   The Garlic Dungeness Crabs are not to be missed. The service by the waiter and the bus staff was impeccable.  This was a great experience that will always be remembered when we reminisce about our travels to San Francisco.  Don't leave without eating the homemade Frozen Custard for Dessert.
author: Stan P.

description: I admittedly am a food snob but not so bad that i would give a restaurant an unfair review. This place was a disappointment in so many ways. It was obvious they rely on tourists for their business because they were not overly polite and had substandard food quality. My first impression was of the sitting area where they apparently have the bread service area as well. Well, let me tell you, if you are at all leery of health standards at restaurants, then the fact that bread service area is within easy reach of the waiting area will disgust you. While we were waiting a couple actually walked up the bread table and after putting their hands all over the loaf of bread that was on the table, they helped themselves to the butter. 2 seconds later a waiter walked up to the bread table, cut bread from the same loaf and delivered it to his table. My only thought was I dearly pray that the guy who was waiting had washed his hands!!! I told a waiter what had happened and I was appalled at his response, which was "it's ok! You can have some bread too!" I was shocked! I said, but the guy put his hands all over the bread, you don't know if his hands were clean! The waiter seemed confused so I just sat down. This was how my experience at the restaurant began. Not a good beginning! We ordered the fried calamari; it was oily but still good. Then we ordered clam chowder and bean soup in bread bowls. The bread bowls were old and hard, the clam chowder was runny, not at all what you would expect on the Wharf. For dinner we ordered the prime rib and tiger prawns. The tiger prawns were over cooked. How could you over cook seafood if seafood is what you claim to be famous for? The prime rib was ok, the mashed potatoes were good but don't you dare ask for substitutions. I asked our waiter if I could sub zucchini for the creamed collards and he said no, the price of the zucchini is higher than the collards. Wait a minute, I pointed out to the waiter that on the menu, the side items are all the same price, $7. So how is it more expensive? His only excuse after that was to tell me the restaurant does not allow subs. Well, The Franciscan needs to get with the times because most all restaurants allow subs. And please find a better excuse for not allowing it than what that waiter told me. It was an insult. All in all, the view was fabulous; the table was good, giving you the feel that you have some privacy from other patrons. The hostess could use an attitude adjustment but again, I think they cater to tourists so they feel like they just don't care. Only reason I will ever eat here again is if we have a relative from out of town who absolutely insists on eating there. Otherwise we will stick to what we know is good.
author: amy m.

description: came here for lunch on Saturday. we came to surprise our cousin for her birthday. we were able to make reservations and have them hold a cake for us. they also helped set up the surprise for her. when everything got settled though it seemed as though everything slowed down. i know we were there for lunch on a Saturday but the service was on and off. sometimes they did great to see how we were doing and refilling our drinks. other times, especially after we got our meal, it seemed to take forever to get someone to pay attention to us. for appetizers we had calamari and oysters. they were obviously fresh and came out just after being cooked. the calamari wasn't rubbery or stringy. good sized, the batter was inconsistent on some of the pieces though. the oysters were really good and steaming. they also were nice enough to bring us extra bowls and spoons to help with the appetizers. i also ordered a crab chowder which was really good. it was hard for me to pass up clam chowder especially in sf, but its crab. the crab chunks were good sized and plentiful. next time I'm in sf i think ill get a crab + clam chowder somewhere haha. OK for lunch the table ordered a good variety. i had the spicy prawns. the shrimp could have been larger, i was surprised that they were a regular sized but hey. it wasn't as spicy as i would hoped it would be and the pasta was sticky like it sat out on the warming shelf for to long. at the end the waiter was kind enough to bring out the cake, lite with candles, and started singing happy birthday for us. overall the beginning was great but it tapered off to mediocre\average towards the end. it is very touristy (the menu) but has good views and a good experience. it seems as though it is very on and off though from our experience and other reviews.
author: aaron n.
